translated: And because doubt arises after the understanding of the object, whether the knowledge produced by this has a real object or not.

original: tasmādāptoktatvaṃ bhramādyajanyatvaṃ abādhitārthakatvaṃ yathārthavākyārthapratītiparatvaṃ vā jñātaṃ anugatamapi na hetuḥ prathamaṃ grahītumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: tasmāt āpta ukta tvam bhrama ādi ajanya tvam abādhita arthaka tvam yathārtha vākya artha pratīti paratvam vā jñātam anugatam api na hetuḥ prathamam grahītum aśakya tvāt
translated: Therefore, even though the statement of a reliable person, being non-deceptive, and having a non-contradictory meaning, or being intended to convey the meaning of the sentence correctly, is known and consistent, it is not the reason, because it cannot be grasped first.

original: kintu tātparyagrāhakatvenābhimatānāṃ nyāyajanyajñānaprakaraṇādīnāmanyatarat tātparyavyāpyatvenānugataṃ /
analyzed: kintu tātparya grāhaka tvena abhimatānām nyāya janya jñāna prakaraṇa ādīnām anyatarat tātparya vyāpya tvena anugatam
translated: But any one of logic, knowledge produced by logic, context, etc., which are considered to be indicators of the intended meaning, is consistent in being pervaded by the intended meaning.

original: tathākāṅkṣāsattiniścayaḥ /🔽tadviparyaye saṃśaye ca śābdajñānābhāvāt /
analyzed: tathā ākāṅkṣā satti niścayaḥ  tad viparyaye saṃśaye ca śābda jñāna abhāvāt
translated: Similarly, the ascertainment of the presence of expectancy.🔽Because there is no verbal knowledge in the opposite of that, or in doubt.

original: yogyatāyāśca jñānamatraṃ hetuḥ tatsaṃśaye viparyaye pramāyāñca vākyārthajñānāt /
analyzed: yogya tāyāḥ ca jñānam atram hetuḥ tad saṃśaye viparyaye pramāyām ca vākya artha jñānāt
translated: And the knowledge of fitness is the cause here, because of verbal knowledge in doubt, the opposite, and in valid knowledge.

original: tathā vibhaktyādisamabhivyāharaḥ sambhūyoccāraṇañca śābdajñānamātre kāraṇāni nānārthe śrliṣṭe cānekopasthitāvapi prakaraṇādivaśādekamarthamādayānvayabodhaḥ
analyzed: tathā vibhakti ādi samabhivyāharaḥ sambhūya uccāraṇam ca śābda jñāna mātre kāraṇāni nānā arthe śrliṣṭe ca aneka upasthitau api prakaraṇa ādi vaśāt ekam artham ādayā anvaya bodhaḥ
translated: Similarly, the co-occurrence of case endings etc. and the simultaneous utterance are causes only for verbal cognition, not for the cognition of multiple meanings connected to each other. Even when multiple meanings are present, the understanding of the relation is based on the context etc., by selecting one meaning.

original: lakṣaṇā ca na tātparyānupapattyā kintvanvayānupapattyaiva prakaraṇādbhojanaprajanakatvenāvagatapraveśanasya yaṣṭyanvayānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: lakṣaṇā ca na tātparya anupapattyā kintu anvaya anupapattyā eva prakaraṇāt bhojana prajanaka tvena avagata praveśanasya yaṣṭi anvaya anupapatteḥ
translated: And figurative meaning is not due to the impossibility of intention, but only due to the impossibility of relation. Because the relation of the stick, understood as bringing about eating and procreation from the context, with the entering is impossible.

original: ajahatsvārthāyāṃ prakaraṇādeva chatri taditarasya yāntītyanena gamanakarttṛtvamavagataṃ tadanvayānupapatticchatrimātre /
analyzed: a jahat svārthāyām prakaraṇāt eva chatri tad itarasya yānti iti anena gamana karttṛ tvam avagatam tad anvaya anupapatti chatri mātre
translated: In the case of non-abandonment of its own meaning, the agency of going is understood from the context itself by the sentence the umbrella-bearer and others go, and the impossibility of its relation is only with the umbrella-bearer alone.

original: pacatītyasya kalāyamityanyoktena samaṃ nārthapratyākatvaṃ samabhivyāhārābhāvāt /
analyzed: pacati ityasya kalāyam iti anya uktena samam na artha pratyāka tvam samabhivyāhāra abhāvāt
translated: The sentence he cooks does not have the same meaning as he eats lentils uttered by another, because of the absence of co-occurrence.

original: tavāpi tasya tātparyagrāhakatvāt sahoccaritānāṃ sambhūyārthapratyāyakatvasya vyutpattisiddhatvāt /
analyzed: tava api tasya tātparya grāhaka tvāt saha uccaritānām sambhūya artha pratyāyaka tvasya vyutpatti siddha tvāt
translated: Even for you, it is the indicator of the intention, because the simultaneous utterance of words is established by etymology as conveying the combined meaning.

original: anye tu nānārthe lakṣaṇāyāñca niyatopasthityarthaṃ padārthe tātparyagrahāpekṣā tena vinā tadabhāvāt na vākyārthe /
analyzed: anye tu nānārthe lakṣaṇāyām ca niyata upasthiti artham padārthe tātparya graha apekṣā tena vinā tad abhāvāt na vākya arthe
translated: Others say that in the case of multiple meanings and figurative meaning, the meaning of the word requires the understanding of the intention for the definite presentation, because without that it is absent, but not in the case of the meaning of the sentence.

original: tadajñāne 'pi prakaraṇādinā saindhavapadaṃ turagaparaṃ kākapadaṃ upaghātakaparamiti hi pratiyanti /
analyzed: tad ajñāne pi prakaraṇa ādinā saindhava padam turaga param kāka padam upaghātaka param iti hi pratiyanti
translated: Even when that is not known, by context etc. they understand that the word 'saindhava' refers to a horse and the word 'kāka' refers to a crow.

original: anyatrānvayapratiyogyupasthitiḥ tātparyagrahaṃ vinaiveti na tadapekṣā /
analyzed: anyatra anvaya pratiyogi upasthitiḥ tātparya graham vinā eva iti na tad apekṣā
translated: The presence of the object of relation elsewhere is understood even without grasping the purport. So it does not depend on that.

original: vastutastu itarapadasya itarapadārthasaṃsargajñānaparatvaṃ tātparyaṃ tacca vede nyāyādavadhāryate loke nyāyāt prakaraṇādervā /
analyzed: vastutas tu itara padasya itara padārtha saṃsarga jñāna para tvam tātparyam tat ca vede nyāyāt avadhāryate loke nyāyāt prakaraṇa ādeḥ vā
translated: But in reality, the purport of the other word is the knowledge of the relation of the meaning of the other word, and that is determined from logic in the Veda and from logic or context etc. in the world.

original: ata eva śābdabodhe nāniyatahetukatvaṃ taccetarapadārthasaṃsargajñānaṃ vākyarthajñānameveti sāmānyakāreṇa tatparatvagrahaḥ heturna tu viśiṣya /
analyzed: atas eva śābda bodhe na aniyata hetuka tvam tat ca itara padārtha saṃsarga jñānam vākya artha jñānam eva iti sāmānya kāreṇa tatparatva grahaḥ hetuḥ na tu viśiṣya
translated: For this very reason, in verbal cognition there is no uncertainty of cause. And that knowledge of the relation of the meaning of the other word is itself the knowledge of the meaning of the sentence. So the grasping of the purport as a general factor is the cause, not specifically.

original: tacca svaparapadārthayoḥ saṃsargānubhavajananaṃ vinā anupapannamiti padāni sambhūya janayanti /
analyzed: tat ca sva para padārthayoḥ saṃsarga anubhava jananam vinā anupapannam iti padāni sambhūya janayanti
translated: And that is not possible without generating the experience of the relation between one's own and other word meanings. Therefore the words jointly generate it.

original: ata eva nānārthe vinigamanā /
analyzed: atas eva nānā arthe vinigamanā
translated: For this very reason, there is no restriction on the meaning of a word with multiple meanings.

original: tadanupapattireva lakṣaṇābījaṃ tadabhāvādeva pacatipade na smṛtakalāyānvayabodha iti siddhaṃ śabdasya pramāṇāntaratvaṃ /
analyzed: tad anupapattiḥ eva lakṣaṇā bījam tad abhāvāt eva pacati pade na smṛta kalāyā anvaya bodhaḥ iti siddham śabdasya pramāṇa antara tvam
translated: The impossibility of that itself is the seed of secondary meaning. Due to the absence of that alone, there is no cognition of the relation of the remembered Kala with the word 'pacati'. Thus it is established that word is a separate means of knowledge.

original: tasya ca nirākāṅkṣādau saṃsargajñānājanakatvāt āṅkṣādikaṃ sahakārīti /
analyzed: tasya ca nirākāṅkṣa ādau saṃsarga jñāna ajanaka tvāt āṅkṣa ādikam sahakāri iti
translated: And because that [word] does not produce the cognition of connection in the absence of expectancy, etc., expectancy, etc. are cooperating factors.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV.

original: tattvacintāmaṇau śabdākāṅkṣāvādapūrvapakṣaḥ
translated: In the Tattva-cintāmaṇi, the prima facie view on the doctrine of expectancy in words

original: atha keyamākaṅkṣā /
analyzed: atha kā iyam ākaṅkṣā
translated: Now, what is this expectancy?

original: na tāvadavinābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tāvat avinābhāvaḥ
translated: It is not, first of all, invariable concomitance.

original: nīlaṃ sarojamityādāvabhāvāt /
analyzed: nīlam sarojam ityādau abhāvāt
translated: Because it does not exist in [expressions like] the blue lotus, etc.

original: vimalaṃ jalaṃ nadyāḥ kacche mahiṣa ityatra jalānvitanadyā avinābhāvāt kacche sākāṅkṣatāpatteḥ /
analyzed: vimalam jalam nadyāḥ kacche mahiṣaḥ iti atra jala anvita nadyāḥ avinābhāvāt kacche sākāṅkṣa tā āpatteḥ
translated: In [expressions like] the water is clear in the river, the buffalo is in the marsh, because the river with water is invariably concomitant, it follows that the marsh is expected.

original: nāpi samabhivyāhṛtapadasmāritapadārthajijñāsā /
analyzed: nā api samabhivyāhṛta pada smārita padārtha jijñāsā
translated: Nor is it the desire to know the meanings of words that are uttered together and recalled.

original: ajijñāsorapi vākyarthabodhāt viśvajitā yajeta dvāraṃ ityatrāpadārthayopyadhikāriṇo 'pyāhṛtasya pidhānasya cākāṅkṣitatvācca /
analyzed: ajijñāsoḥ api vākī artha bodhāt viśvajitā yajeta dvāram iti atra āhṛtasya pidhānasya ca ākāṅkṣita tvāt ca
translated: Because even those who do not desire to know understand the meaning of a sentence, and because in [expressions like] one should sacrifice with the Viśvajit, the door, even the meaning of the word and the qualified person, which are uttered, are expected.

original: tatra śabdakalpanapakṣe 'pi ghaṭaḥ karmatvamānayanaṃ kṛtirityatra jijñāsitasyānayanāderākāṅkṣitatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: tatra śabda kalpana pakṣe pi ghaṭaḥ karma tvam ānayanam kṛtiḥ iti atra jijñāsitasya ānayana ādeḥ ākāṅkṣita tva āpatteḥ
translated: Even in the case of the theory that it is the imagination of a word, in [expressions like] the pot is the object, bringing is the action, the desire to know and the expectation of bringing, etc. follow.

original: atha jijñāsāyogyatā /
analyzed: atha jijñāsā yogya tā
translated: Now, if it is fitness for desire to know,

original: sā jijñāsā ca viśeṣājñāne bhavati /
analyzed: sā jijñāsā ca viśeṣa ajñāne bhavati
translated: and that desire to know occurs in the absence of knowledge of a particular,

original: yogyatā ca śrotari taduccāraṇajanyasaṃsargāvagamaprāgabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yogyatā ca śrotari tad uccāraṇa janya saṃsarga avagama prāgabhāvaḥ
translated: and fitness in the hearer is the prior absence of the understanding of the connection produced by its utterance,

original: vimalaṃ jalaṃ nadyāḥ kacche mahiṣa ityatra tātparyavaśāt kadācit nadyāḥ kacche saṃsargāvagamāt
analyzed: vimalam jalam nadyāḥ kacche mahiṣaḥ iti atra tātparya vaśāt kadācid nadyāḥ kacche saṃsarga avagamāt
translated: In the sentence the buffalo in the river-bed has pure water, due to the intention, sometimes the connection with the river-bed is understood,

original: tatprāgabhāvasattve 'pi śrotari taduccāraṇena tātparyavaśāt jalānvitanadyāḥ kacche
analyzed: tad prāgabhāva sattve pi śrotari tad uccāraṇena tātparya vaśāt jala anvita nadyāḥ kacche
translated: even though the prior absence of that [connection] exists in the hearer, due to the intention from the utterance of that [sentence], the connection with the river-bed endowed with water

original: saṃsargāvagamoneti na tatpragābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: saṃsarga avagamā ūnā iti na tad pragā bhāvaḥ
translated: is understood. Thus there is no prior absence of that [connection].

original: ghaṭaḥ karmatvamānayanamityatrāpi tatheti cet / na /
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ karma tvam ānayanam iti atra api tathā iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the same applies to the sentence the pot is the object of bringing, it is not so.

original: nirākāṅkṣe taduccāraṇajanyasaṃsargāvagamaprāgabhāvasya siddhyasiddhiparāhatatvāt /
analyzed: nirākāṅkṣe tad uccāraṇa janya saṃsarga avagama prāgabhāvasya siddhi asiddhi parāhata tvāt
translated: Because in the complete sentence, the prior absence of the understanding of connection produced by its utterance is contradicted by the establishment and non-establishment [of the connection].

original: kiñca yatraikovimalaṃ jalamityaśrutvaiva tātparyabhrameṇā vā nadyāḥ kacchānvayaparatvamavaiti /
analyzed: kiñca yatra ekaḥ vimalam jalam iti a śrutvā eva tātparya bhrameṇa vā nadyāḥ kaccha anvaya para tvam avaiti
translated: Moreover, in a case where one, without hearing the sentence the pure water, due to a mistake in intention, does not understand the meaning of the connection with the river-bed,

original: aparaḥ samastena śrutvā nadyā jalānvayaparatvamavadhārayati /
analyzed: aparaḥ samastena śrutvā nadyāḥ jala anvaya paratvam avadhārayati
translated: and another, having heard the complete sentence, ascertains the meaning of the connection with the river's water,

original: tatrobhayarapi taduccāraṇajanyasaṃsargāvagamāt nadyā ityubhayasākāṅkṣaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tatra tad uccāraṇa janya saṃsarga avagamāt nadyāḥ iti ubhaya sākāṅkṣam syāt
translated: in that case, both of them, due to the understanding of connection produced by its utterance, would have a desire for both [the river and the water].

original: api ca pragābhāvābhāvasya kāraṇāntarābhāvavyāptatvāt tata eva kāryābhāva iti kimākāṅkṣayā /
analyzed: api ca pragā abhāva abhāvasya kāraṇa antara abhāva vyāpta tvāt tatas eva kārya abhāvaḥ iti kim ākāṅkṣayā
translated: Moreover, since the absence of the prior absence is pervaded by the absence of another cause, the absence of the effect is due to that alone. What is the use of a desire [for the other factor]?

original: evañca yogyatāsattī api na hetū ayogye anāsanne ca taduccāraṇajanyasaṃsargajñānābhāvena tatprāgabhāvābhāvāt /
analyzed: evam ca yogyatā āsattī api na hetū ayogye anāsanne ca tad uccāraṇa janya saṃsarga jñāna abhāvena tad prāgabhāva abhāvāt
translated: And thus even the presence of fitness is not a reason, because in the unfit and the remote, there is no cognition of the relation produced by its utterance, and hence there is no absence of its prior absence.

original: na caivaṃ bādhābhāvasyānumityādāvapi hetutvaṃ /
analyzed: na ca evam bādhā abhāvasya anumiti ādau api hetu tvam
translated: And thus the absence of contradiction is not a reason even in inference etc.

original: prāgabhāvābhāvenaiva kāryābhāvāt prāgabhāvasya ca kāryamātrahetutvāt /
analyzed: prāgabhāva abhāvena eva kārya abhāvāt prāgabhāvasya ca kārya mātra hetu tvāt
translated: Because the absence of effect is itself due to the absence of prior existence, and prior existence is the cause of mere effect.

original: śabde nāsādhāraṇyaṃ utthitotthāpyākāṅkṣayorutkarṣāpakarṣau na syātāṃ prāgabhāve tadabhāvāt /
analyzed: śabde na asādhāraṇyam utthita utthāpya ākāṅkṣayoḥ utkarṣa apakarṣau na syātām prāgabhāve tad abhāvāt
translated: In the case of a word, there is no exception, because in the prior absence, there would be no superiority and inferiority of the desire to raise what has arisen, due to the absence of that.

original: atha jñāpyataditarānvayaprakārakajijñāsānukūlapadārthopasthitijanakatve satyajanitatātparyaviṣayānvayabodhatvamākāṅkṣā /
analyzed: atha jñāpya tad itara anvaya prakāraka jijñāsā anukūla padārtha upasthiti janaka tve satya janita tātparya viṣaya anvaya bodha tvam ākāṅkṣā
translated: If it is so, then desire is the property of being the cognition of the relation that is the content of the intention produced by the presentation of the meaning of the word that is favorable to the desire to know the object to be indicated and other related things, which is not produced by the cognition of the relation.

original: ghaṭamānayatītyatra ghaṭamityukte kimānayati paśyati vā /
analyzed: ghaṭam ānayati iti atra ghaṭam iti ukte kim ānayati paśyati vā
translated: In the sentence Bring the pot, when pot is said, is it brought or seen?

original: ānayatītyukte kiṃ ghaṭaṃ anyadveti jijñāsā bhavati /
analyzed: ānayati iti ukte kim ghaṭam anyat vā iti jijñāsā bhavati
translated: When bring is said, is it the pot or something else? This is the desire to know.

original: ghaṭaḥ karmatvamānanayanaṃ kṛtirityatrābhedena nānvayo 'yogyatvāt /
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ karma tvam āna nayanam kṛtiḥ iti atra abhedena na anvayaḥ yogya tvāt
translated: In the sentence The pot is the object, bringing is the action, there is no relation without difference, because it is unfit.

original: ghaṭasyānayanamiti tu nānvayabodhaḥ ghaṭa itipadāt sambandhitvena ghaṭasyānupasthiteḥ /
analyzed: ghaṭasya ānayanam iti tu na anvaya bodhaḥ ghaṭaḥ iti padāt sambandhi tvena ghaṭasya anupasthiteḥ
translated: But the understanding of 'bringing of the pot' is not so, because the pot is not presented as related by the word 'pot'.

original: rājña iti putreṇa janitānvayabodhatvāt na puruṣamākāṅkṣatīti cet /
analyzed: rājñaḥ iti putreṇa janita anvaya bodha tvāt na puruṣam ākāṅkṣati iti ced
translated: If it is argued that since the understanding of 'born of the king' is by the son, it does not require a man,

original: tarhi nāmavibhaktidhātvākhyātārthānāṃ ghaṭakarmatvānayanakṛtīnāṃ svarūpeṇopasthitirnānvayanvayaprakārakajijñāsānukūleti tatra nākāṅkṣā
analyzed: tarhi nāma vibhakti dhātu ākhyāta arthānām ghaṭa karma tva ānayana kṛtīnām sva rūpeṇa upasthitiḥ na anvaya nvaya prakāraka jijñāsā anukūlā iti tatra na ākāṅkṣā
translated: then the forms of the pot, accusative case, bringing, and action, which are the components of the pot, accusative case, bringing, and action, are not conducive to the desire to know in the form of the understanding of the relation, so there is no expectancy there.

original: ghaṭaḥ karmatvamānayanaṃ kṛtirityatra ghaṭamānayatītyatrevānvayabodhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ karma tvam ānayanam kṛtiḥ iti atra ghaṭam ānayati iti atra iva anvaya bodhaḥ syāt
translated: The understanding of the relation would be like 'the pot, accusative case, bringing, action' in 'bring the pot',

original: na hi tatra padārthasvarūpāṇāṃ etadvailakṣaṇyenopasthitiḥ /
analyzed: na hi tatra padārtha svarūpāṇām etad vailakṣaṇyena upasthitiḥ
translated: because there is no presentation of the forms of the meanings of the words, case endings, roots, and verbal suffixes as different from this.

original: trayāṇāṃ tulyavat smaraṇe prathamaṃ
analyzed: trayāṇām tulya vat smaraṇe prathamam
translated: When the three are remembered equally,

original: yato rājña iti puruṣeṇa nānveti kintu putreṇa tata evāgrre 'pi vyarthamajanitānvayabodhatvamiti /
analyzed: yatas rājñaḥ iti puruṣeṇa nā anveti kintu putreṇa tatas eva agre vyartham a janita anvaya bodha tvam iti
translated: since it does not relate to a man from 'of the king', but only to a son, therefore the uselessness of the understanding of the relation that has already arisen is also later.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: śabdākāṅkṣāvādasiddhāntaḥ
translated: The conclusion on the doctrine of expectancy of words

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: abhidhānāparyavasānamākāṅkṣā yasya yena vinā na svārthānvayānubhāvakatvaṃ tasya tadaparyavasānaṃ /🔽nāmavibhakidhatvākhyātakriyākārakapadānāṃ parasparaṃ vinā na parasparasya svārthānvayānubhavajanakatvaṃ /🔽paramate nīlaghaṭo 'sti nīlaṃ ghaṭamānayetyādau nāmārthānāṃ kārakāṇāñca na parasparamanvayabodhaḥ
analyzed: abhidhāna aparyavasānam ākāṅkṣā yasya yena vinā na svārtha anvaya anubhāvaka tvam tasya tad aparyavasānam  nāma vibhaki dha tva ākhyāta kriyā kāraka padānām parasparam vinā na parasparasya svārtha anvaya anubhava janaka tvam  para mate nīla ghaṭaḥ sti nīlam ghaṭam ānaya ityādau nāma arthānām kārakāṇām ca na parasparam anvaya bodhaḥ
translated: Non-completion of denotation is expectancy, that which, without which, does not convey the connection of its own meaning.🔽The words denoting nouns, verbs and cases, without each other, do not generate the experience of the connection of their own meanings.🔽In the opinion of others, in sentences like The blue pot exists, Bring the blue pot, etc., there is no understanding of the connection between the meanings of nouns and the cases.

original: viśeṣaṇānvitavibhaktyarthānanvayāditi na viśiṣṭavaiśiṣṭyenānvayaḥ kintvārthaḥ samājaḥ /
analyzed: viśeṣaṇa anvita vibhakti artha ananvayāt iti na viśiṣṭa vaiśiṣṭyena anvayaḥ kintu ārthaḥ samājaḥ
translated: Because the meaning of the case ending connected with the qualifier is not connected. Thus there is no connection by the relation of the qualified and the qualifier, but rather a mere aggregation of meanings.

original: asmākantu nīlaghaṭayorabhedānubhavabalādabheda eva saṃsargaḥ viśeṣavibhaktiḥ sādhutvārthaṃ /
analyzed: asmākam tu nīla ghaṭayoḥ abheda anubhava balāt abhedaḥ eva saṃsargaḥ viśeṣa vibhaktiḥ sādhu tva artham
translated: But for us, due to the experience of non-difference between the blue and the pot, there is only non-difference as the relation. The specific case ending is for the sake of correctness.

original: yadvā samānavibhaktikayorabhedānubhavabalāt viśeṣaṇānvitavibhakterabhedārthakatvaṃ ato viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvānubhāvakatvaṃ tatpadayoḥ /
analyzed: yat vā samāna vibhaktikayoḥ abheda anubhava balāt viśeṣaṇa anvita vibhakteḥ abheda arthaka tvam atas viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva anubhāvaka tvam tad padayoḥ
translated: Or, due to the experience of non-difference between those with the same case ending, the case ending connected with the qualifier has the meaning of non-difference. Therefore, those words convey the relation of qualifier and qualified.

original: na parasparaṃ vinā /
analyzed: na parasparam vinā
translated: Not without each other.

original: dvāramityatrādhyāhāraṃ vinā pratiyogyalābhāt na svārthānvayānubhāvakatvaṃ /
analyzed: dvāram iti atra adhyāhāram vinā pratiyogya lābhāt na svārtha anvaya anubhāvaka tvam
translated: In the word 'door', without supplying the missing element, there is no expression of the connection with its own meaning, because the counter-correlate is not obtained.

original: viśvajitā yajetetyatra mamedaṃ kāryamiti pravarttakatātparyaviṣayajñānaṃ nādhikāriṇāṃ vineti tadākāṅkṣā /
analyzed: viśvajitā yajeta iti atra mama idam kāryam iti pravarttaka tātparya viṣaya jñānam na adhikāriṇām vinā iti tad ākāṅkṣā
translated: In the sentence 'One should sacrifice with the Vishvajit', the knowledge of the object of the prompting purport, 'This is my duty', is not for the qualified persons without that expectation.

original: yadvā kartturivādhikāriṇo 'pi ākṣepādeva lābha iti tadanvayo na śābdaḥ kintvānumānikaḥ /🔽gauṇalākṣaṇikayorananubhāvakatvapakṣe tadupasthāpitasyādhyāhṛtasyevetarapadaṃ vinā nānubhāvakatvaṃ /
analyzed: yat vā karttuḥ iva adhikāriṇaḥ ākṣepāt eva lābhaḥ iti tad anvayaḥ na śābdaḥ kintu ānumānikaḥ  gauṇa lākṣaṇikayoḥ ananubhāvaka tva pakṣe tad upasthāpitasya adhyāhṛtasya iva itara padam vinā na anubhāvaka tvam
translated: Or, just as for the agent, for the qualified person also, the gain is only by implication, so the connection with that is not verbal but inferential.🔽In the case of the view that figurative and secondary expressions do not express, like what is supplied by implication, there is no expression without the other word.

original: ghaṭaḥ karmatvaṃ ānayanaṃ kṛtirityādau abhedena nānvayabodho 'yogyatvāt tattatpadebhyastātparyaviṣayatattatpadārthasvarūpajñānañca padāntaraṃ
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ karma tvam ānayanam kṛtiḥ ityādau abhedena na anvaya bodhaḥ yogya tvāt tad tad padebhyaḥ tātparya viṣaya tad tad padārtha svarūpa jñānam ca pada antaram
translated: In the case of 'The pot is the object', 'Bringing is the action', etc., there is no understanding of the relation without distinction, because of unsuitability. The knowledge of the nature of the respective meanings of the respective words, which is the object of the purport, is also

original: vinaiva /
analyzed: vinā eva
translated: without the other word.

original: ghaṭamānayatītyatreva bhrameṇa tathānvayatātparye 'pi kriyā kārakabhāvena nānvayaḥ
analyzed: ghaṭam ānayati iti atra iva bhrameṇa tathā anvaya tātparye pi kriyā kāraka bhāvena na anvayaḥ
translated: Even when there is such a relation by way of error, like in 'Bring the pot', there is no relation by way of action and object.

original: nāmavibhakidhātvākhyātakriyākārakapadānāṃ anvayabodhe tānyeva padāni samarthāni
analyzed: nāma vibhaki dhātu ākhyāta kriyā kāraka padānām anvaya bodhe tāni eva padāni samarthāni
translated: The words like nouns, verbal roots, finite verbs, action, and object are capable of producing the understanding of the relation.

original: na tu tadarthakāni padāntarāṇi /
analyzed: na tu tad arthakāni pada antarāṇi
translated: But not other words that convey their meanings.

original: agniḥ karaṇatvaṃ odanaḥ karmatā pākaḥ kṛtiḥ iṣṭasādhanatā ityādipadebhyaḥ agnirnodanaṃ pacetetyatreva anvayābodhāt /
analyzed: agniḥ karaṇa tvam odanaḥ karmatā pākaḥ kṛtiḥ iṣṭa sādhana tā ityādi padebhyaḥ agniḥ nodanam paceta iti atra iva anvaya ābodhāt
translated: From words like 'fire is the instrument', 'rice is the object', 'cooking is the action', 'means to the desired end', etc., there is no understanding of the relation as in 'fire cooks rice'.

original: agnikaraṇakaudanakarmakapākaviṣayakakṛtiriṣṭasādhanaṃ iti tu vākyaṃ na padaṃ /
analyzed: agni karaṇaka odana karmaka pāka viṣayaka kṛtiḥ iṣṭa sādhanam iti tu vākyam na padam
translated: But the sentence 'The action of cooking rice with fire as the instrument is a means to the desired end' is not a word.

original: ata eva dvāramityatra pidhehipadādhyāhāraḥ /
analyzed: atas eva dvāram iti atra pidhehi pada adhyāhāraḥ
translated: For this very reason, in 'close the door', there is the implication of the word 'close'.

original: kriyāpadārthasyānyata upasthitau api kārakānanvayāt asāmarthyañca svabhāvāt /
analyzed: kriyā padārthasya anyatas upasthitau api kāraka ananvayāt asāmarthyam ca svabhāvāt
translated: Even when the meaning of the verb is present from elsewhere, due to the non-relation of the noun, and due to natural incapacity,

original: anāsannamapi āsannatādaśāyāṃ āsannatvabhrameṇa vā anvayabodhasamarthameva /
analyzed: anāsannam api āsanna tā daśāyām āsanna tva bhrameṇa vā anvaya bodha samartham eva
translated: even what is not proximate, by the delusion of proximity in the state of proximity, is only capable of producing the understanding of the relation.

original: vahninā siñcatītyatra kriyākārakapadayoranvayabodhe sāmarthye 'pi ayogyatājñānaṃ pratibandhakaṃ dāhe samarthasyāpyagnermaṇiriva /
analyzed: vahninā siñcati iti atra kriyā kāraka padayoḥ anvaya bodhe sāmarthye ayogya tā jñānam pratibandhakam dāhe samarthasya api agneḥ maṇiḥ iva
translated: In 'sprinkles with fire', even though the verb and noun words have the capacity to produce the understanding of the relation, the knowledge of unsuitability is a hindrance, like a gem for fire, even though it is capable of burning.

original: ata eva yogyatābhramāt pratibandhakābhāve tato 'pyanvayabodhaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva yogyatā bhramāt pratibandhaka abhāve anvaya bodhaḥ
translated: For this very reason, from the absence of the hindrance due to the delusion of suitability, there is the understanding of the relation even from that.

original: nahi svabhāvato 'samarthaṃ āropitasāmarthyaṃ vā dahati pacati veti /
analyzed: nahi svabhāvataḥ samartham āropita sāmarthyam vā dahati pacati vā iti
translated: For what is naturally incapable, or what has superimposed capacity, does not burn or cook.

original: prakṛte tu padārthasvarūpajñānaṃ na tvanvayabhramo 'pi /
analyzed: prakṛte tu padārtha svarūpa jñānam na tu anvaya bhramaḥ
translated: But in the original, there is knowledge of the nature of the word-meanings, not even a mistake about the relation.

original: purūṣapadaṃ vināpi rājñā ityasya putreṇa samaṃ svārthānvayānubhāvakatvaṃ iti na tadākāṅkṣā /
analyzed: purūṣa padam vinā api rājñā iti asya putreṇa samam svārtha anvaya anubhāvaka tvam iti na tad ākāṅkṣā
translated: Even without the word 'man', the sentence 'by the king's son' conveys its own meaning, so there is no expectancy of it.

original: yadvā trayāṇāṃ smaraṇo 'janitānvayabodhadaśāyāṃ puruṣānvaye tātparyābhāvāt nānvayabodha ityagre 'pi tathā /
analyzed: yat vā trayāṇām smaraṇaḥ janita anvaya bodha daśāyām puruṣa anvaye tātparya abhāvāt na anvaya bodhaḥ iti agre tathā
translated: Or, in the state where the relation is not produced by the recollection of the three, there is no cognition of the relation because there is no intention to relate to the man, so it will be the same later also.

original: na ca putrasyotthitākāṅkṣatvāt tenaivānvayabodha iti /
analyzed: na ca putrasya utthita ākāṅkṣa tvāt tena eva anvaya bodhaḥ iti
translated: And it cannot be said that the relation is cognized by the son itself because it has an expectant relation.

original: vācyam /
analyzed: vācyam
translated: That is to be said.

original: tātparyavaśāt puruṣeṇaiva prathamamanvayabodhāt /
analyzed: tātparya vaśāt puruṣeṇa eva prathamam anvaya bodhāt
translated: Because the relation is first cognized by the man itself by the intention.

original: ata evānvayabodhasamarthatve sati ajanitatātparyaviṣayānvayabodhatvamākāṅkṣeti kecit /🔽prakṛtipratyayābhyāmanvayabodhe janite 'pi vākyaikavākyatāvat kriyākārakapadayorajanitānvayabodhatvamākāṅkṣā /
analyzed: atas eva anvaya bodha samartha tve sati ajanita tātparya viṣaya anvaya bodha tvam ākāṅkṣā iti kecid  prakṛti pratyayābhyām anvaya bodhe janite pi vākya eka vākya tā vat kriyā kāraka padayoḥ ajanita anvaya bodha tvam ākāṅkṣā
translated: For this very reason, some say that expectancy is the state of not producing the cognition of the relation which is the object of intention, while being capable of producing the cognition of the relation.🔽Even when the relation is produced by the primary and secondary affixes, the expectancy is the state of not producing the cognition of the relation between the words denoting action and instrument, just as in the case of the sentence and the sentence.

original: navyāstu padaviśeṣajanyapadārthopasthitiḥ ghaṭaḥ karmatvaṃ ānayanaṃ kṛtirityevambidhapadājanyapadārthopasthitirvā
analyzed: navyāḥ tu pada viśeṣa janya padārtha upasthitiḥ ghaṭaḥ karmatvam ānayanam kṛtiḥ iti evambidha pada ajanya padārtha upasthitiḥ vā
translated: But the Navya-Naiyāyikas say that the apprehension of the meaning produced by a particular word, or the apprehension of the meaning not produced by words like 'jar', 'action', 'bringing', 'effort', etc.,

original: āsattiranvayabodhāṅgamityāsattyabhāvādevambidhaśabdānnānvayabodhaḥ tvayāpyevambipadārthopasthite rākāṅkṣāhetutvenāvaśyamabhyupeyatvāt /
analyzed: āsattiḥ anvaya bodha aṅgam iti āsatti abhāvāt evambidha śabdāt na anvaya bodhaḥ tvayā api
translated: Connection is a factor in the understanding of relation. Due to the absence of connection itself, there is no understanding of relation from such words. Even by you, it must be accepted that when the meaning of such words is present, it is the cause of the requirement of the rest.

original: janitānvayabodhāt nānvayāntarabodhaḥ tātparyābhāvādityākāṅkṣāyāḥ kāraṇatvameva nāsti /
analyzed: janita anvaya bodhāt na anvaya antara bodhaḥ tātparya abhāvāt iti ākāṅkṣāyāḥ kāraṇa tvam eva na asti
translated: From the understanding of relation that is produced, there is no understanding of another relation, because of the absence of purport. Thus, requirement does not have the nature of being a cause at all.

original: kintu svajanakopasthiteḥ paricāyakatvamātramiti /
analyzed: kintu sva janaka upasthiteḥ paricāyaka tva mātram iti
translated: But it has the mere nature of indicating the presence of what produces itself.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: tattvacintāmaṇau yogyatāvādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of fitness in the Tattva-cintāmaṇi

original: pūrvapakṣaḥ
analyzed: pūrvapakṣaḥ
translated: The prima facie view

original: nanu kā yogyatā /
analyzed: nanu kā yogyatā
translated: What, indeed, is fitness?

original: na tāvat sajātīye 'nvayadarśanaṃ /🔽yathākathañcit sājātyasyāvyāvarttakatvāt /
analyzed: na tāvat sajātīye nvaya darśanam  yathā kathañcid sājātyasya a vyāvarttaka tvāt
translated: Not the perception of relation in a similar class.🔽Because similarity in any way is not determinative.

original: padārthatāvacchedakena sājātyasyādyajātaḥ payaḥ pibatītyadāvabhāvāt vākyārthasyāpūrvatvācca /
analyzed: padārtha tā avacchedakena sājātyasya ādi ajātaḥ payaḥ pibati iti adau abhāvāt vākya arthasya apūrva tvāt ca
translated: Because similarity by the distinguisher of the meaning of the word is not present in The one born drinks milk, etc., and because the meaning of the sentence is unprecedented.

original: nāpi samabhivyāhṛtapadārthasaṃsargavyāpyadharmavattvaṃ /
analyzed: nā api samabhivyāhṛta padārtha saṃsarga vyāpya dharmavat tvam
translated: Nor is it the possession of a property pervaded by the relation of the meanings of the co-occurring words.

original: vākyārthasyānumeyatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: vākya arthasya anumeya tva āpatteḥ
translated: Because the meaning of the sentence would become inferable.

original: na ca vastugatyā saṃsargavyāpyo yo dharmastadvastaṃ tacca na jñātumupayujyate iti nānumeyaḥ saṃsarga iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca vastu gatyā saṃsarga vyāpyaḥ yaḥ dharmaḥ tat vastam tat ca na jñātum upayujyate iti na anumeyaḥ saṃsargaḥ iti vācyam
translated: Nor can it be said that the relation is not to be inferred, because the object which is pervaded by the relation is not known to be useful for knowing that object.

original: yogyatābhramācchābdabhramānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: yogyatā bhramāt śābda bhrama anupapatteḥ
translated: Because verbal error is not possible due to the error of fitness.

original: ata evānvayaniścayaviraha eva yogyatā svarūpasattī hetuḥ tatra taddharmābhāvaniścaye tatprakārakaśābdajñānānudayāt iti parāstam /
analyzed: atas eva anvaya niścaya virahe eva yogyatā svarūpa sattī hetuḥ tatra tad dharma abhāva niścaye tad prakāraka śābda jñāna anudayāt iti parāstam
translated: For this very reason, the absence of the ascertainment of the relation is itself the cause of the existence of the form of fitness. Because the verbal knowledge of that form does not arise when the absence of that property is ascertained there.

original: nāpi samabhivyāhṛtapadārthasaṃsargābhāvavyāpyadharmaśrūnyatvam /
analyzed: nā api samabhivyāhṛta padārtha saṃsarga abhāva vyāpya dharma śrūnyatvam
translated: Nor is it the absence of the property pervaded by the absence of the relation of the co-expressed object.

original: prameyamabhidheyamityādau saṃsargābhāvasyāprasiddhyā tadanirūpaṇāt gehaniṣṭhaghaṭābhāve pramite ghaṭo 'stītivākyāttanniścaye 'pyanvayajñānānudayācca
analyzed: prameyam abhidheyam ityādau saṃsarga abhāvasya aprasiddhyā tad anirūpaṇāt geha niṣṭha ghaṭa abhāve pramite ghaṭaḥ sti iti vākyāt tad niścaye pi anvaya jñāna anudayāt ca
translated: Because the absence of relation is not well-known in cases like 'knowable', 'denoted', etc., and because it cannot be determined, and because even when the absence of pot in the house is known, the knowledge of the relation does not arise from the sentence 'the pot exists'.

original: nāpi bādhakapramāṇābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: nā api bādhaka pramāṇa abhāvaḥ
translated: Nor is it the absence of a contradicting means of knowledge.

original: anyacca yadbādhakaṃ tadabhāvasyāyogye 'pi sattvāt /
analyzed: anyat ca yat bādhakam tad abhāvasya ayogye sattvāt
translated: And because the absence of that which is contradictory is present even in what is unfit.

original: nāpi prakṛtasaṃsargabādhakasyābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: nā api prakṛta saṃsarga bādhakasya abhāvaḥ
translated: Nor is it the absence of what contradicts the relation in question.

original: pratiyogisiddhyasiddhivyāghātāt /
analyzed: pratiyogi siddhi asiddhi vyāghātāt
translated: Because of the contradiction of the establishment and non-establishment of the counter-correlate.

original: na ca prakṛtasaṃsarge anyatra siddhasya bādhakapramāṇasyābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na ca prakṛta saṃsarge anyatra siddhasya bādhaka pramāṇasya abhāvaḥ
translated: And there is no absence of a contradicting means of knowledge elsewhere in the case of connection with the primary meaning.

original: prakṛtasaṃsargasya prathamapratīteḥ ayogye 'pi tatsatvācca /
analyzed: prakṛta saṃsargasya prathama pratīteḥ ayogye pi tad sattvāt ca
translated: Because the connection with the primary meaning is first apprehended, and because it exists even in what is not fit.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: tatra bādhakamapyastīti cet /
analyzed: tatra bādhakam api asti iti ced
translated: If it is argued that there is a contradiction there,

original: tarhi prakṛtasaṃsargabādhakasyābhāvaḥ taccāprasiddham /
analyzed: tarhi prakṛta saṃsarga bādhakasya abhāvaḥ tat ca aprasiddham
translated: then the absence of a contradiction to the connection with the primary meaning is not established.

original: ata eva tatra bādhakasyāpyanirūpaṇam /🔽nāpītarapadārthasaṃsargābhāvapramāviṣayatvābhāvo 'padapadārthe /
analyzed: atas eva tatra bādhakasya api anirūpaṇam  na api itara padārtha saṃsarga abhāva pramā viṣaya tva abhāvaḥ pada padārthe
translated: For the same reason, the contradiction there is also not determined.🔽Nor is there absence of being the object of the cognition of the absence of connection with other word meanings in a non-word.

original: kevalānvayinyaprasiddheḥ /🔽etena yatrāsambandhagrāhakaṃ pramāṇaṃ nāsti tadyogyamiti nirastam /
analyzed: kevala anvayini aprasiddheḥ  etena yatra asambandha grāhakam pramāṇam na asti tad yogyam iti nirastam
translated: Because of non-establishment in the case of a mere universal.🔽By this, it is refuted that what is not contradicted by a means of knowledge is fit.

original: nāpi bodhanīyasaṃsargābhāvapramāvirahaḥ /
analyzed: nā api bodhanīya saṃsarga abhāva pramā virahaḥ
translated: Nor is there absence of the absence of the cognition of the connection to be known.

original: pratiyogyaprasiddheḥ /
analyzed: pratiyogi aprasiddheḥ
translated: Because the counter-correlate is not established.

original: bodhanīyasaṃsargasya prāgapratīteḥ yogyatā ca na svarūpasatyupayujyate ityuktam /
analyzed: bodhanīya saṃsargasya prāk apratīteḥ yogyatā ca na svarūpa satī upayujyate iti uktam
translated: Because the connection of the object to be known was not apprehended before, and it has been said that fitness is not useful as an intrinsic reality.

original: ayogye tat sattvasyānirūpaṇācca /
analyzed: ayogye tat sattvasya anirūpaṇāt ca
translated: And because its existence in what is unfit is not determined.

original: api ca svīyabādhakapramāvirahasyāyogye 'pi sattvāt bādhakapramāmātravirahasya yogye 'pi jñātumaśakyatvāt parapramāyā ayogyatvāt /
analyzed: api ca svīya bādhaka pramā virahasya ayogye pi sattvāt bādhaka pramā mātra virahasya yogye pi jñātum aśakya tvāt para pramāyāḥ ayogya tvāt
translated: Moreover, the absence of one's own invalid cognition exists even in what is not fit, and the absence of mere invalid cognition is impossible to know even in what is fit, and the cognition of another is not fit.

original: na ca svarūpasannevāyaṃ hetuḥ /
analyzed: na ca sva rūpa san eva ayam hetuḥ
translated: And this reason is not merely existent in itself.

original: svīyabādhakapramāvirahadāśāyāṃ yogyatābhrameṇa śābdabhramānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: svīya bādhaka pramā viraha dāśāyām yogyatā bhrameṇa śābda bhrama anupapatteḥ
translated: Because in the hope of the absence of one's own invalid cognition, the verbal error would not be possible due to the error of fitness.

original: anvayaprayojakarūpavattvena bādhakapramāmātraviraho 'numeya iti cet / na /
analyzed: anvaya prayojaka rūpavat tvena bādhaka pramā mātra virahaḥ numeyaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the mere absence of invalid cognition is to be inferred by having the form that is the cause of the relation, it is not so.

original: sekānānvitatoye dravadravyatve satyapi bādhakasattvena vyabhicārāt upajīvyatvena tasyaiva yogyatātvāpatteśca /
analyzed: seka anānvita toye drava dravya tve sati api bādhaka sattvena vyabhicārāt upajīvya tvena tasya eva yogyatā tva āpatteḥ ca
translated: Because there is the existence of the invalid cognition even in the water that is not related to sprinkling, due to the presence of fluidity, and because the fitness itself becomes the sublater by being the cause of the sublation.

original: na caivameveti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam eva iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that it is so.

original: ākāṅkṣāsattyanvayaprayojakarūpavattve satyapyanāptavākye bādhakapramāyāmanvābodhāt /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣā satti anvaya prayojaka rūpavat tve sati api anāpta vākye bādhaka pramāyām anvābodhāt
translated: Because even when there is the presence of the form that is the cause of the relation in the absence of expectancy, there is no cognition of the relation in the invalid sentence.

original: bādhakapramāviraho heturiti cettarhyāvaśyakatvāt saiva yogyatā /
analyzed: bādhaka pramā virahaḥ hetuḥ iti ced tarhi āvaśyaka tvāt sā eva yogyatā
translated: If it is argued that the absence of the invalid cognition is the reason, then that itself is the fitness, because it is necessary.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: yogyatāvādasiddhāntaḥ
translated: The conclusion of the theory of fitness

original: ucyate bādhakapramāviraho yogyatā /
analyzed: ucyate bādhaka pramā virahaḥ yogyatā
translated: It is said that the absence of the invalid cognition is the fitness.

original: sā cetarapadārthasaṃsarge 'parapadārthaniṣṭhātyantābhāvapratiyogitvapramāviśeṣyatvābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: sā ca itara padārtha saṃsarge para padārtha niṣṭha atyanta abhāva pratiyogi tva pramā viśeṣya tva abhāvaḥ
translated: And that is the absence of the property of being the qualifier of the cognition of the relation of the absence of the other word-meaning.

original: prameyaṃ vācyamityatra prameyaniṣṭhātyantābhāvapratiyogitvapramāviśeṣyatvaṃ gotve prasiddhaṃ vācyatvasaṃsarge tadabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: prameyam vācyam iti atra prameya niṣṭha atyanta abhāva pratiyogitva pramā viśeṣya tvam go tve prasiddham vācyatva saṃsarge tad abhāvaḥ
translated: In the sentence The knowable is denotable, the property of being the qualifier of the cognition of the relation of the absence of cowness is well-known in cowness, and its absence in the relation of denotability.

original: vastutastvitarapadārthasaṃsarge 'parapadārthaniṣṭhātyantābhāvapratiyog itāvacchedakadharmaśūnyatvaṃ yogyatā lāghavāt śakyajñānatvāñca /
analyzed: vastutas tu itara padārtha saṃsarge para padārtha niṣṭha atyanta abhāva pratiyog iti avacchedaka dharma śūnyatvam yogyatā lāghavāt śakya jñāna tvāt ca
translated: But in reality, in the relation of the other word-meaning, the absence of the property which is the qualifier of the relation of the absence of the other word-meaning is the fitness, due to simplicity and possibility of knowledge.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: na ca naraśiraḥśaucānumānabādhāt tadaśaucabodhakaśabdāt anvayābodha iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca nara śiraḥ śauca anumāna bādhāt tad aśauca bodhaka śabdāt anvaya abodhaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the relation is not understood from the word which conveys the impurity of the human head, because it is contradicted by inference.

original: upajīvyajātīyatvena śabdasya balavattvāt tenaiva tadanumānabādhāt /
analyzed: upajīvya jātīya tvena śabdasya balavat tvāt tena eva tad anumāna bādhāt
translated: Because the word is stronger by being of the class which is to be relied upon, and that inference is contradicted by that itself.

original: nanvākāṅkṣāsattimattvena śabdasya pramāṇatā na tu yogyatāpi tanniveśino bādhābhāvasya pramāmātrahetutvāditi cet / na /
analyzed: nanu ākāṅkṣā āsattimat tvena śabdasya pramāṇatā na tu yogyatā api tad niveśinaḥ bādhā bhāvasya pramā mātra hetu tvāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the word is a means of valid knowledge by having the property of expectancy, but not by fitness also, because the absence of contradiction which is included in it is the cause of valid knowledge only, it is not so.

original: bādhe hi pramāṇadoṣo 'vaśyaṃ vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: bādhe hi pramāṇa doṣaḥ vaśyam vaktavyaḥ
translated: For, in case of contradiction, the fault of the means of valid knowledge must be stated.

original: anyathā pramāṇaviṣaye bādhāsambhavāt yathānumāne bādhādupādhikalpanadvārā vyāptivighātaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā pramāṇa viṣaye bādhā sambhavāt yathā anumāne bādhāt upādhi kalpana dvārā vyāpti vighātaḥ
translated: Otherwise, since contradiction is not possible in the domain of valid cognition, just as in inference, the contradiction of pervasion is through the postulation of an accessory.

original: nirūpādhau bādhānavakāśāt /
analyzed: nirūpādhau bādhā anavakāśāt
translated: Because there is no opportunity for contradiction in the absence of an accessory.

original: seyaṃ na svarūpasato prayojikā śābdabhāsocchedaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: sā iyam na svarūpa satoḥ prayojikā śābda bhāsa uccheda prasaṅgāt
translated: And this is not the motivator of what exists in its own form, because of the consequence of the cessation of verbal cognition.

original: tanniścayaśca na bhavatyupāyābhāvāt iti cet / na /
analyzed: tad niścayaḥ ca na bhavati upāya abhāvāt iti ced na
translated: And that ascertainment does not occur due to the absence of a means. If it is said that it is not so,

original: saṃśayaviparyapramāsādhāraṇasya yogyatājñānamātrasya kāraṇatvāt /
analyzed: saṃśaya viparyapramā sādhāraṇasya yogyatā jñāna mātrasya kāraṇa tvāt
translated: because the mere knowledge of fitness, which is common to doubt, error, and valid cognition, is the cause.

original: ayogyatājñānasya pratibandhakasya sarvatrābhāvāt kvacittanniścayo 'pi yogyatānupalabdhā yatheha ghaṭo nāstīti /
analyzed: ayogya tā jñānasya pratibandhakasya sarvatra abhāvāt yogyatā anupalabdhā yathā iha ghaṭaḥ na asti iti
translated: Because the knowledge of unfitness, which is an obstruction, is absent everywhere, the ascertainment of that is also not perceived in fitness, as in there is no pot here.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p / 🔽āsattivādaparvapakṣaḥ
analyzed: bibl ind  āsatti vāda parvapakṣaḥ
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.🔽The side of the chapter on proximity

original: āsattiścāvyavadhānenānvayapratiyogyupasthitiḥ /
analyzed: āsattiḥ ca avyavadhānena anvaya pratiyogi upasthitiḥ
translated: And proximity is the presence of the object of relation without interruption.

original: sā ca smṛtirnānubhavo 'tonānyonyāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: sā ca smṛtiḥ na anubhavaḥ
translated: And that is memory, not experience. Therefore, there is no mutual dependence.

original: atha nānāviśeṣaṇakakarmakarttṛkaraṇādhikaraṇakriyādikramikapadajñānajanyakramikapadārthasmṛtīnāṃ
analyzed: atha nānā viśeṣaṇaka karma karttṛ karaṇa adhikaraṇa kriyā ādi kramika pada jñāna janya kramika padārtha smṛtīnām
translated: Now, the sequential memories of the meanings of words produced by the knowledge of words with various qualifications, actions, agents, instruments, substrata, actions, etc.,

original: na yaugapadyaṃ sambhavati āśutaravināśināṃ kramikāṇāṃ malakānupapatteriti kathaṃ
analyzed: na yaugapadyam sambhavati āśutara vināśinām kramikāṇām malaka anupapatteḥ iti katham
translated: Simultaneous occurrence is not possible, because a series of very quickly perishing atoms is not possible. So how

original: tāvatpadārthānvayabodhaḥ viśeṣaṇajñānasādhyatvādviśiṣṭajñānasyeti cet /
analyzed: tāvat padārtha anvaya bodhaḥ viśeṣaṇa jñāna sādhya tvāt viśiṣṭa jñānasya iti ced
translated: is the cognition of the relation between the words and their meanings possible? If it is argued that the cognition of the qualified is accomplished by the knowledge of the qualifier,

original: śrautrapratyekapadānubhavajanyasaṃskāramelakādekadaiva tāvatpadasmṛtiḥ tata ekadaiva tāvatpadārthasmṛtau satyāṃ vākyārthānubhavaḥ /
analyzed: śrautra pratyeka pada anubhava janya saṃskāra melakāt ekadā eva tāvat pada smṛtiḥ tatas ekadā eva tāvat padārtha smṛtau satyām vākya artha anubhavaḥ
translated: then the memory of the words arises simultaneously from the collection of impressions produced by the auditory perception of each word. Then, when the memory of the meanings of the words arises simultaneously, there is the cognition of the meaning of the sentence.

original: na cānyaviṣayakasaṃskāreṇa nānyatra smaraṇamiti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca anya viṣayaka saṃskāreṇa na anyatra smaraṇam iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that memory of one thing cannot be produced by the impressions of another thing.

original: vakyārthānupapattyā phalabalena saṃskārāṇāṃ parasparasahakāreṇa tatraikasmaraṇakalpanāt /
analyzed: vakyārtha anupapattyā phala balena saṃskārāṇām paraspara sahakāreṇa tatra eka smaraṇa kalpanāt
translated: Because by the force of the result, which is the impossibility of the meaning of the sentence, the impressions mutually cooperate and imagine a single memory of that.

original: pratyekavarṇasaṃskārāṇāmivānanyagatikatayā padasmaraṇe /
analyzed: pratyeka varṇa saṃskārāṇām iva ananyagatika tayā pada smaraṇe
translated: Just as the impressions of each letter necessarily produce the memory of the word.

original: atha yadyadākāṅkṣitaṃ yogyaṃ sannidhānaṃ prapadyate /
analyzed: atha yat yat ākāṅkṣitam yogyam sannidhānam prapadyate
translated: When something is required, is fit, and comes into proximity,

original: tena tenānvitaḥ svārthaḥ padairevāvagamyate'' /
analyzed: tena tena anvitaḥ sva arthaḥ padaiḥ evā avagamyate
translated: the meaning of the words is understood as related to that by the words themselves.

original: na caivamanvayāntarābhidhānaṃ na syāt viramya vyāpārābhāvāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam anvaya antara abhidhānam na syāt viramya vyāpāra abhāvāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the expression of another relation would not be possible, because there is no operation after cessation.

original: evamapi prathamamananvaye hetvanupanyāsāt uttarasya hīdaṃ sāmagrīvaikalyaṃ na pūrvasyeti cet /
analyzed: evam api prathamam ananvaye hetu anupanyāsāt uttarasya hi idam sāmagrī vaikalyam na pūrvasya iti ced
translated: Even so, in the first case, since the reason is not stated in the non-anvaya, this deficiency in the completeness of the conditions belongs to the latter, not to the former.

original: astu tāvadevaṃ tathāpi caramaṃ tāvatpadārthaghaṭitavākyārthānubhave uktaiva gatirananyagatikatvāt /
analyzed: astu tāvat evam tathā api caramam tāvat padārtha ghaṭita vākya artha anubhave uktā eva gatiḥ ananyagatika tvāt
translated: Let it be so for the time being. Even then, in the experience of the meaning of a sentence consisting of word meanings at the end, the same course is to be followed, because there is no other alternative.

original: atra vadanti /
analyzed: atra vadanti
translated: Here they say:

original: sannidhirna padajanyaivānyavabodhahetuḥ dvāramityādau adhyāhṛtenāpi pidhānādinā anvayabodhadarśanāt /
analyzed: sannidhiḥ na pada janyā evā anya vabodha hetuḥ dvāram ityādau adhyāhṛtena api pidhāna ādinā anvaya bodha darśanāt
translated: Proximity is not produced only by words, but is the cause of understanding something else. In door etc., even by what is supplied, such as closing etc., the understanding of the relation is seen.

original: na ca pidhehīti śabda evādhyāhriyate /
analyzed: na ca pidhehi iti śabdaḥ eva adhyāhriyate
translated: And the word close itself is not supplied.

original: anupayogāt /🔽arthasyaivānvayapratiyogitvenopayogitvāt āvaśyakatvācca /
analyzed: anupayogāt  arthasya eva anvaya pratiyogi tvena upayogi tvāt āvaśyaka tvāt ca
translated: Because it is not useful.🔽Because the meaning itself is useful as the counter-correlate of the relation, and because it is necessary.

original: arthāpatterupapādakaviṣayatvāt /
analyzed: arthāpatteḥ upapādaka viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because presumption has as its object what is explanatory.

original: na ca śabdamātramupapādakaṃ /
analyzed: na ca śabda mātram upapādakam
translated: And the mere word is not explanatory.

original: api tu tadarthaḥ /🔽avaśyakalpyārthasāhacaryeṇa daivavaśasampannaśabdasmṛteranyathāsiddheḥ /
analyzed: api tu tad arthaḥ  avaśya kalpya artha sāhacaryeṇa daiva vaśa sampanna śabda smṛteḥ anyathā siddheḥ
translated: But its meaning is.🔽Because the recollection of the word, which is fortuitously obtained in association with the necessarily imagined meaning, is otherwise established.

original: anyathā padabodhitasyaivārthasyānvayabodhakatvamiti niyamaśakikalpanāpatteḥ /
analyzed: anyathā pada bodhitasya eva arthasya anvaya bodhaka tvam iti niyama śaki kalpanā āpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, there would be the consequence of imagining a rule that only the meaning indicated by the word is what causes the understanding of the relation.

original: svārthānvayaparatvācchabdānāṃ dvāramiti na pidhānānvayabodhakamiti tadanvayabodhārthamavaśyaṃ śabdakalpanamiti cet / na /
analyzed: svārtha anvaya para tvāt śabdānām dvāram iti na pidhāna anvaya bodhakam iti tad anvaya bodha artham avaśyam śabda kalpanam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that since words have the nature of expressing their own meaning and the relation, the door is not the means of expressing the relation of covering, and therefore the word must be imagined for the purpose of expressing that relation, it is not so.

original: lakṣaṇānāṃ vyabhicārāt tavāpyākṣiptena kartrānvayabodhācca /🔽atha dvārapadasahabhāvamātraṃ pidhehiśabdasya kalpyate lāghavāt /
analyzed: lakṣaṇānām vyabhicārāt tava api ākṣiptena kartrā anvaya bodhāt ca  atha dvāra pada sahabhāva mātram pidhehi śabdasya kalpyate lāghavāt
translated: Because figurative expressions are variable, and because even for you the relation with the implied agent is understood.🔽If it is argued that for the sake of simplicity, only the mere co-occurrence with the word door is imagined for the word pihīhi,

original: na ca pidhānābhidhāyakānekaśabdopasthitau vinigamakavirahaḥ /
analyzed: na ca pidhāna abhidhāyaka aneka śabda upasthitau vinigamaka virahaḥ
translated: and that there is no absence of a determining factor when many words expressing covering are present,

original: saṃskāratāratamyāt padaviśeṣasmṛteriti cet / na /
analyzed: saṃskāra tāratamyāt pada viśeṣa smṛteḥ iti ced na
translated: if it is argued that it is due to the gradation of impressions, the memory of specific words, it is not so.

original: ākāṅkṣādimatpratiyogyanvitasvārthaparatvasya krṛptatvāt lāghavenārthādhyāhārāt /
analyzed: ākāṅkṣā ādimat pratiyogi anvita svārtha paratvasya krṛpta tvāt lāghavena artha adhyāhārāt
translated: Because the nature of expressing one's own meaning related to the required relation is fixed, and the meaning is supplied with simplicity.

original: na ca śrutapadāni labdhaprayojanānīti kathamapyadhyāhṛte teṣāṃ tātparyamiti vācyam /🔽śrutārthānvayānupapattyā adhyāhṛte
analyzed: na ca śruta padāni labdha prayojanāni iti katham api adhyāhṛte teṣām tātparyam iti vācyam  śruta artha anvaya anupapattyā adhyāhṛte
translated: And it should not be said that the heard words have attained their purpose, and therefore they have relevance even if somehow supplied.

original: tātparyāt /
analyzed: tātparyāt
translated: Because of the relevance due to the impossibility of the relation of the heard meaning.

original: kathaṃ tarhyedanaṃ pacatītyatra samabhivyāhṛtamātrānvayaḥ kalāyāderapi smṛtatvāt iti cet / na /
analyzed: katham tarhi edanam pacati iti atra samabhivyāhṛta mātra anvayaḥ kalāya ādeḥ api smṛta tvāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that then how is there the relation merely by co-occurrence in he cooks this, because even the ladle etc. are remembered, it is not so.

original: tātparyaniyamādityavehi yatparaḥ śabdaḥ sa hi śabdārthaḥ /
analyzed: tātparya niyamāt iti avehi yad paraḥ śabdaḥ sa hi śabda arthaḥ
translated: Know that the meaning of a word is what it is intended to convey, for that is the purport of the word.

original: anyathā tavāpi daivavaśasmṛtakalāyapadopasthāpitenānvayabodhaḥ syāt ayaṃ devadatta odanamityādivākye kriyāpadādhyāhārabhāvena kartturanabhidhānāt
analyzed: anyathā tava api daiva vaśa smṛta kalāya pada upasthāpitena anvaya bodhaḥ syāt ayam devadattaḥ odanam ityādi vākye kriyā pada adhyāhāra bhāvena karttuḥ anabhidhānāt
translated: Otherwise, even for you, there would be the understanding of relation by the word kalāya, remembered by chance, in the sentence This Devadatta is rice, etc., because the agent is not denoted by the verb.

original: tṛtīyā syāt iti cet / na /
analyzed: tṛtīyā syāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the instrumental case would be used, it is not so.

original: adhyāhṛtapacatipadenāpi kartturanabhidhānāt /
analyzed: adhyāhṛta pacati padena api karttuḥ anabhidhānāt
translated: Because even by the implied verb pacati (cooks), the agent is not denoted.

original: karttusaṃkhyābhihiteti cet / na /
analyzed: karttu saṃkhyā abhihitā iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the number of the agent is denoted, it is not so.

original: devadattasya pāka ityatrāpi tṛtīyāpatteḥ /
analyzed: devadattasya pākaḥ iti atra api tṛtīyā āpatteḥ
translated: Because even in the sentence The cooking of Devadatta, the instrumental case would be used.

original: tātparyatastacca vyavastheti cet / tulyam /🔽nanu dvāraṃ pidhehītyādau pidhānaśabdānubhave pidhānopasthāpakapadatvena janakatvamiti cet / na /
analyzed: tātparyataḥ tat ca vyavasthā iti ced tulyam  nanu dvāram pidhehi ityādau pidhāna śabda anubhave pidhāna upasthāpaka pada tvena janakatvam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that that is determined by the purport, it is the same.🔽If it is argued that in the sentence Close the door, the word pidhānam (closing) is not experienced, but it is the cause by being the word that brings about the closing, it is not so.

original: anvayapratiyogyupasthāpakapadatvena janakatvāt na tu tadupasthāpakayāvatatpadatvena gauravāt /
analyzed: anvaya pratiyogi upasthāpaka pada tvena janaka tvāt na tu tad upasthāpaka yāvat tad pada tvena gauravāt
translated: Because it is the cause by being the word that brings about the cognition of the counter-correlate of the relation, not by being the word that brings about that much, because that would be too complicated.

original: evaṃ pidhānānvayabodhe 'pi /
analyzed: evam pidhāna anvaya bodhe pi
translated: In the same way, even in the cognition of the relation with closing.

original: anyathā gauṇalākṣaṇikayoranvayabodho na syāt tayorananubhāvakatvāditi //
analyzed: anyathā gauṇa lākṣaṇikayoḥ anvaya bodhaḥ na syāt tayoḥ an anubhāvaka tvāt iti
translated: Otherwise, there would be no cognition of the relation in the secondary and figurative senses, because they do not bring about the cognition.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: BibL. Ind. IV. P.

original: āsattivādasiddhāntaḥ
translated: The conclusion of the section on proximity

original: ucyate / kriyāpadopasthāpitā kriyā /
analyzed: ucyate kriyā pada upasthāpitā kriyā
translated: It is said: The action is presented by the verb.

original: kārakapadopasthāpitañca kārakaṃ parasparamākāṅkṣati na tūpasthitimātraṃ anyathā dvāraṃ karmatā pidhehi /
analyzed: kāraka pada upasthāpitam ca kārakam parasparam ākāṅkṣati na tu upasthiti mātram anyathā dvāram karma tā pidhehi
translated: And the object is presented by the noun. They desire each other, not mere presentation. Otherwise, close the door as an object of the action.

original: dvāraṃ pidhānaṃ kṛtirityatrāpi kriyākarmādhyāhāra ivānvayabodhaprasaṅgaḥ
analyzed: dvāram pidhānam kṛtiḥ iti atra api kriyā karma adhyāhāre iva anvaya bodha prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Even in the case of close the door, just as there is an implication of action and object, there would be the implication of the relation.

original: kriyāyāḥ karmaṇaścopasthitestulyatvāt /
analyzed: kriyāyāḥ karmaṇaḥ ca upasthiteḥ tulya tvāt
translated: Because the presentation of action and object is the same.

original: evaṃ vidhapadopasthāpite parasparamākāṅkṣā nastīti cet /🔽tarhyākāṅkṣāyāṃ padaviśeṣopasthāpitatvaṃ tantraṃ na tūpasthitimātraṃ /
analyzed: evam vidha pada upasthāpite parasparam ākāṅkṣā na asti iti ced  tarhi ākāṅkṣāyām pada viśeṣa upasthāpita tvam tantram na tu upasthiti mātram
translated: If it is argued that there is no mutual desire in what is presented by such words,🔽then in the case of desire, the presentation by a particular word is the basis, not mere presentation.

original: arthaviśeṣe 'sādhutvānnātrānvayabodha iti cet / na /
analyzed: artha viśeṣe sādhu tvāt na atra anvaya bodhaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is no implication of the relation here because of ungrammaticality in the case of a particular meaning, it is not so.

original: pidhehīti padaṃ vinā dvāramityasyāpyasādhutvāt tadarthayoge sādhutvasya tulyatvāt sādhutvajñānasyānvayabodhe 'prayojakatvācca gauravādapabhraṃśādapyanvayabodhācca
analyzed: pidhehi iti padam vinā dvāram iti asya api asādhu tvāt tad artha yoge sādhu tvasya tulya tvāt sādhu tva jñānasya anvaya bodhe prayojaka tvāt ca gauravāt apabhraṃśāt api anvaya bodhāt ca
translated: Because even without the word close, door is also ungrammatical, and because the grammaticality is the same in the case of its connection with that meaning, and because the knowledge of grammaticality is not a cause in the case of the implication of the relation, and because of the difficulty, and because of the implication of the relation even from a non-standard form,

original: na cātrāsaṃsargāgrahaḥ /
analyzed: na ca atra a saṃsarga agrahaḥ
translated: And here there is no non-apprehension of the relation.

original: bādhakābhāvāt /
analyzed: bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: tasmāt kriyā padasya kārakapadena kārakapadasya kriyāpadena sahānvayabodhakatvaṃ na tvekaṃ vinā tṛtīyānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt kriyā padasya kāraka padena kāraka padasya kriyā padena saha anvaya bodhaka tvam na tu ekam vinā tṛtīyā anupapattiḥ
translated: Therefore, the word denoting an action does not have syntactical relation with the word denoting a kāraka, nor does the word denoting a kāraka have syntactical relation with the word denoting an action. Without one, the instrumental case is not possible.

original: nahi kriyāpadārthayoge dvitīyā /
analyzed: nahi kriyā padārtha yoge dvitīyā
translated: For there is no instrumental case when there is connection with the meaning of the word denoting an action.

original: ghaṭa ānayanaṃ kṛtirityatrāpi dvitīyāpatteḥ /
analyzed: ghaṭaḥ ānayanam kṛtiḥ iti atra api dvitīya āpatteḥ
translated: Even in the case of 'the pot is the action of bringing', the instrumental case would be applicable.

original: tathā ca puṣpebhya ityatra spṛhayatipadādhyāhāraṃ vinā caturthyanupapattiḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca puṣpebhyaḥ iti atra spṛhayati pada adhyāhāram vinā caturthī anupapattiḥ
translated: And in the same way, in 'from the flowers', without supplying the word 'spṛhayati' (aspires), the ablative case is not possible.

original: yadi spṛhayati padārthayoge caturtho tadā puṣpamicchatītyatrāpi syāt spṛhayatīcchatipadayorekārthatvāt /
analyzed: yadi spṛhayati padārtha yoge tadā puṣpam icchati iti atra api syāt spṛhayati icchati padayoḥ ekārtha tvāt
translated: If the ablative case were to be used when there is connection with the meaning of the word 'spṛhayati' (aspires), then it would also be so in 'the flower desires', because the words 'spṛhayati' (aspires) and 'icchati' (desires) have the same meaning.

original: atha sādhutvārtha dvāraṃ puṣpebhya ityatra pidhehispṛhayatipadādhyāhāro 'numanyate na tvanvayabodhārthaṃ tasyānvayapratiyogivijñānādevopapatteriti
analyzed: atha sādhu tva artha dvāram puṣpebhyaḥ iti atra pidhehi spṛhayati pada adhyāhāraḥ nu manyate na tu anvaya bodha artham tasya anvaya pratiyogi vijñānāt eva upapatteḥ iti
translated: If the supplying of the words 'pidhāhi' (close) and 'spṛhayati' (aspires) is accepted in 'from the flowers' for the sake of correctness, then it is not for the sake of understanding the syntactical relation, because that is possible just from the knowledge of the counterpart of the syntactical relation.

original: tarhi kriyāpadayogaṃ vinā na kārakavibhakiḥ /
analyzed: tarhi kriyā pada yogam vinā na kāraka vibhakiḥ
translated: Then, without connection with the word denoting an action, there is no case-ending denoting a kāraka.

original: kārakapadayogaṃ vinā na tadanvayayogyaṃ kriyāpadamiti kevalakārakapade kriyāpadādhyāhāraḥ /
analyzed: kāraka pada yogam vinā na tad anvaya yogyam kriyā padam iti kevala kāraka pade kriyā pada adhyāhāraḥ
translated: And without connection with the word denoting a kāraka, the word denoting an action is not fit for syntactical relation with it. Therefore, in the word denoting only a kāraka, there is the supplying of the word denoting an action.

original: kevalakriyāyāñca kārakapadādhyāhāraḥ sādhutvārthamāvaśyaka iti tajjanyopasthitiranvayabodhaupayiko
analyzed: kevala kriyāyām ca kāraka pada adhyāhāraḥ sādhu tva artham āvaśyakaḥ iti tad janya upasthitiḥ anvaya bodha aupayikaḥ
translated: And in the case of mere action, the insertion of a word denoting an agent is necessary for the sake of correctness, so the presentation produced by that is useful for the understanding of the relation.

original: tasmāt kriyākārakapadopasthāpitayoreva kriyākārakayoḥ parasparamanvaya iti śabdādhyāhāra eva /
analyzed: tasmāt kriyā kāraka pada upasthāpitayoḥ eva kriyā kārakayoḥ parasparam anvayaḥ iti śabda adhyāhāraḥ eva
translated: Therefore, the relation between action and agent is only between those action and agent presented by the words denoting action and agent, so the insertion of words is itself.

original: kartrākṣepe tu vakṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: kartṛ ākṣepe tu vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: But in the case of the implication of the agent, we will explain.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: tātparyavādaḥ
analyzed: tātparya vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of purport

original: tātparyadhīnaṃ śabdapramāṇyaṃ tatra tatparatvaṃ na tatsādhyakatvaṃ padārthatatsaṃsargayoḥ śabdāsādhyatvāt /
analyzed: tātparya dhīnam śabda pramāṇyam tatra tad paratvam na tad sādhyaka tvam padārtha tad saṃsargayoḥ śabda asādhya tvāt
translated: The validity of verbal testimony depends on purport. Being about that does not mean being to be accomplished by that, because the word-meaning and its connection are not to be accomplished by the word.

original: atha taṅgocarapravṛttinivṛttisādhyakatvaṃ tatparatvaṃ /
analyzed: atha tad gocara pravṛtti nivṛtti sādhyaka tvam tad paratvam
translated: If it is said that being about that means being to be accomplished by the activity and cessation that have that as their domain,

original: tacca bhāvyārthasya sākṣāt bhūtārthasya tu praśaṃsānindāvākyasya praśastaninditārthapratipādanadvārā lākṣaṇikasya lakṣaṇīyaviṣayapravṛttinivṛttijanakatvaṃ
analyzed: tat ca bhāvya arthasya sākṣāt bhūta arthasya tu praśaṃsā nindā vākyasya praśasta nindita artha pratipādana dvārā lākṣaṇikasya lakṣaṇīya viṣaya pravṛtti nivṛtti janaka tvam
translated: and that is directly for the object to be brought about, but for the expressed object it is through the statement of praise and blame, and for the figurative it is the capacity to generate activity and cessation with respect to the indicated object,

original: tatparatvamiti cet / na /
analyzed: tad paratvam iti ced na
translated: if it is said that is being about that, no.

original: tatparatve tajjñānaṃ janayitvā tatra pravarttakatvaṃ tatpravarttakatvañca tatparatvamiti parasparāśrayāt /
analyzed: tad para tve tad jñānam janayitvā tatra pravarttaka tvam tad pravarttaka tvam ca tad para tvam iti paraspara āśrayāt
translated: If it is said to be for that, then after generating the knowledge of that, it becomes the instigator in that, and that instigation of that is being for that. Thus there is mutual dependence.

original: lākṣaṇikasyānanubhāvakatve 'pi lakṣaṇīyaparatvāt kāvyādeḥ svarūpākhyānamātraparatvenāpi paryavasānāñca /
analyzed: lākṣaṇikasya ananubhāvaka tve pi lakṣaṇīya paratvāt kāvya ādeḥ svarūpa ākhyāna mātra paratvena api paryavasānāt ca
translated: Even though the figurative is not expressive, because it is for what is indicated, and because poetry etc. concludes as being only for the purpose of narrating its own nature.

original: nanu tatbuddhijanakatvaṃ tatparatvaṃ praśaṃsānindāvākyamapi praśastaninditasvārthadhīhetutvena tatparameva /
analyzed: nanu tad buddhi janaka tvam tad paratvam praśaṃsā nindā vākyam api praśasta nindita sva artha dhī hetutvena tat param eva
translated: But if it is said that being for that is the cause of generating the cognition of that, then even a statement of praise or blame is for that by being the cause of the cognition of the praised or blamed meaning.

original: tacca jñānaṃ praśaste sarvaḥ pravartate ninditāñca nivartate iti svaviṣaye pravṛttinivṛttau janayatīti tatparamucyata iti cet / na /
analyzed: tat ca jñānam praśaste sarvaḥ pravartate ninditān ca nivartate iti sva viṣaye pravṛtti nivṛttau janayati iti tatparam ucyate iti ced na
translated: And that cognition is said to be for that because it generates engagement and disengagement towards its own object, since everyone engages in the praised and disengages from the blamed. If this is said, it is not so.

original: gauṇalākṣaṇikayoranubhāvakatvāt tadbuddhijanane tatparatvamityanyonyāśrayācca /
analyzed: gauṇa lākṣaṇikayoḥ anubhāvaka tvāt tad buddhi janane tad para tvam iti anyonya āśrayāt ca
translated: Because the figurative and secondary are expressive, and because there is mutual dependence in generating the cognition of that by being for that.

original: tajjananayogyatvamiti cet /
analyzed: tad janana yogya tvam iti ced
translated: If it is said to be the suitability for generating that,

original: tarhyekatroccāraṇe nānārthe nānārthaparatvaṃ lakṣaṇāyāñca mukhyārthaparatvaṃ syāt yogyatāyāḥ sattvāt /
analyzed: tarhi ekatra uccāraṇe nānā arthe nānā artha paratvam lakṣaṇāyām ca mukhya artha paratvam syāt yogyatāyāḥ sattvāt
translated: then in a single utterance, the meaning of many would be for many meanings, and in figurative expression, the primary meaning would be for that, because suitability exists.

original: nāpi tatpratipādyakatvaṃ /
analyzed: nā api tad pratipādyaka tvam
translated: Nor is it the quality of being expressible by that.

original: tātparyaṃ vinā na tathetyanyonyāśrayāt /
analyzed: tātparyam vinā na tathā iti anyonya āśrayāt
translated: Without the intention, it is not so. Thus, there is mutual dependence.

original: praśaṃsānindāvākyasya pravṛttyādyapratipādakatvāt lākṣaṇikasyāpratipādakatvācca /
analyzed: praśaṃsā nindā vākyasya pravṛtti ādi apratipādaka tvāt lākṣaṇikasya apratipādaka tvāt ca
translated: Because a sentence of praise or blame does not convey engagement etc., and because a figurative expression does not convey meaning.

original: atha gaṅgāpadaṃ svārthāvinābhāvi tīraṃ pratipādayattatparamiti cet / na /
analyzed: atha gaṅgā padam svārtha avinābhāvi tīram pratipādayat tat param iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the word Gaṅgā conveys the bank which is invariably concomitant with its own meaning, then it is not so.

original: mañcāḥ krośantītyatra tena vināpi puruṣe tātparyāt gaṅgādipadaṃ matsyādiparaṃ mukhye tīraparañca syāt avinābhāvasya tādavasthyāt /
analyzed: mañcāḥ krośanti iti atra tena vinā api puruṣe tātparyāt gaṅgā ādi padam matsya ādi param mukhye tīra parañca syāt avinābhāvasya tādavasthyāt
translated: Because in the sentence the benches are shouting, even without that, there is intention towards a man. The word Gaṅgā etc. would refer to fish etc. primarily and to the bank secondarily, because the invariable concomitance remains the same.

original: mukhye bādhake satīti cet /
analyzed: mukhye bādhake sati iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is so only when there is contradiction in the primary meaning,

original: tarhi mukhyārthaparataiva na syāt na syācca gaccha gacchasītyatra gamanābhāvaparatvaṃ /
analyzed: tarhi mukhya artha para tā eva na syāt na syāt ca gaccha gacchasi iti atra gamana abhāva para tvam
translated: then it would not have the primary meaning as its referent. And in the sentence go, you are going, it would not have the meaning of absence of going.

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: tatprayojanakatvaṃ tatparatvaṃ tadarthaśca pratītiḥ pravṛttinivṛttī ca /
analyzed: tad prayojanaka tvam tad para tvam tad arthaḥ ca pratītiḥ pravṛtti nivṛttī ca
translated: Being for the sake of that is being about that, and its meaning is cognition, engagement and disengagement.

original: prayojanatvañca na sādhyatvaṃanyonyāśrayāt /
analyzed: prayojana tvam ca na sādhya tvam anyonya āśrayāt
translated: And being for the sake of is not being accomplished, because of mutual dependence.

original: nāpi pratipādyecchāviṣayatvaṃ /🔽yasya yadicchāviṣayaḥ taṃ pratitatparatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: na api pratipādya icchā viṣaya tvam  yasya yad icchā viṣayaḥ tam prati tad paratva āpatteḥ
translated: Nor is it being the object of desire in what is to be conveyed.🔽Because if something is the object of desire for someone, then it would follow that it is about that for him.

original: tadarthasāthyatvena icchāniyama iti cet / na /
analyzed: tad artha sāthya tvena icchā niyamaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is so by virtue of being related to its meaning, it is not so.

original: iha dhūma ityatra janyajñāpyabhedena sādhyasya bahu vidhatayā vākyabhedaprasaṅgāt pumicchayā niyantumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: iha dhūmaḥ iti atra janya jñāpya bhedena sādhyasya bahu vidha tayā vākya bheda prasaṅgāt pumicchayā niyantum aśakya tvāt
translated: Here, in the sentence there is smoke, due to the probandum being of many kinds by the distinction of what is produced and what is indicated, there is the contingence of sentence split, because it cannot be controlled by the speaker's wish.

original: kintu pratipādakecchāviṣayatvaṃ tatparatvaṃ /
translated: But being the content of the speaker's wish is being about that.

original: yaḥ śabdaḥ vaktā yadicchayā prayuktaḥ sa tatparaḥ / sā cecchā
analyzed: yaḥ śabdaḥ vaktā yad icchayā prayuktaḥ sa tatparaḥ sā ca icchā
translated: That word which is used by the speaker according to his wish is about that. And that wish

original: pratipādyadhīpravṛttinivṛttiviṣayeti tatparatvaṃ /🔽nānārthāt śrliṣṭādanekapadārthānvitaikakriyāpadāt mukhyalākṣaṇikaparāccāvṛttyā krameṇānekapadārthajñānaṃ na tvekadaiva /
analyzed: nānā arthāt śrliṣṭāt aneka padārtha anvita eka kriyā padāt mukhya lākṣaṇika parāt ca āvṛttyā krameṇa aneka padārtha jñānam na tu ekadā eva
translated: is about the engagement, disengagement, and object of the understanding of what is to be conveyed. Thus it is about that.🔽From a word with multiple meanings, from a word connected with multiple meanings, from a word denoting a single action connected with multiple meanings, and from a word that is primary and figurative, there is knowledge of multiple meanings in sequence by repetition, but not simultaneously.

original: sakṛduccaritasya sakṛdarthaparatvaniyamenaikatroccaraṇe anekārthaparatvābhāvāditi sakalatāntrikaikavākyatayā vadanti /
analyzed: sakṛt uccaritasya sakṛt artha paratva niyamena ekatra uccaraṇe aneka artha paratva abhāvāt iti sakala tāntrika ekavākyatayā vadanti
translated: They say that this is the case because of the restriction that a word uttered once has a single meaning, and because there is no being about multiple meanings when uttered in one place.

original: vayantu brūmaḥ /
analyzed: vayantu brūmaḥ
translated: But we say:

original: anākapadārthapratītīcchayā ekamuccāraṇaṃ bhavatyeva pumicchāyāniyantumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: anāka padārtha pratīti icchayā ekam uccāraṇam bhavati eva pum icchāyāḥ a niyantum aśakya tvāt
translated: There is indeed a single utterance with the wish to convey the meanings of all the words, because it cannot be controlled by the speaker's wish.

original: yadi ca taduccāraṇaṃ nānekārthaparaṃ tadāvṛttirapi na syāt tātparyanirvāhārthamātravṛttikalpanāt /
analyzed: yadi ca tat uccāraṇam na aneka artha param tadā āvṛttiḥ api na syāt tātparya nirvāha artha mātra vṛtti kalpanāt
translated: And if that utterance is not about many meanings, then repetition would also not be necessary, because it would be assumed to occur only for the sake of conveying the intended meaning.

original: anyathaikapare 'pi tadāpatteḥ /
analyzed: anyathā eka pare pi tad āpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, it would follow even when it is about one thing.

original: ata eva taduccāraṇasya ubhayaparatāyāṃ nāvṛttikalpaṇaṃ tasmāttulyavadanekārthopasthitau🔽tātparyādijñāne yugapadanekānvayabodho bhavati sāmagrayāstulyatvāt prathamamekasyānvayabodho
analyzed: atas eva tad uccāraṇasya ubhaya para tāyām na avṛtti kalpaṇam tasmāt tulya vat aneka artha upasthitau  tātparya ādi jñāne yugapad aneka anvaya bodhaḥ bhavati sāmagrayāḥ tulya tvāt prathamam ekasya anvaya bodhaḥ
translated: For this very reason, when that utterance is about both, repetition is not assumed. Therefore, when many meanings are presented equally,

original: na tadanyasyeti niyantumaśakyatvacca /
analyzed: na tad anyasya iti niyantum aśakya tvat ca
translated: there is simultaneous understanding of many relations, because the collection is the same. At first, the understanding of the relation of one is not that of another, because it cannot be determined.

original: atha vivādadhyāsitamakṣapadoccāraṇaṃ ekapadaikaśaktiviṣayamekamevānubhāvati ekatroccāraṇe nānāśaktyā nānārthānanubhāvakaṃ nānārthatvāt ekaparanānārthapadavaditi
analyzed: atha vivāda dhyāsitam akṣa pada uccāraṇam eka pada eka śakti viṣayam ekam eva anubhāvati ekatra uccāraṇe nānā śaktyā nānā artha an anubhāvakam nānā artha tvāt eka para nānā artha pada vat iti
translated: If it is argued that the utterance of the word akṣa in dispute only expresses one meaning, which is the object of one word and one power, and does not express many meanings with many powers in one utterance, because it has many meanings, like a word about one thing with many meanings,

original: cet / na /
analyzed: ced na
translated: that is not so.

original: anekārthānubhavasāmargrīvasattvena bādhitatvāt sāmagrīrahasyopādhitvācca /
analyzed: aneka artha anubhava sāmargrī vasattvena bādhita tvāt sāmagrī rahasya upādhi tvāt ca
translated: Because it is contradicted by the non-existence of the capacity to experience many meanings, and because it is a secret accessory of the collection.

original: ata evākṣamānayetyukte bhinnaprakaraṇādinā bhinne tātparyapramāyāṃ bhrame vā pratipādyayorekadaivāvṛttiṃ vinānekārthapratītirna tu tatraiko
analyzed: atas eva akṣamā ānaya iti ukte bhinna prakaraṇa ādinā bhinne tātparya pramāyām bhrame vā pratipādyayoḥ ekadā eva āvṛttim vinā aneka artha pratītiḥ na tu tatra ekaḥ
translated: For this very reason, when it is said bring the axe, if there is a different purport due to a different context etc., or if there is doubt, then the understanding of multiple meanings does not occur simultaneously without repetition of the two things to be conveyed, but not there is one.
