original: evaṃ ghaṭaṃ paṭaṃ vā ānayetyatrānayanasyobhayaparatve ekadaivānvayabodho natvāvṛttiḥ vākyabhedastvarthabhedāt na jñānabhedāt /
analyzed: evam ghaṭam paṭam vā ānaya iti atra ānayanasya ubhaya paratve ekadā eva anvaya bodhaḥ na tvā āvṛttiḥ vākya bhedaḥ tu artha bhedāt na jñāna bhedāt
translated: Similarly, in bring the pot or the cloth, if the bringing is related to both, then the understanding of the relation occurs simultaneously, not by repetition. The difference in sentences is due to the difference in meaning, not due to the difference in cognition.

original: gaṅgāyāṃ jalaṃ ghoṣaśca prativasatītyatra gaṅgāpadasya yugapatpravāhatīrayostātparyagrahe tayordvayorapyekadopesthitau jalaghoṣayorekadaivānvayabodhaḥ
analyzed: gaṅgāyām jalam ghoṣaḥ ca prativasati iti atra gaṅgā padasya yugapad pravāha tīrayoḥ tātparya grahe tayoḥ dvayoḥ api ekadā upesthitau jala ghoṣayoḥ ekadā eva anvaya bodhaḥ
translated: In The water and the sound reside in the Ganges, when there is the understanding of the purport of the word Ganges simultaneously with the river and the bank, then the understanding of the relation of the water and the sound occurs simultaneously, even though they are not present together.

original: na ca yugapadvṛttidvayāpattiḥ /
analyzed: na ca yugapad vṛtti dvaya āpattiḥ
translated: And there is no contradiction in having two usages simultaneously.

original: iṣṭatvāt /🔽tātparyādvi vṛttiḥ /
analyzed: iṣṭa tvāt  tātparyāt vi vṛttiḥ
translated: Because it is accepted.🔽The usage is due to the purport.

original: na tu vṛttyanurodhāt tātparyaṃ /🔽gauṇalākṣaṇikayorucchedāpatteḥ tātparyanirvāharthaṃ vṛttitvena tayoḥ kalpanāt /
analyzed: na tu vṛtti anurodhāt tātparyam  gauṇa lākṣaṇikayoḥ uccheda āpatteḥ tātparya nirvāha artham vṛtti tvena tayoḥ kalpanāt
translated: But the purport is not due to the usage.🔽Because if the secondary and figurative meanings were to be rejected, they would have to be assumed as usages in order to fulfill the purport.

original: mukhyalākṣiṇikayorekaikamātraparatve tu yugapadvṛttidvayavirodhaḥ /
analyzed: mukhya lākṣiṇikayoḥ ekaika mātra paratve tu yugapad vṛtti dvaya virodhaḥ
translated: But if the primary and figurative meanings are related to each one individually, then there is a contradiction in having two usages simultaneously.

original: anekānvayabodhaparatve vṛttidvayavirodhasya doṣatve paribhāṣāpatteḥ /
translated: If the meaning of the sentence is to be understood through the relation of many meanings, then the contradiction of the two meanings is a fault, because it is a rule.

original: yatra mukhyārthe śīghratvena prathamamanvayabodhaḥ anantaraṃ lākṣaṇikānvayabodhaḥ
analyzed: yatra mukhya arthe śīghra tvena prathamam anvaya bodhaḥ anantaram lākṣaṇika anvaya bodhaḥ
translated: Where the relation is understood first quickly in the primary meaning, and then the relation in the secondary meaning is understood,

original: tatrāvṛttireva tasmāt yugapattātparyagrahe sati nāvṛttiḥ kintvanekārthaparatve satyeva
analyzed: tatra avṛttiḥ eva tasmāt yugapad tātparya grahe sati na avṛttiḥ kintu aneka artha paratve sati eva
translated: there is repetition. Therefore, when the purport is grasped simultaneously, there is no repetition, but only when there are many meanings.

original: yatra tātparyagrahakamādanvayabodhakramaḥ tatrāvṛttiḥ prathamoccāraṇasya paryavasitatvāditi /
analyzed: yatra tātparya graha kamāt anvaya bodha kramaḥ tatra avṛttiḥ prathama uccāraṇasya paryavasita tvāt iti
translated: Where the order of understanding the relation is due to the grasping of the purport, there is repetition, because the first utterance has ended.

original: evañca loke kḷptatvāt vede 'podaṃ tātparyamiti tasya pauruṣeyatvam /
analyzed: evañca loke kḷpta tvāt vede podam tātparyam iti tasya pauruṣeya tvam
translated: And thus, because it is established in the world, the purport is in the Veda. Therefore, it is authored.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: atra mīmāṃsakāḥ yathoccāraṇapūrvatvāt uccāraṇaṃ vede paratantraṃ tathā tātparyamapi
analyzed: atra mīmāṃsakāḥ yathā uccāraṇa pūrva tvāt uccāraṇam vede paratantram tathā tātparyam api
translated: Here, the Mimamsakas say that just as the utterance in the Veda is dependent on what was uttered before, so too the purport is

original: tātparyapūrvakameveti paratantraṃ na tu kasyāpi prathamaṃ tātparyaṃ anāditvāt pūrvapūrvavākyārthajñānecchayoccāraṇamupajīvyāgrimasya
analyzed: tātparya pūrvakam eva iti paratantram na tu kasya api prathamam tātparyam anādi tvāt pūrva pūrva vākya artha jñāna icchayā uccāraṇam upajīvya agrimasya
translated: dependent in the same way. The purport is only preceded by the purport. It does not belong to anyone first, because it is beginningless. The utterance is dependent on the desire to know the meaning of the previous sentence.

original: tadicchayoccāraṇāt tadicchayā taduccāraṇameva hi tatparatvaṃ lokavedasādhāraṇaṃ /
analyzed: tad icchayā uccāraṇāt tad icchayā tad uccāraṇam eva hi tad paratvam loka veda sādhāraṇam
translated: For the fact that it is uttered by His will is nothing but the fact that it is uttered by His will, which is common to both secular and Vedic speech.

original: sā cecchā svatantrā paratantrā veti na kaścidviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: sā ca icchā svatantrā paratantrā vā iti na kaścid viśeṣaḥ
translated: And there is no difference whether that will is independent or dependent.

original: tadavadhāraṇāñcānādimīmāṃsāpariśodhitanyāyādveda ityubhayavādisiddhaṃ /
analyzed: tad avadhāraṇāt ca anādi mīmāṃsā pariśodhita nyāyāt vedaḥ iti ubhaya vādi siddham
translated: And the ascertainment of that is from the beginningless Mīmāṃsā, which is established by logic. Thus, the Veda is established by both parties.

original: atastātparyānurodhena vedasya na pauruṣeyatvam /
analyzed: atas tātparya anurodhena vedasya na pauruṣeya tvam
translated: Therefore, the Veda is not human in its origin, in accordance with its purport.

original: nanvarthajñānaṃ vinoccaritavedāt kathamarthayoḥ vākyārthajñānaṃ vinā tadicchayoccāraṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: nanu artha jñānam vinā uccarita vedāt katham arthayoḥ vākya artha jñānam vinā tad icchayā uccāraṇa abhāvāt
translated: But how can the meaning be known from the Veda uttered without the knowledge of the meaning? Because there is no utterance by His will without the knowledge of the meaning of the sentence.

original: pratipuruṣamuccāraṇabhedāditi cet /
analyzed: pratipuruṣam uccāraṇa bhedāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is due to the difference in utterance for each person,

original: tarhi paṭhyamānabhāratādapi tathābhūtādarthadhīrna syāt vyāsena yatpratītīcchayā uccāraṇaṃ kṛtaṃ tajjātīyatvāt arthajñānaṃ vināpi paṭhyamānabhāratārthadhīriti
analyzed: tarhi paṭhyamāna bhāratāt api tathābhūtāt artha dhīḥ na syāt vyāsena yat prati iti icchayā uccāraṇam kṛtam tad jātīya tvāt artha jñānam vinā api paṭhyamāna bhārata artha dhīḥ iti
translated: then the knowledge of the meaning from the Mahabharata being recited in the same way would not arise, because the knowledge of the meaning of the Mahabharata being recited without the knowledge of the meaning arises from the fact that it is of the same kind as that which was uttered by Vyasa with the desire to convey that meaning.

original: tarhi vede 'pi tulya /
analyzed: tarhi vede pi tulya
translated: Then it is the same in the case of the Veda also.

original: tattātparyakajātīyatvasya niyāmakatvāt anyathā paṭhyamānavedāttavāpyarthadhīrna syāt īśvarāpraṇītatvāt /
analyzed: tad tātparyaka jātīya tvasya niyāmaka tvāt anyathā paṭhyamāna vedāt tava api artha dhīḥ na syāt īśvara apraṇīta tvāt
translated: Because the fact of being of the same kind as that which has that purport is the determining factor. Otherwise, you would not have the knowledge of the meaning from the Veda being recited by someone else, because it is not composed by God.

original: atha vedaḥ pauruṣeyaḥ vākyatvāt bhāratādivat iti cet /
analyzed: atha vedaḥ pauruṣeyaḥ vākya tvāt bhāratādivat iti cet
translated: If it is argued that the Veda is human speech because it is a statement like the Bharata,

original: ko vedaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ vedaḥ
translated: what is the Veda?

original: anugatadharmābhāvena tasya śākhāsu nānārthatvāt /
analyzed: anugata dharma abhāvena tasya śākhāsu nānā artha tvāt
translated: Because it has different meanings in the branches due to the absence of a common property.

original: tathāhi na mukhyavedapaprayogaviṣayovedaḥ mukhyārthākathanāt /
analyzed: tathā hi na mukhya veda paprayoga viṣayaḥ vedaḥ mukhya artha akathanāt
translated: Thus, the Veda is not the object of the primary use of the word Veda, because it does not state the primary meaning.

original: nāpi śākhāsamudāyaḥ /
analyzed: na api śākhā samudāyaḥ
translated: Nor is it the collection of branches.

original: tasya vedanirūpyatvāt samudāyasyāpratipādakatvena vākyatvāsiddheśca /
analyzed: tasya veda nirūpya tvāt samudāyasya apratipādaka tvena vākya tva asiddheḥ ca
translated: Because that is dependent on the Veda, and because the collection cannot be a statement since it is not a speaker.

original: nāpi svargakāmādivākyaṃ /
analyzed: na api svarga kāma ādi vākyam
translated: Nor is it the statement beginning with one who desires heaven.

original: smṛtibhāratāderapi tathātvāt /
analyzed: smṛti bhārata ādeḥ api tathātvāt
translated: Because the Smriti and Bharata etc. are also like that.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p. 11.

original: nāpi sandigdhakartṛkavākyaṃ /
analyzed: na api sandigdha kartṛka vākyam
translated: Nor is it a statement whose author is doubted.

original: vādinorniścayāt / /
analyzed: vādinoḥ niścayāt
translated: Because the disputants are certain.

original: vādyanumānayostulyatvena madhyasthasya saṃśaya iti cet /
analyzed: vādi anumānayoḥ tulya tvena madhyasthasya saṃśayaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the neutral person has doubt because the statement and inference are equal,

original: tarhyanumānābhyāṃ tasya saṃśayomadhyasthasaṃśayapraśrnānantarañcānumānamityanyonyāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: tarhi anumānābhyām tasya
translated: then there is mutual dependence, because his doubt is from the two inferences, and the inference is after the neutral person's doubt.

original: nāpi vivādādhyāsitaṃ vākyaṃ /
analyzed: nā api vivāda adhyāsitam vākyam
translated: Nor is it the statement that is the subject of dispute.

original: anugatadharmaṃ vinā vivādasyāpyabhāvāt bhāratādāvapi tatsamāvāñca /
analyzed: anugata dharmam vinā vivādasya api abhāvāt bhārata ādau api tad samāvāt ca
translated: Because even dispute is not possible without a common property, and it is also present in the Bharata etc.

original: nāpi mahānajanānāṃ vedākārānugatavyavahārāt vedatvaṃ jātiḥ /
analyzed: nā api veda ākāra anugata vyavahārāt veda tvam jātiḥ
translated: Nor is the Veda a universal because of the usage of the great people that conforms to the form of the Veda.

original: devadattīyatvādyanumāpakaśabdavṛttijātibhiḥ saṅkaraprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: devadattīya tva ādi anumāpaka śabda vṛtti jātibhiḥ saṅkara prasaṅgāt
translated: Because there would be the undesirable consequence of confusion with the universal that is the basis of the usage of the word that indicates the quality of being related to Devadatta.

original: kiñca pauruṣeyatvaṃ na tadarthadhījanyatvaṃ taduccāraṇadhīprabhavatvaṃ vā /
analyzed: kiñca pauruṣeya tvam na tad artha dhī janya tvam tad uccāraṇa dhī prabhava tvam vā
translated: Moreover, being composed by a person does not mean being produced by the cognition of its meaning, or being produced by the cognition of its utterance.

original: adhyāpakatadubhayadhījanyatvena siddhasādhanāt /
analyzed: adhyāpaka tad ubhaya dhī janya tvena siddhasādhanāt
translated: Because it would be proving what is already established by being produced by the cognition of both the teacher and that.

original: nāpyuccāraṇasya sāditvaṃ /
analyzed: na api uccāraṇasya sādi tvam
translated: Nor is the utterance being produced by that.

original: pratyuccāraṇasya sāditvāt /
analyzed: pratyuccāraṇasya sādi tvāt
translated: Because each utterance is being produced by that.

original: nāpi svatantrapuruṣapraṇītatvaṃ /
analyzed: na api svatantra puruṣa praṇīta tvam
translated: Nor is it being composed by an independent person.

original: paṭhyamānavedabhāratayostadabhāvāt /
analyzed: paṭhyamāna veda bhāratayoḥ tad abhāvāt
translated: Because the recited Veda and Mahabharata do not have that.

original: tajjātīyaḥ svatantrapuruṣapraṇīta iti cet /
analyzed: tad jātīyaḥ svatantra puruṣa praṇītaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that it is of that kind and composed by an independent person,

original: tarhi paṭhyamānabhārataṃ vyāsasya na mameti kathaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tarhi paṭhyamāna bhāratam vyāsasya na mama iti katham syāt
translated: then how can the recited Mahabharata be of Vyasa and not of me?

original: svātantryañca yadyuccāraṇavyaktau tadā mamāpyuccāraṇasamānye na vyāsasyāpi /
analyzed: svātantryam ca yadi uccāraṇa vyaktau tadā mama api uccāraṇa samānye na vyāsasya api
translated: And if independence is in the individual utterance, then it is not in the general utterance of me or Vyasa.

original: kiñca svatantrapuruṣapraṇītajātīyatvaṃ yadi sādhyate tadādyabhārate smṛtau ca vākyatvamanaikāntikaṃ /
analyzed: kiñca svatantra puruṣa praṇīta jātīya tvam yadi sādhyate tadā ādya bhārate smṛtau ca vākya tvam anaikāntikam
translated: Moreover, if the universal of being composed by an independent person is to be established, then in the first Mahabharata and Smriti, the property of being a sentence is inconclusive.

original: na hi tajjātīyaṃ svatantrapuruṣapraṇītamiti sādhyamanirdhāritaviśeṣaṃ jīvī kvacidastīti vaditi cet /
analyzed: na hi tad jātīyam svatantra puruṣa praṇītam iti sādhyam anirdhārita viśeṣam jīvī kvacid asti iti vat iti ced
translated: For it is not to be established that what is of that kind is composed by an independent person. If it is said that there is no particular that is determined anywhere,

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p / na /
analyzed: bibl ind  p na
translated: BibL. Ind. IV. P. N.

original: paṭhyamānabhārate vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: paṭhyamāna bhārate vyabhicārāt
translated: Because of the deviation from the recited Mahabharata.

original: athārthaṃ pratītya tadarthaparatayā pratisandhīyamānapadatvaṃ pauruṣeyatvaṃ tasya prathamamāvaśyakatvāt /
analyzed: atha artham pratītya tad artha para tayā pratisandhīyamāna pada tvam pauruṣeya tvam tasya prathamam āvaśyaka tvāt
translated: If it is argued that being a human utterance is being a word that is remembered with the meaning as its object, because it is necessary at first,

original: ata evānuccārito 'pi sau mauniśrlokaḥ pauruṣeya iti cet / na /
analyzed: atas eva an uccāritaḥ sau mauniḥ lokaḥ pauruṣeyaḥ iti ced na
translated: then even the unuttered verse of the sage is a human utterance. No.

original: arthajñānavatādhyapakena siddhasādhanāt /
analyzed: artha jñānavatā adhyapakena siddha sādhanāt
translated: Because it is established by a teacher who knows the meaning.

original: anyathā paṭhyamānavedabhāratābhyāṃ vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: anyathā paṭhyamāna veda bhāratābhyām vyabhicārāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be deviation from the recited Vedas and Mahabharata.

original: ata eva vedatvaṃ svatantrapuruṣapraṇītavṛtti vākyavṛttidharmatvāt bhāratatvavaditi nirastam /
analyzed: atas eva veda tvam svatantra puruṣa praṇīta vṛtti vākya vṛtti dharma tvāt bhārata tva vat iti nirastam
translated: For this very reason, the argument that the Vedas are independent because they are statements made by a free person, like the Mahabharata, is refuted.

original: svatantrapraṇītatvaṃ hi vākyārthagocarayathārthajñānacikhyāpayiṣayoccaraṇaṃ tathā ca
analyzed: svatantra praṇīta tvam hi vākya artha gocara yathārtha jñāna cikhyāpayiṣayā uccaraṇam tathā ca
translated: For independence is the utterance with the desire to make known the true knowledge that has as its object the meaning of a statement, and

original: tathāvidhādhyāpakena siddhasādhanam /
analyzed: tathāvidha adhyāpakena siddha sādhanam
translated: in that way, it is established by a teacher of that kind.

original: etena vaktṛtvānuvaktṛtvayorbhedasya lokasiddhatvāt savaktṛkatvaṃ sādhyamiti nirastaṃ /
analyzed: etena vaktṛ tva anuvaktṛ tvayoḥ bhedasya loka siddha tvāt savaktṛka tvam sādhyam iti nirastam
translated: By this, the argument that the Vedas have a speaker because the difference between speaking and repeating is well-known in the world, and therefore having a speaker is to be established, is refuted.

original: nāpi sajātīyayoccāṇānapekṣoccāraṇaṃ pauruṣeyatvaṃ paṭhyamānavede bādhāt bhārate vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: nā api pauruṣeya tvam paṭhyamāna vede bādhāt bhārate vyabhicārāt
translated: Nor is the fact of being uttered without dependence on a previous utterance of the same kind the definition of being human, because it is contradicted by the Veda being recited and by the Mahabharata.

original: ucyate / śabdatadupajīvipramāṇātirikapramāṇajanyapramityaviṣayārthakatve sati śabdajanyavākyārthajñānajanyapramāṇaśabdatvaṃ vedatvam /
analyzed: ucyate śabda tad upajīvi pramāṇa atirika pramāṇa janya pramitya viṣaya arthaka tve sati śabda janya vākya artha jñāna janya pramāṇa śabda tvam veda tvam
translated: It is said: The definition of the Veda is: being a word whose meaning is not the object of knowledge produced by a means of knowledge other than word and that which depends on word, and being a word that produces a means of knowledge in the form of knowledge of the meaning of a sentence produced by a word.

original: īśvarīyapramāyāḥ ajanyatvāt /
analyzed: īśvarīya pramāyāḥ ajanya tvāt
translated: Because the knowledge of God is not produced by a means of knowledge.

original: vedārthasyānumānādiviṣayatve 'pi anumānādervedopajīvakatvāt /
analyzed: veda arthasya anumāna ādi viṣaya tve pi anumāna ādeḥ veda upajīvaka tvāt
translated: Even though the meaning of the Veda is the object of inference etc., inference etc. depend on the Veda.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: smṛtīnāṃ bhāratādibhāgasya ca vedasamānārthakatve 'pi śabdajanyadhījanyatvāt vedārthaṃ pratītya tat praṇayanāt /
analyzed: smṛtīnām bhārata ādi bhāgasya ca veda samāna arthaka tve pi śabda janya dhī janya tvāt veda artham pratītya tat praṇayanāt
translated: Even though the Smritis and the part of the Mahabharata etc. have the same meaning as the Veda, they are not the Veda because they are produced by knowledge produced by words, and because they were composed after understanding the meaning of the Veda.

original: sajātīyoccāraṇanapekṣoccāritajātīyatvaṃ pauruṣeyatvaṃ /
analyzed: sajātīya uccāraṇa anapekṣa uccārita jātīya tvam pauruṣeya tvam
translated: Being uttered without dependence on a previous utterance of the same kind is the definition of being human.

original: ādyabhārate 'pi tajjatīyatvānna vyabhicāraḥ /
analyzed: ādya bhārate pi tajjatīya tvāt na vyabhicāraḥ
translated: Even in the first Mahabharata, it is not contradicted because it is of the same kind.

original: athavā vedatvaṃ sajītīyoccāṇānapekṣoccaritavṛtti pramāṇatāvacchedakavākyavṛttidharmatvāt smṛtitvavat /
analyzed: athavā veda tvam sa jītīya uccāṇa anapekṣa uccarita vṛtti pramāṇa tā avacchedaka vākya vṛtti dharma tvāt smṛti tva vat
translated: Or, the definition of the Veda is: being a property belonging to a sentence that is a means of knowledge, belonging to what is uttered without dependence on a previous utterance of the same kind, because it is a property of what is uttered by a sentence that is a means of knowledge, like being a Smriti.

original: yadvā vedāḥ śabdājanyavākyārthagocarayathārthajñānajanyāḥ pramāṇaśabdatvāt bhāratavat /
analyzed: yat vā vedāḥ śabda ajanya vākya artha gocara yathārtha jñāna janyāḥ pramāṇa śabda tvāt bhārata vat
translated: Or, the Vedas are produced by true knowledge having for its content the meaning of sentences produced by words, because they are authoritative words, like the Bharata.

original: na ca paṭhyamāne vede bādhaḥ bhārate manvādismṛtau ca vyabhicāraḥ teṣāṃ dvikartṛkatvāt tādṛśajñānajanyajātīyatvaṃ vā sādhyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca paṭhyamāne vede bādhaḥ bhārate manu ādi smṛtau ca vyabhicāraḥ teṣām dvi kartṛka tvāt tādṛśa jñāna janya jātīya tvam vā sādhyam
translated: And there is no contradiction in the Vedas being recited, nor is there any fallacy in the case of Manu's Smritis, because they are produced by two agents, or the probandum may be stated as belonging to the class produced by such knowledge.

original: tavāpyetadabhāvādeva vede 'pauruṣeyatvavyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: tava api etad abhāvāt eva vede pauruṣeya tva vyavahāraḥ
translated: Even for you, the usage of the Vedas being not produced by a person is due to the absence of this.

original: nanvaprayojakamidaṃ vākyārthagocarayathārthajñānapūrvakatvameva śabdapramāṇye tantraṃ na tu tādṛśajñānasya śabdājanyatvamapi gauravāt /
analyzed: nanu aprayojakam idam vākya artha gocara yathārtha jñāna pūrvakatvam eva śabda pramāṇye tantram na tu tādṛśa jñānasya śabda ajanya tvam api gauravāt
translated: But this is not a proper reason, that the authoritativeness of words is based on their being preceded by true knowledge having for its content the meaning of sentences, but not on the true knowledge being produced by words, because it is too wide.

original: anyathā vede 'pi tava dvikartṛkatvena pramāṇyaṃ syāt loke tathā darśanāt /🔽evañca anādimīmāṃsāsiddhanyāyenāvagatatātparyāt vedārthaṃ pratītya pūrvapūrvādhyapakena
analyzed: anyathā vede pi tava dvi kartṛka tvena pramāṇyam syāt loke tathā darśanāt  evañca anādi mīmāṃsā siddha nyāyena avagata tātparyāt veda artham pratītya pūrva pūrva adhyapakena
translated: Otherwise, even in the case of the Vedas, their authoritativeness would be due to their being produced by two agents, because it is seen to be so in the world.

original: uccaritādvedaduttarottarasyāpyadhyayanatadarthapratītirityanāditaivātaḥ kiṃ svatantrapuruṣeṇa
analyzed: uccaritāt vedat uttarottarasya api adhyayana tad artha pratītiḥ iti anāditā eva atas kim svatantra puruṣeṇa
translated: And thus, the meaning of the Vedas being understood through the eternal Mimamsa philosophy, the study of the Vedas by the later students is due to the recitation of the earlier teachers, and the understanding of their meaning. Thus, it is beginningless. So what is the use of an independent person?

original: tatprayojanasya paratantrādeva siddheḥ /
analyzed: tad prayojanasya paratantrāt eva siddheḥ
translated: Because the purpose is accomplished by something else.

original: kiñca pūrvakalo na vedaśūnya ityuddeśyapratīterasiddheḥ nāṃśataḥ siddhasādhanaṃ /
analyzed: kiñca pūrva kalaḥ na veda śūnyaḥ iti uddeśya pratīteḥ asiddheḥ na aṃśataḥ siddhasādhanam
translated: Moreover, the previous person is not devoid of the Vedas, so the proposition is not established, and therefore it is not a partially established proof.

original: tathā pūrvakālīnaṃ vedādhyayanaṃ gurvadhyayanapūrvakaṃ adhyayanatvāt idānīntanādhyāyanavat /
analyzed: tathā pūrva kālīnam veda adhyayanam guru adhyayana pūrvakam adhyayana tvāt idānīntana adhyāyana vat
translated: Similarly, the previous study of the Vedas is preceded by the study of the teacher, because it is a study, like the present study.

original: na ca lipyanumitavedādhyayanena vyabhicāraḥ /
analyzed: na ca lipi anumita veda adhyayanena vyabhicāraḥ
translated: And there is no fallacy due to the study of the Vedas inferred from the script,

original: liperadhyayanapūrvakatvāt /
analyzed: lipeḥ adhyayana pūrvaka tvāt
translated: because the script is preceded by study.

original: na caivaṃ bhāratādhyayanamapi tathā syāt /
analyzed: na ca evam bhārata adhyayanam api tathā syāt
translated: And it cannot be that the study of the Mahabharata would be the same in this way.

original: tasya bhāratādāveva vyāsādikartṛkatvena kathanāditi /
analyzed: tasya bhārata ādau eva vyāsa ādi kartṛka tvena kathanāt iti
translated: Because it is said that it was composed by Vyasa and others in the Mahabharata itself.

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: vedaprāmāṇyādhīnaṃ tatprāmāṇyamityatmāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: veda prāmāṇya adhīnam tat prāmāṇyam iti ātma āśrayaḥ
translated: The validity of that [script] depends on the validity of the Vedas, so it is a fallacy of circular reasoning.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV, p.

original: na ca pūrvavedaprāmāṇyādhīnamuttaravedapramāṇyamiti vyaktibhedamādāya nātmāśraya iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca pūrva veda prāmāṇya adhīnam uttara veda pramāṇyam iti vyakti bhedam ādāya na ātma āśrayaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the validity of the later Vedas depends on the validity of the earlier Vedas, so it is not a fallacy of circular reasoning by taking the difference in individuals.

original: evaṃ tatpūrvasyāpi tatpūrvaprāmāṇyāt prāmāṇyamityanavasthānāt /
analyzed: evam tad pūrvasya api tad pūrva prāmāṇyāt prāmāṇyam iti anavasthānāt
translated: Because in that case, the validity of the earlier one also depends on the validity of the earlier one, so there is an infinite regress.

original: anāditvādayamadoṣa iti cet / na /
analyzed: anādi tvāt ayam adoṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that this is not a fallacy because it is beginningless, that is not so.

original: mūlabhūtapramāṇāntarābhāvāt andhaparamparāpātāt /
analyzed: mūla bhūta pramāṇa antara abhāvāt andha paramparā pātāt
translated: Because there is no other basic means of knowledge, and because it would lead to an infinite regress of blindness.

original: svataḥ pramāṇaṃ veda eva sarvatra vede mūlamiti cet / na /
analyzed: svatas pramāṇam vedaḥ eva sarvatra vede mūlam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the Veda is self-sufficient in its authority, and that in every case the Veda is the basis (of Dharma), (we reply) no.

original: sarveṣāmeva paravedāpekṣatvena svataḥ pramāṇatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva para veda apekṣa tvena svatas pramāṇa tva abhāvāt
translated: For all (the Smṛtis) are not self-sufficient in their authority, because they all depend on the Veda.

original: ata evācārāt smṛtiḥ smṛterācāra ityatra viśvāsavījaparānapekṣamūlabhūtapramāṇābhāvādandhaparamparābhayena tatra vedamūlakatvakalpanā /
analyzed: atas eva ācārāt smṛtiḥ smṛteḥ ācāraḥ iti atra viśvāsa vīja para anapekṣa mūla bhūta pramāṇa abhāvāt andha paramparā bhayena tatra veda mūlaka tva kalpanā
translated: For this very reason, in the case of the Smṛti and the practice (of good men), where there is no basis in the shape of a trustworthy person, which is the seed of confidence, the assumption of the Veda as the basis is made for fear of an infinite regress.

original: anādimahājanaparigrahādanādivedapravāhaprāmāṇyāvadhāraṇe 'pi tannirvāhaketarānapekṣamūlabhūtapramāṇābhāvenānāśvāsa
analyzed: anādi mahājana parigrahāt anādi veda pravāha prāmāṇya avadhāraṇe tad nirvāhaka itara anapekṣa mūla bhūta pramāṇa abhāvena anāśvāsa
translated: Even though the authority of the eternal current of the Veda is ascertained by the acceptance of it by the great people from the beginning, still, in the absence of a basis in the shape of a trustworthy person, which is the basis of that (Veda), there is no confidence (in it),

original: eva anyathā smṛtyācārayorapyevaṃ pramāṇaṇyāvadhāraṇe pramāṇamūlakatvakalpanā na syāt /
analyzed: eva anyathā smṛti ācārayoḥ api evam pramāṇa ṇya avadhāraṇe pramāṇa mūlaka tva kalpanā na syāt
translated: and (therefore) it is not authoritative. Otherwise, the assumption of the basis in the shape of the Veda would not be made in the case of the Smṛti and the practice (of good men) also, if their authority were thus ascertained.

original: tasmādāśvāsavījaparānapekṣeśvarapratyakṣamūlakatvādeva vedasya prāmāṇyaṃ mahājanaprarigrahādavadharyate /
analyzed: tasmāt āśvāsa vīja para anapekṣa īśvara pratyakṣa mūlaka tvāt eva vedasya prāmāṇyam mahājana prarigrahāt avadharyate
translated: Therefore, the authority of the Veda is ascertained by the acceptance of it by the great people, because it has for its basis the perception of God, which is independent of a trustworthy person, the seed of confidence.

original: etenānumānamapi nirastam /
analyzed: etena anumānam api nirastam
translated: By this (argument) inference also is refuted.

original: mūlabhūtapratyakṣaṃ vinā vedaprāmāṇyānupapattyā sādhyābhāvasiddhau bādhāt /
analyzed: mūla bhūta pratyakṣam vinā veda prāmāṇya anupapattyā sādhya abhāva siddhau bādhāt
translated: Because, when the non-existence of the probandum is established by the impossibility of the authority of the Veda without the perception, which is the basis (of the Veda), there is contradiction (of the conclusion of the Buddhist).

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: nanu vedo na pauruṣeyaḥ asmaryamāṇakartṛkatvāditi bādhakamastviti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu vedaḥ na pauruṣeyaḥ asmaryamāṇa kartṛkatvāt iti bādhakam astu iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is a counter-argument that the Veda is not human because its author is not remembered, it is not so.

original: kapilakaṇādagautamaistacchiṣyaiścādyaparyantaṃ vede sakartṛkatvasmaraṇasya pratīyamānatvāt /
analyzed: kapila kaṇāda gautamaiḥ tad śiṣyaiḥ ca ādya paryantam vede sakartṛkatva smaraṇasya pratīyamāna tvāt
translated: Because from Kapila, Kanāda, Gautama, their disciples, and others up to the present day, the remembrance of the Veda as having an author is perceived.

original: na ca mūlabhūtānubhavābhāvāt smaraṇānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: na ca mūla bhūta anubhava abhāvāt smaraṇa anupapattiḥ
translated: And it is not that remembrance is not possible due to the absence of the original experience.

original: pauruṣeyatvānumānādevānubhavāt /
analyzed: pauruṣeya tva anumānāt eva anubhavāt
translated: Because the experience is from the inference of being human itself.

original: asmaraṇameva tatra bādhakamiti cet / na /
analyzed: asmaraṇam eva tatra bādhakam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the mere non-remembrance is the counter-argument there, it is not so.

original: evaṃ satyasmaraṇānanubhavayoranyonyāśrayāt /
analyzed: evam satya smaraṇa ananubhavayoḥ anyonya āśrayāt
translated: Because in that case, the non-remembrance and the non-experience would be mutually dependent.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: agre tadarthasmaraṇābhāve 'pi pramāṇasyānubhāvakam /
analyzed: agre tad artha smaraṇa abhāve pi pramāṇasya anubhāvakam
translated: Even in the absence of the remembrance of its meaning, the means of knowledge is the revealer.

original: ''tasmāttapastepānāccatvāro vedā ajāyanta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire'' iti kartṛśravaṇāt pratimanvantarañcaiṣā śrutiranyā vidhīyate'' ityādikartṛsmaraṇācca
analyzed: tasmāt tapaḥ tepānāt catvāraḥ vedāḥ ajāyanta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire iti kartṛ śravaṇāt pratimanvantaram ca eṣā śrutiḥ anyā vidhīyate iti ādi kartṛ smaraṇāt ca
translated: Because the author is heard: Therefore, when austerity was being performed, the four Vedas were born. The Ṛc verses and Sāman chants were born. And because the author is remembered in the scriptures like This scripture is prescribed differently for each Manu period.

original: pauruṣeyatve bādhakaṃ vinā arthavādamātratvasya vaktṛmaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: pauruṣeya tve bādhakam vinā arthavāda mātra tvasya
translated: Because in the case of being human, without a counter-argument, it is impossible to say that it is mere eulogy.

original: ''svayambhūreṣa bhagavān vedo gītastvayā purā /
analyzed: svayambhūḥ eṣa bhagavān vedaḥ gītaḥ tvayā purā
translated: This self-existent revered Veda was sung by you in the past.

original: śivādyā ṛṣiparyantāḥ smarttāro 'sya na kārakāḥ'' iti mahābhāgavatapurāṇīyavākyasya śrutivirodhenānyacca tātparyāt /
analyzed: śiva ādyāḥ ṛṣi paryantāḥ smarttāraḥ na kārakāḥ iti mahā bhāgavata purāṇīya vākyasya śruti virodhena anyat ca tātparyāt
translated: The rememberers of this, beginning with Śiva and ending with the sages, are not the makers. This statement from the Mahābhārata Purāṇa is contradicted by the Vedas and has a different intended meaning.

original: na ca kāryaparameva pramāṇaṃ /
analyzed: na ca kārya param eva pramāṇam
translated: And a means of knowledge is not merely about an effect.

original: kartṛsmaraṇasya sarvatrāvidhyarthatvāt sakartṛkatvārthavādasya svarganarakārthavādasyeva īśvaramupāsīta'' iti vidhiśeṣatvācca /
analyzed: kartṛ smaraṇasya sarvatra a vidhi artha tvāt sa kartṛka tva artha vādasya svarga naraka artha vādasya iva īśvaram upāsīta iti vidhi śeṣa tvāt ca
translated: Because the remembrance of the agent is not the purpose of all injunctions, and because the eulogy about having an agent, like the eulogy about heaven and hell, is a supplement to the injunction One should worship God.

original: sādhayiṣyate siddhārthasya prāmāṇyam /
analyzed: sādhayiṣyate siddhārthasya prāmāṇyam
translated: The validity of that which has a well-known purpose will be established.

original: na caivamānando 'pīśvare syāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam ānandaḥ pīśvare syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that bliss would not be in God in this way.

original: tatra mānāntaravirodhāt /
analyzed: tatra māna antara virodhāt
translated: Because there is contradiction with another means of knowledge in that case.

original: puruṣasya bhramapramādādibhūyiṣṭhatvena vede nāśvāsa iti cet /
analyzed: puruṣasya bhrama pramāda ādi bhūyiṣṭha tvena vede na āśvāsaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the Veda is not reliable because the person is mostly deluded and mistaken,

original: na / dharmigrāhakamānena nityasarvajñatvena siddhe tatra doṣābhāvāditi /
analyzed: na dharmi grāhaka mānena nitya sarvajña tvena siddhe tatra doṣa abhāvāt iti
translated: that is not so, because when eternality and omniscience are established by the means of knowing the nature of things, there is no fault there.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: śabdanityatāvādapūrvapakṣaḥ
analyzed: śabda nitya tā vāda pūrvapakṣaḥ
translated: The prima facie view on the eternality of sound

original: nanu tathāpyaprayojakaṃ pauruṣeyatvānumānaṃ nityanirdeṣatvenaiva tatprāmāṇyopapatteriti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu tathā api aprayojakam pauruṣeya tva anumānam nitya nirdeṣa tvena eva tad prāmāṇya upapatteḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even so, the inference of being authored is not a reason, because the validity of that is possible only by being eternal and faultless, that is not so.

original: varṇānāṃ anityatvena tatsamūhasya sutarāmanityatvāt /
analyzed: varṇānām anitya tvena tad samūhasya sutarām anitya tvāt
translated: Because the letters are impermanent, and their collection is even more impermanent.

original: na ca tadasiddhaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tat asiddham
translated: And that is not unestablished.

original: tathāhi varṇātmakaḥ śabdo 'nityaḥ samavetatve satyutpattimattvāt ghaṭavat /
analyzed: tathā hi varṇa ātmakaḥ śabdaḥ nityaḥ samaveta tve sati utpattimat tvāt ghaṭa vat
translated: Thus, sound which has the nature of letters is impermanent, because it is an inherence cause and has origination, like a pot.

original: na ca hetvasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: na ca hetu asiddhiḥ
translated: And the reason is not unestablished.

original: utpanno gakāraḥ haṭṭāyāmutpadyamāno 'sti kolāhala iti pratyayāt /
analyzed: utpannaḥ gakāraḥ haṭṭāyām utpadyamānaḥ sti kolāhalaḥ iti pratyayāt
translated: Because there is the cognition The letter 'ga' which has originated is present in the tumult that is originating.

original: na ca vyañjakābhāvāt prāganupalabdhasyopalabdhimātraṃ tasya /
analyzed: na ca vyañjaka abhāvāt prāk anupalabdhasya upalabdhi mātram tasya
translated: And it is not merely the apprehension of what was not apprehended before due to the absence of the manifestor.

original: utpanno gakāra iti pratyayāt /
analyzed: utpannaḥ gakāraḥ iti pratyayāt
translated: Because there is the cognition The letter 'ga' has originated.

original: na cāyamaupādhikaḥ /
analyzed: na ca ayam aupādhikaḥ
translated: And this is not adventitious.

original: anyotpattāvagṛhyamāṇāyāmapi tadanubhavāt /
analyzed: anya utpattau agṛhyamāṇāyām api tad anubhavāt
translated: Because it is experienced even when the origination of another is not being grasped.

original: na ca smaryamāṇāropaḥ /
analyzed: na ca smaryamāṇa āropaḥ
translated: And it is not a superimposition of what is remembered.

original: bādhakābhāvāt /
analyzed: bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

original: anyathā ghaṭotpattirapi na siddhyet /
analyzed: anyathā ghaṭa utpattiḥ api na siddhyet
translated: Otherwise, even the origination of a pot would not be established.

original: yattu śrotrānuvidhānāt padaṃ śṛṇomītyabādhitānuvyavasāyāt śrotrādanyena grahītumaśakyatvāñca
analyzed: yat tu śrotra anuvidhānāt padam śṛṇomi iti abādhita anuvyavasāyāt śrotrāt anyena grahītum aśakya tvāt ca
translated: But what is said - I hear the word because it conforms to the ear, because of the uncontradicted cognition 'I hear the word', and because it cannot be grasped by anything other than the ear -

original: śrotragrāhyaivānupūrvī sā ca dhamamānakālīnaprāgabhāvapratiyogitvaṃ ṭasyeti prāgabhāvapratiyogitvamutpattimattvaṃ
analyzed: śrotra grāhyā eva ānupūrvī sā ca dhama māna kālīna prāgabhāva pratiyogi tvam ṭasya iti prāgabhāva pratiyogi tvam utpattimat tvam
translated: the sequence is grasped by the ear, and that has the prior non-existence which is simultaneous with the present as its counter-correlate, so the prior non-existence is the origination of the letter.

original: varṇasya pratyakṣamiti /
analyzed: varṇasya pratyakṣam iti
translated: The origination of the letter is directly perceived.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: ghajñānānantarajñānaviṣayatva ṭasyānantaryaṃ tayorānupūrvī sā ca manasaiva gṛhyate ghaṭapaṭajñānayoriva /
analyzed: tayoḥ ānupūrvī sā ca manasā eva gṛhyate ghaṭa paṭa jñānayoḥ iva
translated: The sequence of those two is the order of the cognition that arises immediately after the cognition of the jar and the cognition of the cloth. And that is grasped by the mind itself.

original: tadupanītā ca śrotraviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: tad upanītā ca śrotra viṣayaḥ
translated: And that which is presented by that is the object of the ear.

original: nanu sa evāyaṃ gakāra iti pratyabhijñābādhitamidamityekaikā eva gakārādivyaktayaḥ /
analyzed: nanu saḥ eva ayam gakāraḥ iti pratyabhijñā bādhitam idam iti ekaikāḥ eva gakāra ādi vyaktayaḥ
translated: But this is contradicted by the recognition This is the same letter ga. Thus, the individual letters like ga are one by one.

original: yadyapi pratyabhijñāyāṃ nityatvaṃ na viṣayastathāpi nāśakatvābhimataśabdāntarādīnāṃ🔽antarāsambhave 'pi tāvat kālīnatāṃ gakārasya gṛhṇātīti tāvatkālaṃ sthirañcainaṃ
analyzed: yadi api pratyabhijñāyām nitya tvam na viṣayaḥ tathā api nāśaka tva abhimata śabda antara ādīnām  antara asambhave tāvat kālīna tām gakārasya gṛhṇāti iti tāvatkālam sthiram ca enam
translated: Even though eternality is not the object of recognition, still, due to the excess of eternality over the destruction of other sounds that are considered to be destroyed,🔽it comes down to eternality itself, even though the destruction of the letter ga is not possible in the meantime, it grasps the time of the letter ga. Thus, it grasps it as stable for that time.

original: kaḥ paścānnāśayiṣyatīti parābhimatāśuvināśitvatirekānnityatāyāmeva paryavasyati /
analyzed: kaḥ paścāt nāśayiṣyati iti para abhimata āśu vināśi tu atirekāt nitya tāyām eva paryavasyati
translated: Who will destroy it later?

original: na ca dharmiṇo gakārasya bhede 'pi ekajātīyatvena pratyabhijñā /
analyzed: na ca dharmiṇaḥ gakārasya bhede pi eka jātīya tvena pratyabhijñā
translated: And even if the letter ga, the substratum, is different, there is recognition due to belonging to the same class.

original: tathā sati tajjātīyopamitiḥ syānna tu sa evāyamiti /
analyzed: tathā sati tad jātīya upamitiḥ syāt na tu saḥ eva ayam iti
translated: If that were so, there would be a recollection belonging to that class, not This is the same.

original: atha tāratvamandatvaviruddhadharmādhyastaviṣayatvena sā na pramāṇam /
analyzed: atha tāra tva manda tva viruddha dharma adhyasta viṣaya tvena sā na pramāṇam
translated: If it is not a valid cognition due to having an object superimposed with contradictory properties like loudness and slowness,

original: na ca tāratvādīnāṃ svābhāvikatvaṃ viruddhatvañcāsiddhaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tāra tva ādīnām svābhāvika tvam viruddha tvañca asiddham
translated: And the naturalness and contradiction of the qualities of loudness etc. are not unestablished.

original: mandastāro gakārastārānmando 'nya ityananyathāsiddhapratyakṣāt tatsiddheḥ /
analyzed: mandaḥ tāraḥ gakāraḥ tārāt mandaḥ nyaḥ iti ananyathā siddha pratyakṣāt tad siddheḥ
translated: Because their establishment is by perception which is not otherwise established, as in The letter g is low and loud, and the other is low and not loud.

original: na hyapāṃ śaityadravatve svābhāvike ityatra pratyakṣādanyat pramāṇam /
analyzed: na hi apām śaitya drava tve svābhāvike iti atra pratyakṣāt anyat pramāṇam
translated: For in the case of the coldness and fluidity of water being natural, there is no means of knowledge other than perception.

original: tat kiṃ yo yadgatatvena bhāsate sa taddharma eva tathā sati raktaḥ paṭaḥ lohitaḥ sphaṭikaḥ ityādāvapi tathā syādaviśeṣāt / na /
analyzed: tat kim yaḥ yad gata tvena bhāsate sa tad dharmaḥ eva tathā sati raktaḥ paṭaḥ lohitaḥ sphaṭikaḥ ityādau api tathā syāt aviśeṣāt na
translated: Then, is what appears as belonging to something just a property of that? If so, it would be the same in cases like The cloth is red and The crystal is red, because there is no difference. No.

original: raktatvādīnāmanyadharmatvasthitau sphaṭikādīnāñca tadviruddhadharmatve sthite japākusumāderanvaya vyatirekānuvidhānād bādhena tatra bhrāntatvāt
analyzed: rakta tva ādīnām anya dharma tva sthitau sphaṭika ādīnām ca tad viruddha dharma tve sthite japā kusuma ādeḥ anvaya vyatireka anuvidhānāt bādhena tatra bhrānta tvāt
translated: When redness etc. are established as properties of something else and crystal etc. are established as having contradictory properties, then due to the conformity of the presence and absence of the red flower etc., it is erroneous there due to contradiction.

original: na ceha tāratvāderanyadharmatvenopasthitiḥ /
analyzed: na ca iha tāra tva ādeḥ anya dharma tvena upasthitiḥ
translated: But here there is no apprehension of loudness etc. as properties of something else.

original: nāpi gakārādīnāṃ tadviruddhadharmavattvam /
analyzed: nā api gakāra ādīnām tad viruddha dharmavat tvam
translated: Nor do the letters g etc. have those contradictory properties.

original: nāpyanyasya tāratvādidharmaṇo 'nuvidhānam /
analyzed: na api anyasya tāra tva ādi dharmaṇaḥ
translated: Nor is there conformity of anything else having the property of loudness etc.

original: na cāvaśyaṃ svīkṛtavāyoreva dharmāstāratvādayogakārādigatatvena bhāsante iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca avaśyam svīkṛta vāyoḥ eva dharmāḥ tāra tvāt ayogakāra ādi gata tvena bhāsante iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the properties of wind, which is accepted as such, necessarily appear as belonging to loudness etc. and the letter g etc.

original: sparśāgrahe tvaco vyāpārābhāvena tvacā tadagrahāt /
analyzed: sparśa agrahe tvacaḥ vyāpāra abhāvena tvacā tad agrahāt
translated: But if sound is grasped, since there is no operation of the skin, it is not grasped by the skin.

original: na ca śravasā tadgahaḥ /
analyzed: na ca śravasā tat gahaḥ
translated: And it is not grasped by hearing.

original: avāyavīyatvena vāyumātradharmāgrāhakatvāccakṣurvat /🔽tāratvādayo vā na vāyudharmāḥ śravaṇatvāt kādivāt /
analyzed: a vāyavīya tvena vāyu mātra dharma a grāhaka tvāt cakṣuḥ vat  tāra tva ādayaḥ vā na vāyu dharmāḥ śravaṇa tvāt
translated: Because, like the eye, it does not grasp the properties of air alone, being not made of air.🔽Or sharpness, etc. are not the properties of air, because they are grasped by hearing, like the letter ka, etc.

original: vāyurvā na śravaṇamātragrāhyadharmomūrttatvāt paṭavat /
analyzed: vāyuḥ vā na śravaṇa mātra grāhya dharmaḥ mūrtta tvāt paṭa vat
translated: Or air is not the property to be grasped by hearing alone, because it is corporeal, like a cloth.

original: ata eva na tāratvādayo vāyudharmadhvanidharmāḥ vāyudharmasya dhvaneragrahāt /
analyzed: atas eva na tāra tva ādayaḥ vāyu dharma dhvani dharmāḥ vāyu dharmasya dhvaneḥ agrahāt
translated: For this very reason, sharpness, etc. are not the properties of air, but the properties of sound, because the property of air is not grasped.

original: na ca dhvanirūpaḥ śabdo nabhovṛttireva tathā sati taddharmatāratvādigrahaḥ śravaseti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca dhvani rūpaḥ śabdaḥ nabhaḥ vṛttiḥ eva tathā sati tad dharma tāra tva ādi grahaḥ śravasā iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that sound in the form of sound is only present in space, and its properties like sharpness are grasped by hearing.

original: tāro 'yaṃ gakāra ityatra dhyanīnāmasphuraṇaṃ /
analyzed: tāraḥ yam gakāraḥ iti atra
translated: Because sharpness does not appear in this letter ga.

original: tatkāraṇābhāvācca /
analyzed: tad kāraṇa abhāvāt ca
translated: And because there is no cause for that.

original: na ca vyaktyā vinā jātisphuraṇaṃ /
analyzed: na ca vyaktyā vinā jāti sphuraṇam
translated: And the universal does not appear without the individual.

original: tasyā vyaktisamānasaṃvit saṃvedyatvāt /
translated: Because it is to be known by the same cognition as the individual.

original: na ca smaryamāṇatāratvādyāropaḥ /
analyzed: na ca smaryamāṇa tāra tva ādi āropaḥ
translated: And it is not the superimposition of remembered sharpness, etc.

original: bādhakābhāvāt prathamatastāratvādyagrahaprasaṅgācceti /
analyzed: bādhaka abhāvāt prathamatas tāra tva ādi agraha prasaṅgāt ca iti
translated: Because there is no contradiction, and because it would follow that sharpness, etc. are not grasped at first.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: Do not say so.

original: tāratvādayo na gakārādijātayaḥ gatvādinā saṅkaraprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: tāra tva ādayaḥ na gakāra ādi jātayaḥ ga tva ādinā saṅkara prasaṅgāt
translated: Sharpness, etc. are not the universals of the letter ga, etc., because there would be a mixture with the universal ga, etc.

original: na ca nānaiva tāratvaṃ /
analyzed: na ca nānā eva tāra tvam
translated: And pitch is not many.

original: tārākarānugatapratyayābhāvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: tāra ākara anugata pratyaya abhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the absurd consequence that there would be no cognition following the source of pitch.

original: na ca sajātīyasākṣātkārapratibandhakatāvacchedakaśabdavṛttijātitvena nānātaratveṣṭhanugamaḥ /
analyzed: na ca sajātīya sākṣātkāra pratibandhaka tā avacchedaka śabda vṛtti jāti tvena
translated: And the recognition of pitch as many is not by the property of being a universal inhering in sound, which is the qualifier of the obstruction of the cognition of the homogeneous.

original: tadapratisandhāne 'pi tāratvānugatapratyayāt /
analyzed: tad apratisandhāne pi tāra tva anugata pratyayāt
translated: Because there is a cognition following pitch even when that is not remembered.

original: tāratvamandatve ca na śabdavṛttijātī sapratiyogikatvāt /
analyzed: tāra tva manda tve ca na śabda vṛtti jātī sa pratiyogika tvāt
translated: And pitch and slowness are not universals inhering in sound, because they have counter-correlatives.

original: nāpi tāratvamandatvayorvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: nā api tāra tva manda tvayoḥ virodhaḥ
translated: Nor is there a contradiction between pitch and slowness.

original: ya eva gakārastāra āsīt sa evedānīṃ manda iti samayabhedena vaktṛbhedena ca tayorekatvapratīteḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ eva gakāraḥ tāraḥ āsīt saḥ eva idānīm mandaḥ iti samaya bhedena vaktṛ bhedena ca tayoḥ eka tva pratīteḥ
translated: Because there is the cognition of their identity through the difference in time and the difference in the speaker, that the same g sound which was pitched is now slow.

original: tāro 'yaṃ na tāratarastārānmando 'nya iti bhedapratītirastīti cet na /
analyzed: tāraḥ yam na tārataraḥ tārāt mandaḥ nyaḥ iti bheda pratītiḥ asti iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is the cognition of difference as this is pitched, not more pitched, the slow one is different from the pitched one, it is not so.

original: dharmiṇo 'bhede bhāsamāne viśiṣṭadharmibhedapratīterdharmabhedaviṣayatvāt /
analyzed: dharmiṇaḥ bhede bhāsamāne viśiṣṭa dharmi bheda pratīteḥ dharma bheda viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because the cognition of the difference of the qualified things is due to the object of the cognition of the difference of properties, when the non-difference of the substratum appears.

original: ekatra ghaṭe lohito 'yaṃ na śyāmaidānīmiti pratītivat /
analyzed: ekatra ghaṭe lohitaḥ yam na śyāmā aidānīm iti pratīti vat
translated: Like the cognition this red pot is not black now in one pot.

original: na ca tīvreṇa gakāreṇa mandagakārābhibhāvāt tayorbhedaḥ na hi tadeva tadabhibhāvakaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tīvreṇa gakāreṇa manda gakāra abhibhāvāt tayoḥ bhedaḥ na hi tat eva tad abhibhāvakam
translated: And the difference between them is not due to the suppression of the slow g sound by the intense g sound, because that itself is not the suppressor.

original: tasyaiva tenaiva tadaiva grahaṇāgrahaṇayorvirodhāt iti vācyam /
analyzed: tasya eva tena eva tadā eva grahaṇa agrahaṇayoḥ virodhāt iti vācyam
translated: It cannot be said that there is a contradiction in the perception and non-perception of the same by the same at the same time.

original: tāratvavyañjakavāyorbalavattvena mandatvavyañjakavāyvabhibhāvāt mandatvasyāgrahaṇāt /
analyzed: tāra tva vyañjaka vāyoḥ balavat tvena manda tva vyañjaka vāyu abhibhāvāt manda tvasya agrahaṇāt
translated: Because the air that manifests loudness is stronger and overpowers the air that manifests slowness, so slowness is not perceived.

original: santu vā tāramandarūpādayobhinnā eva gakārāstatpratyayabhijñāne bādhakābhāvāt /
analyzed: santu vā tāra manda rūpa ādayaḥ bhinnāḥ eva gakārāḥ tad pratyaya abhijñāne bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Or let the forms of loud and slow be different from the letter 'ga', because there is no contradiction in the recognition of that.

original: tasmāt vāyudharmā eva tāratvādayaḥ śabdagatatvena bhāsante darpaṇadharmā iva sukhādau
analyzed: tasmāt vāyu dharmāḥ eva tāra tva ādayaḥ śabda gata tvena bhāsante darpaṇa dharmāḥ iva sukha ādau
translated: Therefore, loudness etc. are qualities of air only, appearing as belonging to sound, like the qualities of a mirror appearing in the object reflected in it.

original: tadgrahaṇañca sparśapuraskāreṇa karṇaśaṣkulītvagindriyeṇa tāramandajanakavāyūnaṃ
analyzed: tad grahaṇam ca sparśa puraskāreṇa karṇaśaṣkulī tvac indriyeṇa tāra manda janaka vāyūnam
translated: And that is perceived by the skin sense organ in the ear cavity, with the help of touch, of the air that produces loudness and slowness.

original: tvayāpyutkarṣāpakarṣasyodbhūtasparśasya ca svīkārāt śrotreṇaiva vā /
analyzed: tvayā api utkarṣa apakarṣasya udbhūta sparśasya ca svīkārāt śrotreṇa eva vā
translated: Or it may be by the ear itself, because you accept the distinction of superior and inferior and the touch produced.

original: cakṣurāderyanna vāyudharmagrahastatrāyogyatvamupādhiḥ /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ ādeḥ yat na vāyu dharma grahaḥ tatra ayogya tvam upādhiḥ
translated: The reason why the eye etc. do not perceive the qualities of air is because they are not fit for it.

original: anyathā śrotreṇa svaguṇo na gṛhyeta indriye tathā darśanāt /
analyzed: anyathā śrotreṇa sva guṇaḥ na gṛhyeta indriye tathā darśanāt
translated: Otherwise, the ear would not perceive its own quality, because it is seen to be so in the case of other sense organs.

original: cakṣurvā na pārthivarūpagrāhakaṃ apārthivendriyatvāt rasanavat ityadyapi syāt /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ vā na pārthiva rūpa grāhakam apārthiva indriya tvāt rasana vat iti adi api syāt
translated: Or it may be argued that the eye does not perceive the color of earth, because it is not an earthly sense organ, like the tongue.

original: atha yogyo yogyena gṛhyate svaguṇaḥ paraguraṇo vā /
analyzed: atha yogyaḥ yogyena gṛhyate sva guṇaḥ para guraṇaḥ vā
translated: Now, a quality is apprehended by a fit sense organ, either its own or another's.

original: yogyatā ca phalabalena kalpate /
analyzed: yogyatā ca phala balena kalpate
translated: And fitness is imagined on the basis of the power of the result.

original: tarhi śrotrasyāpi vāyudharmagrahe tulyam /
analyzed: tarhi śrotrasya api vāyu dharma grahe tulyam
translated: Then, in the case of the ear also, it is the same in apprehending the quality of air.

original: na ca tāro gakāra ityatra vāyorapratītiḥ /
analyzed: na ca tāraḥ gakāraḥ iti atra vāyoḥ apratītiḥ
translated: And there is no non-apprehension of air in the high-pitched ga-sound.

original: vāyutvenāpratītāvapi tāratvādinaiva tatpratīteḥ /
analyzed: vāyu tvena apratītau api tāra tva ādinā eva tad pratīteḥ
translated: Even when not apprehended as air, it is apprehended just by high-pitch etc.

original: yathā agnitvenapratītāvapi ayogolake lohita iti pratītiḥ /
analyzed: yathā agni tvena pratītau api ayaḥ golake lohitaḥ iti pratītiḥ
translated: Just as when apprehended as fire, there is the apprehension of red in the iron ball.

original: nanu vāyuśabdayostvacā śrotreṇa vā grahe kena tāro 'yaṃ gakāraityāropa iti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu vāyu śabdayoḥ tvacā śrotreṇa vā grahe kena tāraḥ yam gakāra eti āropaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that when the words air and sound are apprehended by the skin or the ear, by what is there the superimposition this is the high-pitched ga-sound? No.

original: ubhayendriyagrāhyayorasaṃsargāgrahāt saṃsargavyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: ubhaya indriya grāhyayoḥ a saṃsarga agrahāt saṃsarga vyavahāraḥ
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of non-contact between what are to be apprehended by both sense organs, there is the usage of contact.

original: astu vā tvagindriyopanītasya śrotreṇāropaḥ śrotreṇaiva vā tāratvagraho 'pītyuktaṃ /
analyzed: astu vā tvac indriya upanītasya śrotreṇa āropaḥ śrotreṇa eva vā tāra tva grahaḥ iti uktam
translated: Or let there be the superimposition by the ear of what is presented by the skin sense organ, or let there be the apprehension of high-pitch even by the ear itself - this has been said.

original: utpattimattvañcāsiddhaṃ tatpratīteḥ śrutapūrvo 'yaṃ gakāra iti pratyabhijñānabādhitatvāt /
analyzed: utpattimat tvañca asiddham tad pratīteḥ śruta pūrvaḥ yam gakāraḥ iti pratyabhijñāna bādhita tvāt
translated: And the quality of being produced is not established, because the cognition of it is contradicted by the recognition this ga-sound was heard before.

original: nanu pratyabhijñaiva tayā bādhitā gatvajātyaupadhiko 'bhedapratyayo gakāre sambhavatītyuktamiti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu pratyabhijñā eva tayā bādhitā ga tva jāti aupadhikaḥ bheda pratyayaḥ gakāre sambhavati iti uktam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that recognition itself is contradicted by that, and the non-difference cognition with the ga-sound as the substrate is possible due to the universal ga-ness, no.

original: gatvajāterasiddheḥ bhede bhāsamāne hyabhedapratītirjātimālambate /
analyzed: ga tva jāteḥ asiddheḥ bhede bhāsamāne hi abheda pratītiḥ jātim ālambate
translated: Because the universal is not established, when difference appears, the cognition of non-difference relies on the universal.

original: na ca gakārabhedapratītirasti /🔽tāratvamandatve api na bhedahetū ya eva tāraḥ sa evedānīṃ manda iti pratyabhijñānāt /
analyzed: na ca gakāra bheda pratītiḥ asti  tāra tva manda tve api na bheda hetū yaḥ eva tāraḥ saḥ eva idānīm mandaḥ iti pratyabhijñānāt
translated: And there is no cognition of the difference of the letter 'ga'.🔽Pitchiness and slowness are also not causes of difference, because there is recognition that the same one is now slow.

original: gakārānityatve 'pi tathā sambhavatīti cet /
analyzed: gakāra anitya tve pi tathā sambhavati iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is possible in the same way even in the impermanence of the letter 'ga',

original: tarhi nityatve 'pi karṇaśaṣkulītvagindriyopanītavāyudharmotpatterupādhitvaṃ sambhavati /
analyzed: tarhi nitya tve pi karṇaśaṣkulī tvac indriya upanīta vāyu dharma utpatteḥ upādhi tvam sambhavati
translated: then even in permanence, the condition of being produced by the property of air brought by the ear-drum and skin sense organ is possible.

original: na ca vāyorapratītiḥ /
analyzed: na ca vāyoḥ apratītiḥ
translated: And there is no non-cognition of air.

original: utpannatvenaiva tatpratīteḥ lohitatveneva japākusumasya sphaṭike /
analyzed: utpanna tvena eva tad pratīteḥ lohita tvena iva japā kusumasya sphaṭike
translated: Because it is cognized just by being produced, like a red japā flower in a crystal.

original: astu vā prāganulabhyamānatve sati upalabhyamānatvena utpannasya sādṛśyena smṛtotpattimattvāropaḥ /
analyzed: astu vā prāk anulabhyamāna tve sati upalabhyamāna tvena utpannasya sādṛśyena smṛta utpattimat tva āropaḥ
translated: Or let there be the superimposition of the property of being produced by memory through similarity in one who is cognized as produced after not being cognized before.

original: na caivaṃ ghaṭādāvapi notpatteḥ siddhyediti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam ghaṭa ādau api nā utpatteḥ siddhyet iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that in this way, production would not be established even in a pot,

original: kulālavyāpārānantaramanubhūyamānadhaṭasya tadvyāpārāt prāganubhūyamānena ghaṭena nābhedobhāsate kintu bheda eveti tatra prāgasattve sattvaṃ
analyzed: kulāla vyāpāra anantaram anubhūyamāna dhaṭasya tad vyāpārāt prāk anubhūyamānena ghaṭena na abhedaḥ bhāsate kintu bhedaḥ eva iti tatra prāk asattve sattvam
translated: because the difference of the pot cognized after the potter's operation from the pot cognized before the potter's operation does not appear as non-difference but as difference, so there the non-existence before and existence after are superimposed through similarity.

original: gakāre tūtpattipratītyanantaraṃ kaṇṭhatālvādivyāpārāt pūrvamanubhūyamānagakāreṇābhedapratyayāt pūrvamanubhūyagakāreṇābhedapratyayāt dīpavat
analyzed: gakāre tu utpatti pratīti anantaram kaṇṭha tālu ādi vyāpārāt pūrvam anubhūyamāna gakāreṇa abheda pratyayāt pūrvam anubhūya gakāreṇa abheda pratyayāt dīpa vat
translated: In the letter 'ga', there is the cognition of non-difference with the letter 'ga' experienced before the operation of the throat, palate, etc., after the cognition of origination, like a lamp.

original: sa vyañjaka eva /
analyzed: sa vyañjakaḥ eva
translated: It is only the manifester.

original: atha śabda utpadyate utkarṣavattve sati apakarṣavattvāt mādhuryavat ata evānityatvamiti cet / na /
analyzed: atha śabdaḥ utpadyate utkarṣavat tve sati apakarṣavat tvāt mādhurya vat atas eva anitya tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that sound is produced because it has both superiority and inferiority, like sweetness, and for the same reason it is non-eternal, it is not so.

original: tāratvamandatvayorutkarṣāpakarṣayorgakāre pūrvanyāyenāsiddheḥ siddhau vā jātisaṅkarabhayenotkarṣāpakarṣayorjātyoḥ rasatvaśabdatvavyāpyayornānātvena
analyzed: tāra tva manda tvayoḥ utkarṣa apakarṣayoḥ gakāre pūrva nyāyena asiddheḥ siddhau vā jāti saṅkara bhayena utkarṣa apakarṣayoḥ jātyoḥ rasa tva śabda tva vyāpyayoḥ nānātvena
translated: Because superiority and inferiority of loudness and slowness are not established in the letter 'ga' by the previous reasoning, or if established, due to the fear of mixing the universals, the universals of superiority and inferiority, which pervade sweetness and sound, are different.

original: rasaśabdasādhāraṇyābhāvāt /
analyzed: rasa śabda sādhāraṇya abhāvāt
translated: There is no commonality between sweetness and sound.

original: ata eva sajātīyasākṣātkārapratibandhakatāvacchedakasāmānyamutkarṣaḥ tatpratibadhyasākṣātkāraviṣayatāvacchedakasāmānyamapakarṣa iti sādhāraṇo
analyzed: atas eva sajātīya sākṣātkāra pratibandhaka tā avacchedaka sāmānyam utkarṣaḥ tad pratibadhya sākṣātkāra viṣaya tā avacchedaka sāmānyam apakarṣaḥ iti sādhāraṇaḥ
translated: For the same reason, superiority is the common property that determines the obstruction of the cognition of the homogeneous, and inferiority is the common property that determines the object of the cognition that is obstructed. The common reason

original: heturapāstaḥ /
analyzed: hetuḥ apāstaḥ
translated: is refuted.

original: tāratvādergakārajātitvāsiddheḥ /
analyzed: tāra tva ādeḥ gakāra jāti tva asiddheḥ
translated: Because loudness, etc. are not established as the universal of the letter 'ga'.

original: sādhanāvacchinnasādhyavyāpakapūrttaguṇatatvasyāśrautratvasya copādhitvāt aprayojakatvācca /
analyzed: sādhana avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka pūrtta guṇata tvasya aśrautra tvasya ca upādhi tvāt aprayojaka tvāt ca
translated: Because the quality of being a non-inherent cause, which is pervaded by the probandum qualified by the means of knowledge, is a superimposition, and because it is not a proper reason.

original: na hi kāraṇādhīna eva utkarṣo 'pakarṣaśca /
analyzed: na hi kāraṇa adhīnaḥ eva utkarṣa u pakarṣaḥ ca
translated: For superiority and inferiority are not dependent on causes alone.

original: paramamahati paramāṇau ca parimāṇe pratyekaṃ sattvāt /
analyzed: parama mahati paramāṇau ca parimāṇe pratyekam sattvāt
translated: Because in the case of the supreme atom and the supreme magnitude, magnitude exists in each.

original: na cobhayasyaikatra sattvaṃ kāraṇaprayojyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca ubhayasya ekatra sattvam kāraṇa prayojyam
translated: And the existence of both in one thing is not caused by a cause.

original: ekaikavaddvayorapi pratyekamekatvāt /
analyzed: ekaika vat dvayoḥ api pratyekam ekatvāt
translated: Because both are like each one, each one being one.

original: syādetat /
analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be so.

original: śrotravyāpārānantaramidānīṃ śrutapūrvo gakāro nāsti vinaṣṭaḥ kolāhala iti pratīteḥ pratyakṣameva śabdānityatvaṃ vināśibhāvatvenotpattimattvānumānadvā /🔽pratyakṣrapratiyogikābhāvatvena hi pratyakṣatvaṃ dhvaṃsasya ghaṭadhvaṃsavat na tu vināśagrahe pratiyogisamavāyipratyakṣatvaṃ tantraṃ dharmābhāvasya
analyzed: śrotra vyāpāra anantaram idānīm śruta pūrvaḥ gakāraḥ na asti vinaṣṭaḥ kolāhalaḥ iti pratīteḥ pratyakṣam eva śabda anitya tvam vināśi bhāva tvena utpattimat tva anumāna dvār  pratyakṣra pratiyogika abhāva tvena hi pratyakṣa tvam dhvaṃsasya ghaṭa dhvaṃsa vat na tu vināśa grahe pratiyogi samavāyi pratyakṣa tvam tantram dharma abhāvasya
translated: Since there is the cognition Now, after the operation of the ear, the letter 'ga' heard before does not exist, it has perished, it is a din, the impermanence of sound is directly perceived as perishable, or it is inferred to be produced.

original: pratyakṣatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: pratyakṣa tva āpatteḥ
translated: For the destruction is directly perceived as the absence of what is directly perceived, like the destruction of a pot, not the direct perception of the counter-correlate that inheres in the apprehension of destruction, because the absence of a property would follow.

original: tadindriyāgrāhye 'pi pratiyogisamavāyini gandharasābhāvayograhaṇācca /
analyzed: tad indriya a grāhye pi pratiyogi samavāyini gandha rasa abhāvayoḥ grahaṇāt ca
translated: And because the absence of smell and taste is apprehended even when the counter-correlate that inheres is not apprehended by the sense organ.

original: nobhayaṃ gauravāt smṛtaghaṭasaṃyogadhvaṃsapratyakṣatvāpātācca /
analyzed: na ubhayam gauravāt smṛta ghaṭa saṃyoga dhvaṃsa pratyakṣa tva āpātāt ca
translated: And it is not both, because of the undesirable consequence that the destruction of the conjunction of a pot would be perceptible, due to its heaviness.

original: na ca pratiyogiyogyatvasya tantratve vāyusparśadhvaṃso 'pi pratyakṣaḥ syāt iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca pratiyogi yogya tvasya tantra tve vāyu sparśa dhvaṃsaḥ api pratyakṣaḥ syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even the destruction of the touch of air would be perceptible if the fitness of the counter-correlate were the determining factor.

original: āśrayanāśajanyasya tasya grāhakendriyasannikarṣābhāvāt /
analyzed: āśraya nāśa janyasya tasya grāhaka indriya sannikarṣa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contact of the sense organ that apprehends it with what is produced by the destruction of the substratum.

original: kiñca yasya sattvaṃ yatrānupalabdhārthaḥ /
analyzed: kiñca yasya sattvam yatra anupalabdha arthaḥ
translated: Moreover, the existence of something is not apprehended where there is non-apprehension of the object.

original: ata eva pṛthivītvābhāvo jalīyaparamāṇau na pratyakṣaḥ pratyakṣaśca vāyau rūpābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva pṛthivī tva abhāvaḥ jalīya paramāṇau na pratyakṣaḥ pratyakṣaḥ ca vāyau rūpa abhāvaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the absence of earthness is not perceptible in watery atoms, but the absence of form is perceptible in air.

original: asti ca tathā śabde tasya sattve samavadhāne ca pratītiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: asti ca tathā śabde tasya sattve samavadhāne ca pratīti prasaṅgāt
translated: And if the existence and conjunction of that [absence of form] were to exist in sound, there would be the undesirable consequence of the apprehension of it.

original: niradhikaraṇābhāvapratītirnāstīti cet / na /
analyzed: niradhikaraṇa abhāva pratītiḥ na asti iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is no apprehension of an absence without a substratum, that is not so.

original: ihedānīṃ śabdo nāstīti pratīteḥ /
analyzed: iha idānīm śabdaḥ na asti iti pratīteḥ
translated: Because there is the apprehension Sound does not exist here now.

original: tasmāt yatrādhikaraṇe deśe samaye vā pratiyogyatra vartate tatra tadabhāvo nirūpyate /
analyzed: tasmāt yatra adhikaraṇe deśe samaye vā pratiyogī atra vartate tatra tad abhāvaḥ nirūpyate
translated: Therefore, the absence of something is determined in that substratum, i.e., in that place or time where the counter-correlate exists.

original: ata eva sadbhyāmabhāvo nirūpyate ityuktaṃ /
analyzed: atas eva sadbhyām abhāvaḥ nirūpyate iti uktam
translated: For this very reason, it is said that absence is determined by two [entities].

original: śabdābhāvasya ca svata evendriyasannikṛṣṭatvāt nāśraye sannikarṣāpekṣā /
analyzed: śabda abhāvasya ca svatas eva indriya sannikṛṣṭa tvāt na āśraye sannikarṣa apekṣā
translated: And because the absence of sound is in contact with the sense organ by itself, it does not require contact with the substratum.

original: indriyaviśeṣaṇatayā nābhāvagrahaṇamiti cet / na /
analyzed: indriya viśeṣaṇa tayā na abhāva grahaṇam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the absence is not grasped because it is a qualifier of the sense organ, that is not so.

original: ayogyatvasyāpadhitvāt /
analyzed: ayogya tvasya apadhi tvāt
translated: Because the state of being unfit is a superimposition.

original: anyathā guṇasya saṃyuktasamavāyena grahaṇadarśanāt na samavāyena śabdagrahaḥ syāditi /
analyzed: anyathā guṇasya saṃyukta samavāyena grahaṇa darśanāt na samavāyena śabda grahaḥ syāt iti
translated: Otherwise, because the quality is seen to be grasped by the inherence in the conjoined, the sound would not be grasped by inherence.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, it should not be so.

original: sata eva hi śabdasya vyañjakavirahādanupalabdhimātraṃ na tu dhvaṃsaḥ /🔽tattadvayāpetarasakalatadupalambhakasamavadhāne tadanupalabdhirūpayogyānupalabdherabhāvāt /
analyzed: sataḥ eva hi śabdasya vyañjaka virahāt anupalabdhi mātram na tu dhvaṃsaḥ  tad tad vaya apeta rasa kala tad upalambhaka samavadhāne tad anupalabdhi rūpa yogya anupalabdheḥ abhāvāt
translated: For, it is only the non-apprehension of the existent sound due to the absence of the manifestor that is mere non-apprehension, not destruction.🔽Because there is no absence of the possible non-apprehension in the form of non-apprehension of that, which is the conjunction of all the apprehenders of that which is dependent on that and that.

original: pratiyogyupalambhakavyañjakavāyusparśadhvaṃsopādhikaiva /
translated: It is only due to the destruction of the contact with the air that is the manifestor of the apprehender of the opposite.

original: vāyurnotpādakaḥ kintu vyañjakaḥ ityatra kiṃ vinigamakamiti cet / na /
analyzed: vāyuḥ na utpādakaḥ kintu vyañjakaḥ iti atra kim vinigamakam iti ced na
translated: If it is asked what is the determining factor here that the air is not the producer but the manifestor, no.

original: idānīṃ śrutapūrvo gakāro nāsti vinaṣṭaḥ kolāhalaiti pratītyanantaraṃ punaḥ śravaṇe śrutapūrvo 'yaṃ gakāraḥ punaḥ sa evāyaṃ kolāhala iti pratyabhijñānameva /
analyzed: idānīm śruta pūrvaḥ gakāraḥ na asti vinaṣṭaḥ kolāhala eti prati iti anantaram punar śravaṇe śruta pūrvaḥ yam gakāraḥ punar saḥ eva ayam kolāhalaḥ iti pratyabhijñānam eva
translated: After the cognition The previously heard letter ga does not exist now, it is destroyed by the noise, when it is heard again, there is the recognition This previously heard letter ga is the same as the one in the noise.

original: ghaṭadhvaṃsapratītyanantarañca sa evāyaṃ ghaṭa iti na pratyabhijñānamiti tatra vinaṣṭapratītyādhvaṃsa eva sidhyati /
analyzed: ghaṭa dhvaṃsa pratīti anantaram ca saḥ eva ayam ghaṭaḥ iti na pratyabhijñānam iti tatra vinaṣṭa pratītyādhvaṃsaḥ eva sidhyati
translated: And after the cognition of the destruction of the pot, there is no recognition that 'this is the same pot', so the destruction is established only by the cognition of what has been destroyed there.

original: ata eva tāratvatārataratvamandatvamandataratvapratītīnāṃ bhramatvakalpanamityapāstam /
analyzed: atas eva tāra tva tāratara tva manda tva mandatara tva pratītīnām bhrama tva kalpanam iti apāstam
translated: For this very reason, the assumption that the cognitions of 'high pitch', 'higher pitch', 'low pitch', and 'lower pitch' are illusory is rejected.

original: etāsu satīṣpyabhedapratyabhijñānāt /
analyzed: etāsu satīṣu abheda pratyabhijñānāt
translated: Because even when these are present, there is the recognition of non-difference.

original: syādetat /
analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be argued:

original: śabdaḥ prayatnasādhyaḥ tadanabhivyañjakatvaṃ hi indriyasambandhapratibandhakāpanāyakatvādindriyasannidhāpakatvādvā kuḍyotsāraṇeneva paṭādīnāṃ /
analyzed: śabdaḥ prayatna sādhyaḥ tad anabhivyañjaka tvam hi indriya sambandha pratibandhaka apanāyaka tvāt indriya sannidhāpaka tvāt vā kuḍya utsāraṇena iva paṭa ādīnām
translated: Sound is accomplished by effort. Its non-manifestation is either due to the removal of the obstruction to the connection with the sense organ, or due to the proximity of the sense organ, like the removal of a wall for cloth etc.

original: tadubhayamapi śabde na sambhavati nityasamavetatvenāvaraṇāpanayanasannidhānapanayorabhāvāt /
analyzed: tat ubhayam api śabde na sambhavati nitya samaveta tvena āvaraṇa apanayana sannidhāna panayoḥ abhāvāt
translated: Both of these are not possible for sound, because there is no removal of obstruction or proximity due to its being eternally inherent.

original: nāpi śrotrasaṃskārāt /🔽indriyasaṃskārasya unmīlanālokādeḥ sakṛdindrayasambandhayogyasarvārthopalabdhyanukūlasaṃskārajanakatvaṃ
analyzed: na api śrotra saṃskārāt  indriya saṃskārasya unmīlana āloka ādeḥ sakṛt indraya sambandha yogya sarva artha upalabdhi anukūla saṃskāra janaka tvam
translated: Nor is it from the modification of the auditory organ.

original: dṛṣṭaṃ tadvadvāyurapi sakṛdeva sarvaśabdopalabdhyanukūlalaṃ śrotre saṃskāramādadhyāt /
analyzed: dṛṣṭam tadvat vāyuḥ api sakṛt eva sarva śabda upalabdhi anukūla lam śrotre saṃskāram ādadhyāt
translated: The modification of the sense organ, such as the light of opening the eyes, is seen to produce a modification favorable to the perception of all objects connected with the sense organ at once. In the same way, air would also deposit a modification favorable to the perception of all sounds in the auditory organ at once.

original: tathāca sarvaśabdopalabdhiḥ syāt /
analyzed: tathā ca sarva śabda upalabdhiḥ syāt
translated: And thus there would be the apprehension of all words.

original: taduktaṃ sakṛcca saṃskṛtaṃ śrotraṃ sarvaśabdān prakāśyet /
analyzed: tat uktam sakṛt ca saṃskṛtam śrotram sarva śabdān prakāśyet
translated: And it is said: The ear, once embellished, would manifest all sounds.

original: ghaṭāyonmīlitaṃ cakṣuḥ paṭaṃ na hi na budhyate'' /
analyzed: ghaṭāya unmīlitam cakṣuḥ paṭam na hi na budhyate
translated: The eye, opened for a pot, does not indeed not perceive a cloth.

original: athānvaya vyatirekābhyāṃ kārye pratiniyatajanakajanyatvavacchabde 'pi pratiniyatavyañjakavyaṅyāḥ ekāvacchedena samānadeśatve sati samānendriyagrāhyatvāt
analyzed: atha anvaya vyatirekābhyām kārye pratiniyata janaka janya tva vat śabde pi pratiniyata vyañjaka vyaṅyāḥ eka avacchedena samāna deśa tve sati samāna indriya grāhya tvāt  /
translated: Now, by positive and negative concomitance, just as in an effect there is the relation of producer and produced which is restricted to each, so in the case of sound also, there is the relation of manifester and manifested which is restricted to each, because of being apprehended by the same sense organ, when there is the same place of manifestation with the restriction of one substratum,

original: ghaṭaikatvaparimāṇavat /🔽na cāvayavasaṃyogabahutvavyañajakāvyaṅyenāvayavinotpalatvavyañjakadīpāvyaṅyena tannīlimnā ghaṭavṛttipṛthaktvavyañjakāvyaṅyenaikatvena vā vyabhicāraḥ
analyzed: ghaṭa eka tva parimāṇa vat  na ca avayava saṃyoga bahu tva vyañajaka avyaṅyena avayavinā utpala tva vyañjaka dīpa avyaṅyena tad nīlimnā ghaṭa vṛtti pṛthaktva vyañjaka avyaṅyena ekatvena vā vyabhicāraḥ
translated: like the dimension of the oneness of a pot.🔽And there is no invalidation by the oneness of a substance which is manifested by the many conjunctions of its parts but not manifested by them, or by the blueness of a lotus which is manifested by a lamp but not manifested by it, or by the oneness which manifests the separateness residing in a pot.

original: avayavasaṃyogāvayavinornīlatvotpalatvayoścāvyāpyavyāpyavṛttinorutpalatvasya cādhikavṛttitvenaikāvacchedena vṛttyabhāvāt /
analyzed: avayava saṃyoga avayavinoḥ nīla tva utpala tvayoḥ ca avyāpya vyāpya vṛttinoḥ utpala tvasya ca adhika vṛtti tvena eka avacchedena vṛtti abhāvāt
translated: Because the conjunctions of the parts and the substance, and the blueness and the lotusness, which reside in the non-pervading and the pervading respectively, and the lotusness which has a wider extension, do not reside with the restriction of one substratum.

original: bahutvapṛthaktvavyañjakavyaṅyatvaṃ /
translated: The relation of manifester and manifested is with the many and the separateness.

original: ata eva nīlā balāketyatra
analyzed: atas eva nīlā balākā iti atra
translated: For this very reason, in the sentence the blue cranes,

original: rūpaparimāṇayorarddhanikhātavaṃśasaṅkhyāparimāṇayorvā na vyabhicāra iti /
analyzed: rūpa parimāṇayoḥ arddha nikhāta vaṃśa saṅkhyā parimāṇayoḥ vā na vyabhicāraḥ iti
translated: There is no contradiction in the case of the dimension of form or the number of half-buried bamboos.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, it should not be so.

original: varṇāḥ pratiniyatavyañjakavyaṅyāḥ āśrayeṇa saha samānendriyāgrāhyatvāt gandhavat ityāpātataḥ satpratipakṣatvāt /
analyzed: varṇāḥ pratiniyata vyañjaka vyaṅyāḥ āśrayeṇa saha samāna indriya a grāhya tvāt gandha vat iti āpātataḥ sat pratipakṣa tvāt
translated: Colors are the manifestations of specific manifesters, because they are not grasped by the same sense organ as their substratum, like smell. This is prima facie, because there is a counter-argument.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. Iv. p.

original: vastutastu ananyathāsiddhapratyabhijñānabalenanābhedasiddhau pratiniyatavyañjakavyaṅyatvasādhakasyai balavattvaṃ /
analyzed: vastutas tu balavat tvam
translated: But in reality, when non-difference is established by the power of non-different recognition, the proof of being the manifestation of specific manifesters is stronger.

original: śabdasya śabdajanakatvañca śabdanāśakatvaṃ vīcītaraṅganyāyenotpattikalpanañca kalpanameva śabdasya śabde 'janakatvādanāśakatvāñca antyādyaśabdavat
analyzed: śabdasya śabda janaka tvañca śabda nāśaka tvam vīcī taraṅga nyāyena utpatti kalpanam ca kalpanam eva śabdasya śabde janaka tvāt anāśaka tvāt ca antya ādya śabda vat
translated: The production of sound by sound and the destruction of sound by sound, and the assumption of production according to the principle of waves in a stream, is mere assumption, because sound does not produce sound and does not destroy it, like the last unmanifested sound.

original: etena sāmānyavattve satyasmadādivahirindriyajapratyakṣatvāt ityapāstaṃ /
analyzed: etena sāmānyavat tve sati asmat ādi vahis indriya ja pratyakṣa tvāt iti apāstam
translated: By this, the argument because it is perceptible by the external sense organs of us etc. when it has generality is refuted.

original: pratyabhijñānabādhāt śabdatvagatvāderasiddheśca /
analyzed: pratyabhijñāna bādhāt śabda tva ga tva ādeḥ asiddheḥ ca
translated: Because it is contradicted by recognition, and because soundness, audibility etc. are not established.

original: tasmācchabdo nityaḥ vyomaikaguṇatvāt tatparimāṇavat /
analyzed: tasmāt śabdaḥ nityaḥ vyoma eka guṇa tvāt tad parimāṇa vat
translated: Therefore, sound is eternal, because it is a quality of the one-substance ether, like its dimension.

original: śrotragrāhyatvāt śabdatvavat /
analyzed: śrotra grāhya tvāt śabda tva vat
translated: Because it is grasped by the auditory organ, like soundness.

original: viśeṣaguṇāntarāsamānādhikaraṇaikavṛttiguṇatvāt samayaparimāṇavat /🔽pṛthivītaranityabhūtaviśeṣaguṇatvāt apākajatve sati nityaikasamavetatvāt jalaparamāṇurūpavat /
analyzed: viśeṣa guṇa antara asamāna adhikaraṇa eka vṛtti guṇa tvāt samaya parimāṇa vat
translated: Because it is a quality that inheres in one thing, not in common with other specific qualities, like the dimension of time.🔽Because it is a quality of the specific eternal elements other than earth, being non-produced, and inhering in one eternal thing, like the color of a water atom.

original: avyāsajyavṛttitve sati anātmavibhuguṇatvāt kālaparimāṇavat /
analyzed: avyāsajya vṛtti tve sati anātma vibhu guṇa tvāt kāla parimāṇa vat
translated: Because it is a quality of the self and the all-pervading substances, not inhering in all, like the dimension of time.

original: vipakṣe bādhakañca pratyabhijñānameveti /
analyzed: vipakṣe bādhakam ca pratyabhijñānam eva iti
translated: And the very recognition is the counter-argument against the contrary view.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: śabdānityatāvādasiddhāntaḥ
translated: The conclusion on the doctrine of the impermanence of sound

original: atrocyate /
analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

original: gakārādivyaktayonaikaikāḥ /
analyzed: gakāra ādi vyaktayaḥ nā ekaikāḥ
