translated: Nor is the validity of everything dependent on the validity of others, so it is not independent.

original: pratyakṣāderapi tathātvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: pratyakṣa ādeḥ api tathā tva āpatteḥ
translated: Because perception and others would also be like that.

original: etena vivādapadamācāro nirapekṣapramāṇamūlakaḥ avigītamahājanājāratvāt pratyakṣavedamūlācāravaditi nirastaṃ /
analyzed: etena vivāda padam ācāraḥ nirapekṣa pramāṇa mūlakaḥ avigīta mahā jana ajāra tvāt pratyakṣa veda mūla ācāra vat iti nirastam
translated: By this, the argument that conduct is an independent means of knowledge based on the root, because it is the conduct of the great who are not divided, like conduct based on perception and the Veda, is refuted.

original: anumānasya nirapekṣapramaṇatvāt pramāṇamūlatvanaiva hetorupapatteḥ nirapekṣatvasya gauraveṇāprayojakatvācca /
analyzed: anumānasya nirapekṣa pramaṇa tvāt pramāṇa mūla tvanā eva hetoḥ upapatteḥ nirapekṣa tvasya gauraveṇa aprayojaka tvāt ca
translated: Because inference is an independent means of knowledge, the reason is established by being based on a means of knowledge, and because independence is not a reason, being heavy.

original: na ca sāpekṣatvena na pramāṇatā /
analyzed: na ca sāpekṣa tvena na pramāṇa tā
translated: And it is not that it is not a means of knowledge because it is dependent.

original: vyāptyādisattvāt /
analyzed: vyāpti ādi sattvāt
translated: Because pervasion and others exist.

original: na ca sāpekṣatvena na pramāṇatā /
analyzed: na ca sāpekṣa tvena na pramāṇa tā
translated: And it is not that it is not a means of knowledge because it is dependent.

original: vyāptyādisattvāt / /
analyzed: vyāpti ādi sattvāt
translated: Because of the existence of pervasion and so on.

original: anyathā pramāṇe nairapekṣasya vaiyarthyāt /
analyzed: anyathā pramāṇe nairapekṣasya vaiyarthyāt
translated: Otherwise, for one who is independent of means of knowledge, it would be useless.

original: na cācāre vedamūlatvaprasiddhestadanumānaṃ /
analyzed: na ca ācāre veda mūla tva prasiddheḥ tad anumānam
translated: And it is not an inference of that (the validity of Smriti and Practice) from the well-known fact that Smriti and Practice have the Veda as their basis.

original: asiddheḥ vyabhicārādanyathopapatteśca /🔽na ca vedamūlatvenaiva mahājanaparigrahāttathā /
analyzed: asiddheḥ vyabhicārāt anyathā upapatteḥ ca  na ca veda mūla tvena eva mahā jana parigrahāt tathā
translated: Because it is not established, because of contradiction, and because of being otherwise possible.🔽And it is not so because of the acceptance of Smriti and Practice by the great people themselves on the basis of their having the Veda as their basis.

original: na hi vedamūlo 'yamiti kṛtvā mahājanānāṃ tatparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: na hi veda mūlaḥ yam iti kṛtvā mahājanānām tad parigrahaḥ
translated: For the great people do not accept it on the ground that it has the Veda as its basis.

original: vedamūlatvasya prathamaṃ jñātumaśakyatvācchakyatve vā kimanumānena /
analyzed: veda mūla tvasya prathamam jñātum aśakya tvāt śakya tve vā kim anumānena
translated: Because it is not possible to know in the first place whether it has the Veda as its basis or not, or if it is possible, what is the use of inference?

original: na ca vedamūlatvenaiva mahājanaparigṛhīto 'yamācāra iti jñātvā tatra mahājanaparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: na ca veda mūla tvena eva mahā jana parigṛhītaḥ yama ācāraḥ iti jñātvā tatra mahā jana parigrahaḥ
translated: And it is not that the great people accept it on the ground that this Practice is accepted by the great people on the basis of its having the Veda as its basis.

original: gauravādasiddheśca /
analyzed: gauravāt asiddheḥ ca
translated: Because of the undesirability of the great effort (involved in accepting the Veda as the basis of Smriti and Practice), and because of non-establishment.

original: pūrvamahājanaparigrahādevottarottareṣāṃ parigrahādanuṣṭhānopapatteḥ /
analyzed: pūrva mahājana parigrahāt eva uttara uttareṣām parigrahāt anuṣṭhāna upapatteḥ
translated: Because the performance (of the duties enjoined by Smriti and Practice) is possible from the acceptance of the earlier great people themselves by the later ones.

original: tādṛśasmṛtyācārayorvedamalatvena vyāptervedasiddhiriti cet / na /
analyzed: tādṛśa smṛti ācārayoḥ veda mala tvena vyāpteḥ veda siddhiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the establishment of the Veda is from the pervasion of Smriti and Practice having the Veda as their basis, it is not so.

original: asambhavanmūlāntaratvasyopādhitvāt /
analyzed: asambhavat mūla antara tvasya upādhi tvāt
translated: Because the impossibility of having another basis is a fallacy.

original: anyathā lobhanyāyamūlasmṛterapi vedamūlatvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā lobha nyāya mūla smṛteḥ api veda mūla tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of even the Smriti having greed as its basis having the Veda as its basis.

original: astu vā smṛtyācārayoranāditvaṃ /
analyzed: astu vā smṛti ācārayoḥ anādi tvam
translated: Let there be the beginninglessness of Smriti and Practice.

original: na cācārāt smṛtiḥ smṛterācāra ityandhaparamparā mūlabhūtapramāṇābhāvāt iti vacyam /
analyzed: na ca ācārāt smṛtiḥ smṛteḥ ācāraḥ iti andha paramparā mūla bhūta pramāṇa abhāvāt iti vacyam
translated: And it should not be said that the Smṛti is based on the practice, and the practice on the Smṛti, so that it is a blind tradition, because there is no basic authoritative text.

original: smṛtyācārayorubhayorapi pramāṇatvāt /
analyzed: smṛti ācārayoḥ ubhayoḥ api pramāṇa tvāt
translated: Because both the Smṛti and the practice are authoritative.

original: anyathā na tato vedānumānamapīti /
analyzed: anyathā na tatas veda anumānam api iti
translated: Otherwise, there would not even be an inference of the Veda from them.

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: pralaye pūrvasmṛtyācārayorucchedāt sargādau nityasarvajñeśvarapraṇītavedamūlatvaṃ smṛtyācārayoḥ /
analyzed: pralaye pūrva smṛti ācārayoḥ ucchedāt sarga ādau nitya sarvajña īśvara praṇīta veda mūla tvam smṛti ācārayoḥ
translated: Because the Smṛti and the practice were destroyed at the time of dissolution, at the beginning of creation they must have the eternal Veda composed by the omniscient Lord as their basis.

original: anyathā mūlābhāvenāndhaparamparāprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā mūla abhāvena andha paramparā prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Otherwise, without a basis, there would be the undesirable consequence of a blind tradition.

original: na ca manvādīnāmatīndriyārthadarśitvaṃ /
analyzed: na ca manu ādīnām atīndriya artha darśi tvam
translated: And Manu and others do not have the ability to perceive things beyond the senses.

original: tadupāyaśravaṇādestadānīmabhavāt /
analyzed: tad upāya śravaṇa ādeḥ tadānīm abhavāt
translated: Because at that time there was no hearing or other means of knowing those things.

original: pūrvasargasiddhasarvajñamanvādaya eva te iti cet /
analyzed: pūrva sarga siddha sarvajña manu ādayaḥ eva te iti ced
translated: If it is argued that they are Manu and others who were omniscient in a previous creation,

original: na pramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: na pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: that is not so, because there is no evidence.

original: smṛtyācārayoḥ pramāṇamūlatvameva tatkalpanamiti cet / na /
analyzed: smṛti ācārayoḥ pramāṇa mūla tvam eva tad kalpanam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the assumption of their omniscience is based on the authoritative nature of the Smṛti and the practice, that is not so.

original: pratisargaṃ teṣāmanyonyatvakalpane gauravamityekasyaiva nityasarvajñasya kalpanāt /
analyzed: pratisargam teṣām anyonya tva kalpane gauravam iti ekasya eva nitya sarvajñasya kalpanāt
translated: Because it is cumbersome to assume that they are different in each creation, it is better to assume only one eternal omniscient being.

original: na ca smṛtaya eva tatpraṇītāḥ /
analyzed: na ca smṛtayaḥ eva tad praṇītāḥ
translated: And the Smṛtis are not composed by him.

original: tāsāṃ manvādikartṛkatvena smṛtau bodhanāt smṛtāveva smṛtīnāṃ vedamūlatvasmaraṇāñca /
analyzed: tāsām manu ādi kartṛka tvena smṛtau bodhanāt smṛtau eva smṛtīnām veda mūla tva smaraṇāt ca
translated: Because they are taught in the Smṛti by Manu and others, and because the Smṛtis themselves remember the Vedas as their source.

original: evañca smṛtyācārayormahājanaparigrahādvedamūlatvasādhakamapi bhagavati pramāṇam /
analyzed: evam ca smṛti ācārayoḥ mahājana parigrahāt veda mūla tva sādhakam api bhagavati pramāṇam
translated: And thus, the Smṛti and the conduct of the great people are also a means of knowledge regarding the Lord, establishing that they have the Vedas as their source.

original: ata eva pratimanvantarañcaiṣā śrutiranyā vidhīyate'' ityāgamo 'pi /
analyzed: atas eva pratimanvantaram ca eṣā śrutiḥ anyā vidhīyate
translated: For this very reason, there is the Āgama (scripture) that says, And this Śruti is enjoined differently in each Manu period.

original: evañca pūrvaṃ pratyakṣamūlāveva smṛtyācārau /
analyzed: evam ca pūrvam pratyakṣa mūlau eva smṛti ācārau
translated: And thus, in the beginning, the Smṛti and conduct had the Vedas as their source.

original: agre ca kālakrameṇāyurārogyabalaśraddhāgrahaṇadhāraṇādiśakteraharapacīyamānatvāt tadadhyayanavicchedana śākhocchedāt smṛtyācārabhyāmeva
analyzed: agre ca kāla krameṇa āyuḥ ārogya bala śraddhā grahaṇa dhāraṇa ādi śakteḥ ahar apacīyamāna tvāt tad adhyayana vicchedana śākhā ucchedāt smṛti ācārabhyām eva
translated: Later, due to the gradual decrease of the power of life, health, strength, faith, grasping, retaining, etc. over time, due to the interruption of their study and the cutting off of the branches,

original: kartavyatāmadhigatya pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: kartavya tām adhigatya pravṛttiḥ
translated: people engage in their duties by understanding them through the Smṛti and conduct.

original: nanvevaṃ smṛtirastu vedamūlāmaṅgalādyācārastvīśvarādeva bhaviṣyati ghaṭalipyādisamprādayavaditi cet / na /
analyzed: nanu evam smṛtiḥ astu veda mūla amaṅgala ādi ācāraḥ tu īśvarāt eva bhaviṣyati ghaṭa lipi ādi samprādaya vat iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the Smṛti may be so, but the conduct beginning with auspiciousness will be from God alone, like the transmission of pot-writing, etc., it is not so.

original: bahuvyāpāraghaṭitasya tattadācārasya gurutvena maṅgalamācaredityādivākyasyaiva lāghavena kalpanāt /
analyzed: bahu vyāpāra ghaṭitasya tad tad ācārasya guru tvena maṅgalam ācaret ityādi vākyasya eva lāghavena kalpanāt
translated: Because it is more reasonable to assume that the conduct, which consists of many activities, is enjoined by a single statement such as One should perform auspiciousness, etc. due to its simplicity.

original: na ca maṅgalādipadaśaktigrahārthe tadupapatteḥ /
analyzed: na ca maṅgala ādi pada śakti graha arthe tad upapatteḥ
translated: And it is not so because it is appropriate for the understanding of the power of words like auspiciousness, etc.

original: ata eva yatra vacanamātrāt parapratipattistatra nācāraḥ parīkṣakāṇāṃ /
analyzed: atas eva yatra vacana mātrāt para pratipattiḥ tatra na ācāraḥ parīkṣakāṇām
translated: For this very reason, where the understanding of others is from mere words, there is no examination of conduct by the critical.

original: tasya ca vedatvaṃ neśvarapraṇītatvena śaktigrahaṇārthatadvacane vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: tasya ca veda tvam na īśvara praṇīta tvena śakti grahaṇa artha tad vacane vyabhicārāt
translated: And that is not because it is composed by God, because there is deviation in the statement for the purpose of grasping power.

original: kintu tādṛśācārāsya vedamūlatvaniyamāditi /
analyzed: kintu veda mūla tva niyamāt iti
translated: But rather, because such conduct is necessarily based on the Veda.

original: syādet / pralaye satyevameva tat sa eva tu nāsti pramāṇābhāvat iti cet / na /
analyzed: syāt et pralaye sati evam eva tat saḥ eva tu na asti pramāṇa abhāvat iti ced na
translated: This may be so. At the time of dissolution, it is just so. But that itself does not exist, because there is no evidence. If it is argued that it does not exist, it is not so.

original: kālakapālānyāvṛttighaṭaprāgabhāvaḥ kāryadravyānādhārādhāraḥ kāryadravyānadhikaraṇakāryādhikaraṇavṛttirvā abhāvatvāt ākāśavṛttyanyonyābhāvavaditi
analyzed: kāla kapāla anya āvṛtti ghaṭa prāgabhāvaḥ kārya dravya anādhāra ādhāraḥ kārya dravya anadhikaraṇa kārya adhikaraṇa vṛttiḥ vā abhāva tvāt ākāśa vṛtti anyonya abhāva vat iti
translated: Because the repetition of the skull is the non-existence of the pot prior to its production, it is the substratum of the substance that is the effect, or it occurs in the effect without being the substratum of the substance that is the effect, because it is non-existence, like the mutual non-existence occurring in space.

original: vṛttapralayasādhanāt /
analyzed: vṛtta pralaya sādhanāt
translated: Because it proves the dissolution of the present.

original: evameva ghaṭadhvaṃsaṃ pakṣīkṛtyāgāmipralayasādhanam /🔽yadvā ghaṭaḥ kāryadravyānadhikaraṇakāryādhikaraṇavṛttidhvaṃsapratiyogī kāryatvācchabdavat /
analyzed: evam eva ghaṭa dhvaṃsam pakṣīkṛtya āgāmi pralaya sādhanam  yat vā ghaṭaḥ kārya dravya anadhikaraṇa kārya adhikaraṇa vṛtti dhvaṃsa pratiyogī kārya tvāt śabda vat
translated: In the same way, taking the destruction of the pot as the subject, it proves the future dissolution.🔽Or, the pot is the counter-correlate of the destruction that occurs in the effect without being the substratum of the substance that is the effect, because it is an effect, like sound.

original: yadvā kāryadravyatvaṃ kāryadravyānadhikaraṇakāryādhikaraṇavṛttidhvaṃsapratiyogivṛtti kāryamātravṛttitvāt śabdatvavat /
analyzed: yat vā kārya dravya tvam kārya dravya anadhikaraṇa kārya adhikaraṇa vṛtti dhvaṃsa pratiyogi vṛtti kārya mātra vṛtti tvāt śabda tva vat
translated: Or, the quality of being a substance that is an effect is the quality that occurs in the destruction that occurs in the effect without being the substratum of the substance that is the effect, because it occurs in mere effects, like the quality of being sound.

original: yadvā ekakālīnāḥ sarve paramāṇavaḥ samagrīpādeyaprabandhaśūnyā ārambhakatvāt naṣṭapavanārambhakaparamāṇuvat /
analyzed: yat vā eka kālīnāḥ sarve paramāṇavaḥ samagrī pādeya prabandha śūnyāḥ ārambhaka tvāt naṣṭa pavana ārambhaka paramāṇu vat
translated: Or, all atoms existing at one time are devoid of a series that is to be produced by a collection, because they are productive, like atoms that are productive of destroyed air.

original: sarvatra pakṣatāvacchedakāvacchinnaṃ sādhyaṃ pratīyate iti ekakāle śūnyate labhyate /
analyzed: sarvatra pakṣa tā avacchedaka avacchinnam sādhyam pratīyate iti eka kāle śūnyate labhyate
translated: Everywhere the probandum is understood as qualified by the property of being the subject, so emptiness at one time is obtained.

original: na ca pavanaparamāṇūnāmapi pakṣatvenāṃśataḥ siddhasādhanaṃ /
analyzed: na ca pavana paramāṇūnām api pakṣa tvena aṃśataḥ siddha sādhanam
translated: And it is not an instance of proving what is already established in part, if air atoms are also the subject.

original: pakṣadharmatābalalabhyasādhyāpratīteḥ /
translated: Because the probandum, which is to be understood by the power of the property of being the subject, is not understood.

original: abhedānumānavacca pakṣasya dṛṣṭāntatvāvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: abheda anumāna vat ca pakṣasya dṛṣṭānta tva avirodhaḥ
translated: And as in the inference of non-difference, there is no contradiction in the subject being the example.

original: yadvā paramāṇavaḥ kāryadravyānadhikaraṇavṛttikāryavantaḥ nityadravyatvāt ākāśavat /
analyzed: yat vā paramāṇavaḥ kārya dravya anadhikaraṇa vṛtti kāryavantaḥ nitya dravya tvāt ākāśa vat
translated: Or, atoms have an effect that does not inhere in a substance that is an effect, because they are eternal substances, like space.

original: bhūgolakasantāno 'yaṃ bhūgolakasantānānadhikaraṇavṛttidhvaṃsapratiyogī kāryatvāt ghaṭavat /
analyzed: bhū golaka santānaḥ yam bhū golaka santāna anadhikaraṇa vṛtti dhvaṃsa pratiyogī kārya tvāt ghaṭa vat
translated: This continuum of the earth-globe is an object of the negation that does not inhere in a continuum of the earth-globe, because it is an effect, like a pot.

original: yadvā etatkarmātiktāni karmāṇi etatpratibandhakapratibadhyāni karmatvāt etatkarmavat /
analyzed: yat vā etad karma atiktāni karmāṇi etad pratibandhaka pratibadhyāni karma tvāt etad karma vat
translated: Or, these actions are obstructed by that which obstructs them, because they are actions, like that action.

original: na cātra vyabhicāraśaṅkā /
analyzed: na ca atra vyabhicāra śaṅkā
translated: And there is no suspicion of fallacy here.

original: sarveṣāmevaṃrūpatvādanevambhāve ca svabhāvapracyavāt /
analyzed: sarveṣām evaṃrūpa tvāt anevambhāve ca svabhāva pracyavāt
translated: Because all are of this form, and if they were not so, they would lose their nature.

original: anyathā niyame 'pi niyamāntarāpekṣāyāmanavasthiteḥ /
analyzed: anyathā niyame pi niyama antara apekṣāyām anavasthiteḥ
translated: Otherwise, even in the case of a rule, if another rule is required, there would be an infinite regress.

original: āgamo 'pyamumevārthaṃ saṃvatadīti kṛtaṃ prasaktānuprasaktyā //
analyzed: āgamaḥ pi amum eva artham kṛtam prasakta anuprasaktyā
translated: The scriptures also confirm this meaning. Enough of digressions.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV.

original: vidhivādapūrvapakṣaḥ
analyzed: vidhi vāda pūrvapakṣaḥ
translated: The prima facie view on injunctions

original: ācāramūlatvaṃ vedasya pravartakajñānajanakatvena bhavatīti pravartakajñānaṃ nirūpyate /
analyzed: ācāra mūla tvam vedasya pravartaka jñāna janaka tvena bhavati iti pravartaka jñānam nirūpyate
translated: The Vedas are the root of Dharma because they generate the knowledge that prompts action. Such prompting knowledge is now examined.

original: tatrābhidhāsaṅkalpāpūrvabhāvanājñānaṃ na pravartakaṃ /
analyzed: tatra abhidhā saṅkalpa apūrva bhāvanā jñānam na pravartakam
translated: The knowledge of the injunction, which is a mental resolve preceded by the Vedic text, does not prompt action.

original: tasmin satyapi apravṛtteḥ asatyapi pravṛtteśca /
analyzed: tasmin sati api apravṛtteḥ asati api pravṛtteḥ ca
translated: Because even when it exists, there is no action, and even when it does not exist, there is action.

original: kāryatvajñānaṃ pravartakamiti guravaḥ /
analyzed: kārya tva jñānam pravartakam iti guravaḥ
translated: The teachers say that the knowledge of being an effect prompts action.

original: tathā hi jñānasya kṛtau janyāyāṃ cikīrṣātiriktaṃ na kartavyamasti tatsattve kṛtivilambohetvantarābhāvāt /
analyzed: tathā hi jñānasya kṛtau janyāyām cikīrṣā atiriktam na kartavyam asti tad sattve
translated: For instance, in the production of an action, there is nothing to be done besides the desire to do. When that exists, there is a delay in action due to the absence of another cause.

original: cikīrṣā ca kṛtisādhyatvaprakārikā kṛtisādhyakriyāviṣayecchā pākaṃ kṛtyā sādhayāmīti tadanubhavāt /
analyzed: cikīrṣā ca kṛti sādhya tva prakārikā kṛti sādhya kriyā viṣaya icchā pākam kṛtyā sādhayāmi iti tad anubhavāt
translated: And desire is the wish for an action that is to be accomplished by one's own action, having the form of being to be accomplished by one's own action, as is known from the experience I will accomplish cooking by my action.

original: sā ca svakṛtisādhyatājñānasādhyā icchāyāḥ svaprakārakadhīsādhyatvaniyamāt /
analyzed: sā ca sva kṛti sādhya tā jñāna sādhyā icchāyāḥ sva prakāraka dhī sādhya tva niyamāt
translated: And that is to be accomplished by the knowledge that one's own action is to be accomplished, because desire is necessarily to be accomplished by one's own knowledge.

original: ata eva svakṛtisādhye pāke pravartate /🔽na tviṣṭasādhanatājñānasādhyā svakṛtyasadhye cikīrṣāpatteḥ /
analyzed: atas eva sva kṛti sādhye pāke pravartate  na tu iṣṭa sādhana tā jñāna sādhyā sva kṛtya sadhye cikīrṣā āpatteḥ
translated: Therefore, he engages in cooking, which is accomplished by his own action.🔽But not in the knowledge of being an instrument for attaining what is desired, because the desire to accomplish what is not accomplished by one's own action would follow.

original: svakṛtyasādhyatvajñānaṃ pratibandhakamiti cet / na /
analyzed: sva kṛtya sādhya tva jñānam pratibandhakam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own action is a hindrance, it is not so.

original: tadabhāvakāraṇatve gauravāt /
analyzed: tad abhāva kāraṇa tve gauravāt
translated: Because it is cumbersome to be the cause of the absence of that.

original: athābhāva ubhayasiddhaḥ kṛtisādhyatādhīrasiddhetyato na lāghavāvasara iti cet / na /
analyzed: atha abhāvaḥ ubhaya siddhaḥ kṛti sādhya tā dhīra siddha iti atas na lāghava avasaraḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the absence is established by both, but the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own action is not established, so there is no opportunity for parsimony, it is not so.

original: yatra śabdādanumānadvā daivāt sā tatra lāghavāvatārādicchāyāḥ svaprakārakajñānasādhyatvaniyamena
analyzed: yatra śabdāt anumāna dvā daivāt sā tatra lāghava avatārāt icchāyāḥ sva prakāraka jñāna sādhya tva niyamena
translated: Where it is by chance from words or inference, there, due to the entry of parsimony, the desire to act is necessarily accomplished by the knowledge of itself.

original: kṛtisādhyatvajñānasyāvaśyakatvācca janakajñānaṃ vighaṭayata eva jñānasya pratibandhakatvācca /
analyzed: kṛti sādhya tva jñānasya āvaśyaka tvāt ca janaka jñānam vighaṭayataḥ eva jñānasya pratibandhaka tvāt ca
translated: And because the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own action is necessary, and because the knowledge that obstructs the knowledge that generates it is itself an obstruction.

original: vyāptijñānavighaṭanadvārā anumitipratibandhakānaikāntikajñānavat /
translated: Like the knowledge of inconclusive evidence that obstructs inference by obstructing the knowledge of pervasion.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: anyathā svakṛtyasādhyatvāniṣṭasādhanatvopekṣaṇītvaniṣphalatvajñānaṃ pratibandhakaṃ kriyājñānameva pravartakaṃ kalpeta /
analyzed: anyathā sva kṛtya sādhya tva aniṣṭa sādhana tva upekṣaṇī tva niṣphala tva jñānam pratibandhakam kriyā jñānam eva pravartakam kalpeta
translated: Otherwise, the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own action, being an instrument for attaining what is undesirable, being indifferent, and being fruitless would be an obstruction, and the knowledge of action itself would be imagined to be an instigator.

original: nanu sanodhātvarthagocarecchāvācitvāt lāghavāñca kṛtāvicchā cikīrṣā sā ca vṛṣṭāviveṣṭasādhanatājñānāditi cet / na /🔽vahninā sādhayāmītivat kṛtyāsādhayāmītīcchāyāḥ kṛteḥ pūrvamanubhūyamānāyāḥ sanantāvācyatvena gauraveṇa ca pratyākhyātumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: nanu sanaḥ dhātvartha gocara icchā vāci tvāt lāghavāt ca kṛtau icchā cikīrṣā sā ca vṛṣṭau iva iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānāt iti ced na  vahninā sādhayāmi iti vat kṛtyā sādhayāmi iti icchāyāḥ kṛteḥ pūrvam anubhūyamānāyāḥ sananta avācya tvena gauraveṇa ca pratyākhyātum aśakya tvāt
translated: If it be said that the suffix 'san' denotes the desire to do, and that the desire to do is produced by the knowledge of the means to the desired result, this is not so.🔽Because the desire to do, which is experienced before the act, in the form 'I shall accomplish by the act', cannot be rejected on the ground of being denoted by the suffix 'san' and being heavy.

original: kiñca pākaṃ cikīrṣatītyatra prādhānyena pākasyecchāviṣayatvamanubhūyate na tu kṛteḥ /
analyzed: kiñca pākam cikīrṣati iti atra prādhānyena pākasya icchā viṣaya tvam anubhūyate na tu kṛteḥ
translated: Moreover, in the sentence 'he desires to cook', the cooking is experienced as the primary object of desire, not the act.

original: dhātośca sanpratyayābhidheyecchāprakāravācitvaṃ /
analyzed: dhātoḥ ca san pratyaya abhidheya icchā prakāra vāci tvam
translated: And the verbal root denotes the desire in the form denoted by the suffix 'san'.

original: odanaṃ bubhukṣata ityatra bhojanaviśeṣyatayaudanasyecchāviṣayatvānubhavāt /
analyzed: odanam bubhukṣate iti atra bhojana viśeṣya tayā odanasya icchā viṣaya tva anubhavāt
translated: Because in the sentence 'he desires rice', rice is experienced as the object of desire qualified by eating.

original: iṣṭasādhanatvena vṛṣṭāviva kṛtāvicchāsambhave 'pi kṛtīcchā na pravartikā kintu svakṛtisādhyecchaiva /
analyzed: iṣṭasādhana tvena vṛṣṭau iva kṛtau icchā sambhave pi kṛti icchā na pravartikā kintu sva kṛti sādhya icchā eva
translated: Even if the desire to do is possible with regard to the desired result, the desire to do is not the prompter, but rather the desire to be accomplished by one's own act.

original: ghaṭaṃ jānāti cikīrṣati karotījñānacikīrṣākṛtīnāmekaviṣayatvānubhavāt /
analyzed: ghaṭam jānāti cikīrṣati karoti ijñāna cikīrṣā ākṛtīnām eka viṣaya tva anubhavāt
translated: Because the experience of knowledge, desire to do, and act having the same object is found in the sentence 'he knows, desires to do, and does the pot'.

original: atha yadi kṛtyā sādhayitumicchā sā tadā cikīrṣitasya pākasyānyataḥ siddhau sā nāpagacchet /
analyzed: atha yadi kṛtyā sādhayitum icchā sā tadā cikīrṣitasya pākasya anyatas siddhau sā nā apagacchet
translated: Now, if the desire to accomplish an action is that, then when the cooking to be done is accomplished from elsewhere, that desire would not cease.

original: na hyupāyaviśeṣasādhyatvenecchopāyāntarādhīnaphalalābhena nivāryate /
analyzed: na hi upāya viśeṣa sādhya tvena icchā upāya antara adhīna phala lābhena nivāryate
translated: For one is not prevented by obtaining the result dependent on another means when desiring something to be accomplished by a particular means.

original: prītyā dhanalābhe 'pi pratigraheṇa tallipsāyā anivṛtteriti cet / na /
analyzed: prītyā dhana lābhe pi pratigraheṇa tad lipsāyāḥ anivṛtteḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even when wealth is obtained through affection, the desire for it through receiving gifts does not cease, it is not so.

original: svaviṣayasiddhatvasya phalecchāvicchedasya copāyecchāvirodhatvāt /
analyzed: sva viṣaya siddha tvasya phala icchā vicchedasya ca upāya icchā virodha tvāt
translated: Because the fact of being accomplished in one's own object and the cessation of the desire for the result are contradictory to the desire for the means.

original: asti ca tatra pākaudanayoḥ siddhatvaṃ /
analyzed: asti ca tatra pāka odanayoḥ siddha tvam
translated: And there is the accomplishment of cooking and rice there.

original: anyaudanecchāyāṃ pākacikīrṣā bhavatyeva /
analyzed: anya odana icchāyām pāka cikīrṣā bhavati eva
translated: When there is a desire for another rice, the desire to cook certainly arises.

original: pratyutāsiddhatvāt kṛtāvevecchā na vicchidyeta yadi kṛtiviṣayasiddhatvaphalecchāvicchedau na virodhinau /
analyzed: pratyuta asiddha tvāt kṛtau evā icchā na vicchidyeta yadi kṛti viṣaya siddha tva phala icchā vicchedau na virodhinau
translated: On the contrary, if the fact of being accomplished in the object of action and the cessation of the desire for the result were not contradictory, then the desire would not cease even in cooking, because it is not accomplished.

original: prītyā dhanalābhe ca tadadhikadhanecchā na vicchidyate tasyāsiddhatvāt tatphalecchāyāśca
analyzed: prītyā dhana lābhe ca tad adhika dhana icchā na vicchidyate tasya asiddha tvāt tad phala icchāyāḥ ca
translated: And when wealth is obtained through affection, the desire for more wealth does not cease, because it is not accomplished, and because the desire for that result

original: sattvāt dhanamātrārthinaśca prītyā dhanalābhe 'pi pratigraheṇa tallipsā nāstyeva
analyzed: sattvāt dhana mātra arthinaḥ ca prītyā dhana lābhe pi pratigraheṇa tad lipsā na asti eva
translated: exists. And for one who desires wealth alone, there is no desire for it through receiving gifts even when wealth is obtained through affection,

original: dhanamātrasya siddhatvāt /
analyzed: dhana mātrasya siddha tvāt
translated: because mere wealth is accomplished.

original: kiñcidviśeṣasiddhyaiva hi sāmānyecchāvicchedaḥ /
analyzed: kiñcid viśeṣa siddhyā eva hi sāmānya icchā vicchedaḥ
translated: For the desire for the general is cut off only by the establishment of a particular.

original: anyathā sakalasvaviṣayasiddherasambhavena tadvicchedo na syādeva /🔽vastutastu kriyānukūlā kṛtiriṣṭopāya iti jñāne kriyāyāḥ kṛtisādhyatvamiṣṭopāyatvañca🔽bhātaṃ kriyādvāraiva kṛteriṣṭasādhanatvāditi tadbodhāt kṛtāviva kṛtisādhyatvena kriyāyāmapi
analyzed: anyathā sakala sva viṣaya siddheḥ asambhavena tad vicchedaḥ na syāt eva  vastutas tu kriyā anukūlā kṛtiḥ iṣṭa upāyaḥ iti jñāne kriyāyāḥ kṛti sādhya tvam iṣṭa upāya tvañca  bhātam kriyā dvārā eva kṛteḥ iṣṭa sādhana tvāt iti tad bodhāt kṛtau iva kṛti sādhya tvena kriyāyām api
translated: Otherwise, since the establishment of all one's own objects is impossible, the cutting off of that would not occur at all.🔽But in reality, the cognition that activity is the means to the desired goal, since activity is accomplished by effort, and activity is the means to the desired goal🔽only through activity itself, since effort is the means to the desired goal through activity itself. Thus, from the understanding of that, just as in effort, in activity also

original: saiveccheti cikīrṣāyāṃ kṛtisādhyatvaprakāranaiyatyamataḥ kṛtisamānaviṣayacikīrṣātvena
analyzed: sā eva icchā iti cikīrṣāyām kṛti sādhya tva prakāra naiyatyam atas kṛti samāna viṣaya cikīrṣā tvena
translated: by the nature of being accomplished by effort, there is the same desire. And in the desire to do, the restriction of the mode of being accomplished by effort. Therefore, by the nature of being the desire to do with the same object as effort,

original: cikīrṣāyāḥ kṛtikāraṇatvaṃ na tu kṛtīcchātvena bhinnaviṣayatayā gauravāt /
analyzed: cikīrṣāyāḥ kṛti kāraṇa tvam na tu kṛti icchā tvena bhinna viṣayatayā gauravāt
translated: the desire is the cause of effort, but not by the nature of the desire to do, because of the complexity due to the difference of objects.

original: tathāpi yena rūpeṇa yasyeṣṭasādhanatvaṃ tena prakāreṇa tatrecchā yathā svakedāravṛṣṭitvena
analyzed: tathā api yena rūpeṇa yasya iṣṭa sādhana tvam tena prakāreṇa tatra icchā yathā sva kedāra vṛṣṭi tvena
translated: Even so, in whatever form something is the means to the desired goal, in that way there is desire for it, just as by the nature of rain in one's own field,

original: iṣṭasādhanatvāt tathaivaicchā tathā kṛtisādhyatvena pākasyeṣṭasādhanatvamataḥ kṛtisādhyatvena
analyzed: iṣṭa sādhana tvāt tathā eva aicchā tathā kṛti sādhya tvena pākasya iṣṭa sādhana tvam atas kṛti sādhya tvena
translated: since it is the means to the desired goal, there is desire for it in that very way. Similarly, cooking is the means to the desired goal by being accomplished by effort. Therefore,

original: tatrecchā bhavatīti /
analyzed: tatra icchā bhavati iti
translated: there is desire for it by being accomplished by effort.

original: kṛtau kṛtiviṣaye vā cikīrṣāyāṃ na vṛṣṭīcchā /
analyzed: kṛtau kṛti viṣaye vā cikīrṣāyām na vṛṣṭi icchā
translated: In the desire to do or in the sphere of action, there is no desire for rain.

original: vilakṣaṇasāmagrayantarakalpanamiti cet /
analyzed: vilakṣaṇa sāmagraya antara kalpanam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is the postulation of a different set of causes,

original: bhavedevaṃ /
analyzed: bhavet evam
translated: it may be so.

original: yadi kṛtisādhyatvena pākasya odanasādhanatā syāt /
analyzed: yadi kṛti sādhya tvena pākasya odana sādhana tā syāt
translated: If cooking were the means of accomplishing rice by being accomplished by volition,

original: na caivaṃ gauravāt kintu pākatvena /
analyzed: na ca evam gauravāt kintu pāka tvena
translated: but not so, because of the burden, but rather by the nature of cooking.

original: sa tu kṛtiṃ vinā netyanyadetat /
analyzed: sa tu kṛtim vinā na iti anyat etat
translated: But that is not possible without volition, so this is different.

original: vahninā sādhayāmītivat kṛtyā sādhayāmītīcchā iṣṭasādhanatājñānādeveti cet /🔽tarhi tatra vahnisādhyatājñānavadatrāpi kṛtisādhyatvajñānaṃ kāraṇamāvaśyakaṃ kṛtau
analyzed: vahninā sādhayāmi iti vat kṛtyā sādhayāmi iti icchā iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānāt eva iti ced  tarhi tatra vahni sādhya tā jñāna vat atra api kṛti sādhya tva jñānam kāraṇam āvaśyakam kṛtau
translated: If it is argued that the desire to accomplish by volition is like the desire to accomplish by fire, it is only from the knowledge of the means to the desired object,

original: cānubhavasiddhacikīrṣādhīnatatvaṃ viśeṣaḥ tena prāṇapañcakasañcāre jīvanayonikṛtisādhye na pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: viśeṣaḥ tena prāṇapañcaka sañcāre jīvana yoni kṛti sādhye na pravṛttiḥ
translated: then in that case, just as the knowledge of being accomplished by fire is the cause here, so too the knowledge of being accomplished by volition is necessary. And the difference is that in volition it is dependent on desire, which is established by experience. Therefore there is no engagement in the life-giving volition that is accomplished by the movement of the five life-breaths.

original: anyathā kṛtisādhyeṣṭasādhanatāpakṣe 'pi tatra pravarteta /
analyzed: anyathā kṛti sādhya iṣṭa sādhana tā pakṣe tatra pravarteta
translated: Otherwise, even in the case of accepting the means to the desired object that is accomplished by volition, one would engage in that.

original: nanu cikīrṣādhīnatvasyopalakṣaṇatve upalakṣyamātragatānatiprasaktadharmābhāvāt kṛtimātrasya cātiprasaṅgāt tattatkṛtiviśeṣā upalakṣyāḥ tathāca
analyzed: nanu cikīrṣā adhīna tvasya upalakṣaṇa tve upalakṣya mātra gata anatiprasakta dharma abhāvāt kṛti mātrasya ca atiprasaṅgāt tad tad kṛti viśeṣāḥ upalakṣyāḥ tathāca
translated: If the dependence on desire is a distinguishing feature, and there is no non-promiscuous property in what is distinguished, and volition alone is too broad, then the various specific volitions are what is distinguished. And thus,

original: tadananugamāt pravṛttyananugamaḥ /
analyzed: tad ananugamāt pravṛtti ananugamaḥ
translated: Because it is not present in all cases, there is no presence of activity.

original: viśeṣaṇatve cikīrṣāyāṃ pravṛttau ca cikīrṣājñānakāraṇatve gauravaṃ pramāṇābhāvaśca /
analyzed: viśeṣaṇa tve cikīrṣāyām pravṛttau ca cikīrṣā jñāna kāraṇa tve gauravam pramāṇa abhāvaḥ ca
translated: And in the case of being a qualifier, if activity is due to desire, there is the fault of complexity and lack of evidence in the cause of the knowledge of desire.

original: kiñca cikīrṣāsādhyāvasthāyāḥ kṛteḥ siddhāvasthasādhanatvavirodhena kṛtisādhyatā pākādau na jñāyeteti cet / na /
analyzed: kiñca cikīrṣā sādhya avasthāyāḥ kṛteḥ siddha avasthā sādhana tva virodhena kṛti sādhya tā pāka ādau na jñāyeta iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the fact that cooking etc. are to be accomplished by activity is not known because the existence of activity which is to be accomplished by desire is contradictory to the fact that it is a means of the accomplished state, it is not so.

original: asti hi kṛtiviśeṣomānasapratyakṣasiddhojīvanayoniprayatnavyāvṛttaścikīrṣopalakṣyaḥ yatra cikīrṣākāraṇatvagrahaḥ sa ca tava jātirūpo mama tvanugatakāraṇopādhirūpaḥ /
analyzed: asti hi kṛti viśeṣaḥ mānasa pratyakṣa siddhaḥ jīvana yoni prayatna vyāvṛttaḥ cikīrṣā upalakṣyaḥ yatra cikīrṣā kāraṇa tva grahaḥ sa ca tava jāti rūpaḥ mama tu anugata kāraṇa upādhi rūpaḥ
translated: For there is a particular kind of activity which is established by mental perception and is distinguished from the effort which is the source of life, and is characterized by desire, and in which there is the apprehension of being the cause of desire. And that is of the nature of a universal for you, but for me it is of the nature of an invariable cause.

original: evañca cikīrṣādhīnatvenānugatena kṛtiviśeṣāṇāmupalakṣyāṇāṃ anugatatvamapi /
analyzed: evam ca cikīrṣā adhīna tvena anugatena kṛti viśeṣāṇām upalakṣyāṇām anugata tvam api
translated: And thus, by being connected with dependence on desire, the particular activities which are characterized are also connected.

original: yathā gotveṇa taṭasthe nopalakṣitā mahiṣyādivyāvṛttadhānakarmavyaktiviśeṣāḥ
analyzed: yathā go tveṇa taṭa sthe na upalakṣitāḥ mahiṣī ādi vyāvṛtta dhāna karma vyakti viśeṣāḥ
translated: Just as the particular instances of the action of threshing, which are not characterized by the neutral universal cowness, are distinguished from the buffalo etc.,

original: dhenupadenocyate na tu gotvamapi /
analyzed: dhenu padena ucyate na tu go tvam api
translated: they are called by the word cow, but not even by the universal cowness.

original: tathā cikīrṣāpi /
analyzed: tathā cikīrṣā api
translated: And so is desire.

original: evaṃ jīvanayoniyatnavyāvṛttakṛtiviśeṣāṇāṃ kṛtitvena jñānaṃ kāraṇamiti nānanugamaḥ /
analyzed: evam jīvana yoni yatna vyāvṛtta kṛti viśeṣāṇām kṛti tvena jñānam kāraṇam iti na ananugamaḥ
translated: And thus, the knowledge that the particular activities which are distinguished from the effort which is the source of life are of the nature of activity is the cause. So there is no absence of connection.

original: nanu kṛtisādhye na kṛtirviśeṣaṇamasattvāt sattve vā kṛtau satyāṃ jñānaṃ jñāne ca kṛtirityanyonyāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: nanu kṛti sādhye na kṛtiḥ viśeṣaṇam asattvāt sattve vā kṛtau satyām jñānam jñāne ca kṛtiḥ iti anyonya āśrayaḥ
translated: But in what is to be accomplished by an act, the act is not a qualifier, because it does not exist; if it does exist, then when the act exists, there is knowledge, and when there is knowledge, there is an act, so it is a mutual dependence.

original: nopalakṣaṇamatiprasaṅgāditi cet / na /
analyzed: na upalakṣaṇam atiprasaṅgāt iti ced na
translated: If it is said that it is not a qualifier but a means of knowledge to avoid over-extension, no.

original: kṛtirhi jñāne viṣayatayā viśeṣaṇameva sādhye ca paricāyakatayopalakṣaṇaṃ anyathā iṣṭasādhane 'pīṣṭaṃ na viśeṣaṇamasattvāt nopalakṣaṇamatiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: kṛtiḥ hi jñāne viṣaya tayā viśeṣaṇam eva sādhye ca paricāyaka tayā upalakṣaṇam anyathā iṣṭa sādhane pi iṣṭam na viśeṣaṇam asattvāt na upalakṣaṇam atiprasaṅgāt
translated: For an act is a qualifier only in knowledge by being the object, and in what is to be accomplished it is a means of knowledge by indicating, otherwise even in what accomplishes the desired end, the desired end would not be a qualifier because it does not exist, and it would not be a means of knowledge to avoid over-extension.

original: liṅgajñānādau vā kā gatiḥ /
analyzed: liṅga jñāna ādau vā kā gatiḥ
translated: Or what is the position in the knowledge of the mark and so on?

original: nanvevaṃ śrame 'pi cikīrṣā syāttasyāpi cikīrṣādhīnakṛtisādhyatvāt atra vadanti /
analyzed: nanu evam śrame pi cikīrṣā syāt tasya api cikīrṣā adhīna kṛti sādhya tvāt atra vadanti
translated: If so, there would be desire in exertion also, because that is to be accomplished by an act dependent on desire. Here they say:

original: śramastu bhojanādikriyāsādhyo na tatkṛtisādhyaḥ acikīrṣitatvāt kṛteḥ svadhvaṃsasākṣātkārātirikte cikīrṣāviṣayamātre janakatvāt /
analyzed: śramaḥ tu bhojana ādi kriyā sādhyaḥ na tad kṛti sādhyaḥ acikīrṣita tvāt kṛteḥ sva dhvaṃsa sākṣātkāra atirikte cikīrṣā viṣaya mātre janaka tvāt
translated: But exertion is to be accomplished by the action of eating, not by the act of that, because it is not desired. And because the act is the producer of only the object of desire other than the direct perception of its own destruction.

original: na hi bhojanacikīrṣāviṣayamātre janakatvāt /
analyzed: na hi bhojana cikīrṣā viṣaya mātre janaka tvāt
translated: For eating is not the producer of only the object of desire for eating.

original: na hi bhojanacikīrṣādhīnakṛtyā gamanaṃ sādhyate iti kecit /
analyzed: na hi bhojana cikīrṣā adhīna kṛtyā gamanam sādhyate iti kecid
translated: Some say that going is not accomplished by the act dependent on the desire for eating.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: gurutarabhārottolane kṛtyasādhye bhramāt pravṛttasya nigaḍaniścaladehasya vā kṛtau satyāmuttolanacalanakriyānutpāde 'pi śramānubhavāt kṛtereva
analyzed: gurutara bhāra uttolane kṛtya sādhye bhramāt pravṛttasya nigaḍa niścala dehasya vā kṛtau satyām uttolana calana kriyā anutpāde śrama anubhavāt kṛteḥ eva
translated: When one is engaged in lifting a very heavy load, which is to be accomplished by action, and when the action is done, even though the action of lifting and moving does not occur due to the body being immobile like a shackle, there is the experience of fatigue. Therefore, action alone is the cause,

original: kāraṇatvāt /
analyzed: kāraṇa tvāt
translated: not the action produced by it.

original: na tu tajjanyakriyāyāḥ sukhe vyabhicārācca /🔽na hi sukhaṃ kṛtikāraṇacikīrṣāviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: na tu tad janya kriyāyāḥ sukhe vyabhicārāt ca  na hi sukham kṛti kāraṇa cikīrṣā viṣayaḥ
translated: And because pleasure is not invariably concomitant with it.🔽For pleasure is not the object of desire for action as a means.

original: upāyacikīrṣājanyā hi kṛtiḥ na tu sukhacikīrṣājanyā /
analyzed: upāya cikīrṣā janyā hi kṛtiḥ na tu sukha cikīrṣā janyā
translated: Action is produced by the desire for a means, not by the desire for pleasure.

original: cikīrṣājanyakṛtisādhyatvaṃ na śrame dveṣayoniprayatnādapi tadutpatterityapare /
analyzed: cikīrṣā janya kṛti sādhya tvam na śrame dveṣa yoni prayatnāt api tad utpatteḥ iti apare
translated: Others say that fatigue is not to be accomplished by action produced by desire, because it arises even from effort born of aversion.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: śatrubadhasyeṣṭasādhatanatvena cikīrṣājanyakṛtisādhyatvāt dveṣasya yatnājanakatvāt /
analyzed: śatru badhasya iṣṭa sādhatana tvena cikīrṣā janya kṛti sādhya tvāt dveṣasya yatna ajanaka tvāt
translated: Because the killing of an enemy is to be accomplished by action produced by the desire to attain what is desired, and because aversion does not produce effort.

original: dveṣasiddhistu śatruṃ dveṣmītyanubhavabalāt /
analyzed: dveṣa siddhiḥ tu śatrum dveṣmi iti anubhava balāt
translated: But the establishment of aversion is by the power of the experience I hate the enemy.

original: yattu śramaḥ kṛtitvena kṛtisādhyo na cikīrṣādhīnakṛtitvena /
analyzed: yat tu śramaḥ kṛti tvena kṛti sādhyaḥ na cikīrṣā adhīna kṛti tvena
translated: As for fatigue, it is to be accomplished by action, but not by action dependent on desire.

original: yadyacikīrṣi'tepi śrame cikīrṣādhīna kṛtitvena kāraṇatā syāt tadā cikīrṣitameva bhojanaṃ kṛtyā sādhyate nācikīrṣitaṃ gamanādīti na syāt /
analyzed: yadi acikīrṣite api śrame cikīrṣā adhīna kṛti tvena kāraṇatā syāt tadā cikīrṣitam eva bhojanam kṛtyā sādhyate na acikīrṣitam gamana ādi iti na syāt
translated: If even in the case of what is not desired, exertion were to be the cause by virtue of being the effect of the volition, then only what is desired, namely eating, would be accomplished by the action, not what is not desired, such as going, etc.

original: śramavaṅgamane 'pi tajjanyatvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: śrama vaṅgamane pi tad janya tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because even in going, which is not desired, it would follow that it is produced by that [exertion].

original: bhojanādiśca cikīrṣādhīnakṛtiviśeṣāt /
analyzed: bhojana ādiḥ ca cikīrṣā adhīna kṛti viśeṣāt
translated: And eating, etc. are due to the specific action dependent on volition.

original: sa hi kṛtimātraṃ vyabhicārati jīvanayokṛtestadanutpādāt /
analyzed: sa hi kṛti mātram vyabhicarati jīvanayā ukṛteḥ tad anutpādāt
translated: For that [exertion] deviates merely from action, because life, which is the effect of that [exertion], is not produced.

original: yadvā śramo na bhojanakṛtisādhyaḥ kintu tannirantarotpannajjīvanayoniprayatnādeveti /🔽tanna /
analyzed: yat vā śramaḥ na bhojana kṛti sādhyaḥ kintu tad nirantara utpanna jīvana yoni prayatnāt eva iti  tat na
translated: Or, exertion is not to be accomplished by the action of eating, but only by the effort of the life-source that arises immediately after that [eating].🔽That is not so.

original: na hi /
analyzed: na hi
translated: For it is not so.

original: kṛtitvena tacchramajanakatvaṃ /
translated: Exertion is not the cause of that [exertion] by virtue of being an action.

original: nāpi kṛtyantarādeva śramotpattiḥ /
analyzed: nā api kṛti antarāt eva śrama utpattiḥ
translated: Nor does exertion arise from another action alone.

original: jīvanayoniprayatne satyapi bhārodvahanādikamakurvatastādṛśanamānanubhavena tasya śramājanakatvāt tasmāt bhojanādivat śramaviśeṣaṇāmapi bhojanādikṛtisādhyatvamananyagatikatvāt
analyzed: jīvana yoni prayatne sati api bhāra udvahana ādikam akurvataḥ tādṛśa namān anubhavena tasya śrama ajanaka tvāt tasmāt bhojana ādi vat śrama viśeṣaṇām api bhojana ādi kṛti sādhya tvam ananyagatika tvāt
translated: Even when there is effort in the life-source, one who does not do such things as lifting a burden does not experience that kind of exertion, because that [effort in the life-source] does not produce exertion. Therefore, like eating, etc., even the qualification of exertion is to be accomplished by the action of eating, etc., because there is no other way.

original: suptasya svedādyanumitaḥ śramaḥ tajjanya iti cet / na /
analyzed: suptasya sveda ādi anumitaḥ śramaḥ tad janyaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the exertion inferred from sweating, etc. in a sleeping person is produced by that [effort in the life-source], it is not so.

original: svedādeḥ śramānyahetukatvāt anyathā jāgare 'pi tadanuvṛttau śramānuvṛttiprasaṅgāt iti maivaṃ svecchādhīnakṛtiśeṣaṇatvāt /
analyzed: sveda ādeḥ śrama anya hetuka tvāt anyathā jāgare pi tad anuvṛttau śrama anuvṛtti prasaṅgāt iti mā evam sva icchā adhīna kṛti śeṣaṇa tvāt
translated: Because sweating etc. are caused by fatigue and other factors, otherwise, if they continued even while awake, fatigue would continue. But let it not be so, because the action is subordinate to one's own will.

original: śramaśca niyamato 'nyecchādhīnakṛtisādhyaḥ śrame duḥkhatvenecchāvirahād ata evānyecchājanyakṛtisādhyatvena śramo nāntarīyaka ityucyate /
analyzed: śramaḥ ca niyamataḥ nya icchā adhīna kṛti sādhyaḥ śrame duḥkha tvena icchā virahāt atas eva anya icchā janya kṛti sādhya tvena śramaḥ nāntarīyakaḥ iti ucyate
translated: And fatigue is necessarily accomplished by action dependent on another's will, because there is no desire in fatigue due to its being painful. For this very reason, fatigue is said to be invariably concomitant with being accomplished by action generated by another's will.

original: svacikīrṣādhīnatvantu na kṛtau viśeṣaṇaṃ gauravāt /
analyzed: sva cikīrṣā adhīna tvantu na kṛtau viśeṣaṇam gauravāt
translated: But being dependent on one's own desire is not a qualifier of action, because of the burden.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: anye tu kṛtigataṃ dharmāntarameva uddeśyatvaṃ tadviśiṣṭakṛtisādhyaśca na śramaḥ acikīrṣitatvāt kintu kṛtimātrasādhyaḥ /
analyzed: anye tu kṛti gatam dharma antaram eva uddeśya tvam tad viśiṣṭa kṛti sādhyaḥ ca na śramaḥ acikīrṣita tvāt kintu kṛti mātra sādhyaḥ
translated: But others say that the object is a different property in action itself, and fatigue is not accomplished by action qualified by that, because it is not desired, but is accomplished by mere action.

original: ata eva kaṣṭaṃ karmetyanubhavolokānāṃ /
analyzed: atas eva kaṣṭam karma iti anubhavaḥ lokānām
translated: For this very reason, people experience work as painful.

original: evaṃ cikīrṣāyāṃ mamaikaṃ kṛtisādhyatvaṃ prayojakaṃ tava tu kṛtisādhyatve satīṣṭasādhanatvaṃ sukhatvaṃ duḥkhābhāvatvañceti catuṣṭayaṃ /
analyzed: evam cikīrṣāyām mama ekam kṛti sādhya tvam prayojakam tava tu kṛti sādhya tve sati iṣṭa sādhana tvam sukha tvam duḥkha abhāva tvam ca iti catuṣṭayam
translated: Thus, in desire, for me, being accomplished by action is the cause. But for you, it is the set of four: being accomplished by action, being a means to the desired, being pleasant, and being free from pain.

original: icchāprayojakantu mama sukhatvaṃ duḥkhābhāvatvañceti dvayaṃ /
analyzed: icchā prayojakantu mama sukha tvam duḥkha abhāva tvañca iti dvayam
translated: But for me, being pleasant and being free from pain are the two that cause desire.

original: vṛṣṭisādhnatvena tatrecchā sādhanatvasyecchāvirodhitvāt /
analyzed: tatra icchā sādhana tvasya icchā virodhi tvāt
translated: The desire for rain is not a means, because it is opposed to the desire for means.

original: tava tu cayaṃ /
analyzed: tava tu cayam
translated: But in your case, it is not so.

original: viṣabhakṣaṇe tu kṛtisādhyatve 'pi balavadaniṣṭasādhanatvena cikīrṣā nāstīti kṛtau cikīrṣājanyatvaṃ viśeṣaṇamiti kaścit /
analyzed: viṣa bhakṣaṇe tu kṛti sādhya tve pi balavat aniṣṭa sādhana tvena cikīrṣā na asti iti kṛtau cikīrṣā janya tvam viśeṣaṇam iti kaścid
translated: But in the case of eating poison, even though it is accomplished by volition, there is no desire because it is a means to a strong undesirable result. Therefore, the qualification generated by desire is added to volition. So says someone.

original: tattucchaṃ /
analyzed: tat tuccham
translated: But that is worthless.

original: evaṃ hi viṣabhakṣaṇaṃ kṛtisādhyameva na syāt jīvanayonikṛte stasyānutpatteriti vyarthaṃ viśeṣaṇam /
analyzed: evam hi viṣa bhakṣaṇam kṛti sādhyam eva na syāt jīvana yoni kṛte vyartham viśeṣaṇam
translated: For in this way, eating poison would not even be accomplished by volition, because the volition to maintain life would not arise from it. So the qualification is useless.

original: syādetat iṣṭasādhanatābhramād viṣabhakṣaṇe caityavandane ca cikīrṣājanyakṛtisādhyatvamasti
analyzed: syāt etat iṣṭa sādhana tā bhramāt viṣa bhakṣaṇe caitya vandane ca cikīrṣā janya kṛti sādhya tvam asti
translated: This may be said: In eating poison and worshipping a caitya, there is accomplishment by volition generated by desire, because of the effect of the cognition of the means to a desirable end.

original: jñānaprayuktatvāt kāryatvasya tathāca sañjātabādho 'pi tatra kāryaṃ tvajñānāt pravarteta
analyzed: jñāna prayukta tvāt kārya tvasya tathā ca sañjāta bādhaḥ tatra kāryam tu ajñānāt pravarteta
translated: And thus, even one who has had his doubt removed would engage in that action because of ignorance of its being an effect.

original: tathā tṛpto 'pi bhojane /
analyzed: tathā tṛptaḥ u pi bhojane
translated: And thus, even one who is satisfied would engage in eating.

original: nanu svakṛtisādhyatānubhavastathā /
analyzed: nanu sva kṛti sādhya tā anubhavaḥ tathā
translated: But the experience of one's own action being accomplished is not so.

original: anyatheṣṭasādhanatāsmaraṇe viṣabhakṣaṇe 'pi pravarteta /
analyzed: anyathā iṣṭa sādhana tā smaraṇe viṣa bhakṣaṇe pi pravarteta
translated: Otherwise, one would engage in eating poison even when remembering the means to a desirable end.

original: na ceṣṭasādhanatājñānaṃ vedovānubhāvakamastīti cet / na /
analyzed: na ca iṣṭasādhanatā jñānam vedaḥ vā anubhāvakam asti iti ced na
translated: And if it is said that there is no Veda that reveals the knowledge of the means to a desirable end, that is not so.

original: vastutastatra kṛtisādhyatve liṅgāntareṇāptavākyena vā tadanubhavasambhavāt liṅgābhāsācchabdābhāsādvā apravṛttiprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: vastutas tatra kṛti sādhya tve liṅga antareṇa āpta vākyena vā tad anubhava sambhavāt liṅga ābhāsāt śabda ābhāsāt vā apravṛtti prasaṅgāt ca
translated: Because in reality, there the cognition of being the content of an injunction can arise from another inferential mark or from the statement of a trustworthy person, and because there would be the undesirable consequence of non-activity from a false inferential mark or a false statement.

original: bhedāgrahavādinastacca tava tadanubhavābhāvāt /
analyzed: bheda agraha vādinaḥ tat ca tava tad anubhava abhāvāt
translated: And for one who asserts the non-apprehension of difference, that is not possible for you, because of the absence of that experience.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: Do not say so.

original: svaviśeṣaṇavattāpratisandhānajanyaṃ hi kāryatājñānaṃ pravartakaṃ tathā hi kāmye puruṣaviśeṣaṇaṃ kāmanā tataḥ kāmyasādhanatājñānena yāgapākādau
analyzed: sva viśeṣaṇavat tā pratisandhāna janyam hi kāryatā jñānam pravartakam tathā hi kāmye puruṣa viśeṣaṇam kāmanā tatas kāmya sādhanatā jñānena yāga pāka ādau
translated: For the cognition of being the content of an injunction, which is produced by the recollection of being qualified by its own qualifier, is the instigator. Thus, in the case of a desirable act, desire is the qualifier of a particular person. From that, by the cognition of being the means of accomplishing the desirable, in a sacrifice, cooking, etc.,

original: nitye ca kālaśaucādi svaviśeṣaṇaṃ /
analyzed: nitye ca kāla śauca ādi sva viśeṣaṇam
translated: and in the case of a compulsory act, time, purity, etc. are the qualifiers of itself.

original: tathācaitatsandhyāyāmahaṃ kṛtisādhyasaṃdhyāvandanaḥ saṃdhyāsamaye śaucādisvaviśeṣaṇajñānajanyaṃ /
analyzed: tathā ca etad sandhyāyām aham kṛti sādhya saṃdhyā vandanaḥ saṃdhyā samaye śauca ādi sva viśeṣaṇa jñāna janyam
translated: And thus, at that time of dusk, I am the performer of the worship of dusk, which is to be accomplished by my own action. The cognition of being qualified by time, purity, etc. is produced by the cognition of being the content of an injunction.

original: taduktaṃ /
analyzed: tat uktam
translated: That has been stated.

original: sa ca kāryaviśeṣaḥ puruṣaviśeṣaṇāvagataḥ pravṛttiheturiti /
analyzed: sa ca kārya viśeṣaḥ puruṣa viśeṣaṇa avagataḥ pravṛtti hetuḥ iti
translated: And that particular effect, which is cognized as qualified by a particular person, is the cause of activity.

original: saṃjātabādhasya ca viṣabhakṣaṇe caityavandane ca bhramadaśāyāmiva neṣṭasādhanatājñānamasti
analyzed: saṃjāta bādhasya ca viṣa bhakṣaṇe caitya vandane ca bhrama daśāyām iva na iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānam asti
translated: And for one whose doubt has been removed, there is no cognition of being the means of accomplishing the desirable, in eating poison or worshipping a caitya, as in a state of error.

original: yena tajjanyakāryatājñānāt pravarteta tṛptasya ca kāmanāviraheṇa iṣṭasādhanatājñānābhāva na tathā bodhaḥ /
analyzed: yena tad janya kārya tā jñānāt pravarteta tṛptasya ca kāmanā viraheṇa iṣṭa sādhana tā jñāna abhāva na tathā bodhaḥ
translated: By which one would engage in action from the knowledge of the effect to be produced by that. And for one who is satisfied, there is no desire, and hence no knowledge of the means to the desired end, so there is no such cognition.

original: anye tvātmano jīvitvapratisandhānajanyaṃ śrame kṛtisādhyatājñānaṃ sambhavatīti jīvanavyatiriktatvaṃ svaviśeṣaṇe viśeṣaṇamiti /
analyzed: anye tu ātmanaḥ jīvi tva pratisandhāna janyam śrame kṛti sādhya tā jñānam sambhavati iti jīvana vyatirikta tvam sva viśeṣaṇe viśeṣaṇam iti
translated: Others, however, say that the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own effort can arise from the recollection of the self's living nature, so the qualification of being different from life is a qualification of its own particular.

original: tanna /🔽śrame svecchādhīnakṛtisādhyatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: tat na  śrame sva icchā adhīna kṛti sādhya tva abhāvāt
translated: That is not so.🔽Because effort is not accomplished by one's own volitional action.

original: iṣṭasādhanatāliṅgakaṃ kāryatājñānaṃ pravartakaṃ ityapare /
analyzed: iṣṭa sādhana tā liṅgakam kārya tā jñānam pravartakam iti apare
translated: Others say that the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own effort is the motivator, having as its content the nature of being the means to the desired end, which is qualified by the exclusion of eating poison.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: nitye tadabhāvāt /
analyzed: nitye tad abhāvāt
translated: Because that is absent in the case of the obligatory.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: nanu viṣabhakṣaṇavyāvṛttamiṣṭasādhanatvameva kṛtisādhyatājñāne viṣayatayā viśeṣaṇamastu svaviśeṣaṇavattājñānajanyatvāpekṣayā laghutvāt /
analyzed: nanu viṣa bhakṣaṇa vyāvṛttam iṣṭasādhanatvam eva kṛti sādhya tā jñāne viṣayatayā viśeṣaṇam astu sva viśeṣaṇavat tā jñāna janya tva apekṣayā laghutvāt
translated: Well then, let the nature of being the means to the desired end, which excludes eating poison, be the qualifier in the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own effort, by being the content, because it is simpler than requiring the knowledge of the presence of its own qualifier.

original: kiñcopāyaviṣayā
analyzed: kiñca upāya viṣayā
translated: Moreover, the desire for the means

original: cikīrṣā iṣṭasādhanatājñānasādhyā upāyecchātvāt vṛṣṭīcchāvat /
analyzed: cikīrṣā iṣṭa sādhana tā jñāna sādhyā upāya icchā tvāt vṛṣṭi icchā vat
translated: is accomplished by the knowledge of being the means to the desired end, because it is a desire for the means, like a desire for rain.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: bhogacikīrṣāyāṃ tadabhāvāvaprayojakamiṣṭasādhanatvamiti cet / na /
analyzed: bhoga cikīrṣāyām tad abhāvau aprayojakam iṣṭasādhanatvam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the absence of that in the desire for enjoyment is not a reason, because it is the nature of being the means to the desired end, that is not so.

original: tavāpi svaviśeṣaṇadhījanyatvābhāvena tatra tasyāprayojakatvāt /
analyzed: tava api sva viśeṣaṇa dhī janya tva abhāvena tatra tasya aprayojaka tvāt
translated: Because even in that case, your [cognition] would not be a proper reason, since it does not arise from the cognition of its own qualifier.

original: kṛtihetucikīrṣāyāṃ tat prayojakaṃ /
analyzed: kṛti hetu cikīrṣāyām tat prayojakam
translated: It is a proper reason in the case of the desire to do, which is the cause of action.

original: na ca bhogacikīrṣā tathā /
analyzed: na ca bhoga cikīrṣā tathā
translated: But the desire to enjoy is not so.

original: upāyacikīrṣāta eva kṛtisambhavāt /
analyzed: upāya cikīrṣātaḥ eva kṛti sambhavāt
translated: Because the action arises only from the desire for the means.

original: iti cet /
analyzed: iti ced
translated: If you say this,

original: tulyamiti /
analyzed: tulyam iti
translated: [we reply:] it is the same.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: Do not say so.

original: sādhyatvasādhanatvayorvirodhenaikatra jñātumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: sādhyatva sādhana tvayoḥ virodhena ekatra jñātum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because the known and the unknown cannot be known together, due to the contradiction between being an object to be accomplished and being a means of accomplishment.

original: asiddhāvasthasya hi sādhyatvaṃ siddhatādaśāyāṃ tadabhāvāt siddhatādaśāyāñca sādhanatvaṃ
analyzed: asiddha avasthasya hi sādhya tvam siddha tā daśāyām tad abhāvāt siddha tā daśāyām ca sādhana tvam
translated: For that which is in the state of being unaccomplished is an object to be accomplished, and that which is in the state of being accomplished is a means of accomplishment,

original: asiddhāvasthāvataḥ kāryānutpatteḥ tathāca pākāderasiddhatvasiddhatvajñāne sādhyatvasādhanatvagrahaḥ /
analyzed: asiddha avasthāvataḥ kārya anutpatteḥ tathā ca pāka ādeḥ asiddha tva siddha tva jñāne sādhya tva sādhana tva grahaḥ
translated: because an effect does not arise from that which is in the state of being unaccomplished. Thus, in the cognition of cooking as unaccomplished and accomplished, there is the apprehension of being an object to be accomplished and being a means of accomplishment.

original: na caikamekenaikadā siddhamamasiddhañca iti jñāyate /
analyzed: na ca ekam ekena ekadā siddham amasiddham ca iti jñāyate
translated: And one thing cannot be known as both accomplished and unaccomplished at one time by one [cognition].

original: na ca svarūpagatatāsādhyatvasādhanatvayorato na virodha iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca svarūpa gata tā sādhyatva sādhana tvayoḥ atas na virodhaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that being an object to be accomplished and being a means of accomplishment are not contradictory, because they belong to the nature [of the object].

original: yadi hi svarūpanibandhanaṃ tadubhayaṃ tadā tatsvarūpaṃ sadaiva siddhamasiddhañca syāt /
analyzed: yadi hi svarūpa nibandhanam tat ubhayam tadā tat svarūpam sadā eva siddham asiddham ca syāt
translated: For if both of them were based on the nature [of the object], then that nature would always be both accomplished and unaccomplished.

original: bhinnanirūpitatve 'pi tayoḥ siddhatvāsiddhatve anavagamyājñānāt /
analyzed: bhinna nirūpita tve pi tayoḥ siddha tva asiddha tve an avagamya ajñānāt
translated: Even if the two are determined as different, their being established or not is not understood due to ignorance.

original: tasmāt samayabhedopādhika eva tadubhayasambandhaḥ pāke /
analyzed: tasmāt samaya bheda upādhikaḥ eva tad ubhaya sambandhaḥ pāke
translated: Therefore, the relation between the two in cooking is only due to the distinction of convention.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: idānīṃ sādhyatvaṃ agre sādhanatvaṃ jñāyata iti cet / na /
analyzed: idānīm sādhya tvam agre sādhana tvam jñāyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that now it is known to be the object to be accomplished and later it is known to be the means, it is not so.

original: idānīmagrimapadārthayornānātvādananugamena vyāptyagrahāt śabdena tathā pratipādayitumaśakyatvāt gauravācca /
analyzed: idānīm agrima padārthayoḥ nānātvāt ananugamena vyāpti agrahāt śabdena tathā pratipādayitum aśakya tvāt gauravāt ca
translated: Because the two subsequent terms are different now, there is no conformity, and the pervasion is not grasped, because it cannot be conveyed by the word in that way, and because of the complexity.

original: na ca kṛtitaḥ siddhamiṣṭasādhanamitijñānāt cikīrṣā /
analyzed: na ca kṛtitaḥ siddham iṣṭa sādhanam iti jñānāt cikīrṣā
translated: And desire to do does not arise from the knowledge that what is established is the means to the desired object due to action.

original: na hi siddhaṃ kaścit cikīrṣati /
analyzed: na hi siddham kaścid cikīrṣati
translated: For no one desires what is already established.

original: kṛteḥ pūrva kṛtitaḥ siddhamiti jñānābhavācca /
analyzed: kṛteḥ kṛtitaḥ siddham iti jñāna abhavāt ca
translated: And because there is no knowledge that what is established is so due to action prior to the action.

original: na ca kṛtisādhyatvena pākāderiṣṭasādhatvāt sādhanatvamapi sādhyam /
analyzed: na ca kṛti sādhya tvena pāka ādeḥ iṣṭa sādha tvāt sādhanatvam api sādhyam
translated: And it is not that the means is also to be accomplished because cooking, etc. are the means to the desired object by being to be accomplished by action.

original: na hi kṛtisādhyatvena pākasyaudanasādhanatā /
analyzed: na hi kṛti sādhya tvena pākasya odana sādhana tā
translated: For cooking is not the means to cooked rice by being to be accomplished by action.

original: ityuktaṃ tasmāt kṛta kriyamāṇavilakṣaṇaṃ kṛtyanantarabhaviṣyattārūpaṃ kṛtisādhyatvaṃ cikīrṣāprayojakaṃ tādṛśañca sādhanatvavirodhyeva /
analyzed: iti uktam tasmāt kṛta kriyamāṇa vilakṣaṇam kṛti anantara bhaviṣyat tā rūpam kṛti sādhya tvam cikīrṣā prayojakam tādṛśam ca sādhanatva virodhī eva
translated: Thus it is said. Therefore, being to be accomplished by action, which is of the form of what will exist after the action, which is different from what is done and what is being done, is the cause of desire to do, and such being to be accomplished by action is itself opposed to being the means.

original: kiñca sādhanatvasya siddhamātradharmatvāt sādhanatvajñānamicchāvirodhi /
analyzed: kiñca sādhana tvasya siddha mātra dharma tvāt sādhana tva jñānam icchā virodhi
translated: Moreover, since the property of being a means is a property of only what is established, the knowledge of being a means is opposed to desire.

original: na hi kaścit siddhamicchatītyuktam /
analyzed: na hi kaścid siddham icchati iti uktam
translated: For it has been said that no one desires what is established.

original: etena vṛṣṭyādāviṣṭasādhanatājñānamupāyecchākāraṇatvena kḷptamiti nirastam /
analyzed: etena vṛṣṭi ādau iṣṭasādhanatā jñānam upāya icchā kāraṇatvena kḷptam iti nirastam
translated: By this, the established knowledge of being a means to rain etc. as the cause of desire for the means is refuted.

original: kathaṃ tarhi svato 'sundare vṛṣṭyādivicchā /
analyzed: katham tarhi svatas sundare vṛṣṭi ādi vicchā
translated: Then how is there desire for rain etc. which are not beautiful by themselves?

original: tatsādhyeṣṭajñānāditi gṛhāṇa /
analyzed: tad sādhya iṣṭa jñānāt iti gṛhāṇa
translated: Accept that it is from the knowledge of the desired thing to be accomplished by that.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: anye tu sukhaduḥkhābhāvatatsādhaneṣṭicchāprayojakamanugatamuddeśyatvaṃ puruṣārthapadavedanīyaṃ dharmāntaramasti anugatakāryasyānugatakāraṇaniyamyatvāt
analyzed: anye tu sukha duḥkha abhāva tad sādhana iṣṭi chā prayojakam anugatam uddeśya tvam puruṣa artha pada vedanīyam dharma antaram asti anugata kāryasya anugata kāraṇa niyamya tvāt
translated: Others say there is a distinct property called 'aim' which is cognized by the word 'human goal', which is the cause of desire and effort for the absence of pleasure and pain and their means, because an effect that is uniform must be regulated by a uniform cause.

original: tadeva duḥkhatatsādhanādau cikīrṣāprayojakamiti /
analyzed: tat eva duḥkha tad sādhana ādau cikīrṣā prayojakam iti
translated: That alone is the cause of desire for pain and its means etc.

original: na ca duḥkhavirodhitvameva tathāstīti vācyam /🔽sahānavasthānaniyamavirodhasyāsambhavāt /
analyzed: na ca duḥkha virodhi tvam eva tathā asti iti vācyam  saha anavasthāna niyama virodhasya asambhavāt
translated: And it cannot be said that the mere opposition to pain is so.🔽Because the impossibility of contradiction with the rule of non-coexistence is not possible.

original: badhyadhātaka bhāvasyaikasamaye samānādhikaraṇyābhāvasya ca yatnādi sādhāraṇyāditi /
analyzed: bhāvasya eka samaye samānādhikaraṇya abhāvasya ca yatna ādi sādhāraṇyāt iti
translated: Because the absence of co-substratality of the object to be bound and destroyed at the same time is common to effort etc.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: tadajñāne 'pi sukhatvajñānādicchotpatteḥ /
analyzed: tad ajñāne pi sukha tva jñānāt icchā utpatteḥ
translated: Because desire arises from the knowledge of pleasure etc. even without knowing that.

original: na hi sukhatve jñāte dharmāntarajñānaṃ vinā necchati /
analyzed: na hi sukha tve jñāte dharma antara jñānam vinā na icchati
translated: For when pleasure is known, one does not desire it without the knowledge of another property.

original: tathātve svataḥ prayojanahānyāpatteḥ /
analyzed: tathātve svatas prayojana hāni āpatteḥ
translated: If it were so, then the self-purpose would be lost.

original: tadeva hi svataḥ prayojanaṃ tadavagataṃ sat svavṛttitayeṣyate /
analyzed: tat eva hi svatas prayojanam tad avagatam sat sva vṛtti tayā iṣyate
translated: For that itself, when known, is desired for its own occurrence.

original: kiñcānugatadharmakalpanāpi kāraṇe /
analyzed: kiñca anugata dharma kalpanā api kāraṇe
translated: Moreover, the postulation of a common property is also a cause.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: na ca sukhādi icchākaraṇaṃ anāgatatvāt /
analyzed: na ca sukha ādi icchā karaṇam anāgata tvāt
translated: And pleasure etc. are not the cause of desire, because they are future.

original: kintu tadavagamaḥ /
analyzed: kintu tad avagamaḥ
translated: But rather the knowledge of them.

original: tarhi sukhādijñāne tat svarūpasadevecchāprayojakamastviti cet / na /
analyzed: tarhi sukha ādi jñāne tat svarūpa sat eva icchā prayojakam astu iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that in the knowledge of pleasure etc., that very nature which exists is the cause of desire, it is not so.

original: yathā hyuddeśyatvaṃ sukhajñānādiṣūtpadyate anyataratvāt tṛṇāraṇimaṇinyāyādvā tathaivecchaiva jāyatāṃ /
analyzed: yathā hi uddeśya tvam sukha jñāna ādiṣu utpadyate anyatara tvāt tṛṇa araṇi maṇi nyāyāt vā tathā eva icchā eva jāyatām
translated: For just as the state of being the object of desire arises in pleasure, knowledge etc., because of being one or the other, or by the principle of grass, stone and magnet, in the same way let desire itself arise.

original: kṛtisādhyatvañca kṛtau satyāṃ agrimakṣaṇe svarūpaṃ na kṛtiṃ vinā /
analyzed: kṛti sādhya tvam ca kṛtau satyām agrima kṣaṇe svarūpam na kṛtim vinā
translated: And the state of being accomplished by action, when the action exists, in the next moment, the nature, not without action.

original: kṣemasādhāraṇañcaitat /🔽kṛtisādhyatvañca na kṛteḥ pūrvaṃ /
analyzed: kṣema sādhāraṇam ca etat  kṛti sādhya tvam ca na kṛteḥ pūrvam
translated: And this is common to what is safe.🔽And the state of being accomplished by action is not before the action.

original: nanu kṛtau naṣṭāyāṃ sannapi dharmī na kāryaḥ tathāca kathaṃ kārye 'pūrve kāmino 'nvayaḥkṣaṇikatvena kriyātulyatvāditi cet / na /
analyzed: nanu kṛtau naṣṭāyām san api dharmī na kāryaḥ tathā ca katham kārye pūrve kāminaḥ nvayaḥ kṣaṇika tvena kriyā tulya tvāt iti ced na
translated: But when the action has ceased, even though the object exists, it is not the effect. And how then is there concomitance of the lover with the unseen effect, which is to be produced, because of being similar to action by momentariness? If this is argued, it is not so.

original: yadvṛttikāmyasādhanatvaṃ tatra kāryatā buddheḥ prayojakatvāt na tu kāryatāviśiṣṭasya kāmyasādhanateti vyāptiḥ /
analyzed: yad vṛtti kāmya sādhana tvam tatra kāryatā buddheḥ prayojaka tvāt na tu kāryatā viśiṣṭasya kāmya sādhana tā iti vyāptiḥ
translated: The pervasion is: that which is the means of accomplishing the desired object, there the cognition of being an effect is the motivator, not the cognition of being an effect qualified by the desired object.

original: nanu pākādau kṛtisādhyatājñānaṃ na pratyakṣeṇa kṛtyanantaraṃ pāke sati kṛtisādhyatājñānaṃ tasmin sati kṛtirityanyonyāśrayāt kṛtisādhyatotīrṇe 🔽cikīrṣākṛtyorasambhavācceti cet / na /
analyzed: nanu pāka ādau kṛti sādhya tā jñānam na pratyakṣeṇa kṛti anantaram pāke sati kṛti sādhya tā jñānam tasmin sati kṛtiḥ iti anyonya āśrayāt kṛti sādhya tā utīrṇe  / cikīrṣā kṛtyoḥ asambhavāt ca iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that in cooking, etc., the knowledge of being accomplished by action is not by perception, because after the action, when the cooking exists, there is the knowledge of being accomplished by action, and when that exists, there is the action, due to mutual dependence, and because of the impossibility of desire and action when free from being accomplished by action, it is not so.

original: pāko matkṛtisādhyaḥ matkṛtiṃ vinā asattve sati madiṣṭasādhanatvāt daivādyanadhīnatve🔽sati madiṣṭasādhanatvādvā madbhojanavadityanumānāt svakṛtisādhyatājñānaṃ yasya yadiṣṭasādhanaṃ
analyzed: pākaḥ mad kṛti sādhyaḥ mad kṛtim vinā asattve sati mad iṣṭa sādhana tvāt daiva ādi anadhīna tve  sati mad iṣṭa sādhana tvāt vā mad bhojana vat iti anumānāt sva kṛti sādhya tā jñānam yasya yat iṣṭa sādhanam
translated: Because of the inference: cooking is accomplished by my action, because it does not exist without my action, when it exists, it is the means of accomplishing my desired object, or because it is not dependent on fate, etc., when it exists, it is the means of accomplishing my desired object, like my eating.

original: yatkṛtiṃ vinā yadā na sambhavati tat tadā tatkatisādhyaṃ iti vyāpteḥ /
analyzed: yat kṛtim vinā yadā na sambhavati tat tadā tat kati sādhyam iti vyāpteḥ
translated: The knowledge of being accomplished by one's own action is from the pervasion: that which is the means of accomplishing one's desired object, when it does not exist without one's action, that is accomplished by one's action then.

original: asiddhasyeṣṭasādhanatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: asiddhasya iṣṭasādhana tva abhāvāt
translated: Because what is unaccomplished does not have the nature of being the means of accomplishing the desired object.

original: balavadaniṣṭānanubandhitvañca liṅgaviśeṣaṇaṃ tena na madhuviṣasaṃmpṛktānnabhojane vyabhicāraḥ sāmānyatastasyāpi kṛtisādhyatotīrṇe na vyabhicāraḥ
analyzed: balavat aniṣṭa ananubandhi tvam ca liṅga viśeṣaṇam tena na madhu viṣa saṃmpṛkta anna bhojane vyabhicāraḥ sāmānyatas tasya api kṛti sādhya tā utīrṇe na vyabhicāraḥ
translated: And the qualification of the mark is that it is not connected with a very undesirable result. Therefore, there is no contradiction in eating food mixed with honey and poison. In general, it is not contradicted even by that, because it is also accomplished by an action.

original: sāmānyatastasyāpi kṛtisādhyatvāt /
analyzed: sāmānyatas tasya api kṛti sādhya tvāt
translated: Because it is also accomplished by an action in general.

original: atītatādaśāyāñcātītaudanecchāviraheṇeṣṭasādhanatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: atīta tā daśāyām ca atīta odana icchā viraheṇa iṣṭasādhanatva abhāvāt
translated: And because there is no desire for past rice in the past state, there is no means to what is desired.

original: ata eva nidāghadūnadehovarṣati vāride toyadātoyalābhasambhāvanāyāṃ vā saro 'vagāhane
analyzed: atas eva nidāgha dūna dehaḥ varṣati vāride toyada atoya lābha sambhāvanāyām vā saraḥ vagāhane
translated: For this very reason, when there is a possibility of obtaining water from a cloud raining on a body weakened by heat, or when one enters a lake,

original: na pravartate iṣṭasantāpaśāntisādhanatoyasambandhasya svakṛtiṃ vināpi siddhipratisandhānena
analyzed: na pravartate iṣṭa santāpa śānti sādhana toya sambandhasya sva kṛtim vinā api siddhi pratisandhānena
translated: one does not engage in it, because of the recollection that the connection with water, which is the means to the desired relief from heat, is accomplished even without one's own action,

original: liṅgābhāvena svakṛtisādhyatvajñānābhāvāt /
translated: due to the absence of the mark, the knowledge that it is to be accomplished by one's own action.

original: yadā ca matkṛtiṃ vinā na sambhavatīti pratisandhatte tadā pravartate /
analyzed: yadā ca mad kṛtim vinā na sambhavati iti pratisandhatte tadā pravartate
translated: And when one recollects that it cannot exist without one's own action, then one engages in it.

original: yasya santāpaśāntimamātramiṣṭaṃ sa sato 'vagāhanasyeṣṭasādhanatvameva na pratisandhatte upasthitavṛṣṭito 'pi tatsambhavāditi kaścit /
analyzed: yasya santāpa śāntim amātram iṣṭam sa sataḥ vagāhanasya iṣṭa sādhana tvam eva na pratisandhatte upasthita vṛṣṭitaḥ pi tad sambhavāt iti kaścid
translated: Some say that one whose only desire is for the relief of heat does not recollect that entering a lake is a means to what is desired, because it is possible even from the present rain.

original: tanna toyasambandhatvena santāpaśāntisādhanatvaṃ tasya ca saro 'vagāhane 'pi sattvāt anyathā vṛṣṭirapi tatsādhanaṃ na syāt saro 'vagāhanādapi 🔽tatsiddheḥ /
analyzed: tat na toya sambandha tvena santāpa śānti sādhana tvam tasya ca saraḥ vagāhane sattvāt anyathā vṛṣṭiḥ api tad sādhanam na syāt saraḥ vagāhanāt api  tad siddheḥ
translated: The fact that it is a means of alleviating heat by its connection with water does not hold good, because it exists even when one enters a lake. Otherwise, rain also would not be a means of alleviating heat, because it is accomplished even by entering a lake.

original: kāryasādhanatvañca kṛtisādhyatve na liṅgaṃ pākādivadodanāderapi pravṛtteḥ pūrvaṃ kṛtisādhyatvajñāne hetvabhāvāt /
analyzed: kārya sādhana tvañca kṛti sādhya tve na liṅgam pāka ādi vat odana ādeḥ api pravṛtteḥ pūrvam kṛti sādhya tva jñāne hetu abhāvāt
translated: And the fact of being a means of accomplishing an effect is not an inference of being accomplished by an act, because even rice etc. are engaged in it, because there is no reason for the knowledge of being accomplished by an act prior to the engagement.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: nanvevaṃ liṅgajñānameva pravartakaṃ astu prāthamikatvāt āvaśyakatvāñca /
analyzed: nanu evam liṅga jñānam eva pravartakam astu prāthamika tvāt āvaśyaka tvāt ca
translated: If it is argued that thus let the knowledge of the mark alone be the instigator, because it is primary and necessary,

original: na ca lāghavāt kṛtisādhyatvajñānaṃ tathā /
analyzed: na ca lāghavāt kṛti sādhya tva jñānam tathā
translated: and not the knowledge of being accomplished by an act due to simplicity,

original: kṛtisādhyatānumitau tadā mānābhāvena yugapadupasthityabhāvāt pravṛttisāmagṣānumitipravibandhāñceti cet / na /
analyzed: kṛti sādhyatā anumitau tadā māna abhāvena yugapad upasthiti abhāvāt pravṛtti sāmagṣa anumiti pravibandhāt ca iti ced na
translated: if it is argued that in the inference of being accomplished by an act, there is no means of valid knowledge at that time, and because of the absence of simultaneous presentation, and because of the obstruction to the inference of the assemblage of causes for engagement, it is not so,

original: liṅgajñāne kṛtisādhyatvāprakāśe tatprakārakacikīrṣāyāṃ tasyāhetutvāt /
translated: because when the mark is known, and being accomplished by an act is not manifested, in the desire for that, it is not its cause.

original: ata eva liṅgāntarajñānamapi na pravartakam /
analyzed: atas eva liṅga antara jñānam api na pravartakam
translated: For this very reason, the knowledge of another mark also is not the instigator.

original: nanu pākādiḥ kṛtaḥ kriyamāṇovā na pakṣaḥ tasya kṛtisādhyatve bādhāt /
analyzed: nanu pāka ādiḥ kṛtaḥ kriyamāṇaḥ vā na pakṣaḥ tasya kṛti sādhya tve bādhāt
translated: If it is argued that an act like cooking is not the subject, because of the contradiction that it is accomplished by an act,

original: nāpyanāgataḥ /🔽bhāvipāke mānābhāvenāśrayāsiddheḥ /
analyzed: na api anāgataḥ  bhāvi pāke māna abhāvena āśraya asiddheḥ
translated: Nor is it the future.🔽Because the substratum is not established due to the absence of the notion of the future result.

original: pākatvaṃ bhaviṣyadvṛtti sāmānyatvāt gotvavat iti mānamiti cet / na /
analyzed: pāka tvam bhaviṣyat vṛtti sāmānya tvāt go tva vat iti mānam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the state of being cooked is a universal existing in the future because it is a universal, like cowness, that is not so.

original: mānābhāvena gotve 'pi tasyāprasiddheḥ /
analyzed: māna abhāvena go tve pi tasya aprasiddheḥ
translated: Because cowness is also not established due to the absence of the notion.

original: pākamātraṃ pakṣa iti cet / na /🔽mātrārtho yadi pākatvaṃ tadā bādholiṅgāsiddhiśca /
analyzed: pāka mātram pakṣaḥ iti ced na  mātrā arthaḥ yadi pāka tvam tadā bādhaḥ liṅga asiddhiḥ ca
