translated: If it is argued that mere cooking is the subject, that is not so.🔽If the word mere means the state of being cooked, then there is contradiction and the reason is not established.

original: sarvapākaparatve ca tasya siddhabhāge bādho 'nāgatabhāge cāśrayāsiddhiḥ /
analyzed: sarva pāka para tve ca tasya siddha bhāge bādhaḥ nāgata bhāge ca āśraya asiddhiḥ
translated: If it refers to all cooking, then there is contradiction in the established part and the substratum is not established in the future part.

original: vartamānādyudāsīnaḥ pākaḥ pakṣaḥ pākasāmānye ca kṛtisādhyatvaṃ na bādhitamityapi na /
analyzed: vartamāna ādi udāsīnaḥ pākaḥ pakṣaḥ pāka sāmānye ca kṛti sādhya tvam na bādhitam iti api na
translated: It is also not so that cooking, which is neutral to the present etc., is the subject, and the state of being accomplished by action is not contradicted in the universal of cooking.

original: siddhasya pakṣatvaṃ nāsiddhasyetyanumiteḥ siddhaviṣayatve bādhāt bhinnaviṣayatve vā siddhaviṣayecchāpravṛttyādyanutpādakatvācca /
analyzed: siddhasya pakṣa tvam na asiddhasya iti anumiteḥ siddha viṣaya tve bādhāt bhinna viṣaya tve vā siddha viṣaya icchā pravṛtti ādi anutpādaka tvāt ca
translated: Because if the inference is that the subject is the established one, not the unestablished one, then there is contradiction due to the established being the object, or if the objects are different, then desire for the established object and other actions do not arise.

original: kṛtakriyamāṇasādhāraṇakṛti sādhyatvajñānādevāsiddhaviṣayā cikīrṣā kṛtiścotpadyate /
analyzed: kṛta kriyamāṇa sādhāraṇa kṛti sādhya tva jñānāt eva asiddha viṣayā cikīrṣā kṛtiḥ ca utpadyate
translated: Desire and action with unestablished objects arise only from the knowledge that what is accomplished and what is being accomplished are accomplished by a common action.

original: ananyagatikatvena tathākāraṇasvabhāvakalpanāditi / cet /
analyzed: ananyagatika tvena tathā kāraṇa svabhāva kalpanāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is so because the cause is imagined to have that nature due to having no other option,

original: tarhi yādṛśaṃ kṛtisādhyatvaṃ cikīrṣāyāṃ prakāraḥ tādṛśaṃ jñāne nāstītyanyaprakārakajñānādeva cikīrṣā syāt /
analyzed: tarhi yādṛśam kṛti sādhya tvam cikīrṣāyām prakāraḥ tādṛśam jñāne na asti iti anya prakāraka jñānāt eva cikīrṣā syāt
translated: Then, since the relation of being accomplished by an action is not present in the same way in desire as it is in knowledge, desire would arise only from knowledge that has a different mode.

original: tathā ca liṅgajñānameva pravṛttiheturastu prāthamikatvāt /🔽yattu smṛtapāke kṛtisādhyatvāsaṃsargāgrahātpravṛttiḥ sa cāsaṃsargāgrahaḥ iṣṭasādhanatāgrahāditi /
analyzed: tathā ca liṅga jñānam eva pravṛtti hetuḥ astu prāthamika tvāt  yat tu smṛta pāke kṛti sādhya tva asaṃsarga agrahāt pravṛttiḥ sa ca asaṃsarga agrahaḥ iṣṭa sādhanatā grahāt iti
translated: And in that case, let the knowledge of the mark alone be the cause of activity, because it is primary.🔽But it is said that activity arises from the non-apprehension of the relation of being accomplished by an action in remembered cooking, and that non-apprehension of the relation is due to the apprehension of being the means to the desired end.

original: tanna / smṛtapākasya siddhatvena tatra kāryatvāsaṃsargagrahe 'numānabādhāt /
analyzed: tat na smṛta pākasya siddha tvena tatra kārya tva a saṃsarga grahe numāna bādhāt
translated: That is not so. Because when the relation of being an effect is not apprehended in remembered cooking, which is already accomplished, there is contradiction with inference.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p / 🔽smṛtapākasya siddhatvaṃ tadā na gṛhyate iti cet /
analyzed: bibl ind  smṛta pākasya siddha tvam tadā na gṛhyate iti ced
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.🔽If it is argued that the accomplishment of remembered cooking is not apprehended at that time,

original: tarhi smṛtapākasya siddhatvagrahe odanārthī pāke na pravarteta /
analyzed: tarhi smṛta pākasya siddha tva grahe odana arthī pāke na pravarteta
translated: then when the accomplishment of remembered cooking is apprehended, one who desires cooked rice would not engage in cooking.

original: tatra pākādau siddhatvagrahāttadasaṃsargagraha iti cetulyam /🔽api ca smṛtapāke kāryatvāsaṃsargādvidyamānāsaṃsargāgrahādvisaṃvādinī pravṛttiḥ syāt /
analyzed: tatra pāka ādau siddha tva grahāt tad a saṃsarga grahaḥ iti ca itulyam  api ca smṛta pāke kārya tva asaṃsargāt vidyamāna a saṃsarga agrahāt visaṃvādinī pravṛttiḥ syāt
translated: If it is argued that the relation of being an effect is not apprehended in cooking, etc., because of the apprehension of its accomplishment there, it is the same.🔽Moreover, activity would be contradictory, arising from the non-apprehension of the relation of non-existence with remembered cooking due to the non-apprehension of the relation of being an effect with remembered cooking.

original: kiñcaivaṃ siddhapākajñānādajñāte 'siddhe pāke icchāpravṛttī syātāmiti /
analyzed: kiñca evam siddha pāka jñānāt ajñāte siddhe pāke icchā pravṛttī syātām iti
translated: Furthermore, in that case, desire and activity would arise regarding an unknown unaccomplished cooking from the knowledge of an accomplished cooking.

original: atra brūmaḥ /
analyzed: atra brūmaḥ
translated: To this we reply:

original: pāke kṛtisādhyatvaṃ siddhat siddhe bādhāt anāgatapākamādāya sidhyati /
analyzed: pāke kṛti sādhya tvam siddhat siddhe bādhāt anāgata pākam ādāya sidhyati
translated: In cooking, the fact of being accomplished by action is established when the general is established, because it is contradicted. It is established by taking the future cooking.

original: pakṣatāvacchedakadharmasāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ sādhyamānasya liṅgena sidhyatītyanumāne
analyzed: pakṣa tā avacchedaka dharma sāmānādhikaraṇyam sādhyamānasya liṅgena sidhyati iti anumāne
translated: In inference, where the property to be proved is co-extensive with the property that delimits the subject, it is established by the reason.

original: kḷtvāt yathā prasiddhavahnibādhe 'pi vahnimātraṃ na bādhitaṃ ityaprasiddho 'pi vahniḥ
analyzed: yathā vahni mātram na bādhitam iti aprasiddhaḥ pi vahniḥ
translated: Just as when the well-known fire is contradicted, mere fire is not contradicted, so even though the unknown fire

original: sidhyati tathā prasiddhapāke kṛtisādhyatvabādhe 'pi pākamātre na bādhitamityaprasiddhaṃ
analyzed: sidhyati tathā prasiddha pāke kṛti sādhya tva bādhe pi pāka mātre na bādhitam iti aprasiddham
translated: is established, similarly when the well-known cooking is contradicted as being accomplished by action, mere cooking is not contradicted, so by taking the unknown

original: pākamādāya tatsidhyati /
analyzed: pākam ādāya tat sidhyati
translated: cooking, it is established.

original: aprasiddhayoḥ pakṣasādhyayoḥ siddhāvaviśeṣāt /
analyzed: aprasiddhayoḥ pakṣa sādhyayoḥ siddhau aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no difference in the establishment of the unknown subject and the unknown probandum.

original: tasmāt asiddhasya kvacit siddhe siddhe siddhasya ca kvacit /
analyzed: tasmāt asiddhasya kvacid siddhe siddhe siddhasya ca kvacid
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the unestablished in some cases, the establishment of the established in some cases,

original: aprasiddhasya cāsiddhe siddhistenānumā tridhā /
analyzed: aprasiddhasya ca asiddhe siddhiḥ tena anumā tridhā
translated: and the establishment of the unknown in the unestablished - thus inference is threefold.

original: anyathā kṛtisādhyeṣṭasādhanatāpakṣe 'pi pākādau kṛtisādhyatvaṃ kathamavagamyeta /
analyzed: anyathā kṛti sādhya iṣṭa sādhana tā pakṣe pi pāka ādau kṛti sādhya tvam katham avagamyeta
translated: Otherwise, even in the case of accepting cooking etc. as the means of accomplishing the desired object by action, how could the fact of being accomplished by action be understood in cooking etc.?

original: kiñca tavāpīṣṭasādhanatājñānāt kathaṃ vṛṣṭyādāvicchā siddhatvasyecchāvirodhitvāt anāgatasya jñātumaśakyatvāt /
analyzed: kiñca tava api iṣṭa sādhanatā jñānāt katham vṛṣṭi ādau icchā siddhatvasya icchā virodhi tvāt anāgatasya jñātum aśakya tvāt
translated: Moreover, how can desire for rain, etc. be established from the knowledge of being an instrument to what is desired, since desire is incompatible with what is established, and what is future cannot be known?

original: ata eva siddhāsiddhaviṣayatvanirāsena sukhādijñānāt phale 'pi neccheti na vṛṣṭyādāviṣṭasādhanatāpi /
analyzed: atas eva siddha asiddha viṣaya tva nirāsena sukha ādi jñānāt phale pi nā icchā iti na vṛṣṭi ādau iṣṭasādhanatā api
translated: For this very reason, desire for the result is not produced from the knowledge of pleasure, etc., by excluding the object of what is established and what is not established, so there is no desire for rain, etc. as an instrument to what is desired.

original: na ca vṛṣṭyādisādhyeṣṭajñānāt vṛṣṭyādāvicchā /
analyzed: na ca vṛṣṭi ādi sādhya iṣṭa jñānāt vṛṣṭi ādau icchā
translated: And desire for rain, etc. is not produced from the knowledge of what is desired to be accomplished by rain, etc.

original: icchāyāḥ siddhāsiddhavṛṣṭyāditatphalaviṣayatvavikalpagrāsāt /🔽atha sāmānyalakṣaṇapratyāsattyā vṛṣṭyāditvena sukhāditvena ca siddhāsiddhavṛṣṭyāditatphalaviṣayakaṃ jñānamutpannaṃ tena siddhaṃ virodhinaṃ
analyzed: atha sāmānya lakṣaṇa pratyāsattyā vṛṣṭi ādi tvena sukha ādi tvena ca siddha asiddha vṛṣṭi ādi tad phala viṣayakam jñānam utpannam tena siddham virodhinam
translated: Because desire is swallowed by the option of having as its object what is established and what is not established, rain, etc. and its result.

original: tyaktva asiddhaviṣayecchotpadyate /
analyzed: tyaktvā asiddha viṣaya icchā utpadyate
translated: If, however, knowledge of what is established and what is not established, rain, etc. and its result, arises through the proximity of the general characteristic as rain, etc. and as pleasure, etc., then desire for what is not established arises by abandoning what is established and incompatible.

original: yadi ca sāmānyalakṣaṇā nāsti tadā yena rūpeṇeṣṭasādhanatvagrahaḥ tena rūpeṇa jñāte siddhe vecchotpadyate /
analyzed: yadi ca sāmānya lakṣaṇā na asti tadā yena rūpeṇa iṣṭasādhanatva grahaḥ tena rūpeṇa jñāte siddhe vā icchā utpadyate
translated: And if there is no general characteristic, then desire arises in the form in which the knowledge of being an instrument to what is desired occurs, whether it is known or established in that form.

original: anvayavyatirekābhyāṃ tādṛśajñānasya tādṛśecchājanakatvāvadhāraṇāt sukhecchāyāmapyekaṃ iti cet /
analyzed: anvaya vyatirekābhyām tādṛśa jñānasya tādṛśa icchā janaka tva avadhāraṇāt sukha icchāyām api ekam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that this is so in the desire for pleasure also because it is ascertained that such knowledge produces such desire through positive and negative concomitance,🔽then it is not so.

original: tarhi mamāpi pākatvācchedena kṛtisādhyatājñānādanāgate cikīrṣā tacca jñānaṃ sakalapākaviṣayaṃ sannikṛṣṭapākaviṣayaṃ vetyanyadetat /
analyzed: tarhi mama api pāka tva ācchedena kṛti sādhya tā jñānāt anāgate cikīrṣā tat ca jñānam sakala pāka viṣayam sannikṛṣṭa pāka viṣayam vā iti anyat etat
translated: Then, in my case also, from the knowledge of being accomplished by action through cutting, there is desire for the future, and that knowledge is either about all cooking or about proximate cooking - this is different.

original: bālasya vyāptyādyagraheṇādyā pravṛttirjīvanādṛṣṭodbodhitajanmāntarasaṃskārajanyāt stanapānaṃ kāryamiti smaraṇāt tavāpīṣṭasādhanatāsmaraṇāt
analyzed: bālasya vyāpti ādi agraheṇa ādyā pravṛttiḥ jīvana adṛṣṭa udbodhita janma antara saṃskāra janyāt stana pānam kāryam iti smaraṇāt tava api iṣṭa sādhana tā smaraṇāt
translated: For the child, the first activity due to not grasping the pervasion etc. is from the memory generated by the impressions of past lives awakened by the unseen force of living, that breast-feeding is to be done, and for you also from the memory of the means to the desired end.

original: tatra pravṛttiḥ ananyagatikatvāt /
analyzed: tatra pravṛttiḥ ananyagatika tvāt
translated: The activity there is due to having no other recourse.

original: na ca janmāntare 'pi paryanuyogaḥ /
analyzed: na ca janmāntare pi paryanuyogaḥ
translated: And there is no questioning even in another life.

original: janmadhārāyā anāditvāt pratyakṣānumānamūlakatvācca nāndhaparamparā /
analyzed: janma dhārāyāḥ anādi tvāt pratyakṣa anumāna mūlaka tvāt ca na andha paramparā
translated: Because the stream of births is beginningless and is based on perception and inference, it is not a series of blind people.

original: vastutastu śuṣkakaṇṭhatayā bālo duḥkhamanubhavan virodhitayā sukhaṃ smarati /
analyzed: vastutas tu śuṣka kaṇṭha tayā bālaḥ duḥkham anubhavan virodhi tayā sukham smarati
translated: But in reality, the child, experiencing pain due to a dry throat, remembers happiness as opposed to that.

original: tataḥ sukhatvajñānāt sukhavṛttikāryatvaṃ sukhavṛttitayā /
analyzed: tatas sukha tva jñānāt sukha vṛtti kārya tvam sukha vṛtti tayā
translated: Then, from the knowledge of happiness, the property of being an effect that occurs with happiness is due to occurring with happiness.

original: antaraṅgatvāt na tu stanapānamiṣṭasādhanamiti smaraṇaṃ /
analyzed: antaraṅga tvāt na tu stana pānam iṣṭa sādhanam iti smaraṇam
translated: Because of being more internal, there is no memory that breast-feeding is the means to the desired end.

original: sukhāvṛttitvena vahiraṅgatvāt sukhakāryatvañca stanapānamapi viṣayaḥ tena stanapāne kāryatvajñānādeva pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: sukha āvṛtti tvena vahiraṅga tvāt sukha kārya tvañca stana pānam api viṣayaḥ tena stana pāne kārya tva jñānāt eva pravṛttiḥ
translated: The sucking of the breast is also an object because it is an effect of pleasure, being an external means to the attainment of pleasure. Hence, activity is due to the mere knowledge that sucking the breast is an effect.

original: iṣṭasādhanatājñānasya tadānīṃ sāmāgṣabhāvāt evañcādyapravṛttau kāryatvajñānaṃ prayojakaṃ kḷptamityagre 'pi tadeva pravartakaṃ kḷptatvāt /
analyzed: iṣṭasādhanatā jñānasya tadānīm sāmāgṣa bhāvāt evañca ādya pravṛttau kārya tva jñānam prayojakam kḷptam iti agre tat eva pravartakam kḷpta tvāt
translated: And in the initial activity, the knowledge that it is an effect is the prompter, being established. Therefore, in subsequent activities also, that alone is the prompter, because it is established.

original: navīnāstu mamedaṃ kṛtisādhyamiti jñānaṃ na pravartakaṃ anāgataviṣaye pratyakṣānumānayorasambhavāt /
analyzed: navīnāḥ tu mama idam kṛti sādhyam iti jñānam na pravartakam anāgata viṣaye pratyakṣa anumānayoḥ asambhavāt
translated: But the modern thinkers say that the knowledge that this is to be accomplished by my activity is not the prompter, because perception and inference are not possible with regard to the future.

original: kintu yādṛśasya puruṣasya kṛtisādhyaṃ yaddṛṣṭaṃ tādṛśatvamātmanaḥ pratisandhāya tatra pravartate /🔽tathāhyodanakāmasya tatsādhanatājñānavataśca taṇḍulādyupakaraṇavataḥ pākaḥ kṛtisādhyaḥ ahamapi ca tādṛśa iti jñānāt pāke pravartate /
analyzed: kintu yādṛśasya puruṣasya kṛti sādhyam yat dṛṣṭam tādṛśa tvam ātmanaḥ pratisandhāya tatra pravartate  tathā hi odana kāmasya tad sādhana tā jñānavataḥ ca taṇḍula ādi upakaraṇavataḥ pākaḥ kṛti sādhyaḥ aham api ca tādṛśaḥ iti jñānāt pāke pravartate
translated: But a person engages in an activity after identifying himself as similar to one who has seen what is to be accomplished by activity.🔽For instance, when a person desires cooked rice, knows it to be an effect of cooking, and has the necessary ingredients like rice, etc., he engages in cooking because he knows that cooking is to be accomplished by activity and that he himself is similar to one who has done it.

original: evañcānyakṛtapāke kṛtisādhyatājñānaṃ ātmanaḥ pāke kṛtisādhyatvaprayojakaviśeṣaṇavattvajñānañca prapartakaṃ /
analyzed: evam ca anya kṛta pāke kṛti sādhya tā jñānam ātmanaḥ pāke kṛti sādhya tva prayojaka viśeṣaṇavat tva jñānam ca prapartakam
translated: And in the case of cooking done by another, the knowledge that it is to be accomplished by activity and the knowledge that one's own cooking has the property that is the prompter of the property of being to be accomplished by activity are the prompters.

original: anyatrāpi pravṛttirevamevetyanāditaiva /
analyzed: anyatra api pravṛttiḥ evam evā iti anādi tā eva
translated: And in other cases also, the activity is just the same, so it is beginningless.

original: ata eva sañcātabādhaścaityavandane viṣayabhakṣaṇe ca na pravartate iṣṭasādhanatā jñānavato hi tat kṛtisādhyaṃ /
analyzed: atas eva sañcāta bādhaḥ caitya vandane viṣaya bhakṣaṇe ca na pravartate iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānavataḥ hi tat kṛti sādhyam
translated: For this very reason, one who has had his doubts removed does not engage in worshipping a caitya or eating prohibited substances, because for one who knows the means of accomplishing the desired object, that is accomplished by his volition.

original: na ca sañjātabādhastatra iṣṭasādhanatājñānavān /
analyzed: na ca sañjāta bādhaḥ tatra iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānavān
translated: And one who has had his doubts removed does not know the means of accomplishing the desired object there.

original: evaṃ tṛptīcchāvato 'pi bhojanaṃ kṛtisādhyaṃ tṛptaśca na tṛptīcchāvattvamātmanyavetīti na bhojane pravartate /
analyzed: evam bhojanam kṛti sādhyam tṛptaḥ ca na tṛpti icchāvat tvam ātmani aveti iti na bhojane pravartate
translated: Similarly, even for one who has a desire for satisfaction, eating is accomplished by his volition, and one who is satisfied does not know that he has a desire for satisfaction in himself, so he does not engage in eating.

original: atinavīnāstu yādṛśasyetyādau avigītatvaṃ tatkṛtau viśeṣaṇamāhuḥ /🔽sañjātabādhastu viṣabhakṣaṇaṃ caityavandanañca vigītakṛtitādhyatvenaiva jānātīti tatra na pravartate /
analyzed: ati navīnāḥ tu yādṛśasya ityādau avigīta tvam tad kṛtau viśeṣaṇam āhuḥ  sañjāta bādhaḥ tu viṣa bhakṣaṇam caitya vandanam ca vigīta kṛti tādhya tvena eva jānāti iti tatra na pravartate
translated: But the very new ones say that in by one like what etc., the qualification is stated as being not contradicted by the learned in the production of that.🔽But one who has had his doubts removed knows that eating poison and worshipping a caitya are produced by the volition of one who is contradicted by the learned, so he does not engage in them.

original: pravṛttiviṣayaśca sāmānyataḥ kālāsambhinnaḥ pākādirjñāyate /
analyzed: pravṛtti viṣayaḥ ca sāmānyatas kāla asambhinnaḥ pāka ādiḥ jñāyate
translated: And the object of engagement is known in general as cooking etc. not distinguished by time.

original: pravṛttimahimnā cānāgatapākasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: pravṛtti mahimnā ca anāgata pāka siddhiḥ
translated: And by the power of engagement, the future cooking is established.

original: cikīrṣā ca kālāsambhinnaviṣayā na tu bhāvinaṃ kṛtyā sādhayāmītyākāraiveti /
analyzed: cikīrṣā ca kāla asambhinna viṣayā na tu bhāvinam kṛtyā sādhayāmi iti ākārā eva iti
translated: And the desire to do is with respect to an object not distinguished by time, but not in the form I will accomplish the future action.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: vidhivādasiddhāntaḥ
analyzed: vidhi vāda siddhāntaḥ
translated: The conclusion of the discussion on injunctions

original: atrocyate /
analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: Here it is said:

original: viṣabhakṣaṇādivyāvṛttaṃ kṛtisādhyatvajñāne iṣṭasādhanatvaṃ viṣayatayāvacchedakaṃ lāghavāt /
translated: In the cognition of being accomplished by an action, the means of attaining the desired object is the determiner as the object, due to simplicity, excluding the eating of poison, etc.

original: na tu svaviśeṣaṇavattāpratisandhānajanyatvaṃ gauravāt /
analyzed: na tu sva viśeṣaṇavat tā pratisandhāna janya tvam gauravāt
translated: But not the being produced by the remembrance of the presence of its own qualifier, due to complexity.

original: na ca siddhāsiddhāvasthayoḥ sādhyatvasādhanatvayorvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: na ca siddha asiddha avasthayoḥ sādhya tva sādhana tvayoḥ virodhaḥ
translated: And there is no contradiction between the states of being accomplished and unaccomplished in being the object to be accomplished and the means of accomplishment.

original: nirviśeṣitayostayoravirodhāt /
analyzed: niḥ viśeṣitayoḥ tayoḥ avirodhāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction between those two without any qualification.

original: pāko 'siddhaḥ sādhyaḥ siddhaḥ sādhanañcetyunubhavāt /
analyzed: siddhaḥ sādhyaḥ siddhaḥ sādhanam ca iti unubhavāt
translated: Because of the experience that cooking is unaccomplished, to be accomplished, and accomplished, and is the means.

original: tadā sādhyatvaṃ hi tadā sādhanatvasya virodhi niyamatastenaiva tasya pratikṣepeṇa sahānavasthānaniyamāt /
analyzed: tadā sādhya tvam hi tadā sādhana tvasya virodhi niyamataḥ tena eva tasya pratikṣepeṇa saha anavasthāna niyamāt
translated: For at that time, being the object to be accomplished is contradictory to being the means, because of the rule of non-coexistence by the exclusion of that itself.

original: na tu sādhanatvasyānyadā sādhanatvasya vā /
analyzed: na tu sādhana tvasya anyadā sādhana tvasya vā
translated: But not of being the means at another time or of being the means in general.

original: tayorapratikṣepāt /
analyzed: tayoḥ a pratikṣepāt
translated: Because those are not excluded.

original: anyadā sādhanatve 'pi sādhanatvamastyeva sāmānyābhāve viśeṣābhāvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyadā sādhana tve pi sādhana tvam asti eva sāmānya abhāve viśeṣa abhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Even when being the means at another time, being the means exists, because the absence of the particular would follow from the absence of the general.

original: evantadā asiddhatvasya tadā siddhatvaṃ virodhi niyamatastasyaiva pratikṣepāt /
analyzed: evam tadā asiddha tvasya tadā siddha tvam virodhi niyamataḥ tasya eva pratikṣepāt
translated: In the same way, at that time, being unaccomplished is contradictory to being accomplished, because of the rule of exclusion of that itself.

original: na tu siddhatvamātraṃ /
analyzed: na tu siddha tva mātram
translated: But not mere being accomplished.

original: anyadapi tatra siddhatvābhāvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyat api tatra siddha tva abhāva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because the absence of being accomplished would follow there at another time as well.

original: nirviśeṣitayorvirodhe ca siddhatvayoścānyataradeva pākādau syānna tu samayabhede 'pyubhayam /
analyzed: niḥ viśeṣitayoḥ virodhe ca siddha tvayoḥ ca anyatarat eva pāka ādau syāt na tu samaya bhede pi ubhayam
translated: And when two things are mutually exclusive and one of them is already established, only one of them can be present in cooking, etc., not both even when there is a difference in time.

original: na ca tadā kṛtisādhyatve sati tadeṣṭasādhanatvajñānaṃ pravartakaṃ /
analyzed: na ca tadā kṛti sādhya tve sati tadā iṣṭa sādhana tva jñānam pravartakam
translated: And at that time, the knowledge that something is an instrument for attaining what is desired, given that it is to be accomplished by an action, is not the prompter.

original: ata eva vājapeyena yajetetyatra yāgasya karaṇāvasthāyāṃ siddhatvena na vājapeyasya sādhyatā ekadā tayorvirodhāditi karmanāmadheyatvaṃ /
analyzed: atas eva vājapeyena yajeta iti atra yāgasya karaṇa avasthāyām siddha tvena na vājapeyasya sādhya tā ekadā tayoḥ virodhāt iti karma nāmadheya tvam
translated: For this very reason, in the sentence One should sacrifice with the Vajapeya, since the sacrifice is already established in the state of being an instrument, the Vajapeya is not to be accomplished, because of the mutual exclusion of those two at one time. Therefore, it is a name of a rite.

original: na tu karaṇasya siddhatvena sādhyatvavirodhaḥ yogasvarūpe tayoḥ sattvāt /
analyzed: na tu karaṇasya siddha tvena sādhya tva virodhaḥ yoga svarūpe tayoḥ sattvāt
translated: But there is no contradiction between being an instrument and being to be accomplished, because those two exist in the form of a relation.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: atha viruddhayoravacchebhedamādaya ekatra pratītiḥ syāt /
analyzed: atha viruddhayoḥ avacchebhedama ādayaḥ ekatra pratītiḥ syāt
translated: Now, if two mutually exclusive things are cognized together by taking recourse to difference in specification,

original: na ca kṛtisādhyatveṣṭasādhanatvayoḥ samayabhedamādayaikatra pratītirasti /
analyzed: na ca kṛti sādhya tva iṣṭa sādhana tvayoḥ samaya bheda mādayā ekatra pratītiḥ asti
translated: and the knowledge that something is to be accomplished by an action and is an instrument for attaining what is desired does not exist together by taking recourse to difference in time,

original: tathā liṅgābhāvāditi cet / na /
analyzed: tathā liṅga abhāvāt iti ced na
translated: if it is argued that it is because there is no indication of that, it is not so.

original: sādhyatvasādhanatvayoravirodhasyoktatvāt /
analyzed: sādhyatva sādhanatvayoḥ avirodhasya ukta tvāt
translated: Because it has been said that there is no contradiction between being to be accomplished and being an instrument.

original: evaṃ siddhatvāsiddhatvayorbhāvābhāvarūpatve 'pi na virodhaḥ ekadharmigatvena mānasiddhatvāt /
analyzed: evam siddha tva asiddha tvayoḥ bhāva abhāva rūpa tve pi na virodhaḥ eka dharmi ga tvena māna siddha tvāt
translated: Similarly, even if being already established and not being already established are of the nature of existence and non-existence, there is no contradiction, because their existence as belonging to one substratum is established by valid cognition.

original: tasmāt saṃyogatadabhāvayoriva yena prakāreṇa yayorvirodhaḥ tena tayorekadharmigatatvaṃ na pratīyate /
analyzed: tasmāt saṃyoga tad abhāvayoḥ iva yena prakāreṇa yayoḥ virodhaḥ tena tayoḥ eka dharmi gata tvam na pratīyate
translated: Therefore, just as conjunction and its absence are not perceived to reside in the same thing, so are any two things that are mutually exclusive.

original: na tu rūpāntareṇāpīti /🔽api ca yadi sādhyatvasādhanatvayorvirodhastadā tavāpīṣṭasādhanatvena kāryasādhanatvena
analyzed: na tu rūpa antareṇa api iti  api ca yadi sādhyatva sādhanatvayoḥ virodhaḥ tadā tava api iṣṭa sādhana tvena kārya sādhana tvena
translated: But not by any other form.🔽Moreover, if there is a contradiction between being to be established and being a means of establishment, then even for you, an effect is not inferred to be an object of desire or to be a means of accomplishing an effect,

original: vā kāryatvaṃ nānumīyate hetusādhyayorvirodhena sāmānādhikaraṇyābhāvena vyāptyasiddheḥ
analyzed: vā kārya tvam na anumīyate hetu sādhyayoḥ virodhena sāmānādhikaraṇya abhāvena vyāpti asiddheḥ
translated: because of the contradiction between the reason and the conclusion, the absence of co-reference, and the non-establishment of pervasion,

original: pakṣe sādhyasādhanayoranyatarasattve bādhāsidhyoranyataraprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: pakṣe sādhya sādhanayoḥ anyatara sattve bādhā sidhyoḥ anyatara prasaṅgāt ca
translated: and because of the consequence of either contradiction or non-establishment when either the conclusion or the means of establishment is present in the subject.

original: na ca vācyamidānīṃ matkṛtisādhyatvaṃ sādhyamagre madiṣṭasādhanatvaṃ hetuḥ daivādyanadhīnatve🔽sati yadagre madiṣṭāsādhanaṃ tadidānīṃ matkṛtisādhyamiti vyāptiḥ tathāca samayabhedamādāya
analyzed: na ca vācyam idānīm mad kṛti sādhya tvam sādhyam agre mad iṣṭa sādhana tvam hetuḥ daiva ādi anadhīna tve  sati yat agre mad iṣṭa asādhanam tat idānīm mad kṛti sādhyam iti vyāptiḥ tathā ca samaya bhedam ādāya
translated: And it should not be said that the present object of my action is to be established, and the future object of my desire is the reason, because of the pervasion that whatever is not dependent on fate etc.🔽and is not an object of my desire in the future is an object of my action in the present. And thus, taking the difference in time,

original: sādhyatvasādhanatvayoravagama iti /
analyzed: sādhya tva sādhana tvayoḥ avagamaḥ iti
translated: it is said that the relation of being to be established and being a means of establishment is understood.

original: idānīmagrimapadārthayornānātvādanugatarūpābhāvena vyāpteragrahāt /
analyzed: idānīm agrima padārthayoḥ nānātvāt anugata rūpa abhāvena vyāpteḥ agrahāt
translated: This is because the pervasion is not grasped due to the absence of a uniform form in the present and future objects, which are different.

original: pākanyāyenānyatrāpi tattatsamayāntarbhāvena sādhyatvasādhanatvayorapratītiḥ /
analyzed: pāka nyāyena anyatra api tad tad samaya antarbhāvena sādhya tva sādhana tvayoḥ apratītiḥ
translated: By the analogy of cooking, in other cases also, the being an effect and the being a means are not apprehended by implication of the respective conventions.

original: pratītau vā mamāpīdānīṃ kṛtisādhyatve satyagre iṣṭasādhanamiti jñānaṃ pravartakamastu /
analyzed: pratītau vā mama api idānīm kṛti sādhya tve sati agre iṣṭa sādhanam iti jñānam pravartakam astu
translated: If apprehended, then let my knowledge that it is an instrument for attaining the desired object when it is to be accomplished by my activity be the prompter.

original: na ca pāke sādhyeṣṭakatvena kṛtisādhyatvamanumeyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca pāke sādhya iṣṭaka tvena kṛti sādhya tvam anumeyam
translated: And when cooking is the effect, the being to be accomplished by activity is not to be inferred by the nature of being desired.

original: asiddhāvasthāvato hi pākādiṣṭānutpatteḥ pākasya siddhatvamavagamya tatsādhyatvamiṣṭasyāvagantavyamasiddhatvañcāvagamya
analyzed: asiddha avasthāvataḥ hi pākāt iṣṭa anutpatteḥ pākasya siddha tvam avagamya tad sādhya tvam iṣṭasya avagantavyam asiddha tvam ca avagamya
translated: For, when the state of being unaccomplished is present, the desired effect like cooking does not arise. Having understood the accomplished nature of cooking, the being to be accomplished by that of the desired object must be understood. And having understood the unaccomplished nature,

original: kṛtisādhyatvamiti siddhatvāsiddhatvayorvirodho 'trāpi durvāraḥ /
analyzed: kṛti sādhya tvam iti siddha tva asiddha tvayoḥ virodhaḥ durvāraḥ
translated: the being to be accomplished by activity. Thus, the contradiction between the accomplished and unaccomplished natures is unavoidable here also.

original: api ca svaviśeṣaṇadhījanyakāryatājñānābhāvāt sukhe kathaṃ cikīrṣā /
analyzed: api ca sva viśeṣaṇa dhī janya kārya tā jñāna abhāvāt sukhe katham cikīrṣā
translated: Moreover, how can there be desire for pleasure due to the absence of the knowledge of causal relation produced by the cognition of its own qualifier?

original: na hi kṛtisādhyatājñānamātrāt / sā /
analyzed: na hi kṛti sādhya tā jñāna mātrāt sā
translated: It is not that desire arises merely from the knowledge of being to be accomplished by activity.

original: sañjātabādhasya viṣabhakṣaṇādau cikīrṣāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: sañjāta bādhasya viṣa bhakṣaṇa ādau cikīrṣā prasaṅgāt
translated: Because then there would be the undesirable consequence of desire for eating poison, etc., when the contradiction has arisen.

original: athopāyacikīrṣāyāṃ tatkāraṇaṃ icchākaraṇasukhatvajñāne kṛtisādhyatvaṃ yadā viṣayastadā sukhe cikīrṣā no cedicchāmātramiti dvayameva cikīrṣāheturiti
analyzed: atha upāya cikīrṣāyām tad kāraṇam icchā karaṇa sukha tva jñāne kṛti sādhya tvam yadā viṣayaḥ tadā sukhe cikīrṣā no ced icchā mātram iti dvayam eva cikīrṣā hetuḥ iti
translated: If it is said that the cause of desire for the means is the knowledge of the nature of pleasure as the cause of desire, when the being to be accomplished by activity is the object, then there is desire for pleasure in that case. If not, then it is mere desire. Thus, only the two are the cause of desire.

original: tarhīcchāhetujñāne yadā kṛtisādhyatvaṃ bhāsate tāda cikīrṣā no cedicchāmātramityeva sukhatadupāyacikīrṣākāraṇamastu lāghavāt /
analyzed: tarhi icchā hetu jñāne yadā kṛti sādhya tvam bhāsate cikīrṣā no ced icchā mātram iti eva sukha tad upāya cikīrṣā kāraṇam astu lāghavāt
translated: Then, when the fact of being accomplished by effort appears in the cognition of the cause of desire, there is volition, but if it does not, let there be mere desire as the cause of the desire for pleasure and its means, for simplicity's sake.

original: sukhatvajñānavadiṣṭasādhanatājñānasyāpīcchākāraṇatvāt /
analyzed: sukha tva jñāna vat iṣṭasādhanatā jñānasya api icchā kāraṇa tvāt
translated: Because the knowledge of being the means to the desired object is also the cause of desire, like the knowledge of being pleasure.

original: ata eva pāke iṣṭasādhanatājñāne kṛtisādhyatvaṃ viṣaya iti tatra cikīrṣā na tu vṛṣṭyādijñāne tadviṣayatvamitīcchāmātraṃ /
analyzed: atas eva pāke iṣṭa sādhanatā jñāne kṛti sādhya tvam viṣayaḥ iti tatra cikīrṣā na tu vṛṣṭi ādi jñāne tad viṣaya tvam iti icchā mātram
translated: For this very reason, in the knowledge of being the means to the desired object in cooking, the fact of being accomplished by effort is the object, and hence there is volition there, but not in the knowledge of rain etc., where that is not the object, so it is mere desire.

original: sukhacikīrṣāyāmicchākāraṇajñāne kṛtisādhyatāviṣayake cikīrṣājanakatvāvadhāraṇāt /
analyzed: sukha cikīrṣāyām icchā kāraṇa jñāne kṛti sādhya tā viṣayake cikīrṣā janaka tva avadhāraṇāt
translated: In the desire for pleasure, in the knowledge which is the cause of desire, which has the fact of being accomplished by effort as its object, there is the ascertainment of the fact of generating volition.

original: anyathā tatra cikīrṣānutpatteḥ /
analyzed: anyathā tatra cikīrṣā anutpatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, volition would not arise there.

original: vastutastūpāyacikīrṣā iṣṭasādhanatājñānasādhyā upāyecchātvāt vṛṣṭīcchāvat /
analyzed: vastutas tu upāya cikīrṣā iṣṭa sādhana tā jñāna sādhyā upāya icchā tvāt vṛṣṭi icchā vat
translated: In reality, the desire for the means is accomplished by the knowledge of being the means to the desired object, because it is the desire for the means, like the desire for rain.

original: na ca bhogacikīrṣāvattena vināpi syādityaprayoñjakatvaṃ /
analyzed: na ca bhoga cikīrṣā vat tena vinā api syāt iti aprayoñjaka tvam
translated: And it is not that it would occur even without that, like the desire for enjoyment, so it is not a non-contributory cause.

original: upāyecchāyāstadanvayavyatirekānuvidhānāt vṛṣṭeśca svato 'sundaratvenecchānutpatteḥ anugatopāyecchāyāṃ anugatasya prayojakatve sambhavati bādhakaṃ
analyzed: upāya icchāyāḥ tad anvaya vyatireka anuvidhānāt vṛṣṭeḥ ca svatas sundara tvena icchā anutpatteḥ anugata upāya icchāyām anugatasya prayojaka tve sambhavati bādhakam
translated: Because the desire for the means conforms to the positive and negative concomitance of that, and because the desire does not arise by itself due to the ugliness of rain, when there is a possibility of the contributory cause being the contributory cause in the general desire for the means, there is no contradiction.

original: vinā tyāgāyogācca /
analyzed: vinā tyāga ayogāt ca
translated: And because it is impossible without giving up.

original: na ca cikīrṣānyatve sati upāyecchātvaṃ icchātvaṃ vā /
analyzed: na ca cikīrṣā anya tve sati upāya icchā tvam icchā tvam vā
translated: And when there is a difference in what is intended, there is no desire for a means or desire.

original: tajjanyatve prayojakaṃ /
analyzed: tad janya tve prayojakam
translated: That which is produced by that is the cause.

original: gauravāt sukhecchāyāṃ tadabhāvācca /
analyzed: gauravāt sukha icchāyām tad abhāvāt ca
translated: Because of the burden and because of the absence of that in the desire for pleasure.

original: evañcopāyacikīrṣāyāmiṣṭasādhanatvajñāne dhruve 'tiprasaṅgavāraṇārthaṃ kṛtisādhyatvanirvāhārthañca kṛtisādhyatvamapi viṣayatayāvacchedakamastu
analyzed: evam ca upāya cikīrṣāyām iṣṭasādhanatva jñāne dhruve atiprasaṅga vāraṇa artham kṛti sādhyatva nirvāha artham ca kṛti sādhya tvam api viṣayatayā avacchedakam astu
translated: And thus, in order to avoid the fallacy in the case of the desire for a means, and in order to fulfill the condition of being accomplished by an action, let the condition of being accomplished by an action also be the qualifier by way of being the object.

original: na tu tadvihāya tanmātraṃ /
analyzed: na tu tat vihāya tanmātram
translated: But not that alone, without abandoning that.

original: kḷptakāraṇaṃ vinā kāryānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: kḷpta kāraṇam vinā kārya anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the effect is not possible without the established cause.

original: ata eva stanapānapravṛttāvapyupāyecchākāraṇatvena gṛhītasyeṣṭasādhanatvajñānasyāpi kalpanaṃ dṛṣṭānurodhitvāt kalpanāyāḥ /
analyzed: atas eva stana pāna pravṛttau api upāya icchā kāraṇa tvena gṛhītasya iṣṭasādhanatva jñānasya api kalpanam dṛṣṭa anurodhi tvāt kalpanāyāḥ
translated: For this very reason, in the case of engaging in breast-feeding, the knowledge of being the means to what is desired, which is taken as the cause of the desire for a means, is also imagined, because imagination is in accordance with what is seen.

original: nanu sādhanatvamicchāvirodhi tasya siddhadharmatvāt vṛṣṭyādau tatsādhyeṣṭajñānādiccheti cet na /
analyzed: nanu sādhana tvam icchā virodhi tasya siddha dharma tvāt vṛṣṭi ādau tad sādhya iṣṭa jñānāt icchā iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the state of being a means is contrary to desire because it is a property of what is established, and there is desire for the known desired object to be accomplished by rain etc., it is not so.

original: nirviśeṣitayoḥ siddhatvāsiddhatvayoravirodhenecchāsādhanatvayoravirodhāt /
analyzed: niḥ viśeṣitayoḥ siddha tva asiddha tvayoḥ avirodhena icchā sādhana tvayoḥ avirodhāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction between the state of being established and the state of not being established without any distinction, and between desire and the state of being a means.

original: tadāsiddhatvaṃ tadā siddhatvañca necchāsādhanatvayoḥ prayojakamiti tathā na jñāyata eva /
analyzed: tadā asiddha tvam tadā siddha tvañca na icchā sādhana tvayoḥ prayojakam iti tathā na jñāyate eva
translated: And the fact that it is not accomplished and the fact that it is accomplished are not the cause of the desire and the means of accomplishment. Thus it is not known in that way.

original: yattu tatsādhyeṣṭajñānād vṛṣṭyādāviccheti /
analyzed: yat tu tad sādhya iṣṭa jñānāt vṛṣṭi ādau icchā iti
translated: But it is said that from the knowledge of what is to be accomplished and desired, there is desire in rain etc.

original: tattucchaṃ /
analyzed: tat tuccham
translated: That is futile.

original: asiddhāvasthādvṛṣṭyāderiṣeṭānutpattestasyāvaśyaṃ siddhatvamavagantavyamicchānurodhitvāccāsiddhatvamiti /
analyzed: asiddha avasthāt vṛṣṭi ādeḥ iṣā iṣā anutpatteḥ tasya avaśyam siddhatvam avagantavyam icchā anurodhi tvāt ca asiddhatvam iti
translated: Because desire does not arise from rain etc. in the unaccomplished state, its accomplishment must be understood as necessary, and its non-accomplishment is due to the subordination of desire.

original: tatrāpi virodha eva /
analyzed: tatra api virodhaḥ eva
translated: Even there, there is contradiction itself.

original: vṛṣṭau satyāmiṣṭaṃ tayā vinā netyanvayavyatirekagrahasya vṛṣṭisiddhatvamādāya vṛṣṭinirūpiteṣṭasādhyakatvagrāhakatvāt /
analyzed: vṛṣṭau satyām iṣṭam tayā vinā na iti anvaya vyatireka grahasya vṛṣṭi siddha tvam ādāya vṛṣṭi nirūpita iṣṭa sādhyaka tva grāhaka tvāt
translated: When there is rain, the desired is by that. Without that, there is no. The apprehension of positive and negative concomitance, taking the accomplishment of rain, is the cause of grasping the object to be accomplished by the desired determined by rain.

original: kiñca cikīrṣājanyakṛtisādhyaṃ maṇḍalīkaraṇamityarthapratipādakaṃ 'maṇḍalīṃ kuryāditi vākyaṃ pramāṇaṃ syātviṣayābādhāt /
analyzed: kiñca cikīrṣā janya kṛti sādhyam maṇḍalī karaṇam iti artha pratipādakam maṇḍalīm kuryāt iti vākyam pramāṇam syāt viṣaya ābādhāt
translated: Moreover, the sentence One should make a circle would be a means of valid knowledge, indicating the meaning that circularity is to be accomplished by the action produced by desire, because there is no contradiction with the object.

original: etena navīnamatamapyapāstaṃ /
analyzed: etena navīna matam api apāstam
translated: By this, the new doctrine is also refuted.

original: parasya hi kṛtisādhyatvaudanakāmanāvattveṣṭasādhanatājñānānāṃ jñānaṃ tathā ātmana odanakāmānāvattevaṣṭasādhanatājñānasya jñānaṃ na pravṛttikāraṇaṃ
analyzed: parasya hi kṛti sādhya tva odana kāmanāvat tva iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānānām jñānam tathā ātmanaḥ odana kāma anāvattā ivaṣṭa sādhana tā jñānasya jñānam na pravṛtti kāraṇam
translated: For the other, the knowledge of the object to be accomplished by the action, the possession of desire for rice, and the knowledge of the means to the desired, and similarly, the knowledge of the knowledge of the means to the desired by oneself, who possesses desire for rice, is not the cause of activity.

original: kintu matkṛtisādhyatve sati madiṣṭasādhanatājñānameva lāghavāt /🔽yathā ca sādhyatvasādhanatvayoravirodhaḥ anāgatasya pākādeḥ kṛtisādhyatvajñānañca
analyzed: kintu mad kṛti sādhya tve sati mad iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānam eva lāghavāt  yathā ca sādhyatva sādhana tvayoḥ avirodhaḥ anāgatasya pāka ādeḥ kṛti sādhya tva jñānam ca
translated: But when the object is to be accomplished by one's own action, the knowledge of its being a means to one's own desired end is alone the prompter, on account of its being less extensive.🔽And just as there is no contradiction between the object to be accomplished and the means of accomplishment, and the knowledge that the future cooking, etc. is to be accomplished by one's own action,

original: tathopapāditameva kiñca parakṛtisādhyatvamajñātvāpi svakṛtisādhyeṣṭasādhanatājñānāt
analyzed: tathā upapāditam eva kiñca para kṛti sādhya tvam a jñātvā api sva kṛti sādhya iṣṭasādhana tā jñānāt
translated: it has been explained how. And even without knowing that it is to be accomplished by another's action, from the knowledge that one's own action is a means to the desired end,

original: svakalpitalipyādau yauvane kāmodrekāt sambhogādau pravṛtteśca tadeva pravartakam /🔽vastutastu siddhaviṣayakakṛtisādhyatājñānāt kathaṃ kṛtyā sādhayāmītīcchā siddhe icchāvirahāt asiddhasyājñānāt /
analyzed: sva kalpita lipi ādau yauvane kāma udrekāt sambhoga ādau pravṛtteḥ ca tat eva pravartakam  vastutas tu siddha viṣayaka kṛti sādhya tā jñānāt katham kṛtyā sādhayāmi iti icchā siddhe icchā virahāt asiddhasya ajñānāt
translated: and from the activity in one's own invented script, etc., and in enjoyment, etc. due to the abundance of passion in youth, that alone is the prompter.🔽But in reality, how can there be a desire to accomplish by action, from the knowledge that the accomplished object is to be accomplished by action? Because there is no desire for the accomplished, and because the unaccomplished is not known.

original: atha siddhaviṣayādeva kṛtisādhyatājñānāt asiddhaviṣayā kṛtisādhyatvenecchā jñāyate
analyzed: atha siddha viṣayāt eva kṛti sādhya tā jñānāt asiddha viṣayā kṛti sādhya tvena icchā jñāyate
translated: If it is argued that from the knowledge that the accomplished object is to be accomplished by action, the desire to accomplish the unaccomplished object by action is known,

original: icchāyā asiddhaviṣayatvasvabhāvatvādekaprakārakatvena jñānacikīrṣayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvo
analyzed: icchāyāḥ asiddha viṣaya tva svabhāva tvāt eka prakāraka tvena jñāna cikīrṣayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvaḥ
translated: because desire has the nature of having an unaccomplished object, and knowledge and desire have the relation of cause and effect by having the same form,

original: na tvekaviṣayatve sati gauravāt /
analyzed: na tu eka viṣaya tve sati gauravāt
translated: not by having the same object, because that would be too much.

original: icchāyā anāgataviṣayatvāt tasya cājñānāt tathātvadarśanāt sukhādīcchāyāmapyevamiti cet / na /
analyzed: icchāyāḥ anāgata viṣaya tvāt tasya ca ajñānāt tathātva darśanāt sukha ādi icchāyām api evam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that this is so because desire has the future for its object and that is not known, and because it is seen to be so in the case of the desire for pleasure, etc.,—we say no.

original: asiddhaviṣayecchānurodhenānāgatajñānopāyasya darśitatvāt /
analyzed: asiddha viṣaya icchā anurodhena anāgata jñāna upāyasya darśita tvāt
translated: Because the means of knowing the future has been shown in accordance with the desire for an object not yet in existence.

original: astu caivaṃ /
analyzed: astu ca evam
translated: Let it be so.

original: tathāpi kṛtisādhyatājñāne iṣṭasādhanatvameva vyāvartakamastu svaparakīyeṣṭasādhanatājñānaphalakāmanājñānāpekṣayā
analyzed: tathā api kṛti sādhya tā jñāne iṣṭasādhanatvam eva vyāvartakam astu sva parakīya iṣṭasādhanatā jñāna phala kāmanā jñāna apekṣayā
translated: Even so, in the knowledge of what is to be accomplished by one's own action, the fact of being the means to what is desired is itself the precluding factor, because it is simpler than the knowledge of the result of the desire to know what is the means to one's own and others' desired objects.

original: laghutvāt iṣṭasādhanatājñānajñānasya phalakāmanājñānasya ca hetutve mānābhāvācca /
analyzed: laghu tvāt iṣṭasādhanatā jñāna jñānasya phala kāmanā jñānasya ca hetu tve māna abhāvāt ca
translated: And because there is no evidence that the knowledge of the knowledge of the fact of being the means to what is desired and the knowledge of the desire for the result are causes.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: navyāstu svakṛtisādhyatājñānameva pravartakaṃ tena svakṛtyasādhye vṛṣṭyādau kārīryāñca kṛṣīvalasya na pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: navyāḥ tu sva kṛti sādhya tā jñānam eva pravartakam tena sva kṛtya sādhye vṛṣṭi ādau kārīryām ca kṛṣīvalasya na pravṛttiḥ
translated: The Navya-Naiyāyikas say that the knowledge of what is to be accomplished by one's own action is itself the prompter. By that, the cultivator is not engaged in rain, etc., which are to be accomplished by his own action, and in agriculture.

original: na ca sañjātabādhasya viṣabhakṣaṇe pravṛttiprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: na ca sañjāta bādhasya viṣa bhakṣaṇe pravṛtti prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And there is no possibility of engagement in eating poison for one who has had his doubt removed.

original: svakṛtisādhyatājñānaviṣaye iṣṭatvasya svarūpasataḥ pravṛttau sahakāritvāt /
analyzed: sva kṛti sādhya tā jñāna viṣaye iṣṭa tvasya svarūpa sataḥ pravṛttau sahakāri tvāt
translated: Because the fact of being desired, which is in the object of the knowledge of what is to be accomplished by one's own action, is a contributory cause in engagement.

original: na ca sañjātabādhasya viṣabhakṣaṇādāvicchāsti /
analyzed: na ca sañjāta bādhasya viṣa bhakṣaṇa ādau icchā asti
translated: And there is no desire in one who has had his doubt removed with regard to eating poison, etc.

original: iṣṭasādhanatvenājñānāt atītabhojane 'pyata eva na pravartate tṛpteḥ siddhatayā icchāviraheṇa
analyzed: iṣṭa sādhana tvena ajñānāt atīta bhojane eva na pravartate tṛpteḥ siddha tayā icchā viraheṇa
translated: Because of the absence of the knowledge of being the means to the desired end, one does not engage in past eating either, because of the absence of desire due to the established nature of satisfaction.

original: bhojane tadupādhikeṣṭatvābhāvādatītatṛptāvicchā nāstīti tatsādhane 'pīṣṭatvābhāvādeva na pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: bhojane tad upādhika iṣṭatva abhāvāt atīta tṛptau icchā na asti iti tad sādhane pi iṣṭatva abhāvāt eva na pravṛttiḥ
translated: Since there is no desire for past satisfaction in eating due to the absence of the desiredness based on that, there is no engagement even in the means to that, because of the absence of desiredness itself.

original: na caivaṃ pāke na pravarteta tasya svarasataiṣṭatvābhāvāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam pāke na pravarteta tasya svarasa tā eṣṭa tva abhāvāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that one does not engage in cooking in the same way, because of the absence of desiredness by its own nature.

original: iṣṭasādhanatvajñānena tasyāpīṣṭatvāt /
analyzed: iṣṭa sādhana tva jñānena tasya api iṣṭatvāt
translated: Because that is also desired due to the knowledge of being the means to the desired end.

original: hantaivaṃ prāthamikatvādiṣṭatvārthamavaśyāpekṣaṇīyatvācca kṛtisādhyatve satīṣṭasādhanatājñānameva cikīrṣākāraṇamastviti cet / na /🔽iṣṭāsādhanatvābhāve 'pi bhoge cikīrṣāsattvāt tasyāṃ svakṛtisādhanatvābhāve 'pi bhoge
analyzed: hanta evam prāthamika tvāt iṣṭa tva artham avaśya apekṣaṇīya tvāt ca kṛti sādhya tve sati iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānam eva cikīrṣā kāraṇam astu iti ced na  iṣṭa asādhana tva abhāve pi bhoge cikīrṣā sattvāt tasyām svakṛti sādhana tva abhāve pi bhoge
translated: If it is argued that thus, because of being primary and because of being necessarily required for the meaning of desiredness, the knowledge of being the means to the desired end when accomplished by one's own action is itself the cause of desire to do, it is not so.🔽Because there is desire to do in enjoyment even in the absence of being the means to the desired end.

original: cikīrṣāsattvāt tasyāṃ svakṛtisādhyatvajñāne satīṣṭatvameva kāraṇaṃ na tviṣṭasādhanatvaṃ vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: cikīrṣā sattvāt tasyām sva kṛti sādhya tva jñāne sati iṣṭa tvam eva kāraṇam na tu iṣṭa sādhana tvam vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is desire to do in enjoyment even in the absence of being the means to that desire accomplished by one's own action, in that, the cause is only the desiredness when there is the knowledge of being accomplished by one's own action, and not being the means to the desired end, because of deviation.

original: pākādau tadanvayavyatirekāvapīṣṭatvopakṣāṇau /
analyzed: pāka ādau tad anvaya vyatirekau api iṣṭa tva upakṣāṇau
translated: Even the invariable concomitance and non-concomitance in cooking etc. are subservient to desiredness.

original: evaṃ bhoge 'pi pravarteteti cet / na /
analyzed: evam bhoge pi pravarteta iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that in the same way, one engages in enjoyment also, it is not so.

original: iṣṭasādhanatāpakṣe 'pi muktirūpeṣṭasādhane sukhe pravarteteti tulyam /🔽sukhe cikīrṣā bhavatyeva kṛtistu na bhavati kṛteḥ /
analyzed: iṣṭasādhanatā pakṣe pi mukti rūpa iṣṭa sādhane sukhe pravarteta iti tulyam  sukhe cikīrṣā bhavati eva kṛtiḥ tu na bhavati kṛteḥ
translated: Even if the view is that the injunction enjoins the means to what is desired, it is the same, as one engages in the pleasure which is the desired result in the form of liberation.

original: siddhavṛttyasiddhakriyāviṣayatvaniyamāditi cettulyam /🔽tasmāt svakṛtisādhyatvaṃ vidhiriṣṭatvaṃ sahakārīti /🔽maivaṃ /
analyzed: siddha vṛtti asiddha kriyā viṣaya tva niyamāt iti ced tulyam  tasmāt sva kṛti sādhya tvam vidhiḥ iṣṭa tvam sahakāri iti  mā evam
translated: And there is certainly a desire for pleasure, but there is no activity, because activity is restricted to the unaccomplished effect.

original: iṣṭasādhanatājñānasyopāyecchāyāṃ hetutvāvadhāraṇāttasyāstajjanyatvaniyamādicchāyāḥ svaviṣayecchānutpādakatvaniyamācca /
analyzed: iṣṭasādhanatā jñānasya upāya icchāyām hetutva avadhāraṇāt tasyāḥ tad janya tva niyamāt icchāyāḥ sva viṣaya icchā anutpādaka tva niyamāt ca
translated: If it is argued that it is the same, because the knowledge of the means to what is desired is ascertained to be the cause in the desire for that, and because the desire is restricted to being produced from that, and because the desire is restricted to not producing the desire for its own object,

original: nanu siddhaudanaḥ kutaḥ pāke na pravartate /
analyzed: nanu siddhaudanaḥ kutas pāke na pravartate
translated: then why does cooked rice not engage in cooking?

original: odanamātrasya siddhatveneṣṭatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: odana mātrasya siddha tvena iṣṭa tva abhāvāt
translated: Because the mere cooked rice is not desired due to its being accomplished.

original: ata evātītabhojanādau na pravartate atītatṛṣṇādāvicchāvirahāt /
analyzed: atas eva atīta bhojana ādau na pravartate atīta tṛṣṇā ādau icchā virahāt
translated: For the same reason, it does not engage in past food, etc., because of the absence of desire in past craving, etc.

original: nanu sāmudrakavikhyāte bhāviyauvanarojye bhogasādhane svakṛtisādhyatve satīṣṭasādhanatvajñānāt kuto na pravartate /
analyzed: nanu sāmudraka vikhyāte bhāvi yauvana rojye bhoga sādhane sva kṛti sādhya tve sati iṣṭa sādhana tva jñānāt kutas na pravartate
translated: But why does one not engage in the enjoyment of the future youth and kingdom, which is known to be accomplished by the sea-born, when there is the knowledge of being the means to what is desired, being accomplished by one's own activity?

original: bhāvirājyasyāsiddhatvāt pravatteḥ siddhaviṣayatvaniyamāt rājyopāyāparicayācca /
analyzed: bhāvi rājyasya asiddha tvāt pravatteḥ siddha viṣaya tva niyamāt rājya upāya aparicayāt ca
translated: Because the future kingdom is unaccomplished, because engagement is restricted to having an accomplished object, and because of lack of knowledge of the means to the kingdom.

original: tatparicaye ca pravartata eva devatārādhanādāviti cet / na /
analyzed: tad paricaye ca pravartate eva devatā ārādhana ādau iti ced na
translated: If it be said that he does engage in the knowledge of that (means) in the case of the worship of the deity etc., (we say) no.

original: siddhe cikīrṣāviraheṇa yāgādāvapyapravṛttiprasaṅgāt devatārādhanāderapyasiddhatve na tatrāpyapravṛttiprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: siddhe cikīrṣā viraheṇa yāga ādau api apravṛtti prasaṅgāt devatā ārādhana ādeḥ api asiddha tve na tatra api apravṛtti prasaṅgāt ca
translated: For, in the absence of the desire to accomplish what is already accomplished, there would be the contingence of non-engagement even in the case of sacrifice etc., and also because of the non-accomplishment of the worship of the deity etc., there would be the contingence of non-engagement even in that (case).

original: kiñca rājyopayāparicaye tatra mā pravarttiṣṭa svakṛtisādhyeṣṭasādhanatvena jñāne rājye pravṛttiprasaṅge kimāyātaṃ /
analyzed: kiñca rājya upayā paricaye tatra mā pravarttiṣṭa sva kṛti sādhya iṣṭa sādhana tvena jñāne rājye pravṛtti prasaṅge kim āyātam
translated: Moreover, if there is non-engagement in the case of the knowledge of the means to the kingdom, what is the consequence in the case of the knowledge of the means to the kingdom as being accomplished by one's own action, in the contingence of engagement in the kingdom?

original: na hi kṛtisādhyeṣṭasādhanatvena jñāne 'pi tadupāyajñānaṃ tatra pravartakaṃ gauravāt
analyzed: na hi kṛti sādhya iṣṭa sādhana tvena jñāne tad upāya jñānam tatra pravartakam gauravāt
translated: For, even in the case of the knowledge of the means to the kingdom as being accomplished by one's own action, the knowledge of the means to that (knowledge) is not the instigator in that (case), because of the great difficulty (of such a theory)

original: bhinnaviṣayatvācceti cet maivaṃ yauvane hi yāvat pravartata eva rājye bālye tu rājyopāyamakṛtvā
analyzed: bhinna viṣaya tvāt ca iti ced mā evam yauvane hi yāvat pravartate eva rājye bālye tu rājya upāyam a kṛtvā
translated: and because of the difference of the objects (of the two knowledges). If it be said that it should not be so, (we say) no. For, as long as one is engaged in youth, one does engage in the kingdom, but in childhood, without accomplishing the means to the kingdom,

original: matkṛtyedānīṃ rājyaṃ na siddhyatīti svakṛtyasādhyatājñānādeva na pravartate yathā
analyzed: mad kṛtyā idānīm rājyam na siddhyati iti sva kṛtya sādhya tā jñānāt eva na pravartate yathā
translated: one does not engage (in the means to the kingdom) by the mere knowledge that one's own action is to be accomplished, thinking Now, the kingdom will not be accomplished by me.

original: taṇḍulaṃ vinā pāke svakṛtyasādhyatājñānāt rājyopāye tu svakṛtisādhyeṣṭasādhanatvena
analyzed: taṇḍulam vinā pāke sva kṛtya sādhya tā jñānāt rājya upāye tu sva kṛti sādhya iṣṭa sādhana tvena
translated: As (for example), by the knowledge that the cooking is to be accomplished by one's own action without rice, but when the means to the kingdom is known as being accomplished by one's own action,

original: jñāte devatārādhanādau pravartata eva /
analyzed: jñāte devatā ārādhana ādau pravartate eva
translated: one does engage in the worship of the deity etc. as being the means to the desired object accomplished by one's own action.

original: ata eva vrīhyavaghātamakṛtvā puroḍāśastamakṛtvā yāgastamakṛtvāpavūrvaṃ sādhayituṃ
analyzed: atas eva vrīhi avaghātam a kṛtvā puroḍāśaḥ tam a kṛtvā yāgaḥ tam a kṛtvā apavūrvam sādhayitum
translated: Therefore, without threshing the rice, without making the cake, without performing the sacrifice, it is not possible to accomplish the unseen result.

original: na śakyata iti kramaśo 'vaghātādau pravartate na yugapat siddhavṛttyasiddhakriyāviṣayāviṣayasvabhāvatvāt
analyzed: na śakyate iti kramaśas vaghāta ādau pravartate na yugapad siddha vṛtti asiddha kriyā viṣaya aviṣaya svabhāva tvāt
translated: Hence, one engages in threshing etc. in sequence, not simultaneously, because engagement has the nature of not having as its object what has already been accomplished and what has not yet been done.

original: pravṛtteḥ yāgānantarañca nāpūrve pravartate /
analyzed: pravṛtteḥ yāga anantaram ca na apūrve pravartate
translated: And after the sacrifice, it does not operate on the unseen result.

original: kṛtyantaraṃ vinaiva yāgakṛtitastatsambhavāt /🔽iṣṭasādhane ceṣṭotpattināntarīyakaduḥkhājanakatvaṃ viśeṣaṇaṃ na tu tajjñānābhāvaḥ
analyzed: kṛti antaram vinā eva yāga kṛtitaḥ tad sambhavāt  iṣṭa sādhane ceṣṭā utpatti nāntarīyaka duḥkha ajanaka tvam viśeṣaṇam na tu tad jñāna abhāvaḥ
translated: Because that is possible just from the performance of the sacrifice, without any other action.🔽And in the means of accomplishing the desired object, the qualification is not the absence of the knowledge of that which is invariably concomitant with the arising of the desired object,

original: kāraṇaṃ kintu tadeva viṣayatayā kāraṇatāvacchedakaṃ lāghavāt tena madhuviṣasampṛktānnabhojane na pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: kāraṇam kintu tat eva viṣayatayā kāraṇa tā avacchedakam lāghavāt tena madhu viṣa sampṛkta anna bhojane na pravṛttiḥ
translated: but that itself is the defining characteristic of the cause by way of being the object, out of simplicity. Therefore, there is no engagement in eating food mixed with honey and poison.

original: pareṇāpi pravṛttipūrvaṃ liṅgaviśeṣaṇatvena anyathā vā tajjñānaviniyogasvīkārāt /
analyzed: pareṇa api pravṛtti pūrvam liṅga viśeṣaṇa tvena anyathā vā tad jñāna viniyoga svīkārāt
translated: Because even the opponent accepts the knowledge of that as being employed as a qualifier of the indicative, or otherwise, prior to engagement.

original: evañcālpāyāsasādhyādiṣṭotpattisambhave bahvāyāsasādhye na pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: evam ca alpa āyāsa sādhyāt iṣṭa utpatti sambhave bahu āyāsa sādhye na pravṛttiḥ
translated: And in this way, when the desired object can be produced with little effort, there is no engagement in what is accomplished with great effort.

original: ata eva śrutasvargaphalakatve 'pi bahuvittavyayāsasādhye jyotiṣṭomādau phalabhūmā
analyzed: atas eva śruta svarga phalaka tve bahu vitta vyayāsa sādhye jyotiṣṭoma ādau phala bhūmā
translated: For this very reason, even when the result is known to be heaven, there is no engagement in the Jyotiṣṭoma etc. which is accomplished with much wealth and effort, because the result is not directly perceived.

original: kalpane anyathālpāyāsāsadhyādeva svargasiddhisambhave tatrāpravṛttau ananuṣṭhānalakṣaṇamaprāmāṇyaṃ tadvidheḥ syāt /
analyzed: kalpane anyathā alpa āyāsa āsadhyāt eva svarga siddhi sambhave tatra apravṛttau ananuṣṭhāna lakṣaṇam aprāmāṇyam tad vidheḥ syāt
translated: If it were possible to attain heaven by some other means requiring less effort, then in the absence of activity towards that, the injunction would be invalid in the sense of not being performed.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: balavadaniṣṭānanubandhitvañca na viśeṣaṇaṃ bahuvittavyayāyāsasādhyabahutaraduḥkhasyāpyabalavattvaṃ kvacidalpaduḥkhasyāpi balavattvaṃ /
analyzed: balavat aniṣṭa ananubandhi tvañca na viśeṣaṇam bahu vitta vyaya āyāsa sādhya bahutara duḥkhasya api abalavat tvam kvacid alpa duḥkhasya api balavat tvam
translated: And the qualification of not being conducive to a strong undesirable result is not a distinguishing feature, because sometimes even a very large amount of suffering that is accomplished with much wealth, effort and exertion is not strong, and sometimes even a small amount of suffering is strong.

original: tasyāpyuktātiriktasyānanugamāt /
analyzed: tasya api ukta atiriktasya ananugamāt
translated: Because that also, which is different from what has been stated, is not a universal characteristic.

original: āstikasya niṣiddhatvena jñāte 'pi pravṛttiḥ rāgadveṣayorutkaṭatvena narakasādhanatvajñānatirodhānāt /
analyzed: āstikasya niṣiddha tvena jñāte pi pravṛttiḥ rāga dveṣayoḥ utkaṭa tvena naraka sādhana tva jñāna tirodhānāt
translated: Even though known to be prohibited by an atheist, there is activity due to the intensity of passion and hatred, obscuring the knowledge of the means of going to hell.

original: nanu na kalañjaṃ bhakṣayedityatra vidhyarthaniṣedhānupapattiḥ tadbhakṣaṇasya tṛptirūpeṣṭasādhanatvāt /
analyzed: nanu na kalañjam bhakṣayet iti atra vidhi artha niṣedha anupapattiḥ tad bhakṣaṇasya tṛpti rūpa iṣṭa sādhanatvāt
translated: But in the case of one should not eat kalajna, the meaning of the injunction is not possible as an object of prohibition, because eating that is a means to the desired result in the form of satisfaction.

original: na cāsurāvidyādivat paryudāsalakṣaṇayā virodhyaniṣṭasādhanatvabodhanaṃ naño 'samastatvāt
analyzed: na ca asura avidyā ādi vat paryudāsa lakṣaṇayā virodhi aniṣṭa sādhanatva bodhanam nañaḥ samasta tvāt
translated: And unlike the knowledge of demons etc., the negative particle does not indicate the means to a contradictory undesirable result by the nature of exclusion, because it is not compounded.

original: kriyāsaṅgatatvena pratiṣadhavācakatvavyutpatteśceti cet na viśeṣyavati viśiṣṭaniṣedhasya
analyzed: kriyā saṅgata tvena pratiṣadha vācaka tva vyutpatteḥ ca iti ced na viśeṣyavati viśiṣṭa niṣedhasya
translated: And because it is derived as expressing prohibition by being connected with an action. If it is argued that the prohibition of the qualified is not possible when the qualifier exists,

original: saviśeṣaṇe hīti nyāyena viśeṣaṇaniṣedhaparyavamāyitayā kalañjabhakṣaṇamiṣṭotpattināntarīyakaduḥkhātiriktaduḥkhasādhanamiti
analyzed: sa viśeṣaṇe hi iti nyāyena viśeṣaṇa niṣedha paryavamāyi tayā kalañja bhakṣaṇam iṣṭa utpatti nāntarīyaka duḥkha atirikta duḥkha sādhanam iti
translated: Because of the rule that when there is a qualified object, the qualified object is negated, the eating of kalajna is the means of suffering other than that which is concomitant with the production of the desired object.

original: na kalañjaṃ bhakṣayedityanena bodhanāt /
analyzed: na kalañjam bhakṣayet iti anena bodhanāt
translated: Therefore, by the statement one should not eat kalajna, it is understood.

original: iṣṭasādhanatāvācakasya siddheḥ sāmānyato niṣedhānupapatterbalavadaniṣṭānanubandhīṣṭasādhanatvaviśeṣaniṣedhatātparyaṃ tathācāśakyaviśeṣaniṣedhaparatvaṃ
analyzed: iṣṭasādhanatā vācakasya siddheḥ sāmānyatas niṣedha anupapatteḥ balavat aniṣṭa ananubandhi iṣṭa sādhanatva viśeṣa niṣedha tātparyam tathā ca aśakya viśeṣa niṣedha paratvam
translated: Because it is not possible to generally prohibit what expresses the means to the desired object, it is intended to specifically prohibit what is not excessively connected with the undesirable. Thus, the negative particle has the meaning of prohibiting what is impossible to specify.🔽Some say this.

original: naña iti kaścit /🔽tanna /
analyzed: nañaḥ iti kaścid  tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: yathā hyayogyatayā sacchidraṃ vihāya ghaṭatvena taditarānvayo na tu chidretaratvena
analyzed: yathā hi ayogyatayā sa chidram vihāya ghaṭa tvena tad itara anvayaḥ na tu chidra itaratvena
translated: Just as, due to unsuitability, the connection with pot-ness is through excluding the one with a hole, but not through the other than the hole,

original: yugapadvṛttidvayavirodhāt tathātrāpi balavadaniṣṭānanubandhitvenānupasthitau kathaṃ tanniṣedhaḥ /
analyzed: yugapad vṛtti dvaya virodhāt tathā atra api balavat aniṣṭa ananubandhi tvena anupasthitau katham tad niṣedhaḥ
translated: because of the contradiction of two simultaneous occurrences, so too here, when not presented as not excessively connected with the undesirable, how can there be a prohibition of that?

original: śyenenābhicaran yajetetyatra kathaṃ vidhipravṛttiḥ hiṃsāyā balavadaniṣṭānubandhitvāt
analyzed: śyenena abhicaran yajeta iti atra katham vidhi pravṛttiḥ hiṃsāyāḥ balavat aniṣṭa anubandhi tvāt
translated: How does the injunction operate in one should sacrifice with the hawk for the purpose of sorcery? Because violence is excessively connected with the undesirable.

original: iti cet tatra kṛtisādhyatve satīṣṭasādhantvameva yogyatayānveti na tu balavadaniṣṭānanubandhitvamapi ayogyatvāt /
analyzed: iti ced tatra kṛti sādhya tve sati iṣṭa sādhantvam eva yogyatayā anveti na tu balavat aniṣṭa ananubandhi tvam api ayogya tvāt
translated: If it be said that the cognition of the means of valid knowledge is not a means of valid knowledge, because it is a cognition, like the cognition of the means of valid knowledge of sound.🔽If it be said that the cognition of the means of valid knowledge is not a means of valid knowledge, because it is a cognition, like the cognition of the means of valid knowledge of sound, that is not so.

original: nindārthavādena prāyaścittopadeśena ca hiṃsāyā balavadaniṣṭānubandhitvāvagamāt /
analyzed: nindā artha vādena prāyaścitta upadeśena ca hiṃsāyāḥ balavat aniṣṭa anubandhi tva avagamāt
translated: If it be said that this is not so, because the injunction of the Śyena sacrifice is not a means of knowing the means of accomplishing the desired end, we reply: in that case, only the fact of being the means of accomplishing the desired end, when preceded by the fact of being accomplished by human effort, is connected by fitness, not also the fact of not being followed by a powerful undesirable result, because of unfitness.🔽Because the fact of violence being followed by a powerful undesirable result is understood from the statement of censure and from the teaching of expiation.

original: ata eva vihite 'piśyene vigānānna tātvikapravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: atas eva vihite piśyene vigānāt na tātvika pravṛttiḥ
translated: For this very reason, even in the enjoined Śyena sacrifice, there is no real engagement, due to doubt.

original: rāgadveṣayorutkaṭatvenāniṣṭānubandhyaṃśasya tiraskārāt /
analyzed: rāga dveṣayoḥ utkaṭa tvena aniṣṭa anubandhi aṃśasya tiraskārāt
translated: Because the part of being followed by an undesirable result is set aside by the intensity of passion and hatred.

original: kasyacit pravṛttirityeke /
analyzed: kasyacid pravṛttiḥ iti eke
translated: Some say that there is engagement by some.

original: anye tvabhicārasya vairibadhaphalakatvena śrutatvāt badhasādhanatvena śyeno vidhīyate na tu badhasādhyanarakasādhanatvena narakasya phalatvenāśruteḥ
analyzed: anye tu abhicārasya vairi badha phalaka tvena śruta tvāt badha sādhana tvena śyenaḥ vidhīyate na tu badha sādhya naraka sādhana tvena narakasya phala tvena aśruteḥ
translated: But others say that since the Śyena is heard as having the fruit of killing the enemy in the case of witchcraft, it is enjoined as a means of killing, not as a means of accomplishing hell, which is to be accomplished by killing, because hell is not heard as a fruit.

original: na ca janakajanakasya janakatvaniyamaḥ kumbhakārapitṛparamparāyāḥ kumbhajanakatvāpatteḥ vidhinaiva śyenasya balavadaniṣṭānanubandhitvabodhanācca
analyzed: na ca janaka janakasya janaka tva niyamaḥ kumbhakāra pitṛ paramparāyāḥ kumbha janaka tva āpatteḥ vidhinā eva śyenasya balavat aniṣṭa ananubandhi tva bodhanāt ca
translated: And the generator of a generator is not necessarily a generator, because the series of potters' fathers would be the generator of the pot. And because the Śyena is taught by the injunction itself as not being followed by a powerful undesirable result.

original: na ca śyenasya balavadaniṣṭānanubandhitvabodhanācca /
analyzed: na ca śyenasya balavat aniṣṭa ananubandhi tva bodhanāt ca
translated: And because the Śyena is taught as not being followed by a powerful undesirable result.

original: na ca śyenasya narakāhetutve apekṣitavairibadhahetutve vā avigānena pravṛttiḥ syāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca śyenasya naraka ahetu tve apekṣita vairi badha hetu tve vā avigānena pravṛttiḥ syāt iti vācyam
translated: Nor can it be said that one would engage in the performance of the Śyena sacrifice without discrimination, if the killing of an enemy were not a necessary condition for going to hell.

original: śyenādbadho badhāccāvaśyaṃ naraka iti pratisandhānena vigānāt /
analyzed: śyenāt badhaḥ badhāt ca avaśyam narakaḥ iti pratisandhānena vigānāt
translated: For one engages in it with the discrimination that killing through the Śyena sacrifice necessarily leads to hell.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p / 🔽nanu śyenomaraṇaphalakavyāpāratvena hiṃsā sā ca narakajaniketi cet na na hi sākṣāt
analyzed: bibl ind  nanu śyenaḥ maraṇa phalaka vyāpāra tvena hiṃsā sā ca naraka janikā iti ced na na hi sākṣāt
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: paramparāsādhāraṇamaraṇaphalakavyāpāro hiṃsā kūpādau vinaṣṭe gavi tatkartturgobadhakarttutvāpatteḥ
analyzed: paramparā sādhāraṇa maraṇa phalaka vyāpāraḥ hiṃsā kūpa ādau vinaṣṭe gavi tad karttuḥ go badha karttu tva āpatteḥ
translated: If it be said that violence is that operation which has death as its fruit, and that that leads to hell, we say no. For violence is not that operation which has death as its fruit, either directly or indirectly. For if it were so, then when a cow perishes in a pit, the owner of the cow would be guilty of the killing of the cow.

original: badhyasyāpi hanturmṛtyūtpādanadvāreṇātmahantṛtvaprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: badhyasya api hantuḥ mṛtyu utpādana dvāreṇa ātma hantṛ tva prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And also because it would follow that the victim also would be the killer of the killer, by way of producing his death.

original: na hi anutpāditamanyuḥ kaścit kamapi vyāpādayati kintvanuniṣpādimaraṇaphalakovyāpāro hiṃsā yadanantaraṃ maraṇaṃ bhavatyeva /
analyzed: na hi anutpādita manyuḥ kaścid kam api vyāpādayati kintu anuniṣpādi maraṇa phalakaḥ vyāpāraḥ hiṃsā yat anantaram maraṇam bhavati eva
translated: For no one kills another without producing anger in him. But violence is that operation which has death as its fruit, which is produced subsequently, and after which death certainly happens.

original: na ca śyenastathā kintu khaṅgahananādikameva /
analyzed: na ca śyenaḥ tathā kintu khaṅga hanana ādikam eva
translated: But the Śyena sacrifice is not so. Rather, it is the killing with a sword, etc.

original: atha maraṇānuddeśena kṣiptanārācāddhatabrāhyaṇe ca hiṃsā na syāt /
analyzed: atha maraṇa anuddeśena kṣipta nārācāt hata brāhyaṇe ca hiṃsā na syāt
translated: If it be said that there would be no violence in the case of a Brāhmaṇa killed by an arrow shot without the intention of killing,

original: kiñca hinastidhātvarthe avacchedakaṃ phalamavyavahitameva maraṇaṃ avyavahitaphalakasyaiva
analyzed: kiñca hinasti dhātvarthe avacchedakam phalam avyavahitam eva maraṇam avyavahita phalakasya eva
translated: Moreover, in the meaning of the root 'to kill', the result is the immediate death itself, which is the immediate result,

original: vyāpārasya dhātuvācyatvāt anyathā paramparayā vilkiptiphalakānnakāmeṣṭataṇḍulakrayādāvapi pacatītiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: vyāpārasya dhātu vācya tvāt anyathā paramparayā pacati iti prasaṅgāt
translated: because only the operation having an immediate result is denoted by the root. Otherwise, there would be the absurd consequence of using 'cooks' even in the case of buying rice for food, which has its result indirectly.

original: evaṃ khaṅgābhighātānantaraṃ yatra vilambena maraṇaṃ vraṇapākaparamparayā vā anne🔽viṣaprayogeṇa vā tatra hantṛtvaṃ prāyaścittādi ca na syāt iti cet na prāyaścittatulyatārthaṃ
analyzed: evam khaṅga abhighāta anantaram yatra vilambena maraṇam vraṇa pāka paramparayā vā anne  viṣa prayogeṇa vā tatra hantṛ tvam prāyaścitta ādi ca na syāt iti ced na prāyaścitta tulya tā artham
translated: Similarly, if death occurs with a delay after a sword blow, or through a series of wound infections, or by food

original: hi tatra hantṛvyadeśo gauṇaḥ vinigamakañca lāghavameva /
analyzed: hi tatra hantṛ vyadeśaḥ gauṇaḥ vinigamakam ca lāghavam eva
translated: poisoning, there would be no killing and no penance etc. in that case. This is not so, because the killing of the killer in that case is figurative, for the purpose of equality with penance, and the determining factor is only simplicity.

original: vastutastu maraṇoddeśena kṛto 'dṛṣṭādvārākastadanukūla vyāpāro hiṃsā /
analyzed: vastutas tu maraṇa uddeśena kṛtaḥ vyāpāraḥ hiṃsā
translated: In reality, however, violence is the operation favorable to that, indirectly through unseen [forces], done with the intention of death.

original: kūpādau vinaṣṭe gavi tatkarturgobadhakartutvāpatteḥ badhyasyāpi hanturmutyūtpādanadvāreṇātmahantṛtvaprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: kūpa ādau vinaṣṭe gavi tad kartuḥ go badha kartu tva āpatteḥ badhyasya api hantuḥ muti ūtpādana dvāreṇa ātma hantṛ tva prasaṅgāt ca
translated: Because if a well etc. is destroyed, the owner would be guilty of killing the cow, and because there would be the absurd consequence of the killed person also being the killer of himself through the medium of producing the killer's death.

original: na hi anutpāditamanyuḥ kaścit kamapi vyāpādayati kintvanuniṣpādimaraṇaphalakovyāparo hiṃsā yadanantaraṃ maraṇaṃ bhavatyeva /
analyzed: na hi anutpādita manyuḥ kaścid kam api vyāpādayati kintu anuniṣpādi maraṇa phalakaḥ vyāparaḥ hiṃsā yat anantaram maraṇam bhavati eva
translated: For no one kills anyone without arousing anger. Rather, violence is that action which immediately produces the fruit of death.

original: na ca śyenastathā kintu khaṅgahananādikameva /🔽atha maraṇānukūlyavyāpāro maraṇoddaśenānuṣṭhīyamāno hiṃsā śyenaśca tathā kūpādau🔽ca na maraṇoddeśenānuṣṭhīyamānatvamiti cet na evaṃ sati gauravāt maraṇānuddeśena
analyzed: na ca śyenaḥ tathā kintu khaṅga hanana ādikam eva  atha maraṇa ānukūlya vyāpāraḥ maraṇa uddaśena anuṣṭhīyamānaḥ hiṃsā śyenaḥ ca tathā kūpa ādau  ca na maraṇa uddeśena anuṣṭhīyamāna tvam iti ced na evam sati gauravāt maraṇa anuddeśena
translated: And the hawk does not do so, but rather the striking with a sword and so on.

original: kṣiptanārācāddhatabrāhmaṇe ca hiṃsā na syāt /
analyzed: kṣipta nārācāt hata brāhmaṇe ca hiṃsā na syāt
translated: If it is argued that violence is the action that is conducive to death, performed with the intention of causing death, and the hawk and the pit are not performed with the intention of causing death, that is not so, because in that case it would be too broad, as there would be no violence in the Brahmin killed by an arrow shot without the intention of causing death.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p / 🔽kiñca hinastidhātvarthe avacchedakaṃ phalamavyavahitameva maraṇaṃ avyavahitaphalakasyaiva
analyzed: bibl ind  kiñca hinasti dhātvarthe avacchedakam phalam avyavahitam eva maraṇam avyavahita phalakasya eva
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV, p. 10.

original: vyāpārasya dhātuvācyatvāt anyathā paramparayā viklittiphalakānnakāmeṣṭataṇḍulakrayādāvapi pacatītiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: vyāpārasya dhātu vācya tvāt anyathā paramparayā viklitti phalaka anna kāma iṣṭa taṇḍula kraya ādau api pacati iti prasaṅgāt
translated: Moreover, in the meaning of the root 'hinast' (to kill), the result which is the qualifier is only the immediate death, because only an action with an immediate result is denoted by the root, otherwise there would be the absurd consequence of saying 'he cooks' even in the buying of rice for food that has the result of nourishment indirectly.

original: evaṃ khaṅgābhighātānantaraṃ yatra vilambena maraṇaṃ vraṇapākaparamparayā vā anne
analyzed: evam khaṅga abhighāta anantaram yatra vilambena maraṇam vraṇa pāka paramparayā vā anne
translated: In the same way, where death occurs with a delay after the striking with a sword, or through a series of wound suppurations, in food or drink mixed with poison, or in the case of a Brahmin killed by an arrow shot without the intention of causing death,

original: viṣaprayogeṇa vā tatra hantṛtvaṃ prāyaścittādi ca na syāt iti cet prāyaścittatulyatārthaṃ
analyzed: viṣa prayogeṇa vā tatra hantṛ tvam prāyaścitta ādi ca na syāt iti ced prāyaścitta tulya tā artham
translated: If it is argued that there would be no killing or expiation etc. there by the use of poison, [we say] for the purpose of equality with expiation,

original: hi tatra hantṛvyapadeśo gauṇaḥ vinigamakañca lāghavameva /
analyzed: hi tatra hantṛ vyapadeśaḥ gauṇaḥ vinigamakam ca lāghavam eva
translated: If it is argued that in that case, there would be no killing and no expiation etc. for the killer by the use of poison, the designation of the killer there is figurative for the purpose of equality with expiation.🔽And the determining factor is only simplicity.

original: vastutastu maraṇoddeśena kṛto 'dṛṣṭādvārakastadanukūlyavyāpāro hiṃsā śyenaścādṛṣṭadvārakastanukūlyavyāpāro hiṃsā śyenaścādṛṣṭadvārā maraṇasādhanamato
analyzed: vastutas tu maraṇa uddeśena kṛtaḥ dṛṣṭa advārakaḥ tad anukūlya vyāpāraḥ hiṃsā śyenaḥ ca adṛṣṭa dvārakaḥ tanukūlya vyāpāraḥ hiṃsā śyenaḥ ca adṛṣṭa dvārā maraṇa sādhanam atas
translated: But in reality, the violence is the activity favorable to that through an unseen means, done with the intention of death. And the hawk is the means of death through an unseen means.

original: na hiṃsā /
analyzed: na hiṃsā
translated: Therefore it is not violence.

original: yadi cādṛṣṭadvārāpi maraṇasādhanaṃ hiṃsā syāt tadā saptamītailābhyaṅgasyādṛṣṭadvārā iṣṭabhāryavināśahetutvādabhyaṅgakartuhiṃsakatvāpattiḥ /
analyzed: yadi ca adṛṣṭa dvārā api maraṇa sādhanam hiṃsā syāt tadā saptamī taila abhyaṅgasya adṛṣṭa dvārā iṣṭa bhārya vināśa hetu tvāt abhyaṅga kartu hiṃsaka tva āpattiḥ
translated: And if violence were the means of death even through an unseen means, then the application of oil on the seventh day would be the cause of the destruction of the desired wife through an unseen means, and the one who applies the oil would be a killer.

original: ata eva kūpādau gomaraṇe 'pi na badhakartutvaṃ tatkartuḥ galalagnānnamaraṇe na bhokturna
analyzed: atas eva kūpa ādau go maraṇe na tad kartuḥ gala lagna anna maraṇe na bhoktuḥ na
translated: For the same reason, even in the death of a cow in a well etc., the one who digs it is not a killer. In the death of one entangled in the throat, the one who feeds is not a killer.
