original: tadanyānvayī vā atra guravaḥ nāhatya kriyākāryatayā liṅgā bodhayituṃ śakyate svargakāmaniyojyānvayayogyatājñānavirahāt /
analyzed: tad anya anvayī vā atra guravaḥ na āhatya kriyā kāryatayā liṅgā bodhayitum śakyate svarga kāma niyojya anvaya yogya tā jñāna virahāt
translated: or with something else. The teachers here say: An action cannot be understood as an effect by implication, because of the absence of the knowledge of the eligibility for connection with one who is to be enjoined in the desire for heaven.

original: kāmanāviśiṣṭasya hi mamedaṃ kāryamiti boddhṛtvaṃ niyojyatvaṃ tat kāmanāyāstadbodhopayoge
analyzed: kāmanā viśiṣṭasya hi mama idam kāryam iti boddhṛ tvam niyojya tvam tat kāmanāyāḥ tad bodha upayoge
translated: For one who has the knowledge This is to be done by me who has the desire, is one who is to be enjoined. That knowledge of desire is useful for that understanding.

original: sati bhavati sa ca kāmanānantaraṃ kāmyasādhanatābodhanāt kāryatā bodhe sati syāt
analyzed: sati bhavati sa ca kāmanā anantaram kāmya sādhana tā bodhanāt kārya tā bodhe sati syāt
translated: And that occurs when there is the knowledge of being an effect after the knowledge of being a means to what is desired.

original: evañca svargasādhanatābodhe sati svargakāmaniyojyānvayayogyatā /
analyzed: evam ca svarga sādhanatā bodhe sati svarga kāma niyojya anvaya yogyatā
translated: And in that case, when there is the knowledge of being a means to heaven, there is eligibility for connection with one who is to be enjoined in the desire for heaven.

original: na ca kālāntarabhāvisvarge kriyā sākṣāt paramparayā vā sādhanamiti śabdo bodhayitumarhati āśuvināśitvāt paramparāghaṭakānupasthiteśca tṛtīyaprakārābhāvācca
analyzed: na ca kāla antara bhāvi svarge kriyā sākṣāt paramparayā vā sādhanam iti śabdaḥ bodhayitum arhati āśu vināśi tvāt paramparā ghaṭaka anupasthiteḥ ca tṛtīya prakāra abhāvāt ca
translated: And the word cannot convey the idea that heaven, which will come into existence at a later time, is the means, either directly or indirectly, of the act, because of its quick destruction, because of the non-apprehension of what constitutes the series, and because there is no third alternative.

original: anyathā tamādāya sādhanatvasambhavāt kalpyamapyapūrvaṃ na syāt iṣṭasādhanatāvidhipakṣe sphuṭaivānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: anyathā tam ādāya sādhanatva sambhavāt kalpyam api apūrvam na syāt iṣṭasādhanatā vidhi pakṣe sphuṭā evā anupapattiḥ
translated: Otherwise, because it would be possible for it to be the means by taking that [heaven], even the postulated unseen potency would not exist. In the case of the injunction of the desirability of the means, the inconsistency is clearly manifest.

original: kāryatāvidhipakṣe anvayaprakāratayā sādhanatvaṃ śābdamiti phalato na kaścidviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: kāryatā vidhi pakṣe anvaya prakāra tayā sādhanatvam śābdam iti phalatas na kaścid viśeṣaḥ
translated: In the case of the injunction of the effect, the fact that the means is [implied] by the mode of connection is the same as the result.

original: ataḥ kriyāto 'nyat svargasādhanatārhaṃ kriyākāryatānirvāhakaṃ liṅgādyarthaḥ /🔽nanu svajātīye 'nvayadarśanaṃ yogyatā dṛṣṭañca ghṛtapānasyāśuvināśinaḥ kālāntare🔽puṣṭihetutvamiti cet na yathākathañcit sājātyasyāyogye 'pi sattvena yogyatayā avyāvartakatvāpatteḥ
analyzed: atas kriyātaḥ svarga sādhana tā arham kriyā kārya tā nirvāhakam liṅga ādi arthaḥ  nanu sva jātīye nvaya darśanam yogyatā dṛṣṭaḥ ca ghṛta pānasya āśu vināśinaḥ kāla antare  puṣṭi hetu tvam iti ced na yathā kathañcid sājātyasya ayogye pi sattvena yogyatayā avyāvartaka tva āpatteḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the optative suffix is something other than the act, which is fit to be the means of heaven, and which accomplishes the effect of the act.🔽If it is argued that the perception of the connection of a thing with its own kind is the fitness, and that the quick-destroying drinking of ghee is seen to be the cause of nourishment at a later time, it is not so, because even in what is unfit, there is the sameness in some way, and therefore fitness would not be a determiner.

original: padārthatāvacchedakena sājātyasyādyajātaḥ payaḥ pibatītyādau prakṛte cāsambhavāt
analyzed: padārtha tā avacchedakena sājātyasya ādi ajātaḥ payaḥ pibati ityādau prakṛte ca asambhavāt
translated: Because the sameness by the determiner of the nature of the word-meaning is not possible in the case of the newly born drinks milk, and in the present case.

original: tasmādanvayaprayojakarūpavattvaṃ sājātyam /🔽ata eva dravadravyatvaṃ sekakaraṇatve prayojakaṃ ityayogyovahniḥ tadihāśuvināśinaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt anvaya prayojaka rūpavat tvam sājātyam  atas eva drava dravya tvam seka karaṇa tve prayojakam iti ayogyaḥ vahniḥ tat iha āśu vināśinaḥ
translated: Therefore, having the form that is the cause of the relation is similarity.

original: kālāntarabhāviphalajanakatve phalasamayaparyantasthāyivyāpārajanakatvaṃ prayojakamato🔽'pūrvaṃ vinā sājātyameva na gṛhyate ghṛtapānasya tu vaidyakopasthitadhātusāmyamādāya
analyzed: kāla antara bhāvi phala janaka tve phala samaya paryanta sthāyi vyāpāra janaka tvam prayojakam atas  pūrvam vinā sājātyam eva na gṛhyate ghṛta pānasya tu vaidyaka upasthita dhātu sāmyam ādāya
translated: For this very reason, the quality of being a liquid substance is the cause of being the instrument of sprinkling, so fire is not suitable. Here, in the production of the result that occurs after some time, the cause of the operation that lasts until the time of the result is the cause. Therefore,

original: puṣṭisādhanatvayogyatājñānaṃ vijñasya /
analyzed: puṣṭi sādhana tva yogya tā jñānam vijñasya
translated: without the unseen force, similarity itself is not grasped. But for the drinking of ghee, the learned person has the knowledge of suitability as a means of nourishment, taking into account the balance of bodily elements established by Ayurveda.

original: atha bādhakapramāṇābhāvo yogyatā /
analyzed: atha bādhaka pramāṇa abhāvaḥ yogyatā
translated: Now, if the absence of a contradictory means of knowledge is suitability,

original: na ca sādhanatvamātre bādhakaṃ sākṣātdbodhe 'pi paramparāsādhanatvamādāya tadviśrāntisambhavāt /
analyzed: na ca sādhanatva mātre bādhakam paramparā sādhanatvam ādāya tad viśrānti sambhavāt
translated: and there is no contradiction in mere instrumentality, because even in direct cognition, instrumentality can be established by way of indirect instrumentality.

original: na ca yogyānupalabdhā dvārasya bādhāt paramparāsādhanatvamapi bādhitaṃ saṃskāsyeva tasya sambhavāt anyathā vācye 'pyapūrve kriyā kāmikāryā
analyzed: na ca yogya anupalabdhā dvārasya bādhāt paramparā sādhanatvam api bādhitam tasya sambhavāt anyathā vācye pi apūrve kriyā kāmi kāryā  /
translated: And because of the contradiction of the door of non-apprehension of the suitable, indirect instrumentality is also contradicted, because like the impression, it is possible. Otherwise, even if the unseen force is to be stated, the action would not be for the desired effect,

original: na syāt kāmyāsādhatvāt /
analyzed: na syāt kāmya a sādha tvāt
translated: because it is not a means of accomplishing the desired.

original: na hi yadevāyogyaṃ tatpaścāt yogyaṃ ayogyatve ca niṣphalaḥ prayāsaḥ /
analyzed: na hi yat eva ayogyam tat paścāt yogyam ayogya tve ca niṣphalaḥ prayāsaḥ
translated: For that which is unsuitable is not suitable later. And if it is unsuitable, the effort is fruitless.

original: na ca kāmikāryamapūrvaṃ tadarthikāryā ca kriyeti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca kāmi kāryam apūrvam tad arthi kāryā ca kriyā iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the unseen potency is the object of the desire, and the act is the object of the unseen potency.

original: yāge rāgādityanena virodhāt /
analyzed: yāge rāgāt iti anena virodhāt
translated: Because this would contradict the statement that the sacrifice is for the purpose of passion etc.

original: tathāpi dvārānupasthityā paramparāsādhanamiti jñānaṃ na bhavediti cet satyaṃ kintu
analyzed: tathā api dvāra anupasthityā paramparā sādhanam iti jñānam na bhavet iti ced satyam kintu
translated: Even so, if the means of the means is not presented through the door, knowledge would not arise. If it is argued that this is so, it is true, but

original: svargasādhanaṃ yāga iti jñānaṃ sākṣātparamparodāsīnaṃ vastugatyā paramparāsādhanatvaviṣayakamutpadyamānaṃ
analyzed: svarga sādhanam yāgaḥ iti jñānam sākṣāt paramparā udāsīnam vastu gatyā paramparā sādhanatva viṣayakam utpadyamānam
translated: the knowledge that the sacrifice is a means to heaven arises directly, indifferently to the means of the means and the means of the means, and being produced,

original: nāyogyatayā paribhavituṃ śakyam /
analyzed: na ayogya tayā paribhavitum śakyam
translated: it cannot be obstructed by unfitness.

original: yadi ca sākṣātparamparāviśeṣadvayavyatiriktaṃ sāmānyaṃ nāstyeva tadā ananugamaḥ kiṃ vā viśeṣayasi sākṣātparamparayā veti /
analyzed: yadi ca sākṣāt paramparā viśeṣa dvaya vyatiriktam sāmānyam na asti eva tadā ananugamaḥ kim vā viśeṣayasi sākṣāt paramparayā vā iti
translated: And if there is no general at all apart from the two, direct and indirect, then there is no universal. What do you specify - directly or indirectly?

original: na ca yāvadviśeṣabādhe tadbidhitaṃ paramparāsādhanatve 'bādhāditi /
analyzed: na ca yāvat viśeṣa bādhe tat bidhitam paramparā sādhana tve bādhāt iti
translated: And it is not that as long as the particular is obstructed, the knowledge of it is not obstructed in the means of the means of the means.

original: maivaṃ /🔽yogyatā hi svabādhakapramāviraho vā sakalabādhakapramāviraho vā ādye vahninā siñcatītyādau
analyzed: mā evam  yogyatā hi sva bādhaka pramā virahaḥ vā sakala bādhaka pramā virahaḥ vā ādye vahninā siñcati ityādau
translated: Do not say so.🔽For fitness is either the absence of a contradictory cognition or the absence of all contradictory cognitions. In the first case, in sprinkling with fire etc.,

original: svabādhakapramātadvirahau samayabhedena sta iti tadeva yogyamayogyañceti prāptaṃ
analyzed: sva bādhaka pramā tad virahau samaya bhedena staḥ iti tat eva yogyam ayogyam ca iti prāptam
translated: the contradictory cognition and its absence exist by the division of time. Therefore, that itself is fit and unfit.

original: dvitīye tu yogyānupalabdhā tanniścayo 'śakyaḥ parapramāyā ayogyatvāt /
analyzed: dvitīye tu yogya anupalabdhā śakyaḥ para pramāyāḥ ayogya tvāt
translated: But in the second case, the non-apprehension of the proper object is incapable of ascertaining that, because the cognition of another is not proper.

original: na ca vācyaṃ sakalabādhakapramāvirahaḥ svarūpasanneva prayojaka iti ayogye yogyatāmramādanvaya bodhābhāvaprasaṅgāt anyasya tatra bādhakapramāsattvāt
analyzed: na ca vācyam sakala bādhaka pramā virahaḥ svarūpa sanna eva prayojakaḥ iti ayogye bodha abhāva prasaṅgāt anyasya tatra bādhaka pramā sattvāt
translated: And it cannot be said that the mere presence of the absence of all contradictory cognitions is itself the cause, because in an improper case, the cognition of the proper object would lead to the undesirable consequence of the absence of the cognition of the relation, as something else is the cause of contradiction there.

original: anvayaprayojakarūpavattvena bādhakapramāviraho niścīyate iti cet tarhi prāthamikatvāt saiva yogyatā /
analyzed: anvaya prayojaka rūpavat tvena bādhaka pramā virahaḥ niścīyate iti ced tarhi prāthamika tvāt sā eva yogyatā
translated: If it is argued that the absence of contradictory cognitions is ascertained by the presence of the form that is the cause of the relation, then that itself is the proper object, because it is primary.

original: na ca sā prakṛte sambhavatītyuktaṃ kiñcaikaviśeṣabādhe śābdasāmānyajñānaṃ taditaraviśeṣaprakāratāniyataṃ chidrabādhe chidretaraghaṭajñānavat
analyzed: na ca sā prakṛte sambhavati iti uktam kiñca eka viśeṣa bādhe śābda sāmānya jñānam tad itara viśeṣa prakāra tā niyatam chidra bādhe chidra itara ghaṭa jñāna vat
translated: And it is said that it is not possible in the present case. Moreover, in the contradiction of a particular, the general cognition of the word is determined by the form of the other particular, like the cognition of a pot in the contradiction of a hole.

original: na ca dvārānupasthityā prakṛte tathā ghaṭate /
analyzed: na ca dvāra anupasthityā prakṛte tathā ghaṭate
translated: And it does not hold thus in the present case due to the non-appearance of the door.

original: etena yaduktaṃ praśastarūpavān caitra ityatra gauraśyāmaviśeṣānavagame 'pi rūpamātramavagamyate
analyzed: etena yat uktam praśasta rūpavān caitraḥ iti atra gaura śyāma viśeṣa anavagame pi rūpa mātram avagamyate
translated: In this connection, it is said that in the sentence Caitra has a beautiful form, even without the understanding of the particulars of fair or dark, only the form is understood.

original: tadvat viśeṣānavagame 'pi sādhanatvamātramiti tatpratyuktaṃ tatraikaviśeṣabādhābhāvenaudāsīnyasambhavāt /
analyzed: tadvat viśeṣa anavagame pi sādhana tva mātram iti tat pratyuktam tatra eka viśeṣa bādhā abhāvena audāsīnya sambhavāt
translated: Similarly, even in the absence of the knowledge of a particular, it is only the mere instrumentality that is accepted. That has been refuted there, because neutrality is possible due to the absence of the contradiction of a particular.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: etena svargakāmānvayabalāt kriyāyāḥ phalasādhanatvaṃ tadbalācca paṭoḥ saṃskāsyeva
analyzed: etena svarga kāma anvaya balāt kriyāyāḥ phala sādhanatvam tad balāt ca paṭoḥ
translated: By this, let the fruit-instrumentality of the action be assumed by the force of the connection with one desiring heaven, and by that force, let the permanence of the cloth be assumed

original: sthāyitvaṃ kalpyatāṃ kimapūrveṇa saṅkalpaviśeṣasya yāgasyāgre pratyakṣānupalabdhi
analyzed: sthāyi tvam kalpyatām kim apūrveṇa saṅkalpa viśeṣasya yāgasya agre pratyakṣa anupalabdhi
translated: like the object to be refined, what is the use of postulating an unseen potency? The particular volition of the sacrifice is not perceived at first,

original: rātmaviśeṣaguṇānāṃ prathamakṣaṇa eva svaviṣayakapratyakṣajananasvabhāvāt astu na
analyzed: rātma viśeṣa guṇānām prathama kṣaṇaḥ eva sva viṣayaka pratyakṣa janana svabhāvāt astu na
translated: let it be so, because the particular qualities of the self are by nature the producers of perception of their objects even in the first moment,

original: caivaṃ kriyāntaramapi tathā pramāṇābhāvāt evaṃ lokaprasiddhakriyākāryatvavyutpattirapi
analyzed: ca evam kriyā antaram api tathā pramāṇa abhāvāt evam loka prasiddha kriyā kāryatva vyutpattiḥ api
translated: and not so for other actions, because there is no evidence. Thus, the derivation of the meaning of the action as known in the world

original: bhagnā na bhavatīti parāstam /
analyzed: bhagnā na bhavati iti parāstam
translated: is not destroyed, so it is refuted.

original: svargasādhanatāyogyatayā svargakāmānvayaḥ tadanvaye ca sthāyitvaṃ ityanyonyāśrayāt lāke dharmigrāhakamānena kriyāyāḥ kṣaṇikatvaniścayācca /
analyzed: svarga sādhanatā yogyatayā svarga kāma anvayaḥ tad anvaye ca sthāyi tvam iti anyonya āśrayāt lāke dharmi grāhaka mānena kriyāyāḥ kṣaṇikatva niścayāt ca
translated: The connection with one desiring heaven by the fitness for being the means to heaven, and the permanence in the connection with that, because of the mutual dependence, and because of the ascertainment of the momentariness of action by the evidence that apprehends the subject in the world.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: nanu devapūjārtho yajiḥ pūjā cārādhanā gauravitaprītihetuḥ kriyā ato devatāprītidvārā
analyzed: nanu deva pūjā arthaḥ yajiḥ pūjā ca ārādhanā gauravita prīti hetuḥ kriyā atas devatā prīti dvārā
translated: But the sacrifice is for the worship of the gods, and worship is a rite that causes respect and affection. Therefore, through the satisfaction of the deity,

original: yāgasya svargasādhanatvaṃ prīteḥ kṣaṇikatve 'pi prītyanubhavajanitasaṃskāradvārā tatsambhavāt /
translated: the sacrifice is the means of attaining heaven, because even though satisfaction is momentary, it is possible through the impressions produced by the experience of satisfaction.

original: ata evāgneyādau prītibhāgitayā agnagaderuddheśyatvamiti cet na yaj devapūjāyāṃ iti hi śābdikasmṛtiḥ smṛtitvādeva na svataḥ pramāṇam /
analyzed: atas eva āgneya ādau prīti bhāgi tayā ced na yat deva pūjāyām iti hi śābdika smṛtiḥ smṛti tvāt eva na svatas pramāṇam
translated: For this very reason, in the Agneya and other sacrifices, Agni and other deities are mentioned as partakers of the satisfaction. If this is argued, it is not so. For the statement in the worship of the gods is a Smriti of the grammarians. It is not a valid means of knowledge by itself, merely because it is a Smriti.

original: na ca yāgasya devatāprītihetutve svargasya devatāprītisādhyatve vā mānāntaramasti /
analyzed: na ca yāgasya devatā prīti hetu tve svargasya devatā prīti sādhya tve vā māna antaram asti
translated: And there is no other valid means of knowledge for the sacrifice being the cause of the satisfaction of the deity, or for heaven being accomplished by the satisfaction of the deity.

original: vastutastu cetane deve mānameva nāsti yatra ca viṣṇuprītikāmādivādo 'sti tatra viṣṇureva
analyzed: vastutas tu cetane deve mānam eva na asti yatra ca viṣṇu prīti kāma ādi vādaḥ sti tatra viṣṇuḥ eva
translated: In reality, there is no valid means of knowledge even for a conscious deity. And where there is the doctrine of desiring the satisfaction of Vishnu, there the satisfaction is of Vishnu himself,

original: prītiḥ na tu viṣṇoḥ ṣaṣṭhyarthalakṣaṇādoṣāt viṣṇuśabdasya prītiviśeṣavācakatvaṃ veda eva kalpyate /
analyzed: prītiḥ na tu viṣṇoḥ ṣaṣṭhī artha lakṣaṇā doṣāt viṣṇu śabdasya prīti viśeṣa vācaka tvam vede eva kalpyate
translated: not of Vishnu, because of the fault of the genitive case denoting a quality. The Vedic text alone is imagined to denote a particular satisfaction by the word Vishnu.

original: na ca devatāpūjārthayajyanvayabalāttathā anyonyāśrayāt /
analyzed: na ca devatā pūjā artha yaji anvaya balāt tathā anyonya āśrayāt
translated: And it is not so by the force of the relation of the sacrifice to the worship of the deity, because of mutual dependence.

original: nanvevaṃ āgneyāndīnāṃ ṣaṇāṃ kṣaṇikatvāt yogyatānavagatau paramāpūrvakāraṇatvānavagame🔽kathamapūrvakalpaneti cet na kāmye apūrvavācyatvasthitau āgneyādau tadvārā sādhanatvasya
analyzed: nanu evam āgneya āndīnām ṣaṇām kṣaṇika tvāt yogyatā anavagatau parama apūrva kāraṇatva anavagame  katham apūrva kalpanā iti ced na kāmye apūrva vācya tva sthitau āgneya ādau tad dvārā sādhanatvasya
translated: If it is argued that thus, since the six Āgneya sacrifices are momentary, when fitness is not known and the cause of the supreme apūrva is not understood,🔽how can apūrva be imagined? It is not so. When the expressibility by apūrva is established in the desired, the instrumentality through that is possible in the Āgneya etc.,

original: yogyatāsambhavāt na tu prathamam /
analyzed: yogyatā sambhavāt na tu prathamam
translated: but not first.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: nanu yo brāhmaṇāyāvagurettaṃ śatena yātayedityatra brāhmaṇabadhodyamasya śatayātanāhetutvāvagame
analyzed: nanu yaḥ brāhmaṇāya avaguret tam śatena yātayet iti atra brāhmaṇa badha udyamasya śata yātanā hetutva avagame
translated: If it is argued that just as in the sentence one who strikes a Brahmin should be punished with a fine of one hundred, when the attempt to kill a Brahmin is understood to be the cause of the fine of one hundred,

original: yathā duritāpūrvaṃ kalpyate tathehāpīti cet na avaguret yātayet ityatra hetuhetumatorliṅityanuśāsanāt
analyzed: yathā durita apūrvam kalpyate tathā iha api iti ced na avaguret yātayet iti atra hetu hetumatoḥ liṅ iti anuśāsanāt
translated: an apūrva of sin is imagined, so it is here also, it is not so. Because of the rule that the relation of cause and effect is indicated by the optative suffix in should strike and should punish,

original: liṅgā avagoraṇa śatayātanayoṃrniyataṃ paurvāparyaṃ bodhyate pratyakṣeṇānubhavasmaraṇayoriva
analyzed: liṅgāḥ avagoraṇa śatayātanayoḥ niyatam paurvāparyam bodhyate pratyakṣeṇa anubhava smaraṇayoḥ iva
translated: the definite sequence of striking and being punished is understood from the optative suffix, just as from perception in the case of experience and memory.

original: tacca sādhanatve sādhanasādhanatve vā ubhayamapi madhyavartighaṭitamiti dūritakalpanaṃ
analyzed: tat ca sādhana tve sādhana sādhana tve vā ubhayam api madhyavarti ghaṭitam iti dūrita kalpanam
translated: And that is either instrumentality or instrumentality of the instrument, both of which are constructed in the middle. Therefore, the imagination is far-fetched.

original: saṃskāravat iha tu vidhyanuśiṣṭā liṅg kāryatāmāha /
analyzed: saṃskāra vat iha tu vidhi anuśiṣṭā liṅg kārya tām āha
translated: But here, the optative suffix, instructed by the injunctive suffix, expresses the relation of effect.

original: kiñca kāmī kāmyādanyat kāmyāvyavahitasādhanatayā jñātameva kartavyatayāvaitīti niyamāt na kriyāyāṃ kāminonvayo yogyaḥ /🔽na ca tṛptikāmasya pāke pravṛttervyabhicāraḥ odanakāmasya tatra pravṛtteḥ tṛptikāmanā tu tatkāmanopayogino na tu sākṣāt anyathā sādhanasādhane
analyzed: kiñca kāmī kāmyāt anyat kāmya avyavahita sādhanatayā jñātam eva kartavya tayā avaiti iti niyamāt na kriyāyām kāminaḥ anvayaḥ yogyaḥ  na ca tṛpti kāmasya pāke pravṛtteḥ vyabhicāraḥ odana kāmasya tatra pravṛtteḥ tṛpti kāmanā tu tad kāmanā upayoginaḥ na tu sākṣāt anyathā sādhana sādhane
translated: Moreover, since it is a rule that one who desires something knows only what is an immediately antecedent means to that desired thing as something to be done, therefore the desirer is not fit to be related to the action.

original: pravṛttirna syāt /🔽kāmyasādhanatvaṃ pravartakaṃ🔽lāghavāditi cet na bhojanakāmasya siddhaudanasya pāke pravṛttiprasaṅgāt tasyaudanadvārā
analyzed: pravṛttiḥ na syāt           lāghavāt iti ced na bhojana kāmasya siddha odanasya pāke pravṛtti prasaṅgāt tasya odana dvārā
translated: And it is not a fallacy to say that one who desires satisfaction engages in cooking, because one who desires cooked rice engages in it. But the desire for satisfaction is useful for the desire for that, not directly. Otherwise, there would be no engagement in the means to the means.

original: bhojanasādhanatvāviśeṣāt viśeṣaṇe tu yatrāvyavahitasādhanaṃ pākaḥ tat na kāmyaṃ yacca🔽kāmyaṃ tatra nāvyavahitasādhanaṃ pākaiti na pravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: bhojana sādhanatva aviśeṣāt viśeṣaṇe tu yatra avyavahita sādhanam pākaḥ tat na kāmyam yat ca  kāmyam tatra na avyavahita sādhanam pāka eti na pravṛttiḥ
translated: If it is argued that the being a means to the desired thing is the motivator, because of simplicity, it is not so, because of the consequence of engagement in cooking of cooked rice for one who desires a meal, because of the non-difference of being a means to the meal through cooked rice. But if there is a qualification, where cooking is an immediately antecedent means, that is not desired. And where it is desired, there cooking is not an immediately antecedent means, so there is no engagement.

original: nanu pākasya siddhaudanadvārā bhojanasādhanatvaṃ na sambhavati dvārasyāsādhyatvāt
analyzed: nanu pākasya siddha odana dvārā bhojana sādhanatvam na sambhavati dvārasya asādhya tvāt
translated: But it is not possible for cooking to be a means to a meal through cooked rice, because a means is not to be accomplished.

original: odanāntaradvārā ca tathā pratisandhāne avyavahitaviśeṣaṇe 'pi kuto na pāke pravartate
analyzed: odana antara dvārā ca tathā pratisandhāne avyavahita viśeṣaṇe kutas na pāke pravartate
translated: And how is it that cooking does not occur in the other rice, even when the qualification is not obstructed, through the medium of the other rice?

original: odanāntare dvāre sākṣātsādhanatvāditi cet na pākasya bhojanasādhanatve viśeṣasyāprayojakatayā
analyzed: odana antare dvāre sākṣāt sādhanatvāt iti ced na pākasya bhojana sādhanatve viśeṣasya aprayojaka tayā
translated: If it is argued that it is because cooking is directly the means in the other rice, no, because in the means of eating, the qualification is not a cause.

original: odanamātrasya dvāratvāt tasya ca sādhyatvāvivādāt /🔽odanaviśeṣe ca siddhe odanakāmanāvirahāt na tulyatvam /🔽nanvodane siddhatvāt yathā na kāmanā tata eva dvāratāpi na athaudanāntarasyāsiddhatvamādāya🔽dvāratā tarhi kāmanāpi syāt tasyāsiddhatvamādāya dvāratā tarhi kāmanāpi syāt tasyāsiddhatvāditi
analyzed: odana mātrasya dvāra tvāt tasya ca sādhya tva avivādāt  odana viśeṣe ca siddhe odana kāmanā virahāt na tulya tvam  nanu odane siddha tvāt yathā na kāmanā tatas eva dvāra tā api na atha odana antarasya asiddha tvam ādāya  dvāra tā tarhi kāmanā api syāt tasya asiddha tvam ādāya dvāra tā tarhi kāmanā api syāt tasya asiddha tvāt iti
translated: Because only rice is the means, and there is no dispute that that is to be accomplished.🔽And when a particular rice is accomplished, there is no desire for rice, so it is not the same.

original: cet na pākasyaikaviśeṣadvāratā bādho na🔽viśeṣāntaradvāratāvirodhī sakalaviśeṣasyaikatra dvāratvāsambhavāt ekaviśeṣasiddhau
analyzed: ced na pākasya eka viśeṣa dvāra tā bādhaḥ na
translated: But just as there is no desire because rice is accomplished, so too there is no medium. If it is argued that the medium is taken from the non-accomplishment of another rice, then there would be desire. If the medium is taken from the non-accomplishment of that, then there would be desire. If it is argued that it is because of non-accomplishment, no, because the medium of one particular of cooking is not contradicted.🔽It is not contradictory to the medium of another particular. Because it is not possible for the entire particular to be the medium in one place. But when one particular is accomplished,

original: tu tanmātrakāmanā vicchidyate na hi sakalaviśeṣasiddhatvena sāmānyakāmanāvicchedaḥ
analyzed: tu tanmātra kāmanā vicchidyate na hi sakala viśeṣa siddha tvena sāmānya kāmanā vicchedaḥ
translated: the desire for that alone is cut off. For the desire for the general is not cut off by the accomplishment of the entire particular.

original: sakalaviśeṣasiddherasambhavena tadanucchedaprasaṅgāt /🔽atha vā kāmyādanyat sākṣādasādhanatvena jñāyamānaṃ yatkartavyatayā kāmo budhyate tatkāmyāvyavahitasādhanamantarā kṛtvaiva /
analyzed: sakala viśeṣa siddheḥ asambhavena tad anuccheda prasaṅgāt  atha vā kāmyāt anyat sākṣāt asādhana tvena jñāyamānam yat kartavyatayā kāmaḥ budhyate tat kāmya avyavahita sādhanam antarā kṛtvā eva
translated: Because of the impossibility of establishing all the details, there would be the undesirable consequence of their non-cessation.🔽Or, that which is known as something to be done, other than what is desired, directly as not being a means, is understood as a desire. That desire is the means immediately preceding the desired object, only after performing the means that is not obstructed by the desired object.

original: yadvā kāmyādanyat kāmo prathamaṃ kāmyāvyavahitasādhanaṃ kartavyatayāvaiti paścāt tadvārā avyavahitasādhanamiti prathamaṃ yāge kāmikāryatābodho
analyzed: yat vā kāmyāt anyat prathamam kāmya avyavahita sādhanam kartavya tayā avaiti paścāt tad vārā avyavahita sādhanam iti prathamam yāge kāmi kārya tā bodhaḥ
translated: Or, first, desire, which is other than the desired object, understands the means immediately preceding the desired object as something to be done, and then through that, the means that is not obstructed. First, the cognition of the state of being an object of desire in the sacrifice

original: 'yogyatāparāhata eva /
analyzed: yogyatā parāhataḥ eva
translated: is only not contradicted by incapacity.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: uttānāstu vivādaviṣayoliṅg samabhivyāhṛtakriyānvitakāryatābodhikā pramāṇaliṅgatvāt
analyzed: uttānāḥ tu vivāda viṣayaḥ liṅg samabhivyāhṛta kriyā anvita kāryatā bodhikā pramāṇa liṅga tvāt
translated: However, the uplifted one is the subject of dispute. The indicator is the means of knowing the state of being an object of desire connected with the action expressed together with it, because it is an indicator of the means of knowledge.

original: laukikaliṅgavat liṅgapasthāpyaṃ kāryatvaṃ samabhivyāhṛtakriyānvitaṃ liṅupasthāpyakāryatvatvāt
translated: Like a worldly indicator, the state of being an object of desire, which is to be established by the indicator, is connected with the action expressed together with it, because it is the state of being an object of desire established by the optative suffix.

original: pacetetikāryatvavat yāgo vā kāryatvānvitaḥ kriyākāryatvāvagamenāpūrvaṃ kalpyamiti
analyzed: paceta iti kārya tva vat yāgaḥ vā kārya tva anvitaḥ kriyā kārya tva avagamena apūrvam kalpyam iti
translated: Like the state of being an object of desire in the sentence He should cook, or the sacrifice is connected with the state of being an object of desire, because the means of knowing the state of being an object of desire of the action implies the postulation of an unseen result.

original: tatra prathame yāgānvitakāryatvabodhikatvaṃ liṅgo bodhyate na tu kriyate /
analyzed: tatra prathame yāga anvita kāryatva bodhikatvam liṅgaḥ bodhyate na tu kriyate
translated: There, in the first case, the fact that the optative suffix indicates the state of being an object of desire connected with the sacrifice is understood, but it is not done.

original: na ca yogyatājñānaṃ vinā tatsambhavatītyuktameva /
analyzed: na ca yogyatā jñānam vinā tat sambhavati iti uktam eva
translated: And it has been said that that is not possible without the knowledge of fitness.

original: na hi yogyatādikaṃ vinaiva tadanumānaprāmāṇyaprayojanamātrādanvitamabhidhīyate śabdena nāntyau kuryādityatra vyabhicārāt vedāsyānuvādakatāpātācca
analyzed: na hi yogyatā ādikam vinā eva tad anumāna prāmāṇya prayojana mātrāt anvitam abhidhīyate śabdena na antyau kuryāt iti atra vyabhicārāt veda āsya anuvādaka tā āpātāt ca
translated: For fitness etc. are not mentioned by the word without fitness etc., only for the purpose of the validity of that inference, because of the fallacy in the case of Do not do the last two, and because of the consequence of the Veda being a restatement.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: nanvapūrve vyutpattivirahaḥ tathā hi prasiddhārthasvargakāmapadasamabhivyāhārānyathānupapattyā upasthite śaktirgrahītavyā /
analyzed: nanu apūrve vyutpatti virahaḥ tathā hi prasiddha artha svarga kāma pada samabhivyāhāra anyathā anupapattyā upasthite śaktiḥ grahītavyā
translated: Now, there is absence of derivation in the case of the unseen. Thus, the potency is to be grasped by the incomprehensibility of the association with the well-known words heaven and desire.

original: na ca śābdānubhavāt pūrvaṃ apūrvamupasthitaṃ mānābhāvāt apūrvatvavyāghātāt avācyatvāpātācca /
analyzed: na ca śābda anubhavāt pūrvam apūrvam upasthitam māna abhāvāt apūrva tva vyāghātāt avācya tva āpātāt ca
translated: And before the verbal experience, the unseen is not presented, because of the absence of a means of knowledge, because of the contradiction of being unseen, and because of the consequence of being inexpressible.

original: na ca liṅgādinā tadupasthitiḥ vyutpattyanantaraṃ tatpravṛttāvanyonyāśrayāt /
analyzed: na ca liṅga ādinā tad upasthitiḥ vyutpatti anantaram tad pravṛttau anyonya āśrayāt
translated: And it is not its presentation by the inferential mark etc., because of mutual dependence in the occurrence of that after derivation.

original: na ca kāryatvenopalakṣite tatra śaktigrahaḥ upalakṣaṇaṃ hi smaraṇamanumānaṃ vā agṛhīte sambandhāgrahādaśakyamiti /
analyzed: na ca kārya tvena upalakṣite tatra śakti grahaḥ upalakṣaṇam hi smaraṇam anumānam vā agṛhīte sambandha agrahāt aśakyam iti
translated: And the grasping of potency in that indicated by the universal being an effect is not possible, because the indication is either memory or inference, and that is impossible without the grasped relation.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: Do not say so.

original: kārye dharmiṇi kāryatvena śaktigrahāt kāryatvaviśiṣṭañcopasthitameva tato 'nvitābhidhānadaśāyāṃ🔽yāgaviṣayakaṃ kāryamityanubhavaḥ svargakāmānvayāyogyatayā ghaṭādikaṃ tiraskṛtya kriyāṃbhinne
analyzed: kārye dharmiṇi kārya tvena śakti grahāt kārya tva viśiṣṭam ca upasthitam eva tatas nvita abhidhāna daśāyām  yāga viṣayakam kāryam iti anubhavaḥ svarga kāma anvaya ayogya tayā ghaṭa ādikam tiraskṛtya kriyām bhinne
translated: Because the capacity is grasped as being the effect in the object to be accomplished, and what is presented is qualified by being the effect, then in the stage of expressing the relation,

original: yogyatāvaśādyāgaviṣayakāpūrve paryavasyati na tvapūrvatvena śaktigrahaḥ /
analyzed: yogyatā vaśāt yāga viṣayaka apūrve paryavasyati na tu apūrva tvena śakti grahaḥ
translated: the experience is of an effect having the sacrifice as its object, excluding the pot etc. due to its unsuitability for being related to one desiring heaven, and by the force of suitability it concludes in the unseen potency having the sacrifice as its object, but there is no grasping of capacity as being the unseen potency.

original: na cāpūrvaṃ kāryamityanubhavaḥ bhavati ca sāmānyataḥ sambandhabuddhiḥ sahakārivaśāt viśeṣabuddhyāpayaḥ yathā tavaiva kartṛviśeṣasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: na ca apūrvam kāryam iti anubhavaḥ bhavati ca sāmānyatas sambandha buddhiḥ sahakāri vaśāt yathā tava eva kartṛ viśeṣa siddhiḥ
translated: And there is no experience that the unseen potency is the effect. And the cognition of the relation in general arises from the auxiliaries, leading to the cognition of the particular, just as in your own case the establishment of the particular agent.

original: nanu kāryatvenāpi kiṃ ghaṭādau śaktigrahaḥ utāpūrve ubhayatra vā nādyaḥ anyapratipattāvanyaśaktigrahānupayogāt /🔽nāntyau prāganupasthiteriti cet na yena hi rūpeṇa śabdenānubhavo janyate tena rūpeṇa
analyzed: nanu kāryatvena api kim ghaṭa ādau śakti grahaḥ uta apūrve ubhayatra vā na ādyaḥ anya pratipattau anya śakti graha anupayogāt  na antyau prāk anupasthiteḥ iti ced na yena hi rūpeṇa śabdena anubhavaḥ janyate tena rūpeṇa
translated: But even if it is by being the effect, is the grasping of capacity in the pot etc. or in the unseen potency or in both? Not the first, because grasping the capacity of one thing is not useful in understanding another.

original: śaktigrahaḥ padārthasmaraṇañca śābdānubhavahetuḥ na hi prameyatvena śaktigrahaḥ padārthasmaraṇañca
analyzed: śakti grahaḥ padārtha smaraṇañca śābda anubhava hetuḥ na hi prameya tvena śakti grahaḥ padārtha smaraṇañca
translated: Not the latter two, because of non-presentation before. If it is said that it is not so, because the capacity is grasped by whatever form the word generates experience, and the recollection of the word-meaning is the cause of verbal experience, for the grasping of capacity as being the object of knowledge and the recollection of the word-meaning as being the object of knowledge are not the cause of verbal experience.

original: ghaṭatvena śābdānubhavahetuḥ /
translated: The universal of pot is the cause of verbal cognition as a pot.

original: evañca ghaṭādāveva kārye śaktā liṅgiti śaktigrahastataḥ kāryamiti smaraṇaṃ tato yogyatādivaśāt
analyzed: evam ca ghaṭa ādau eva kārye śaktā liṅgiti śakti grahaḥ tatas kāryam iti smaraṇam tatas yogyatā ādi vaśāt
translated: And thus, the power to infer is only in the effect like a pot. The apprehension of power is from that. The recollection of the effect is from that. Then, due to the influence of fitness, etc.,

original: pracuradravyaguṇakarmāṇi kāryāṇi vihāya yāgaviṣayakaṃ kāryamityunubhavo bhavannapūrvamālambate
analyzed: pracura dravya guṇa karmāṇi kāryāṇi vihāya yāga viṣayakam kāryam iti unubhavaḥ bhavan apūrvam ālambate
translated: the cognition that the effect is the sacrifice, avoiding the many substances, qualities, and actions that are effects, occurs. It takes the unseen as its object.

original: yogyatvācca tasya sthāyitvalābhaḥ /
analyzed: yogya tvāt ca tasya sthāyi tva lābhaḥ
translated: And due to fitness, it gains permanence.

original: ata eva vākyārthānubhavamātraviṣayatvāttadapūrvam /
analyzed: atas eva vākya artha anubhava mātra viṣaya tvāt tat apūrvam
translated: For this very reason, the unseen is the object of mere cognition of the meaning of the sentence.

original: na ca smṛtānāmākāṅkādivaśādanvayabodhaḥ padena kriyate na cāpūrvaṃ smṛtigocara iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca smṛtānām ākāṅkā ādi vaśāt anvaya bodhaḥ padena kriyate na ca apūrvam smṛti gocaraḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the understanding of the relation is produced by the word based on the desire, etc. of what is remembered, and that the unseen is not the object of memory.

original: śaktigrahapadārthasmṛtiśābdānubhavānāṃ samānaprakārakatāmātreṇa hetuhetumadbhāvāvadhāraṇāt
analyzed: śakti graha padārtha smṛti śābda anubhavānām samāna prakāraka tā mātreṇa hetu hetumat bhāva avadhāraṇāt
translated: Because the determination of the relation of cause and effect is from the mere sameness of type of the apprehension of power, the recollection of the meaning of the word, and the verbal cognition,

original: lāghavādāvaśyakatvācca na tu kvacit sahacāramātreṇa anvayapratiyogina evopasthitistathā
analyzed: lāghavāt āvaśyaka tvāt ca na tu kvacid sahacāra mātreṇa anvaya pratiyoginaḥ eva upasthitiḥ tathā
translated: and because it is necessary due to simplicity, not from mere concomitance anywhere. The mere object of the relation is not presented in that way.

original: gauravāt gopadādapūrvagavānanubhavaprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: gauravāt go padāt apūrva gavān anubhava prasaṅgāt ca
translated: Because of the difficulty. And because there would be the consequence of the cognition of the unseen cow from the word cow.

original: viśiṣṭavaiśiṣṭyabodhe sarvatra tathaiva anyathā parvatīyavahnirvyāpakatayā nāvagata iti kathaṃ tadanvayo 'numitau /
analyzed: viśiṣṭa vaiśiṣṭya bodhe sarvatra tathā eva anyathā parvatīya vahniḥ vyāpaka tayā na avagataḥ iti katham tad anvayaḥ numitau
translated: In the cognition of the qualified and the qualifier, everywhere it is so. Otherwise, if the mountain fire is not cognized as the pervader, how can its concomitance be inferred?

original: nanu sāmānyalakṣaṇā pratyāsattyā sarvā eva vyaktayo vyāptigrahe śaktigrahe ca viṣayībhavanti
analyzed: nanu sāmānya lakṣaṇā pratyāsattyā sarvāḥ eva vyaktayaḥ vyāpti grahe śakti grahe ca viṣayībhavanti
translated: But by the proximity of the general characteristic, all the individual things become the object of grasping the pervasion and the power.

original: kathamanyathā parvatīyadhūmavyāptyagrahe tasmādanumitiriti cet na yena rūpeṇa vyāptigrahastena
analyzed: katham anyathā parvatīya dhūma vyāpti agrahe tasmāt anumitiḥ iti ced na yena rūpeṇa vyāpti grahaḥ tena
translated: Otherwise, if the pervasion of the mountain smoke is not grasped, how can there be inference from it? If it is argued that it is so, then by the form in which the pervasion is grasped, by that form,

original: rūpeṇa vyāpyatvena vā pakṣadharmatāgraho 'numitau kāraṇamastu kiṃ tathā /
analyzed: rūpeṇa vyāpya tvena vā pakṣa dharma tā grahaḥ numitau kāraṇam astu kim tathā
translated: or by the pervasion, let the cognition of the property of the subject be the cause of inference. What is the use of it being so?

original: api ca sā yadyasti mamāpi nāsti cetāvāpi /
analyzed: api ca sā yadi asti mama api na asti cetāvā api
translated: Moreover, if it exists, it does not exist for me.

original: kiñca tava darśane sāstīti sutarāmapūrvavācyatā kāryatvena hi rūpeṇāpūrvasyāpi śaktigrahaviṣayatvaṃ padārthasmṛtiviṣayatvañca /
analyzed: kiñca tava darśane sā asti iti sutarām apūrva vācya tā kārya tvena hi rūpeṇa apūrvasya api śakti graha viṣaya tvam padārtha smṛti viṣaya tvam ca
translated: What is more, in your view, it exists. It is all the more a new object. For the unseen also becomes the object of grasping the power and the object of the memory of the meaning by the form of being an effect.

original: na caivamapūrvatvakṣatiḥ yāgaviṣayatvāderviśeṣasya kārye liṅgaṃ vinānupasthiteḥ yathā parvatīyatvabhānaṃ vahnau nānumitiṃ vinā /
analyzed: na ca evam apūrva tva kṣatiḥ yāga viṣaya tva ādeḥ viśeṣasya kārye liṅgam vinā anupasthiteḥ yathā parvatīya tva bhānam vahnau na anumitim vinā
translated: And thus there is no loss of being unseen. Because the particularity of being the object of the sacrifice and so on is not presented without the mark of being an effect, just as the appearance of being on the mountain is not without inference in fire.

original: nanu kārye yadi kriyāsādhāraṇena liṅgaśaktiḥ kriyā cāyogyeti yogyapūrvalābhaḥ tadā
analyzed: nanu kārye yadi kriyā sādhāraṇena liṅga śaktiḥ kriyā ca ayogyā iti yogya pūrva lābhaḥ tadā
translated: But if the potency of the optative suffix is in respect of the result, and the result is not possible, then the prior obtaining of what is possible is not so.

original: nityaniṣedhāpūrvayoralābhaḥ na hi tatrāyogyatayā kriyā tyaktuṃ śakyate phalāśravaṇāt
analyzed: nitya niṣedha apūrvayoḥ alābhaḥ na hi tatra ayogya tayā kriyā tyaktum śakyate phala aśravaṇāt
translated: Then there is no obtaining of the eternal and prohibited apūrva. For there the result cannot be abandoned as impossible, because no result is heard.

original: kalpanāyāñca bījābhāvāt /
analyzed: kalpanāyām ca bīja abhāvāt
translated: And in imagination, there is no basis.

original: na ca ekatra nirṇītaḥ śāstrartho 'nyatra tathaiveti nyāyāt tatrāpyapūrvameva liṅgartha
analyzed: na ca ekatra nirṇītaḥ śāstra arthaḥ nyatra tathā evā iti nyāyāt tatra api apūrvam eva liṅga artha
translated: And by the principle that the meaning of the scripture determined in one place is the same elsewhere, even there the apūrva is the meaning of the optative suffix.

original: iti tyaktuṃ na hyapūrvatvena śaktigrahaḥ kintu kāryatvaviśiṣṭe dharmiṇi kriyā ca tathā bhavatyeva /
analyzed: iti tyaktum na hi apūrva tvena śakti grahaḥ kintu kāryatva viśiṣṭe dharmiṇi kriyā ca tathā bhavati eva
translated: For the potency is not grasped as apūrva, but in the object qualified by being a result, and the action is also so.

original: na ca kāryeṇa samaṃ kriyāyā anvayānupapattyā apūrve paryavasānaṃ
analyzed: na ca kāryeṇa samam kriyāyāḥ anvaya anupapattyā apūrve paryavasānam
translated: And it is not that the action ends up in the apūrva due to the impossibility of the action's relation with the result,

original: abhedasyāpyanvayāditi / maivaṃ /🔽na hi loke pacetetyādau kārye dharmiṇi śaktiḥ kalpitā kintvananyalabhye kṛtirūpe
analyzed: abhedasya api anvayāt iti mā evam  na hi loke paceta ityādau kārye dharmiṇi śaktiḥ kalpitā kintu ananya labhye kṛti rūpe
translated: because non-difference also has a relation. It should not be so.🔽For in the world, in 'pacati' etc., the potency is not imagined in the object qualified by the result, but in the action, which is not obtained elsewhere,

original: kāryatvamātre dharmiṇaḥ pākāderdhātorevopasthitisambhavāt kriyākāryatvasyānvitābhidhānalabhyatvātathāca
analyzed: kāryatva mātre dharmiṇaḥ pāka ādeḥ dhātoḥ eva upasthiti sambhavāt kriyā kāryatvasya anvita abhidhāna labhya tvāt tathā ca
translated: which is in the form of volition. For the object, such as cooking, can be presented by the verbal root itself, which is merely a result. The action's being a result is obtained by the expression of the relation.

original: dharmiṇi vede śaktiḥ kalpanīyā sā ca kriyānirāsenaiva /
analyzed: dharmiṇi vede śaktiḥ kalpanīyā sā ca kriyā nirāsena eva
translated: The power is to be imagined in the Veda, the subject, only by the exclusion of action.

original: na hi kriyāyāḥ kāryatvānvayayogyatve dharmiṇi śaktiḥ kalpayituṃ śakyate tasmādayogyatayā kriyānirāsānantaraṃ tadatirikta eva śaktiḥ kalpanīyā
analyzed: na hi kriyāyāḥ kāryatva anvaya yogyatve dharmiṇi śaktiḥ kalpayitum śakyate tasmāt ayogya tayā kriyā nirāsa anantaram tad atirikte eva śaktiḥ kalpanīyā
translated: For when action is not fit to be connected with the effect, the power cannot be imagined in the subject. Therefore, by unfitness, after the exclusion of action, the power is to be imagined only in what is left over.

original: na ca kriyātiriktakāryāt kāryamātraṃ laghuḥ tataḥ kriyāpi śakyaiveti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca kriyā atirikta kāryāt kārya mātram laghuḥ tatas kriyā api śakyā evā iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that from an effect other than action, an effect alone is simpler, so action too is possible.

original: yato na brūmaḥ kriyātiriktakāryatvena śaktiḥ kintvayogyatayā kriyāyāṃ nirastāyāṃ
analyzed: yatas na brūmaḥ kriyā atirikta kāryatvena śaktiḥ kintu ayogyatayā kriyāyām nirastāyām
translated: Because we do not say that power is due to being an effect other than action, but when action is excluded by unfitness,

original: dharmiṇi śaktikalpanasamaye yat kriyātiriktaṃ tatra śaktiḥ na tu śaktigrahe kriyāpraveśaḥ
analyzed: dharmiṇi śakti kalpana samaye yat kriyā atiriktam tatra śaktiḥ na tu śakti grahe kriyā praveśaḥ
translated: when power is imagined in the subject, it is in what is left over apart from action, not that action enters into the cognition of power.

original: na hi yatprayuktānupapattyā yatkalpanaṃ tadeva tasya viṣayaḥ evañca kāryatvenāpi
analyzed: na hi yad prayukta anupapattyā yat kalpanam tat eva tasya viṣayaḥ evañca kāryatvena api
translated: For that which is imagined due to the non-applicability of what is employed, that alone is its object. And thus, even by being an effect,

original: tadatiriktakārye eva śaktikalpanānnitya niṣedhayorapi tadevopāsanādyanvayayogyaṃ
analyzed: tad atirikta kārye eva śakti kalpanāt nitya niṣedhayoḥ api tat eva upāsana ādi anvaya yogyam
translated: the power is imagined only in what is left over apart from that. Therefore, even in the eternal negations, that alone is fit to be connected with meditation etc.,

original: liṅgābhidhīyate na tu kāryatvamātraṃ dharmiṇi bādhakābhāvāt lakṣaṇāprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: liṅgā abhidhīyate na tu kāryatva mātram dharmiṇi bādhaka abhāvāt lakṣaṇā prasaṅgāt ca
translated: and is called the indicative, not mere being an effect, because there is no contradiction in the subject, and because of the possibility of figurative usage.

original: ghaṭādistu liṅgaśaktigrahe na tiraskriyate na puraskriyate uyayathāpi gauravāt /
analyzed: ghaṭa ādiḥ tu liṅga śakti grahe na tiraskriyate na puraskriyate gauravāt
translated: But the pot etc. is neither concealed nor brought to the fore in the cognition of the power of the word, just as it is not due to heaviness.

original: anvitābhidhānadaśāyānvayogyatayā tasyāpraveśaḥ vidhipratyayasya ca tatrāprayogaḥ kevalasya tasyāsādhutvāt /
analyzed: anvita abhidhāna daśāyāḥ anu a yogya tayā tasya apraveśaḥ vidhi pratyayasya ca tatra aprayogaḥ kevalasya tasya asādhu tvāt
translated: In the stage of the expression of the relation, it does not enter due to unsuitability, and the optative suffix is not used there, because the mere [word] is ungrammatical.

original: dhātusamabhivyāhārasthale ca tadarthenānvayabodhajanananiyamena ghaṭādyapratipādakatvāt /
analyzed: dhātu samabhivyāhāra sthale ca tad arthena anvaya bodha janana niyamena ghaṭa ādi apratipādaka tvāt
translated: And in the case of co-occurrence with the root, it does not denote the pot etc. due to the restriction on the generation of the understanding of the relation with its meaning.

original: ata evāprayogādevāprayogo 'pūrvatvaṃ vā prayogopādhiriti vadanti /
analyzed: atas eva a prayogāt eva a prayogo pūrva tvam vā prayoga upādhiḥ iti vadanti
translated: For this very reason, they say that the non-use is due to non-use itself, or the novelty is the condition of use.

original: athāpratipādyadhaṭādivṛttitayā na kāryatvaṃ pravṛttinimittaṃ pratipādyaghaṭādivṛttitayā
analyzed: atha apratipādya dhaṭa ādi vṛtti tayā na kāryatvam pravṛtti nimittam pratipādya ghaṭa ādi vṛtti tayā
translated: Now, because it occurs in the pot etc. that is not denoted, causality is not the cause of usage. Because it occurs in the pot etc. that is denoted,

original: na kāryatvaṃ pravṛttinimittaṃ pratipādyamātravṛttereva tathātvāt anyathā prameyatvameva
analyzed: na kārya tvam pravṛtti nimittam pratipādya mātra vṛtteḥ eva tathātvāt anyathā prameya tvam eva
translated: causality is not the cause of usage. Because it occurs only in what is denoted, it is so. Otherwise, the mere object of knowledge would be so.

original: tathāstviti cet na yatprakārikā hi pratipattiḥ padajanyā tadeva tatra pravṛttinimittaṃ
analyzed: tathā astu iti ced na yad prakārikā hi pratipattiḥ pada janyā tat eva tatra pravṛtti nimittam
translated: If it is said that it may be so, no. For the cognition of which type is generated by the word, that alone is the cause of usage there.

original: phalakalpyatvāt śakteḥ na tu pratipādyamātravṛtti sāsnādau vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: phala kalpya tvāt śakteḥ na tu pratipādya mātra vṛtti sāsnā ādau vyabhicārāt
translated: Because the power is assumed as the result, it does not occur only in what is denoted. Because there is deviation in the dewlap etc.

original: na ca prameyatvaṃ tathā tadbodhasyāpravartakatvāt /
analyzed: na ca prameya tvam tathā tad bodhasya apravartaka tvāt
translated: And prameyatva (cognizability) is not so, because the cognition of that does not instigate action.

original: ata eva lāke liṅg lākṣaṇiko kriyābhinne dharmiṇi vede śaktikalpanāt /
analyzed: atas eva kriyā bhinne dharmiṇi vede śakti kalpanāt
translated: For this very reason, in the world, the suffix is figurative in a property-possessor different from action, but in the Veda, the assumption of potency is made.

original: na ca laukikānāmapūrve tātparyaṃ sambhavati pūrvaṃ pramāṇāntareṇāpratīte kriyāsādhāraṇaśaktāvapi
analyzed: na ca laukikānām apūrve tātparyam sambhavati pūrvam pramāṇa antareṇa apratīte kriyā sādhāraṇa śaktau api
translated: And it is not possible for worldly people to have the purport in an unseen object, even if the common potency in action is cognized earlier by another means of knowledge.

original: loke lakṣaṇaiva pacetetyatra hi pākakāryatāvagamyate tatra kāryatve liṅgastātparyaṃ lāghavāt /
analyzed: loke lakṣaṇā eva paceta iti atra hi pāka kāryatā avagamyate tatra kāryatve liṅgaḥ tātparyam lāghavāt
translated: For example, in the sentence pacati (cooks), the result of cooking is understood. There, the purport is in the result, which is the mark of the suffix, due to simplicity.

original: na dharmiṇi kriyāyā dhātulabhyatvāt /🔽tadāhuḥ tātparyāddhi vṛttirna tu vṛttestātparyamiti tṛtīyāyāḥ karaṇatvaikatvāt kāryaṃ
analyzed: na dharmiṇi kriyāyāḥ dhātu labhya tvāt  tat āhuḥ tātparyāt hi vṛttiḥ na tu vṛtteḥ tātparyam iti tṛtīyāyāḥ karaṇa tva ekatvāt kāryam
translated: Not in the property-possessor, because the action is obtained from the verbal root.🔽They say: The occurrence is due to the purport, not the purport due to the occurrence. Because the instrumental case has the meaning of instrument and unity, the result

original: kāryatvañca na svatantraṃ śakyaṃ kintu viśiṣṭaṃ viśiṣṭācca viśeṣaṇamanyadeveti kāryatve lakṣaṇā /
analyzed: kāryatvam ca na svatantram śakyam kintu viśiṣṭam viśiṣṭāt ca viśeṣaṇam anyat eva iti kāryatve lakṣaṇā
translated: and the result-ness are not independent and capable, but qualified. And from the qualified, the qualifier is different. Therefore, there is figurative indication in the result-ness.

original: na ca kāryatvaviśiṣṭadharmyupasthitāvapi dharmyaṃśamapahāya kriyāyāṃ kāryatvānvayo 'stu kiṃ lakṣaṇayeti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca kāryatva viśiṣṭa dharmi upasthitau api dharmi aṃśam apahāya kriyāyām kāryatva anvayaḥ stu kim lakṣaṇayā iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even when the property-possessor qualified by result-ness is presented, let the result-ness be related to the action, leaving aside the property-possessor part, what is the use of figurative indication?

original: na hītaradharmigatatvenopasthitasya dharmyantarākāṅkāsti ataḥ svatantrakāryatvopasthitaye
analyzed: na hi itara dharmi gata tvena upasthitasya dharmi antara ākāṅkā asti atas svatantra kāryatva upasthitaye
translated: For what is presented as belonging to a different substratum does not require another substratum. Therefore, for the presentation of independent action,

original: dharmyantarākāṅkṣāsti ataḥ svatantrakāryatvopasthitaye lakṣaṇā yathā puroḍāśakapālena
analyzed: dharmi antara ākāṅkṣā asti atas svatantra kāryatva upasthitaye lakṣaṇā yathā puroḍāśa kapālena
translated: there is a requirement for another substratum. Therefore, there is figurative meaning for the presentation of independent action, just as in the sentence He cooks the husks with the sacrificial ladle for the cake.

original: tuṣānupapacatītyatra puroḍāśarthitayā tadanvitatvenopasthitasya kapālasya nopavāpākāṅkṣeti
analyzed: tuṣān upapacati iti atra puroḍāśa rthitayā tad anvita tvena upasthitasya kapālasya na upavāpa ākāṅkṣā iti
translated: Here, the sacrificial ladle, which is presented as connected with that [cake] by being desired for the cake, does not require a pouring.

original: svatantrakapālopasthitaye 'dhiṣṭhānalakṣaṇā /
analyzed: svatantra kapāla upasthitaye dhiṣṭhāna lakṣaṇā
translated: Therefore, for the presentation of the independent sacrificial ladle, there is figurative meaning as the substratum.

original: na ca vyutpattivirodhaḥ na hi loke kriyākāryatve śaktiravadhāritā yena virodho bhavet kintu kāryatvamātre kriyāyā dhātulabhyatvāt /
analyzed: na ca vyutpatti virodhaḥ na hi loke kriyā kārya tve śaktiḥ avadhāritā yena virodhaḥ bhavet kintu kārya tva mātre kriyāyāḥ dhātu labhya tvāt
translated: And there is no contradiction with derivation. For in the world, the capacity is not determined in action and the effect, by which there would be a contradiction. Rather, in mere effect, because action is obtained from the verbal root.

original: na ca dharmyantare śaktāvapi tadbhaṅgaḥ tasmāt prakṛtyarthānvitasvārthabodhakatvaṃ pratyayānāṃ gṛhītaṃ pratyayārthaścāpūrvamapīti na virodhaḥ
analyzed: na ca dharmi antare śaktau api tad bhaṅgaḥ tasmāt prakṛti artha anvita sva artha bodhaka tvam pratyayānām gṛhītam pratyaya arthaḥ ca apūrvam api iti na virodhaḥ
translated: And even when there is capacity in a different substratum, there is no split of that. Therefore, there is no contradiction, since the meaning of the verbal root, which is connected with the meaning of the verb, is understood to indicate the meaning of the suffix, and the meaning of the suffix is also the unseen potency.

original: astu vā loke liṅgaḥ kriyākāryatve śaktiḥ tathāpi tadbhaṅgaṃ vinaiva nānārthanyāyena vede dharmyantare śaktistāṃ vinā svargakāmānvayāsambhavāt
analyzed: astu vā loke liṅgaḥ kriyā kāryatve śaktiḥ tathā api tad bhaṅgam vinā eva nānārtha nyāyena vede dharmi antare śaktiḥ tām vinā svarga kāma anvaya asambhavāt
translated: Let there be an indication in the world of the potency in the effect of action, even so, without that being broken, by the principle of multiple meanings, the potency in another dharma in the Veda is due to the impossibility of the connection with one desiring heaven without that.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: anye tu pacetetyādau dhātunaiva pākaḥ kāryo 'bhidhīyate liṅg tatra tātparyagrāhikā
analyzed: anye tu paceta ityādau dhātunā eva pākaḥ kāryaḥ abhidhīyate liṅg tatra tātparya grāhikā
translated: Others think that in sentences like 'pacet' (should cook), cooking is denoted by the root itself, and the indication is

original: na tu śaktā niyamatastādṛśyeva tatprayogāt sāmānyaśabdasya viśeṣaparatvañca na vṛttyantaranirvāhyaṃ
analyzed: na tu śaktā niyamataḥ tādṛśī eva tad prayogāt sāmānya śabdasya viśeṣa para tvam ca na vṛtti antara nirvāhyam
translated: but not the potency, because of the impossibility of such a usage. And the restriction of a general word to a particular meaning is not to be accomplished by another operation.

original: ata eva vartamānatvādau na laṅgādiśaktiriti loke śakyagrahāt na vyutpattivirodha
analyzed: atas eva vartamāna tva ādau na laṅga ādi śaktiḥ iti loke śakya grahāt na vyutpatti virodha
translated: For this very reason, in the present tense etc., there is no potency of the indicative etc. in the world, because of the apprehension of the possible, there is no contradiction in the derivation of meaning.

original: iti tadasat liṅaḥ kāryatve 'śaktau pacipadāt kāryatvajñānānupapatteḥ yugapadvṛttidvayavirodhāt /
analyzed: iti tat asat liṅaḥ kārya tve śaktau paci padāt kārya tva jñāna anupapatteḥ yugapad vṛtti dvaya virodhāt
translated: This is wrong, because if the indicative does not have the potency in the effect, the knowledge of the effect from the word 'pacet' (should cook) is not possible, because of the contradiction of two operations simultaneously.

original: na cājahatsvārthā ubhayasādhāraṇasyānupasthiteriti dik /
analyzed: na ca ajahat svārthāḥ ubhaya sādhāraṇasya anupasthiteḥ iti diś
translated: And it is not that both are common without abandoning their own meanings, because of the non-apprehension of the common. This is the direction.

original: yadvā jñāne padānāṃ śaktiḥ śakyatvāt evañca liṅgapadaṃ ekatroccāraṇe yogyatādivaśāt
analyzed: yat vā jñāne padānām śaktiḥ śakya tvāt evam ca liṅga padam ekatra uccāraṇe yogya tā ādi vaśāt
translated: Or, the potency of words is in knowledge, because of the possibility. And thus, in the utterance of the indicative word in one place, by the power of fitness etc.,

original: yāgaviṣayakaṃ stāyisvargajanakaṃ kāryamityekaṃ jñānamanubhavarūpaṃ pracuradravyaguṇakarmavilakṣaṇaviṣayaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: yāga viṣayakam stāyi svarga janakam kāryam iti ekam jñānam anubhava rūpam pracura dravya guṇa karma vilakṣaṇa viṣayam kriyate
translated: The knowledge that the sacrifice produces a lasting heaven is produced as an experience, having an object different from the many substances, qualities and actions.

original: na caivaṃ nānārthavadekaikajñāne śaktigrahādekaikaviṣayo 'nubhavo bhavet na samuditaviṣaya iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam nānā artha vat ekaika jñāne śakti grahāt ekaika viṣayaḥ nubhavaḥ bhavet na samudita viṣayaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that thus, due to the apprehension of potency in each cognition of multiple meanings, the experience would have each meaning as its object, not the combined object.

original: śaktigrahakāle ekatroccāraṇa iti viśeṣaṇamahimnā tatsambhavāt nānārthe tu pramāṇābhāvena gauravena ca śaktigrahe tasyāpraveśanāt /
analyzed: śakti graha kāle ekatra uccāraṇe iti viśeṣaṇa mahimnā tad sambhavāt nānārthe tu pramāṇa abhāvena gauravena ca śakti grahe tasya apraveśanāt
translated: Because that is possible by the power of the qualification on one utterance at the time of apprehending potency, but in the case of multiple meanings, due to the absence of evidence and the difficulty, the potency is not admitted.

original: tathāpyamīṣāṃ samūhālambanaṃ syānna tu parasparaṃ vaiśiṣṭyajñānamiti cet na sākāṅkṣadharmadharmigocaraikajñānasyaiva viśiṣṭajñānatvāt cana
analyzed: tathā api amīṣām samūha ālambanam syāt na tu parasparam vaiśiṣṭya jñānam iti ced na sākāṅkṣa dharma dharmi gocara eka jñānasya eva viśiṣṭa jñāna tvāt cana
translated: Even so, it would be a collective apprehension, but not the knowledge of mutual distinction. If it is said that this is not so, because only the single knowledge that has a desireless property and property-possessor as its domain is the knowledge of the distinguished,

original: ca samūhālambanasambhedaḥ /
analyzed: ca samūha ālambana sambhedaḥ
translated: there is no confusion of collective apprehension.

original: tasya nirākāṅkṣaviṣayatvāt /
analyzed: tasya nirākāṅkṣa viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because that has a desireless object.

original: astu vopasthiteṣṭhagṛhītāsaṃsargeṣu sthāyitvasvargajanakatvakāryatveṣu śaktiḥ agṛhītāsaṃsargakasyāpi
analyzed: astu vā upasthita iṣṭha gṛhīta a saṃsargeṣu sthāyi tva svarga janaka tva kārya tveṣu śaktiḥ agṛhīta a saṃsargakasya api
translated: Let there be potency in the presented, grasped, and non-related permanence, heaven-producing, and effect. Even for one that is grasped but not related,

original: viśiṣṭajñānasamānaśīlatvāt ata uktanyāyena tāvadviṣayakamekaṃ jñānaṃ liṅgpadena janyate /
analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñāna samāna śīla tvāt atas ukta nyāyena tāvat viṣayakam ekam jñānam liṅg padena janyate
translated: Because of having the same nature as the superior knowledge, therefore, by the stated reasoning, one cognition with that object is produced by the word denoting the sign.

original: evamevālaukikārtheṣu svargādipadeṣu śaktigrahaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva alaukika artheṣu svarga ādi padeṣu śakti grahaḥ
translated: In the same way, there is comprehension of potency in the words denoting supermundane objects like heaven etc.

original: nanu bhavatūktaprakāreṇa śaktigrahastathāpi liṅpadāt yāgaviṣayakakāryānubhave satyapūrvalābhāt
analyzed: nanu bhavatu ukta prakāreṇa śakti grahaḥ tathā api liṅ padāt yāga viṣayaka kārya anubhave satya pūrva lābhāt
translated: Now, let there be comprehension of potency in the stated manner, even then, from the word denoting the sign, when there is the experience of the object, namely the sacrifice, there is the attainment of the unseen potency.

original: svargakāmānvayaḥ sambhavatītyupapādakapratisandhāne prasiddhārthasvargakāmapadasamabhivyāhārānyathānupapattyā
translated: The connection with one who desires heaven is possible. Thus, in the synthesis of the establishing factor, by the non-apprehension of the co-occurrence of the well-known word heaven and desire,

original: liṅgaḥ kārye śaktikalpanaṃ /
analyzed: liṅgaḥ kārye śakti kalpanam
translated: the potency of the word denoting the sign is imagined in the object.

original: na hi prathamamupapādakapratisandhānaṃ vinārthāpattiḥ sambhavati /
analyzed: na hi prathamam upapādaka pratisandhānam vinā arthāpattiḥ sambhavati
translated: For, without first the synthesis of the establishing factor, the presumption is not possible.

original: na ca śaktikalpanāt pūrvaṃ upapādakaśarīraniviṣṭamapūrvaṃ jñātamiti cet tat kiṃ ya
analyzed: na ca śakti kalpanāt pūrvam upapādaka śarīra niviṣṭam apūrvam jñātam iti ced tat kim
translated: And if it is said that before the imagination of the potency, the unseen potency included in the body of the establishing factor is known, then what is that

original: eva viśeṣa upapādakaḥ pakṣadharmatābalāt siddhyati tatpratisandhānamarthāpattau kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: eva viśeṣaḥ upapādakaḥ pakṣa dharma tā balāt siddhi ati tad pratisandhānam arthāpattau kāraṇam
translated: special establishing factor which is established by the power of the property of the subject? The synthesis of that is the cause of the presumption.

original: tathātve pūrvaṃ gṛhītamātrasya kalpyate
analyzed: tathātve pūrvam gṛhīta mātrasya kalpyate
translated: If it were so, then of what is merely apprehended before, there is imagination.

original: kalpanocchedāpattiḥ /
translated: There would be the fault of the cessation of imagination.

original: tasmāt yathā sāmānyatobhojanasya pīnatvasambandhāvagamāt upapādakatarke sati kalpanāto
analyzed: tasmāt yathā sāmānyatobhojanasya pīna tva sambandha avagamāt upapādaka tarke sati kalpanātaḥ
translated: Therefore, just as the connection between general eating and stoutness is understood, and when the reasoning that establishes it is accomplished, the specific understanding arises from imagination,

original: viśeṣāvagamaḥ yathā vā sāmānyaśaktavyaktivācakapadena samabhivyāhāravaśādviśeṣābhidhānamevamatrāpi
analyzed: viśeṣa avagamaḥ yathā vā sāmānya śakta vyakti vācaka padena samabhivyāhāra vaśāt viśeṣa abhidhānam evam atra api
translated: just as the specific expression is due to the force of co-occurrence with a word that expresses the individual that has general power, so too in this case,

original: kāryamātravācakatve kāryaviśeṣalābhaḥ sambhavatīti tarkitopapādakapratisandhānād
translated: the acquisition of a specific effect is possible when the word expresses mere effect. Thus, from the recollection of the reasoning that establishes it,

original: bhavatyarthāpattyā śaktikalpanaṃ yāgaviṣayakañca kāryaṃ na ghaṭādi tasya saviṣayakatvābhāvāt
analyzed: bhavati arthāpattyā śakti kalpanam yāga viṣayakam ca kāryam na ghaṭa ādi tasya sa viṣayaka tva abhāvāt
translated: the imagination of power arises through presumption, and the effect is related to the sacrifice, not to the pot etc., because it is not related to an object.

original: viṣayatvañca jñānaghaṭayoriva svabhāvasambandho vā tannirūpaṇādhīnanirūpaṇatvaṃ vā
analyzed: viṣaya tvañca jñāna ghaṭayoḥ iva svabhāva sambandhaḥ vā tad nirūpaṇa adhīna nirūpaṇa tvam vā
translated: The relation to an object is either a natural relation like that between knowledge and the pot, or the dependence of the determination on that,

original: tatsānasaṃvitasaṃvedyatvaṃ vā vyāvṛttasādhanatvaṃ veti /
analyzed: tad sāna saṃvita saṃvedya tvam vā vyāvṛtta sādhana tvam vā iti
translated: or the cognition of that as cognized by the same cognition, or the quality of being the means of exclusion.

original: asti hi yāgadānahomajanyāpūrvāṇāṃ tulyarūpasādhanāntaravyavacchedena pratyekamātrajanyatvam /🔽taduktaṃ viśabdo hi viśeṣārthaḥ sinotirbandha ucyate /
analyzed: asti hi yāga dāna homa janya apūrvāṇām tulya rūpa sādhana antara vyavacchedena pratyeka mātra janya tvam  tat uktam viśabdaḥ hi viśeṣa arthaḥ sinotiḥ bandhaḥ ucyate
translated: For there is the mere production of each of the non-effects produced by sacrifice, gift, and oblation, by excluding other similar means.🔽For it is said: The word vi is for viśeṣa (particular), and sinoti is said to be bandhu (relation).

original: viśeṣeṇa sinotīti viṣayo 'to niyāmakaḥ iti /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa sinoti iti niyāmakaḥ iti
translated: Since it binds with a particular, the object is the determiner.

original: nanu yena rūpeṇa śaktigrahaḥ tena rūpeṇa kāryatvaśaktāliṅg padāllakṣaṇayā kāryopasthitau
analyzed: nanu yena rūpeṇa śakti grahaḥ tena rūpeṇa padāt lakṣaṇayā kārya upasthitau
translated: But by the word which denotes the causal relation, the effect is presented by the power of suggestion, in the form in which the power is apprehended,

original: yogyatādivaśādapūrvalābho 'stu kāryasmaraṇaṃ hi anvitābhidhānopayogi na tvapūrvasmaraṇaṃ
analyzed: yogyatā ādi vaśāt apūrva lābhaḥ stu kārya smaraṇam hi anvita abhidhāna upayogi na tu apūrva smaraṇam
translated: and the unseen result is obtained by the force of fitness, etc. Let there be the remembrance of the effect, which is useful for the expression of the related meaning, but not the remembrance of the unseen result.

original: tacca padena padārthena veti na kaścidviśeṣaḥ kāryañca śakyakāryatvasambandhitayāvagatameveti
analyzed: tat ca padena padārthena vā iti na kaścid viśeṣaḥ kāryam ca śakya kāryatva sambandhi tayā avagatam eva iti
translated: And whether it is by the word or by the meaning of the word, there is no difference. And the effect is understood only as connected with the relation of the possible effect.

original: cet na liṅgo lākṣaṇikatvenāpūrvānanubhāvakatvāt /
analyzed: ced na liṅgaḥ lākṣaṇika tvena apūrva ananubhāvaka tvāt
translated: If it is argued that this is not so, because the word denoting the causal relation does not indicate the unseen result by the power of suggestion,

original: na cetarānvitasvārthaśaktasya yajyādipadasyetaradapūrvamādāyānubhāvakatvamiti vācyam /🔽itaropalakṣitasvārthānvayamātre hi padānāṃ śaktirna tvitaratra gauravāt padāntaralabhyatvācca /
analyzed: na ca itara anvita svārtha śaktasya yaji ādi padasya itarat apūrvam ādāya anubhāvaka tvam iti vācyam  itara upalakṣita svārtha anvaya mātre hi padānām śaktiḥ na tu itaratra gauravāt pada antara labhya tvāt ca
translated: and it cannot be said that the word yajya, etc., which has the power to connect with something else, indicates the other unseen result,🔽then it is said that the words have the power only to connect with their own meaning, which is qualified by something else, not in any other way, because of the heavy burden and because it is obtained from another word.

original: lakṣaṇāyāñca tīropalakṣitānvayaśālisvārthānubhāvakatvīmitarapadasya tīrasya tu saṃskārādupasthitirasannihitenānvitābhidhānābhāvāt /
analyzed: lakṣaṇāyām ca tīra upalakṣita anvaya śāli svārtha anubhāvaka tvīm itara padasya tīrasya tu saṃskārāt upasthitiḥ asannihitena anvita abhidhāna abhāvāt
translated: And in the case of suggestion, the other word indicates its own meaning, which is connected with the meaning qualified by the other, but the other, i.e., the bank, is presented by memory, because there is no expression of the related meaning by what is not present.

original: na cāpūrvaṃ saṃskāraviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: na ca apūrvam saṃskāra viṣayaḥ
translated: And the unseen result is not the object of memory.

original: kiñca yajipadena svargakāmakāryaviṣayo yāga ityunubhavobhavet lakṣaṇāyāmitarapadasya lakṣaṇīyaviśeṣaṇasvārthaviśeṣyakānubhavajanakatvāt /
analyzed: kiñca yaji padena svarga kāma kārya viṣayaḥ yāgaḥ iti unubhavaḥ bhavet lakṣaṇāyām itara padasya lakṣaṇīya viśeṣaṇa sva artha viśeṣyaka anubhava janaka tvāt
translated: Moreover, if there were indication, the cognition would be that the sacrifice is the object of the action of one desiring heaven, by the word 'yaji' (sacrificer), because the other word (yaji) would generate the cognition of the qualified object consisting of the specific meaning of the qualifier to be indicated.

original: na caitādṛśo bodha ākāṅkṣitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca etādṛśaḥ bodhaḥ ākāṅkṣitaḥ
translated: And such a cognition is not desired.

original: na ca yāgāviśeṣitakāryamātreṇa svargakāmānvayaḥ pratīyate kintu yāgaviṣayakakāryaviśeṣe tathāca tathāvidhabodhārthaṃ liṅgaḥ kārye śaktireveti
analyzed: na ca yāga aviśeṣita kārya mātreṇa svarga kāma anvayaḥ pratīyate kintu yāga viṣayaka kārya viśeṣe tathā ca tathāvidha bodha artham liṅgaḥ kārye śaktiḥ eva iti
translated: And the connection of one desiring heaven is not understood by mere action not qualified by sacrifice, but by a specific action having sacrifice as its object. And thus, for such a cognition, there is only the power of the word 'karana' (means) in the action.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: apūrvavādasiddhāntaḥ
analyzed: apūrva vāda siddhāntaḥ
translated: The conclusion on the doctrine of apurva (unseen potency).

original: atrocyate /
analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

original: anvayaprayojakarūpavattvaṃ na yogyatā anāptokte payasā siñcatītyatra satyapyanvayaprayojakadravadravyatve bādhakapramāyāmanvayābodhāt /
analyzed: anvaya prayojaka rūpavat tvam na yogyatā anāpta ukte payasā siñcati iti atra sati api anvaya prayojaka drava dravya tve bādhaka pramāyām anvaya abodhāt
translated: The presence of the form that is the basis for the relation is not the fitness. Even when there is the property of being a liquid substance, which is the basis for the relation, in the statement sprinkling with milk by one who is not an authority, there is no cognition of the relation due to the presence of a contradictory cognition.

original: atha yogyatve 'pi svabādhakapramāyāmanvayābodhāt /
analyzed: atha yogya tve pi sva bādhaka pramāyām anvaya ābodhāt
translated: Or, even when there is fitness, there is no cognition of the relation due to the absence of one's own contradictory cognition.

original: atha yogyatve 'pi svabādhakapramāvirahaḥ kāraṇaṃ tarhi so 'pyavaśyāpekṣaṇīyaiti lāghavāt
analyzed: atha yogya tve pi sva bādhaka pramā virahaḥ kāraṇam tarhi sā u pi avaśya apekṣaṇīyā eti lāghavāt
translated: If, on the other hand, the absence of one's own contradictory cognition is the cause even when there is fitness, then that too must be necessarily taken into account. Therefore, due to lightness,

original: saiva yogyatā evañca tadeva yogyamayogyañca syāditi cet satyaṃ yathā daśāviśeṣe tadeva
analyzed: sā eva yogyatā evam ca tat eva yogyam ayogyam ca syāt iti ced satyam yathā daśā viśeṣe tat eva
translated: If it is argued that in that case, the same thing would be both fit and unfit, it is true that in a particular state, the same thing is

original: sākāṅkṣamanākāṅkṣamāsannañca tathā svabādhakapramātadvirahadaśāyāṃ tadevānvayabodhe
analyzed: sākāṅkṣam anākāṅkṣam āsannam ca tathā sva bādhaka pramāta dviraha daśāyām tat eva anvaya bodhe
translated: both expectant and non-expectant, and both proximate and remote. In the state of absence of the contradicting cognition, the same thing is said to be fit for the understanding of the relation in the

original: yogyamayogyañcābhidhīyate svabādhakapramāyāṃ tadvirahe vā yogyāyogyatāvyavahāradarśanāt
analyzed: yogyam ayogyam ca abhidhīyate sva bādhaka pramāyām tad virahe vā yogya ayogya tā vyavahāra darśanāt
translated: inferential mark, and unfit in the state of absence of the contradicting cognition, because the usage of fitness and unfitness is seen in the absence of the contradicting cognition.

original: svabādhakapramāvirahadaśāyāṃ yogyatādisattve 'pi vahninā siñcatītyatrānvayabodhaḥ
analyzed: sva bādhaka pramā viraha daśāyām yogyatā ādi sattve pi vahninā siñcati iti atra anvaya bodhaḥ
translated: Even in the presence of fitness etc. in the state of absence of the contradicting cognition, there is understanding of the relation in the

original: apramādoṣavatpuruṣaṇītatvāt /
analyzed: a pramā doṣavat puruṣaṇīta tvāt
translated: statement sprinkle with fire, because it is uttered by a person free from error and faults.

original: sāmānyabhānasya kiñcidviśeṣabhānaniyatatvāt viśeṣābhāne kathaṃ tadbhāsata iti na🔽vastugatyā paramparāsādhanaṃ viśeṣo bhāsata evaya paramparāsādhanatvantu prakāro
analyzed: sāmānya bhānasya kiñcid viśeṣa bhāna niyata tvāt viśeṣa abhāne katham tat bhāsate iti na  vastugatyā paramparā sādhanam viśeṣaḥ bhāsate paramparā sādhana tvantu
translated: Because the manifestation of the universal is always restricted to the manifestation of some particular, how can it appear when the particular is not manifested? This is not so.

original: na bhāsate tatprakārabhāne hi paramparāghaṭakajñānasya hetutvāt yathā ghaṭena jalamāharetyatra
analyzed: na bhāsate tad prakāra bhāne hi paramparā ghaṭaka jñānasya hetu tvāt yathā ghaṭena jalam āhara iti atra
translated: In reality, the particular which is the means of inference does appear, but the property of being the means of inference does not appear. For if the particular were to appear, then the cognition which is a component of the inference would appear as the cause, just as in the statement bring water with the pot,🔽the pot is the means of bringing water, but the property of being the means of bringing water does not appear.

original: yogyatayā chidretaraghaṭe ghaṭatvena bhāsate na tu chidretaratvena tathā sati lakṣaṇāyāṃ
analyzed: yogyatayā chidra itara ghaṭe ghaṭa tvena bhāsate na tu chidra itara tvena tathā sati lakṣaṇāyām
translated: By suitability, the pot other than the one with a hole appears as a pot, not as other than the one with a hole. If it were so, in the case of secondary meaning,

original: yugapad vṛttidvayavirodhena ghaṭānanvayaprasaṅgāt ubhayasādhāraṇarūpeṇānupasthiteśca nājahatsvārthā /
analyzed: yugapad vṛtti dvaya virodhena ghaṭa ananvaya prasaṅgāt ubhaya sādhāraṇa rūpeṇa anupasthiteḥ ca na ajahat svārthā
translated: there would be the undesirable consequence of the pot not being related due to the contradiction of two usages occurring simultaneously, and also because the form common to both is not present, it is not without its own meaning.

original: atha saṃskārāttadusthitiḥ /
analyzed: atha saṃskārāt tad usthitiḥ
translated: If it is argued that it is present there due to impression,

original: na ca subvibhaktīnāṃ prakṛtyarthagatasvārthānvayabodhakatvavyutpattestatra vibhaktyartho nāvyīyeteti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca sup vibhaktīnām prakṛti artha gata sva artha anvaya bodhaka tva vyutpatteḥ tatra vibhakti arthaḥ vācyam
translated: it cannot be said that the case endings do not express the relation of their own meaning to the meaning of the root, because of the established meaning of the case endings.

original: prakṛtyartho hi prakṛtipratipādyāḥ lakṣaṇīyānvayānurodhāt /
analyzed: prakṛti arthaḥ hi prakṛti pratipādyāḥ lakṣaṇīya anvaya anurodhāt
translated: For the meaning of the root is to be conveyed by the root, due to the requirement of the relation to be conveyed.

original: sa ca saṃskārasahakārāt prakṛte 'pi /
analyzed: sa ca saṃskāra sahakārāt prakṛte pi
translated: And that is due to the cooperation of impression even in the case of the root.

original: na ca tasyāniyatodbodhakānna niyatā tadupasthitiḥ /🔽phalabalena tathā kalpanāditi cet na śabdopasthāpi tanaiva śabdasyānvayabodhakatvāt /
analyzed: na ca tasya aniyata udbodhakāt na niyatā tad upasthitiḥ  phala balena tathā kalpanāt iti ced na śabda upasthāpi tanā eva śabdasya anvaya bodhaka tvāt
translated: And it cannot be said that its presence is not definite due to the indefinite arouser.🔽If it is argued that it is so assumed due to the force of the result, it is not so, because the word conveys that only, and the word conveys the relation.

original: na caivamākāśapadāśakyasya saṃskāropasthitasya śabdāśrayatvasya kathaṃ śābdānubhavaviṣayatvamiti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam ākāśa pada aśakyasya saṃskāra upasthitasya śabda āśraya tvasya katham śābda anubhava viṣaya tvam iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that how can the substratum of sound, which is not capable of being denoted by the word space and is present due to impression, be the object of verbal cognition.

original: niyamato yaddharmavattvenopasthite yatra śaktigrahaḥ tatsmaraṇajanakasaṃskārasya
analyzed: niyamataḥ yad dharmavat tvena upasthite yatra śakti grahaḥ tad smaraṇa janaka saṃskārasya
translated: When something is presented as having a certain property, where there is the apprehension of its capability, the impression that produces the memory

original: taddharmaviṣayatāniyamena tadudbodhakādeva tadaṃśe 'pi udbodhaniyamenākāśapadādaśakyasyāpi tasya bhānāt /
analyzed: tad dharma viṣaya tā niyamena tad udbodhakāt eva tad aṃśe pi udbodha niyamena ākāśa padāt aśakyasya api tasya bhānāt
translated: is not restricted to the form of that property. Even in that part, it is aroused only by what arouses it, because even what is incapable is manifested by the word 'ākāśa' due to the restriction on arousal.

original: astu vā tadapi śakyaṃ yadi niyamata upasthitiḥ sahaprayogasya vācyādiparatvenāpyupapatteḥ /
analyzed: astu vā tat api śakyam yadi niyamataḥ upasthitiḥ sahaprayogasya vācya ādi paratvena api upapatteḥ
translated: Or let that also be capable, if there is regular presentation. Because the co-occurrence can be explained as referring to what is expressed and so on.

original: vastutastu niyatopasthitireva nāsti /
analyzed: vastutas tu niyata upasthitiḥ eva na asti
translated: But in reality, there is no regular presentation at all.

original: astu vā padādapi nirvikalpakaṃ tarhyanvayabodhadaśāyāmitarānvayānupapattyabhāvādagrre
analyzed: astu vā padāt api nirvikalpakam tarhi anvaya bodha daśāyām itara anvaya anupapatti abhāvāt agrre
