translated: Or let there be an indeterminate cognition even from the word. Then, in the state of understanding the relation, there would be no assumption even earlier, because there is no impossibility of the relation with another.

original: 'pi kalpanā na syāditi cet tarhi tavāpi kāryatābodhānantaraṃ aupādānikamādhanatābodho
analyzed: pi kalpanā na syāt iti ced tarhi tava api kārya tā bodha anantaram aupādānika mādhana tā bodhaḥ
translated: If it is argued that then even for you, after the understanding of the function, the understanding of the means as derived would not occur,

original: na syāt aupādānikamādhanatābodho na syāt aupādānikabodhe 'nupapattibodhasya hetutvāt
analyzed: na syāt aupādānika mādhana tā bodhaḥ na syāt aupādānika bodhe nupapatti bodhasya hetu tvāt
translated: because the understanding of the impossibility is the cause of the derived understanding,

original: klapanāmātrocchedaścaivaṃ syāt pratītānupapattimūlatvāt kalpanāyāḥ /
analyzed: klapanā mātra ucchedaḥ ca evam syāt pratīta anupapatti mūla tvāt kalpanāyāḥ
translated: and there would be the destruction of mere assumption in this way, because assumption has the understanding of impossibility as its root.

original: vastutastu bādhakapramāvirahasya yogyatātve saṃśayapasādhāraṇaṃ jñānamātrameva tasyāḥ🔽prayojakaṃ tena yatra bādhakapramāniścayastatraivānvayabodhābhāvo 'nyatra tu taddhīmātrācchabdabodha
analyzed: vastutas tu bādhaka pramā virahasya yogyatā tve saṃśaya pa sādhāraṇam jñāna mātram eva tasyāḥ  prayojakam tena yatra bādhaka pramā niścayaḥ tatra eva anvaya bodha abhāvaḥ nyatra tu tad dhī mātrāt śabda bodha
translated: But in reality, mere knowledge, which is common to doubt and certainty, is the only cause of the absence of the cognition of contradiction, which is the fitness.🔽Therefore, where there is certainty of the cognition of contradiction, there is no understanding of the relation, but elsewhere, from that mere cognition, there is understanding of the word.

original: iti yāge 'pi yogyatāsaṃśayenānvayabodhāpratibandhaḥ bādhasaṃśayasyāpratibandhakatvāt
analyzed: iti yāge pi yogyatā saṃśayena anvaya bodha apratibandhaḥ bādha saṃśayasya apratibandhaka tvāt
translated: Even in doubt, there is no obstruction to the understanding of the relation due to the doubt of fitness, because the doubt of contradiction is not obstructive.

original: anyathā anumānādyucchedaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyathā anumāna ādi uccheda prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of the cessation of inference and so on.

original: apūrvavācyatve 'pyapūrve svargasādhanatāsaṃśayādyogyatāyāḥ saṃśaya eva apūrvasya
analyzed: apūrva vācya tve pi apūrve svarga sādhanatā saṃśayāt yogyatāyāḥ saṃśayaḥ eva apūrvasya
translated: Even in the case of the meaning being the unseen, there is doubt of fitness due to the doubt of heaven being the means in the unseen.

original: prathamaṃ svargasādhanatvāniścayādupādānasyānvitābhidhānottarakālīnatvāt sādhakabādhakapramāṇābhāvena
analyzed: prathamam svarga sādhanatva aniścayāt upādānasya anvita abhidhāna uttara kālīna tvāt sādhaka bādhaka pramāṇa abhāvena
translated: Because the unseen is not first ascertained as the means of heaven, and because the adoption comes after the expression of the relation, and because there is no absence of evidence either proving or disproving,

original: dvārasambhavanayā sādhanatvasambhāvanātaḥ svargakāmānvaya iti tulyam /🔽api ca yathā na kriyā sthiretyayoṅgyā tathā
analyzed: dvāra sambhavanayā sādhanatva sambhāvanātaḥ svarga kāma anvayaḥ iti tulyam  api ca yathā na kriyā sthirā iti ayā uṅgyā tathā
translated: there is the relation of heaven with the desire for heaven due to the possibility of being the means by the opening of the door.🔽Moreover, just as the action is not stable, so

original: kāryamapūrvamapi viśiṣṭaṃ na sthiraṃ kṛtervinaṣṭatvāt /
analyzed: kāryam apūrvam api viśiṣṭam na sthiram kṛteḥ vinaṣṭa tvāt
translated: the effect, the unseen, is also not stable when qualified, because the act is destroyed.

original: na cādhiṣeṭhāne apūrvamātre sādhanatvaṃ tasya padāryaikadeśatvenānvayāpratiyogitvāt /
analyzed: na ca adhiṣeṭhāne apūrva mātre sādhanatvam tasya padārya eka deśa tvena anvaya apratiyogi tvāt
translated: And in the case of injunctions, the means-ness does not belong to the unseen effect alone, because it is not a counter-entity to the connection as a part of the word.

original: anye tvanvayavirodhirūpaviraho yogyatā ata eva vahninā siñcatītyatra tad bhrame bhavatyanvayabhramaḥ /
analyzed: anye tu anvaya virodhi rūpa virahaḥ yogyatā atas eva vahninā siñcati iti atra tat bhrame bhavati anvaya bhramaḥ
translated: Others say that fitness is the absence of a form that is incompatible with the connection. For this very reason, when there is a mistake in sprinkling with fire, there is a mistake in the connection.

original: yāge cānvayavirodhirūpaviraho yogyānupalabdhyā sugama eva /
analyzed: yāge ca anvaya virodhi rūpa virahaḥ yogya anupalabdhyā sugamaḥ eva
translated: And in the case of sacrifice, the absence of a form that is incompatible with the connection is easily understood by the non-apprehension of the fit.

original: na ca yāge āśuvināśitvaṃ kālāntarabhāviphalajanakatvavirodhīti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca yāge āśu vināśi tvam kāla antara bhāvi phala janakatva virodhi iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that quick perishability in the case of sacrifice is incompatible with the production of a result that occurs at a later time.

original: anubhave kvāthapāne cāśuvinaśini kālāntarabhāviphalajanakatvād yāge 'pyantatastatsattvāt anyathāpūrvavaiphalyāt /
analyzed: anubhave kvātha pāne ca āśu vinaśini kāla antara bhāvi phala janaka tvāt yāge pi antatas tad sattvāt anyathā pūrva vaiphalyāt
translated: Because in experience and in drinking a decoction, which is quickly perishable, there is the production of a result that occurs at a later time, and because even in sacrifice, that exists in the end, otherwise the prior would be fruitless.

original: asmādanvayaprayojakarūpavattvaṃ laghviti cet na tatsattvepyanāptokte vyabhicārādanvayavirodhitvena
analyzed: asmāt anvaya prayojaka rūpavattvam laghu iti ced na tad sattve pi anāpta ukte vyabhicārāt anvaya virodhi tvena
translated: If it is said that because it has the form that is the cause of the connection, it is light, it is not so, because there is deviation in the statement of an untrustworthy person, even when it exists, by the incompatibility with the connection.

original: yatkiñcit pratisandhānaṃ tatrāstyeva antato bādhakapramāviṣayatvasyaiva virodhinojñānāditi /
analyzed: yat kiñcid pratisandhānam tatra asti eva antatas bādhaka pramā viṣaya tvasya eva virodhinaḥ jñānāt iti
translated: Any kind of recollection exists there, because even at the end, the object of the cognition of contradiction is the object of the cognition of contradiction.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: kāmyasādhanatvajñānameva pravartakaṃ lāghavāt /
translated: The knowledge of being the means of accomplishing what is desired is itself the instigator, because of simplicity.

original: siddhaudanastṛptikāmo laghūpāye bhojane pravartate na tu pāke gurarūpāyatvāt jalādyarthī ca sannihite /🔽ata eva jyotiṣṭomādau śrutasvargaphalakatve 'pi gurūpāyatvenānanuṣṭhānalakṣaṇāpramāṇyāpattyā phalabhūmā kalpyate iṣṭotpattyanāntarīyakaśramajanakatvaṃ
analyzed: siddhaudanaḥ tṛpti kāmaḥ laghu upāye bhojane pravartate na tu pāke guru upāya tvāt jala ādi arthī ca sannihite  atas eva jyotiṣṭoma ādau śruta svarga phalaka tve pi guru upāya tvena ananuṣṭhāna lakṣaṇa apramāṇya āpattyā phala bhūmā kalpyate iṣṭa utpatti anāntarīyaka śrama janaka tvam
translated: One desiring satisfaction engages in eating, which is a light means, not in cooking, because that is a heavy means. And one needing water engages in what is at hand.🔽For this very reason, even when the result is known as heaven in the Jyotiṣṭoma etc., because of the invalidity in the form of non-performance due to being a heavy means, a result is imagined.

original: vā pratibandhakaṃ /
analyzed: vā pratibandhakam
translated: Or the cause of obstruction is the production of the desired result, which is invariably concomitant with the production of fatigue.

original: api ca kāmyavyavahitasādhanatayā jñātameva yadi kāmī kartavyatayāvaitīti niyamaḥ🔽tadā pūrvamapi kāryatayā nāvagamyeta anvitābhidhānāt pūrvaṃ kāmyasādhanatābodhakābhāvādupadānasasyānvitābhidhānottarakālīnatvāt /
analyzed: api ca kāmya vyavahita sādhanatayā jñātam eva yadi kāmī kartavya tayā avaiti iti niyamaḥ  tadā pūrvam api kārya tayā na avagamyeta anvita abhidhānāt pūrvam kāmya sādhanatā bodhaka abhāvāt upadāna sasya anvita abhidhāna uttara kālīna tvāt
translated: Moreover, if it is a rule that one who desires what is known as the means to a desired object should know it as something to be done,🔽then it would not be known as something to be done even before, because of the denotation of the relation, because before the denotation of the relation there is no awareness of being the means to the desired object, because it occurs after the denotation of the relation of the word.

original: ata eva kāmyādanyadityādi prakāradvayaṃ nirastaṃ kāryatābuddhau pravṛttau vā kāmyasādhanatvasyaiva hetutvāt /
analyzed: atas eva kāmyāt anyat ityādi prakāra dvayam nirastam kāryatā buddhau pravṛttau vā kāmya sādhanatvasya eva hetu tvāt
translated: For this very reason, the two types beginning with other than the desired are refuted, because in the cognition of being to be done or in engagement, only being the means to the desired is the cause.

original: na ca kārye ghaṭādau liṅaśaktigrahakāle svargakāmānvayāyogyatvāt kriyānirāsastathā yāgānvayānupapattyā ghaṭādinirāso 'pi syāt /
analyzed: na ca kārye ghaṭa ādau liṅa śakti graha kāle svarga kāma anvaya ayogya tvāt kriyā nirāsaḥ tathā yāga anvaya anupapattyā ghaṭa ādi nirāsaḥ pi syāt
translated: And when the potency of the optative is grasped in the effect like a pot, the action cannot be excluded because it is not fit to be connected with one desiring heaven, and similarly the pot etc. cannot be excluded because of the impossibility of connection with the sacrifice.

original: na hi yāgaviṣayako ghaṭādiḥ sambhavati anyathā anvitābhidhānadaśāyāmapi tanniraso na syāt /
analyzed: na hi yāga viṣayakaḥ ghaṭa ādiḥ sambhavati anyathā anvita abhidhāna daśāyām api tad nirasaḥ na syāt
translated: For an object like a pot with regard to the sacrifice is not possible, otherwise even in the stage of expressing the related meaning, its exclusion would not occur.

original: syādetat svargakāmānvayānupapattyā tadanvayayogye liṅaśaktigrahaḥ sthāyikāryañca tathā ataḥ śaktigrahakāle kriyānirāso yujyate na ghaṭādeḥ
analyzed: syāt etat svarga kāma anvaya anupapattyā tad anvaya yogye liṅa śakti grahaḥ sthāyi kāryam ca tathā atas śakti graha kāle kriyā nirāsaḥ yujyate na ghaṭa ādeḥ
translated: This may be said: By the impossibility of connection with one desiring heaven, the potency of the optative is grasped in what is fit to be connected with that, and the permanent effect is so. Therefore, at the time of grasping the potency, the exclusion of action is proper, not of the pot etc.

original: yajipadamantarbhāvya svargakāmapadaliṅapadābhyāṃ anvitābhidhānadaśāyāṃ ghaṭādinirāso
analyzed: yaji padam antar bhāvya svarga kāma pada liṅ padābhyām anvita abhidhāna daśāyām
translated: By the words one desiring heaven and optative, expressing the related meaning, the exclusion of the pot etc. is done by including the word sacrifice,

original: yāgānvayayogyatvāditi tat kiṃ śaktigrahakāle yāgānvayanupapattirhastapihitā yena
analyzed: yāga anvaya yogya tvāt iti tat kim śakti graha kāle yāga anva anupapattiḥ hasta pihitā yena
translated: because it is fit to be connected with the sacrifice. Then, at the time of grasping the potency, is the impossibility of connection with the sacrifice concealed by the hand,

original: ghaṭādinirāsikā sā na pratisandhīyeta /
analyzed: ghaṭa ādi nirāsikā sā na pratisandhīyeta
translated: by which the exclusion of the pot etc. would not be remembered?

original: pratyuta pratyayasyāntaraṅgaprakṛtyarthānvayaṃ bodhayata evetarānvayabodhakatvamiti tadanvayānupapattipratisandhīyate /
analyzed: pratyuta pratyayasya antaraṅga prakṛti artha anvayam bodhayataḥ eva itara anvaya bodhaka tvam iti tad anvaya anupapattiḥ pratisandhīyate
translated: Rather, the capacity to make one understand the connection with the other is only of the suffix which makes one understand the connection of the internal primary meaning, so the impossibility of connection with that is remembered.

original: pratyuta pratyayasyāntaraṅgaprakṛtyarthānvayaṃ bodhayata evetarānvayabodhakatvamiti
analyzed: pratyuta pratyayasya antaraṅga prakṛti artha anvayam bodhayataḥ eva itara anvaya bodhaka tvam iti
translated: On the contrary, it is only when the cognition of the relation of the word to the primary meaning is produced that it can give rise to the cognition of the relation to other things.

original: tadanvayānupapattipratisandhānameva prāthamikaṃ puruṣadoṣādapratisandhāne śaktigraho
analyzed: tad anvaya anupapatti pratisandhānam eva prāthamikam puruṣa doṣāt apratisandhāne śakti grahaḥ
translated: Therefore, the primary thing is the remembrance of the impossibility of the relation, and in the absence of such remembrance due to a defect in the person, there is the apprehension of the relation of denotation.

original: bhrama eva ghaṭāderaśakyatvāt puruṣaviśeṣaṃ prati apūrvavācyatāpatteśca /
analyzed: bhramaḥ eva ghaṭa ādeḥ aśakya tvāt puruṣa viśeṣam prati apūrva vācya tā āpatteḥ ca
translated: It is only a mistake, because a pot etc. cannot be denoted, and because it would lead to the undesirable consequence that it would be denoted as something not heard before with regard to a particular person.

original: ghaṭādīnāmanantatvena yadi tannirāso na śakyaḥ tadā anvitābhidhānadaśāyāmapi na syāt pākādīnāṃ kriyātveneva pṛthivītvādinā nirāsasambhavācca
analyzed: ghaṭa ādīnām ananta tvena yadi tad nirāsaḥ na śakyaḥ tadā anvita abhidhāna daśāyām api na syāt pāka ādīnām kriyā tvena iva pṛthivī tva ādinā nirāsa sambhavāt ca
translated: And if it is not possible to exclude those because of their infinity, then it would not be possible even in the case of the theory of the relation of the denoted and the denotative, because it is possible to exclude them by the universal earthness etc. just as by the universal actionness in the case of cooking etc.

original: evañca pracuradravya guṇakarmasu nirasteṣu kva kārye dharmiṇi śaktigrahaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca pracura dravya guṇa karmasu nirasteṣu kva kārye dharmiṇi śakti grahaḥ
translated: And thus, when the abundant substances, qualities and actions have been excluded, where is the apprehension of the relation of denotation in the object which is the effect?

original: na ca viśeṣe niraste 'pi kāryasāmānyaṃ na nirastamiti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca viśeṣe niraste kārya sāmānyam na nirastam iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even when the particular is excluded, the universal of the effect is not excluded.

original: na hi viśeṣāviṣayaṃ sāmānyajñānaṃ sambhavati /
analyzed: na hi viśeṣa aviṣayam sāmānya jñānam sambhavati
translated: For, a cognition of the universal is not possible without the particular.

original: etenāpūrvasādhāraṇakāryatvena ghaṭādau śaktigraha iti parāstam /
analyzed: etena apūrva sādhāraṇa kāryatvena ghaṭa ādau śakti grahaḥ iti parāstam
translated: And thus, the view that the relation of denotation is apprehended in a pot etc. by the universal effectness common to the unseen potency is refuted.

original: agṛhītāsaṃsargeṣu sthāyitvakāryatvasvargajanakatveṣu tajjñaneṣu vā śaktigraha ityapi parāstaṃ sthāyināṃ ghaṭādīnāṃ nirāsāt dharmamātre ca
analyzed: agṛhīta asaṃsargeṣu sthāyi tva kārya tva svarga janaka tveṣu tad jñaneṣu vā śakti grahaḥ iti api parāstam sthāyinām ghaṭa ādīnām nirāsāt dharma mātre ca
translated: The view that the cognition of the enduring, the produced, and the cause of heaven is the apprehension of the power is also refuted, because enduring things like pots are denied.

original: śaktigrahasya prakṛte 'nupayogāt /
analyzed: śakti grahasya prakṛte n upayogāt
translated: And because the apprehension of power in mere dharma is not useful in the present context.

original: kiñca teṣu śaktigrahaḥ samuditeṣu pratyekaṃ vā nādyaḥ prathamaṃ samudāyasyaikajñānāviṣayatvāt
analyzed: kiñca teṣu śakti grahaḥ samuditeṣu pratyekam vā na ādyaḥ prathamam samudāyasya eka jñāna aviṣaya tvāt
translated: Moreover, is the apprehension of power in those [enduring things] collectively or individually? Not the first, because the aggregate is not the object of a single cognition at first.

original: viṣayatve vā pūrvameva viśiṣṭasya sattve 'pūrvatvavyāghātaḥ ekajñānaviṣayasākāṅkṣadharmadharmiṇoreva viśiṣṭatvāt /
analyzed: viṣaya tve vā pūrvam eva viśiṣṭasya sattve pūrva tva vyāghātaḥ eka jñāna viṣaya sākāṅkṣa dharma dharmiṇoḥ eva viśiṣṭa tvāt
translated: If it were the object, then the existence of the qualified [cognition] would be prior, contradicting the novelty [of the cognition], because only those related properties and property-bearers that are the objects of a single cognition are qualified.

original: na dvitīyaḥ evaṃ hi liṅapadāt smaraṇatrayaṃ yajipadācca yāgasmaraṇa /
analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ evam hi liṅa padāt smaraṇa trayam yaji padāt ca yāga smaraṇa
translated: If it were the second, then there would be three recollections from the optative suffix and the recollection of sacrifice from the word 'yaji'.

original: na ca caturṇāṃ teṣāṃ yaugapadyamasti /
analyzed: na ca caturṇām teṣām yaugapadyam asti
translated: And there is no simultaneity of those four.

original: na ca pratyekaṃ śaktigrahe 'pi samuditaviṣayakamekameva smaraṇaṃ liṅapadāditi yuktaṃ samudāyasya pūrvamananubhavāt /
analyzed: na ca pratyekam śakti grahe samudita viṣayakam ekam eva smaraṇam liṅa padāt iti yuktam samudāyasya pūrvam ananubhavāt
translated: And it is not proper that even when there is apprehension of power individually, there is only one recollection with the aggregate as its object from the optative suffix, because the aggregate has not been experienced before.

original: smaraṇañca yadi sākāṅkṣadharmadharmiviṣayakamekaṃ tadā apūrvatvakṣatiḥ ekajñānārūḍhayoḥ sākāṅkṣadharmadharmiṇoreva viśiṣṭatvāt tanniyatatvādvā
analyzed: smaraṇam ca yadi sākāṅkṣa dharma dharmi viṣayakam ekam tadā apūrva tva kṣatiḥ eka jñāna ārūḍhayoḥ sākāṅkṣa dharma dharmiṇoḥ eva viśiṣṭa tvāt tad niyata tvāt vā
translated: And if the remembrance is of a dharma and dharmin which require something else, then the novelty is lost, because only a dharma and dharmin which require something else and are included in one cognition are specific, or because that is determined.

original: etena svargādipadeṣu agṛhītāsaṃsargadharmadharmiṣu śaktigraha iti vyudastam /
analyzed: etena svarga ādi padeṣu agṛhīta asaṃsarga dharma dharmiṣu śakti grahaḥ iti vyudastam
translated: By this, the idea that in words like 'heaven' etc., where the dharma and dharmin are not grasped as connected, there is comprehension of potency, is refuted.

original: pratyekasamudāyaviṣayakasmaraṇavikalpagrāsāt /🔽astu vā liṅgaḥ kārye lakṣaṇā yathā hi mañcāḥ krośantītyādau puruṣaviśeṣaḥ prāgananubhūto
analyzed: astu vā liṅgaḥ kārye lakṣaṇā yathā hi mañcāḥ krośanti ityādau puruṣa viśeṣaḥ prāk ananubhūtaḥ
translated: Because of the inclusion of the alternatives of remembrance and imagination which have as their objects the individual and the collection.🔽Or let there be indication of the effect in the case of the word 'heaven' etc., just as in 'the benches are shouting' etc., a particular person who was not experienced before

original: 'pyanubhūyate itarapadāllākṣaṇikasyānubhāvakatvāt tathāpūrvamapi astu ca svargakāmakāryaviṣayo
analyzed: pi anubhūyate itara padāt lākṣaṇikasya anubhāvaka tvāt tathāpūrvam api astu ca svarga kāma kārya viṣayaḥ
translated: is experienced, because the indicated is experienced from the other word, so let there be the unseen effect also. And let the sacrifice have as its object the effect which is the object of the desire for heaven.

original: yāga iti śābdānubhavānantaramarthādyāgaviṣayakaṃ kāryamiti jñānaṃ anupapattiprabhavaṃ /
analyzed: yāgaḥ iti śābda anubhava anantaram arthāt yāga viṣayakam kāryam iti jñānam anupapatti prabhavam
translated: Thus, after the verbal experience, the knowledge that the effect has as its object the sacrifice is born from the impossibility.

original: ata eva śābdabodhānantaramaupādānikabodhātpradhātpravṛttiḥ /
analyzed: atas eva śābda bodha anantaram aupādānika bodhāt pradhāt pravṛttiḥ
translated: For this very reason, after the verbal knowledge, activity proceeds from the subsequent knowledge born from the effect.

original: kiñcāpūrvavācyatve 'pi na kalañjaṃ bhakṣayedityāditaḥ kalañjabhakṣaṇābhāvaviṣayakamapūrvamavagamyāpi
analyzed: kiñca apūrva vācya tve pi na kalañjam bhakṣayet iti āditaḥ kalañja bhakṣaṇa abhāva viṣayakam apūrvam avagamya api
translated: Moreover, even if the unseen is denoted, after 'one should not eat the kalanzha' etc., one understands the unseen which has as its object the absence of eating the kalanzha, but

original: na pravarteta tadabhāve tathāhi bhakṣaṇe rāgādasya kartavyatābuddhirjātā śabdācca
analyzed: na pravarteta tad abhāve tathā hi bhakṣaṇe rāgāt asya kartavya tā buddhiḥ jātā śabdāt ca
translated: It would not operate in its absence. Thus, for him, the cognition of the duty to eat arises from attachment, and from the word.

original: bhakṣaṇābhāve niṣphalāt kāryāt saphalaṃ garīya iti nyāyena sukhahetau bhakṣaṇa eva
analyzed: bhakṣaṇa abhāve niṣphalāt kāryāt saphalam garīyaḥ iti nyāyena sukha hetau bhakṣaṇe eva
translated: In the absence of eating, by the principle that a fruitful action is weightier than a fruitless one, he would engage in eating, which is the cause of pleasure,

original: pravarteta na tadabhāve niṣedhāpūrvameva phalamiti cet na tasya sukhaduḥkhābhāvānyatayā
analyzed: pravarteta na tad abhāve niṣedha apūrvam eva phalam iti ced na tasya sukha duḥkha abhāva anya tayā
translated: not in its absence. If it is argued that the mere prohibition is the result, no, because it is not pleasure, pain, or their absence.

original: phaṇḍatvenatadajanakatayāca gauṇamukhyaprayojanatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: phaṇḍa tvena tad ajanaka tayā ca gauṇa mukhya prayojana tva abhāvāt
translated: It is not the primary or secondary purpose because it does not produce them.

original: sukhavadapūrvamapi prayojanamiti cet na loke tathānavagamāt /
analyzed: sukha vat apūrvam api prayojanam iti ced na loke tathā anavagamāt
translated: If it is argued that the unseen effect is also the purpose like pleasure, no, because it is not known to be so in the world.

original: alaukikayoḥ svargapavargayoḥ lokāvagataprayojanasukha duḥkhābhāvajātīyatayā prayojanatvaṃ
analyzed: alaukikayoḥ svarga pavargayoḥ loka avagata prayojana sukha duḥkha abhāva jātīya tayā prayojana tvam
translated: The non-worldly heaven and liberation are the purpose because they belong to the class of pleasure and absence of pain known in the world.

original: vede 'pi kāmyasthale kāmyasādhanasyaivāpūrvasya gauṇaprayojanasya liṅgābhidhānaṃ
analyzed: vede pi kāmya sthale kāmya sādhanasya eva apūrvasya gauṇa prayojanasya liṅga abhidhānam
translated: In the Vedas too, in the context of desired rites, the unseen effect, which is the secondary purpose of the means of desired rites, is indicated by the word.

original: kāmyasādhanatājñānaṃ vinā kāmikāryatvasya bodhayitumaśakyatvāt na tu svataḥ prayojanatvena
analyzed: kāmya sādhanatā jñānam vinā kāmi kāryatvasya bodhayitum aśakya tvāt na tu svatas prayojana tvena
translated: Because without the knowledge of being the means of desired rites, the knowledge of being the cause of desired results cannot be conveyed. But not as the primary purpose by itself.

original: tatrāsāmārthyādanupayogācca pravṛtterbhojanādāvivalokakḷptakāmyasādhanatājñānāt kāryatājñānādvā
analyzed: tatra asāmārthyāt anupayogāt ca pravṛtteḥ bhojana ādau iva loka kḷpta kāmya sādhana tā jñānāt kārya tā jñānāt vā
translated: There, because of the impossibility of that and because of the uselessness of activity, since the knowledge of the means to be desired, which is like the knowledge of the seer in eating etc., or from the knowledge of the effect,

original: gauṇaprayojanatvenaivopapatteḥ / nāpi
analyzed: gauṇa prayojana tvena eva upapatteḥ na api
translated: it is only proper as the secondary purpose. Nor is it

original: nityaniṣedhayorapūrvaṃ svataḥ prayojanaṃ liṅgābhidhīyate /
analyzed: nitya niṣedhayoḥ apūrvam svatas prayojanam liṅgā abhidhīyate
translated: that the unseen effect is declared by the indicative as the purpose in itself in the case of eternal prohibitions.

original: kāmyasthale hi dharmigrāhakaliṅgādinā pravartakakāryatvenāpūrvamabhihitamatonityādāvapi kāryatvenāpūrvabodhanaṃ na tu svataḥ prayojanatvena
analyzed: kāmya sthale hi dharmi grāhaka liṅga ādinā pravartaka kāryatvena apūrvam abhihitam atas nitya ādau api kāryatvena apūrva bodhanam na tu svatas prayojana tvena
translated: For in the case of what is desired, the unseen effect is stated by the indicative etc. which apprehend the substrate as the effect that impels to activity. Therefore, even in the case of what is eternal etc., the unseen effect is understood as the effect, but not as the purpose in itself.

original: nanu nitye lokavedāvagatagauṇamukhyaprayojanābhāve sati liṅgevāpūrvasya svataḥ
analyzed: nanu nitye loka veda avagata gauṇa mukhya prayojana abhāve sati liṅga iva apūrvasya svatas
translated: If it be said that when there is no secondary or primary purpose known from worldly usage or the Veda in the case of what is eternal, the indicative declares the unseen effect to be the purpose in itself,

original: prayojanatvaṃ bodhayati tena vinā pravṛttiparatvānirvāhāditi cet na nirupadhīcchāviṣayatvaṃ
analyzed: prayojana tvam bodhayati tena vinā pravṛtti paratva anirvāhāt iti ced na nirupadhi icchā viṣayatvam
translated: because without that, the statement of activity is not accomplished, it is not so. For the state of being the object of desire without a limiting condition

original: hi svataḥ prayojanatvaṃ apūrvasya siddhaṃ liṅgā bodhanīyam /
analyzed: hi svatas prayojana tvam apūrvasya siddham liṅgāḥ bodhanīyam
translated: is the purpose in itself, which should be declared by the indicative of the unseen effect.

original: na ca tādṛśecchāviṣayo 'pūrvaṃ kvacidapi siddham /
analyzed: na ca tādṛśa icchā viṣayaḥ pūrvam kvacid api siddham
translated: And the unseen effect, which is the object of such desire, is not established anywhere.

original: na ca liṅgevāpūrvecchāṃ janayitvā tāṃ bodhayati tasyāstatrāsāmarthyādicchāyāḥ sāmagṣantarajanyatvācca /
analyzed: na ca liṅgā iva apūrva icchām janayitvā tām bodhayati tasyāḥ tatra asāmarthyāt icchāyāḥ sāmagṣa antara janya tvāt ca
translated: And the indicative does not generate the desire for the unseen and then make one understand that, because that desire is not capable of that, and because it is produced by a different set of causes.

original: ato 'pi kāmye nitye cecchāviṣayatvaṃ prayojanatvamapūrvasya liṅgādinā na bodhyate apūrvecchāyāḥ śābdajñānāt pūrvaṃ asattvāt kintu śābdakāryatājñānāt
analyzed: kāmye nitye ca icchā viṣaya tvam prayojana tvam apūrvasya liṅga ādinā na bodhyate apūrva icchāyāḥ śābda jñānāt pūrvam asattvāt kintu śābda kārya tā jñānāt
translated: Therefore, in the case of the obligatory, the unseen's being the goal, which is the object of desire, is not made known by the indicative etc., because the desire for the unseen does not exist prior to the verbal cognition, but rather from the cognition of the unseen's being the effect of the verbal cognition.

original: seti /
analyzed: sā iti
translated: Thus.

original: atha nitye kāryatvenaivāpūrvasyābhidhānaṃ na tu svataḥ prayojanatvena kintu liṅgā🔽apūrve bodhite tasya svataḥ prayojanatvamicchāviṣayatvaṃ sambhavati sukhajñānavadapūrvajñānasyāpi
analyzed: atha nitye kārya tvena eva apūrvasya abhidhānam na tu svatas prayojana tvena kintu liṅgā  apūrve bodhite tasya svatas prayojana tvam icchā viṣaya tvam sambhavati sukha jñāna vat apūrva jñānasya api
translated: If it is argued that in the case of the obligatory, the unseen is denoted only as the effect, not as the goal in itself, but rather by the indicative etc.🔽when the unseen is made known, its being the goal in itself, i.e. being the object of desire, is possible, like the cognition of pleasure, because the cognition of the unseen also generates desire in itself.

original: svata evecchājanakatvāt tataḥ kāmyāpūrvasādhanatājñānānnitye kāryatābodhāt pravṛttiriti
analyzed: svatas eva icchā janaka tvāt tatas kāmya apūrva sādhana tā jñānāt nitye kārya tā bodhāt pravṛttiḥ iti
translated: Therefore, from the cognition of the unseen being the means to the desired, and from the cognition of being the effect in the obligatory, there is engagement.

original: cet na apūrvajñānasyecchāhetutvenākḷptvāt /
analyzed: ced na apūrva jñānasya icchā hetu tvena a kḷptvāt
translated: If it is argued that this is not so, because the cognition of the unseen is not recognized as the cause of desire,

original: kāmyāpūrve hi lokakḷpteṣṭasādhanatājñānādevecchā na tvapūrvatvajñānāt /
analyzed: kāmya apūrve hi loka kḷpta iṣṭa sādhana tā jñānāt eva icchā na tu apūrva tva jñānāt
translated: because in the case of the desired unseen, desire arises only from the cognition of the means to the desired that is recognized in the world, not from the cognition of being the unseen.

original: śāstrasthasya śāstrajakartavyatājñānaṃ balavaditi cet saphalaviṣayaṃ tathā idañca niṣphalaviṣayam /🔽atha pravṛttimato nivṛttiniyoge 'dhikāra iti yadā bhakṣaṇapravṛttastadā tanniṣedhe
analyzed: śāstra sthasya śāstra ja kartavya tā jñānam balavat iti ced sa phala viṣayam tathā idam ca niṣphala viṣayam  atha pravṛttimataḥ nivṛtti niyoge dhikāraḥ iti yadā bhakṣaṇa pravṛttaḥ tadā tad niṣedhe
translated: If it is argued that the knowledge of what is to be done from the scriptures is stronger, that is so when it has a fruitful object, but this has a fruitless object.🔽If it is argued that one is entitled to the injunction of cessation when one is engaged in activity, then when one is engaged in eating, the knowledge of the meaning of the prohibition

original: śābdakāryatādhīriti tayā viparītaprayatne janite rāgāt kriyotpattiḥ tenaiva pratibandhāt
analyzed: śābda kārya tā dhīḥ iti tayā viparīta prayatne janite rāgāt kriyā utpattiḥ tena eva pratibandhāt
translated: arises. From that, due to passion, an action arises. Because of that very obstruction,

original: rāgakāritapravṛttimupajīvya hi nivṛttikāryatā śāstreṇa bodhitā atastena bodhane svaphalaṃ
analyzed: rāga kārita pravṛttim upajīvya hi nivṛtti kārya tā śāstreṇa bodhitā atas tena bodhane sva phalam
translated: the meaning of cessation, which depends on the engagement caused by passion, is taught by the scripture. Therefore, by that teaching, its own fruit

original: viparītakṛtiravaśyaṃ utpadyeti śāstrasya balavattvamiti cet na nivṛttikāryatābodhe
analyzed: viparīta kṛtiḥ avaśyam utpadya iti śāstrasya balavat tvam iti ced na nivṛtti kārya tā bodhe
translated: is necessarily produced. If it is argued that the strength of the scripture is because the opposite action is produced, no, even when the meaning of cessation

original: 'pi nivṛttau prayatna eva notpadyate yasya pratibandhakatā syāt syācca nivṛttikāryatābodhakamapramāṇaṃ
analyzed: nivṛttau prayatnaḥ eva nā utpadyate yasya pratibandhaka tā syāt syāt ca nivṛtti kārya tā bodhakam apramāṇam
translated: is known, the effort itself towards cessation is not produced, of which there could be obstruction, and there could be a non-valid means of knowledge teaching the meaning of cessation,

original: niṣphalatvena tatra kṛterabhāvāt /
analyzed: niṣphala tvena tatra kṛteḥ abhāvāt
translated: because of the absence of action there due to fruitlessness.

original: atha kalañjabhakṣaṇasya nindārthavādena balavadaniṣṭasādhanatvāvagamāt tadbhakṣaṇe
analyzed: atha kalañja bhakṣaṇasya nindā artha vādena balavat aniṣṭa sādhanatva avagamāt tad bhakṣaṇe
translated: If it is argued that from the understanding of the strong means of accomplishing the undesirable through the statement of censure of eating garlic, in the eating of that,

original: na pravartata iti cet evamapi kalañjabhakṣaṇe nivartatāṃ tadabhāve niṣprayojanakatayā
analyzed: na pravartate iti ced evam api kalañja bhakṣaṇe nivartatām tad abhāve niṣprayojanaka tayā
translated: If it is argued that it does not engage in action, even so, let it refrain from eating garlic, as it is purposeless in the absence of that.

original: pravṛttau kimāyātamiti /
analyzed: pravṛttau kim āyātam iti
translated: What happens in the engagement due to the nature of being an effect and being an instrument of desired objects?

original: etena nityāpūrvasādhane sandhyāvandanādāvapi pravṛttirapāstā kriyāyāḥ kaṣṭatvāt loke
analyzed: etena nitya apūrva sādhane sandhyā vandana ādau api pravṛttiḥ apāstā kriyāyāḥ kaṣṭa tvāt loke
translated: By this, the engagement in the performance of Sandhya worship etc. which establish eternal Apurva is also rejected, because the action is painful.

original: pacetetyādau kāryatveṣṭasādhanatvarūpadharmaśaktatvena jñātā liṅga svargakāmo yajetetyādau
analyzed: paceta ityādau kāryatva iṣṭa sādhanatva rūpa dharma śaktatvena jñātā liṅga svarga kāmaḥ yajeta ityādau
translated: In the world, in sentences like cook this, the suffix is known by the power of the property in the form of being an effect and being an instrument of desired objects. In sentences like one desiring heaven should sacrifice,

original: tadanvayaṃ yāge yogyatādivaśād bodhayatīti na vede dharmiṇi śaktikalpanā pratītā
analyzed: tad anvayam yāge yogyatā ādi vaśāt bodhayati iti na vede dharmiṇi śakti kalpanā pratītā
translated: it conveys that to the sacrifice by the power of suitability etc. Thus, there is no need to assume the power in the Vedic subject.

original: ca svargasādhanatā sākṣādasādhanasya yāgasya vyāpāramantareṇānupapadyamānā tannirvāhakaṃ
analyzed: ca svarga sādhana tā sākṣāt asādhanasya yāgasya vyāpāram antareṇa anupapadyamānā tat nirvāhakam
translated: The instrumentality to heaven, which is not possible without the operation of the sacrifice which is not directly an instrument, implies the operation which sustains it,

original: vyāpāramapūrvaṃ kalpayati /🔽nanu nirupadhipūrvavartitā kāraṇatā sā vyāpāreṇa nirvāhyata ityatra kor'thaḥ kiṃ
analyzed: vyāpāram apūrvam kalpayati  nanu nirupadhi pūrva varti tā kāraṇatā sā vyāpāreṇa nirvāhyate iti atra kaḥ ṛthaḥ kim
translated: which is the Apurva.🔽What is the meaning of this statement that the causality which precedes without a substrate is sustained by the operation?🔽Is it produced or is it indicated? Not the first, because the operation is subsequent to it and is not capable of producing it. Not the second,

original: kriyate uta jñāpyate nādyaḥ uttaravarttitvena vyāpārasya tatrāsāmārthyāt netaraḥ
analyzed: kriyate uta jñāpyate na ādyaḥ uttara vartti tvena vyāpārasya tatra asāmārthyāt na itaraḥ
translated: because it is not possible to indicate what is not produced.

original: liṅgaiva tadbodhanāt ciradhvastaṃ kāraṇaṃ vyāpāreṇa vyāptamiti cet na vipakṣe bādhakābhāvenāprayojakatvādanyathā
analyzed: liṅgā eva tad bodhanāt cira dhvastam kāraṇam vyāpāreṇa vyāptam iti ced na vipakṣe bādhaka abhāvena aprayojaka tvāt anyathā
translated: If it is argued that the cause that has long ceased is pervaded by the operation, it is not so, because in the absence of a counter-instance, it is not a proper reason. Otherwise,

original: aindriyakaṃ kāraṇamatīndriyavyāpārakamiti yāgānubhavayodarśanāt tathā kalpyate /
analyzed: aindriyakam kāraṇam atīndriya vyāpārakam iti yāga anubhavayoḥ darśanāt tathā kalpyate
translated: the perceptible cause is considered to have an imperceptible operation, because it is seen in the case of sacrifice and experience.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: prāyaścittādīnāñca phalapratibandhakatvameva prāyaścittasya tasmādenasaḥ pūto bhavatīti
analyzed: prāyaścitta ādīnām ca phala pratibandhaka tvam eva prāyaścittasya tasmāt enasaḥ pūtaḥ bhavati iti
translated: And the expiatory rites etc. are only the preventers of the fruit. The expiation is for the purification from that sin.

original: yat phalaṃ śrutamasti tasya niṣiddhakriyātaḥ phalabhāk na bhavatītyarthaḥ dharmaḥ
analyzed: yat phalam śrutam asti tasya niṣiddha kriyātaḥ phala bhāj na bhavati iti arthaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: The fruit that is heard is that one does not enjoy the fruit from the prohibited act. Dharma

original: kṣarati kīrtanādityarthaḥ /🔽kṣaratītyatra bādhakaṃ vinā na lakṣaṇeti cet na upasthitatvena vihitakriyāyāmeva dharmapadaśaktigrahasya bādhakatvāt /
analyzed: kṣarati kīrtanāt iti arthaḥ  kṣarati iti atra bādhakam vinā na lakṣaṇā iti ced na upasthita tvena vihita kriyāyām eva dharma pada śakti grahasya bādhaka tvāt
translated: is destroyed by mere mention.🔽If it is argued that in ksaratîti (it decays), there is no secondary meaning without a counter-instance, it is not so, because the comprehension of the power of the word dharma in the enjoined act itself is counteracted by the presence.

original: na caitasya mukhyatvārthaṃ padārthāntare śaktiḥ lakṣaṇocchedāpatteḥ vihitakriyākartṛtvajñānena dhārmikapadaprayogācca /
analyzed: na ca etasya mukhya tva artham padārtha antare śaktiḥ lakṣaṇa uccheda āpatteḥ vihita kriyā kartṛ tva jñānena dhārmika pada prayogāt ca
translated: And in order for this to be primary, there is no power in another word-meaning, because of the loss of secondary meaning, and because of the use of the word dharmic in the knowledge of being the doer of the enjoined act.

original: etena devadattādyaśarīraṃ devadattaviśeṣaguṇapreritabhūtapūrvakaṃ janyatve sati tadbhogasādhanatvāt tannirṃmitasragvadityanumānāt tatsiddhiriti 🔽parāstam /
analyzed: etena devadatta ādya śarīram devadatta viśeṣa guṇa prerita bhūta pūrvakam janya tve sati tad bhoga sādhana tvāt tad nirṃmita sraj vat iti anumānāt tad siddhiḥ iti  parāstam
translated: By this, the body of Devadatta, etc. is preceded by elements impelled by the specific qualities of Devadatta, because it is produced and is a means of experiencing that, like a garland created by that, from the inference. Thus its establishment is refuted.

original: janmāntarīyajñānādibhireva tajjanakatvābhimataiḥ siddhasādhanāditi maivaṃ ciradhvastasya
analyzed: janma antarīya jñāna ādibhiḥ eva tad janaka tva abhimataiḥ siddhasādhanāt iti mā evam cira dhvastasya
translated: Because the desire to know, etc. in a previous birth are themselves accepted as producers of that, the proof is established by the opponent. Do not say so. Because the existence of operation in what is destroyed for a long time

original: vyāpārasattve kāraṇatvamiti nirupādhyanvayavyatirekābhyāṃ vyāptyavadharaṇāt yāgasya🔽ciradhvastakāraṇatvena vyāpārakalpanāt /
analyzed: vyāpāra sattve kāraṇa tvam iti nirupādhi anvaya vyatirekābhyām vyāpti avadharaṇāt yāgasya  cira dhvasta kāraṇa tvena vyāpāra kalpanāt
translated: is the cause, by the non-restricted positive and negative concomitance, the determination of pervasion. And because the operation of the sacrifice is imagined as the cause destroyed for a long time.

original: kārye vyāpārasya pṛthaganvayavyatirekagrahastadvyāpārakatve upādhiriti cet na saṃskāre tadabhāve 'pyanubhavasya tadvyāpārakatvāt /
analyzed: kārye vyāpārasya pṛthak anvaya vyatireka grahaḥ tad vyāpāraka tve upādhiḥ iti ced na saṃskāre tad abhāve pi anubhavasya tad vyāpāraka tvāt
translated: If it is argued that the apprehension of the positive and negative concomitance of the operation in the effect is the restriction in the case of being the operator, it is not so. Because even in the absence of that, the experience is the operator of that, by the impression.

original: na cāprayojakatvaṃ yāgo yadi ciradhvastatve sati savyāpāro na syāt svargasādhanaṃ ghaṭavaditi vipakṣe bādhāt /
analyzed: na ca aprayojaka tvam yāgaḥ yadi cira dhvasta tve sati sa vyāpāraḥ na syāt svarga sādhanam ghaṭa vat iti vipakṣe bādhāt
translated: And it is not that it is not a reason, because if the sacrifice, even though destroyed for a long time, were not to have operation, it would not be the means of attaining heaven, like a pot. Because there is contradiction in the contrary case.

original: na cātra kāraṇatāgrāhakābhāva upādhiḥ tenāpi samaṃ vyāptyavadhāraṇe tasyāpyāpādanāt /
analyzed: na ca atra kāraṇatā grāhaka abhāvaḥ upādhiḥ tena api samam vyāpti avadhāraṇe tasya api āpādanāt
translated: And it is not that the absence of the apprehender of causal relation is the restriction. Because even by that, the determination of pervasion is the same as its consequence.

original: na caindriyakasyātīndriyavyāpāravattvaniyamaḥ savyāpāratve kāryāvyavahitapūrvasamaye asattvasyopādhitvenāprayojakatvāt /
analyzed: na ca aindriyakasya atīndriya vyāpāravat tva niyamaḥ savyāpāra tve kārya avyavahita pūrva samaye asattvasya upādhi tvena aprayojaka tvāt
translated: And there is no invariable concomitance between being perceptible and having a transcendental operation, because in the case of having an operation, the non-existence of the effect immediately preceding the time is not a reason, being a mere postulation.

original: nanvevaṃ sandhyāvandanākaraṇasya duḥkhasādhanatvaśruteḥ tatkaraṇaprāgabhāvo duḥkhahetustathāca tasya sthiratvena duḥkhajananasambhavāt na pāpe 🔽pramāṇam /
analyzed: nanu evam sandhyā vandanā karaṇasya duḥkha sādhanatva śruteḥ tad karaṇa prāgabhāvaḥ duḥkha hetuḥ tathā ca tasya sthira tvena duḥkha janana sambhavāt na pāpe  pramāṇam
translated: If it is argued that in that case, since the non-existence prior to the performance of the Sandhya worship, which is heard to be the means of suffering, is the cause of suffering, and since that is permanent, it is possible to generate suffering, and therefore there is no evidence of sin,

original: na ca prāyaścittavaiphalyaṃ prāgabhāvanāśa eva tena kriyata iti tanna dhvaṃsaprāgabhāvānavacchinnakālasya
analyzed: na ca prāyaścitta vaiphalyam prāgabhāva nāśaḥ eva tena kriyate iti tat na dhvaṃsa prāgabhāva anavacchinna kālasya
translated: and there is no futility of expiation, because it is done by the destruction of the prior non-existence, that is not so, because the time not delimited by the prior non-existence of destruction

original: pratiyogikālatvena tadā karaṇāpatteriti cet na sandhyākālīnākaraṇasya duḥkhajanakatvena
analyzed: pratiyogi kāla tvena tadā karaṇa āpatteḥ iti ced na sandhyā kālīna akaraṇasya duḥkha janaka tvena
translated: is the time of the counter-correlate, and therefore it would follow that it is performed at that time. If it is argued that the non-performance at the time of Sandhya is the cause of suffering,

original: viśiṣṭasya sandhyākālāpagame 'nupagamāt /
analyzed: viśiṣṭasya sandhyā kāla apagame n upagamāt
translated: and since that qualified by that is not present when the time of Sandhya has passed,

original: na ca sandhyākālīnākaraṇe viśeṣaṇaṃ kintu pratiyoṅgini karaṇe tathāca viśiṣṭābhāvaḥ sthira eveti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca sandhyā kālīna akaraṇe viśeṣaṇam kintu pratiyā uṅgini karaṇe tathāca viśiṣṭa abhāvaḥ sthiraḥ eva iti vācyam
translated: and it should not be said that in the non-performance at the time of Sandhya, the qualifier is not present, but in the performance of the counter-correlate, and thus the absence of the qualified is permanent.

original: sandhyāyā dvyakaraṇe 'nvayastasya padārthatvāt na tu karaṇe tasya padārthekadeśatvenāpradhānatvāt
analyzed: sandhyāyāḥ dvi akaraṇe nvayaḥ tasya padārtha tvāt na tu karaṇe tasya padārtha eka deśa tvena apradhāna tvāt
translated: In the case of the two-fold origination of the evening twilight, there is connection with the object, not with the instrument, because it is a part of the object and is not primary.

original: tathāpi dhvaṃsa eva vyāpāro 'stu tava sahabhāvānirūpakasyāpi kāraṇatvāt tasyānantatve🔽'pi svabhāvāt sāvadhiphalajanakatvam /
analyzed: tathā api dhvaṃsaḥ eva vyāpāraḥ stu tava sahabhāva anirūpakasya api kāraṇa tvāt tasya ananta tve  pi svabhāvāt sa avadhi phala janaka tvam
translated: Even so, let the operation be only the destruction, because even that which does not determine simultaneity is a cause. Even though it is endless,

original: yatra yad dhvaṃsohetustatra tatprāgabhāvo 'pīti cet na duḥkhadhvaṃsajanyadadhni mithyādhīdhvaṃsasādhyamuktau ca vyabhicārāt
analyzed: yatra yat dhvaṃsaḥ hetuḥ tatra tad prāgabhāvaḥ api iti ced na duḥkha dhvaṃsa janya dadhni mithyā dhī dhvaṃsa sādhya muktau ca vyabhicārāt
translated: it produces a limited result by its own nature. If it is argued that where there is the destruction of one, there is also the prior non-existence of that, it is not so, because of the fallacy in the destruction of curd produced by the destruction of pain and in the statement accomplished by the destruction of false cognition.

original: pratibandhakābhāvatvena hetutve tathābhāvācca /
analyzed: pratibandhaka abhāva tvena hetu tve tathā bhāvāt ca
translated: And because of the same nature in being the cause by the absence of obstruction.

original: dhvaṃsenānupapattiḥ kathaṃ tenaiva samādhātavyeti cet na dhvaṃse sati tadvyāpāratvajñānaṃ vinānupapattestadvyāpāratvakalpanayā śānteriti /
analyzed: dhvaṃsena anupapattiḥ katham tena eva samādhātavyā iti ced na dhvaṃse sati tad vyāpāra tva jñānam vinā anupapatteḥ tad vyāpāra tva kalpanayā śānteḥ iti
translated: If it is argued that how can the impossibility be remedied by that very thing in the case of destruction, it is not so, because of the impossibility without the knowledge of being the operation of that when there is destruction, it is imagined to be the operation of that by the peace of mind.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: Do not say so.

original: pratiyāgidhvaṃsayorekatrājanakatvāt /
analyzed: pratiyāgi dhvaṃsayoḥ ekatra ajanaka tvāt
translated: Because the destruction of each opponent is not produced in one place.

original: na hi niyamato yaddhvaṃse sati yadabhavati tat tatra kāraṇam /
analyzed: na hi niyamataḥ yad dhvaṃse sati yat abhavati tat tatra kāraṇam
translated: For it is not necessarily the case that what exists when there is the destruction of one thing is the cause of that.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: na ca saṃsargābhāvatvena hetutve tatheti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca saṃsarga abhāva tvena hetu tve tathā iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the absence of contact is the cause in that way.

original: vyabhicārābhāvena tasyāpi prayojakatvāt /
analyzed: vyabhicāra abhāvena tasya api prayojaka tvāt
translated: Because even that is the prompter by the absence of contradiction.

original: atha śabdād yāgakāraṇatā vyāpāraṃ vinā tadanupapatteḥ tajjanyadhvaṃsasya kāraṇatvakalpanamityubhayamapi
analyzed: atha śabdāt yāga kāraṇatā vyāpāram vinā tad anupapatteḥ tad janya dhvaṃsasya kāraṇa tva kalpanam iti ubhayam api
translated: If it is argued that from the word, the causal relation of the sacrifice is not possible without operation, so the destruction produced by that is imagined to be the cause, and both are

original: janakaṃ anyatra tu mānābhāvānna tatheti cet na yāgadhvaṃsasya yāgajanyasvargaṃ prati
analyzed: janakam anyatra tu māna abhāvāt na tathā iti ced na yāga dhvaṃsasya yāga janya svargam prati
translated: the producer, but not so elsewhere due to the absence of proof, it is not so. The destruction of the sacrifice is not imagined to be the cause of heaven produced by the sacrifice

original: janakatvasya pramāṇāntaravirodhenārthāpattyāpyakalpanāt /
analyzed: janaka tvasya pramāṇa antara virodhena arthāpattyā api akalpanāt
translated: by presumption also, due to contradiction by other means of knowledge.

original: astu tarhi devatāprītireva vyāpāra iti cet yāgasya devatāprītihetutve mānābhāvāt gaṅgāsnānādau devatāprītihetutve mānābhāvāt gaṅgāsnānādau
analyzed: astu tarhi devatā prītiḥ eva vyāpāraḥ iti ced yāgasya devatā prīti hetu tve māna abhāvāt gaṅgā snāna ādau devatā prīti hetu tve māna abhāvāt gaṅgā snāna ādau
translated: If it is argued that then let the operation be the satisfaction of the deity itself, it is not so, because there is no proof of the sacrifice being the cause of the satisfaction of the deity. In the case of bathing in the Ganges etc.,

original: devatāviraheṇa tadasambhavāt /
analyzed: devatā viraheṇa tad asambhavāt
translated: it is not possible due to the absence of the deity.

original: na ca tatrāpi tatprītiḥ tasya tatprītihetutve mānābhāvāt lāghavena kartubhoktṛgatavyāpārakalpanācca /
analyzed: na ca tatra api tad prītiḥ tasya tad prīti hetu tve māna abhāvāt lāghavena kartu bhoktṛ gata vyāpāra kalpanāt ca
translated: And even there, that satisfaction is not so, because there is no proof of that being the cause of that satisfaction, and because the operation belonging to the agent and enjoyer is imagined to be simpler.

original: nanu nāyaṃ niyamaḥ putrakṛtagayāśrāddhādinā pitari pitṛkṛtajāteṣṭyā putre cādṛṣṭotpatteḥ /
analyzed: nanu nā ayam niyamaḥ putra kṛta gayā śrāddha ādinā pitari pitṛ kṛta jāta iṣṭyā putre ca adṛṣṭa utpatteḥ
translated: If it is argued that this is not a rule, because the unseen is produced in the father by the son's performance of the Gaya Sraddha etc., and in the son by the father's performance of the Jati sacrifice,🔽it is not so, because the unseen is not the cause of the satisfaction of the deity, and because the satisfaction of the deity is not the cause of heaven.

original: atha tatrāpi kartaryevādṛṣṭaṃ vihitakriyāyāḥ yāgasyeva kartṛgatādṛṣṭajanakatvāt /
analyzed: atha tatra api kartari eva adṛṣṭam vihita kriyāyāḥ yāgasya iva kartṛ gata adṛṣṭa janaka tvāt
translated: Then, even there, the unseen is only in the agent, because the unseen of the agent is the cause of the enjoined action, like the sacrifice.

original: na ca mukte putre tadadṛṣṭanāśāt pitari na svargaḥ syāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca mukte putre tad adṛṣṭa nāśāt pitari na svargaḥ syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that when the son is liberated, heaven would not be for the father due to the destruction of that unseen.

original: adṛṣṭasya phalanāśyatayā pitari svargābhāvenādṛṣṭānāśāt svavṛttibhogajanakādṛṣṭasya
analyzed: adṛṣṭasya phala nāśya tayā pitari svarga abhāvena adṛṣṭa anāśāt sva vṛtti bhoga janaka adṛṣṭasya
translated: Because the unseen is destroyed by the fruit, and due to the absence of heaven for the father, the unseen is not destroyed. The unseen that produces enjoyment in one's own existence

original: muktivirodhitvāt na tu pitṛgatamadṛṣṭaṃ janyate mukte pitari doṣābhāvena yogināmiva
analyzed: mukti virodhi tvāt na tu pitṛ gatam adṛṣṭam janyate mukte pitari doṣa abhāvena yoginām iva
translated: is opposed to liberation, but the unseen belonging to the father is not produced, because when the father is liberated, there is no fault, like the yogis.

original: vihitakriyāyāḥ pitradṛṣṭājanakatvāt tathātve ca sāṅgamapi śrāddhādikaṃ niṣphalaṃ
analyzed: vihita kriyāyāḥ pitṛ adṛṣṭa ajanaka tvāt tathātve ca sa aṅgam api śrāddha ādikam niṣphalam
translated: Because the enjoined action does not produce the unseen of the father, and if it were so, even the śrāddha etc. with its parts would be fruitless.

original: syāditi taddhidheraprāmāṇyāpattiḥ putragatādṛṣṭena ca mukte pitari sukhotpattau na
analyzed: syāt iti tad hi dheḥ aprāmāṇya āpattiḥ putra gata adṛṣṭena ca mukte pitari sukha utpattau na
translated: Thus there would be the fault of the invalidity of that injunction. And there is no contradiction in the production of happiness for the liberated father by the unseen of the son,

original: virodhaḥ yogināmiva sukhotpattau doṣasyāhetutvāt /
analyzed: virodhaḥ yoginām iva sukha utpattau doṣasya ahetu tvāt
translated: because like the yogis, the fault is not the cause of the production of happiness.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: atha pitṛsukhaṃ pitṛpuṇyajanyamiti pitari puṇyaṃ tena vinā tadasambhavāt na putre
analyzed: atha pitṛ sukham pitṛ puṇya janyam iti pitari puṇyam tena vinā tad asambhavāt na putre
translated: Now, if the happiness of the father is produced from the father's merit, then the merit belongs to the father, because without that it is not possible. It does not belong to the son.

original: tatra phalaprasaṅgāditi pitṛsvargakāmānājanyakriyā pitṛpuṇyaheturiti putrakriyāpi
analyzed: tatra phala prasaṅgāt iti pitṛ svarga kāma anājanya kriyā pitṛ puṇya hetuḥ iti putra kriyā api
translated: There, because of the connection with the result, the action not produced by the desire for the father's heaven is the cause of the father's merit. The son's action also

original: tajjaniketi cet evaṃ pitṛkriyāpi pitṛpuṇyajaniketi na tāṃ vinā pitari puṇyaṃ putrakriyā
analyzed: tad janikā iti ced evam pitṛ kriyā api pitṛ puṇya janikā iti na tām vinā pitari puṇyam putra kriyā
translated: is produced by that. If it is said that the father's action also produces the father's merit, then without that, the father's merit is not produced by the son's action.

original: ca putrapuṇyajaniketi putre puṇyaṃ pitṛsvargakāmanājanyapuṇyatvena pitṛsvargaheturastu
analyzed: ca putra puṇya janikā iti putre puṇyam pitṛ svarga kāmanā janya puṇya tvena pitṛ svarga hetuḥ astu
translated: And the son's action produces the son's merit. Let the son's merit be the cause of the father's heaven by being the merit produced by the desire for the father's heaven.

original: tatpuṇyaṃ pitṛvṛtti tatsukhahetupuṇyatvāt na putravṛtti tatsukhahetupuṇyatvāditi
analyzed: tat puṇyam pitṛ vṛtti tad sukha hetu puṇya tvāt na putra vṛtti tad sukha hetu puṇya tvāt iti
translated: If it is said that that merit is related to the father because it is the merit that causes his happiness, but not related to the son because it is the merit that causes his happiness,

original: cet na tatpuṇyaṃ na pitṛvṛtti tatkṛtyajanyapuṇyatvāt putravṛtti vā tatkṛtapuṇyatvāt
analyzed: ced na tat puṇyam na pitṛ vṛtti tad kṛtya janya puṇya tvāt putra vṛtti vā tad kṛta puṇya tvāt
translated: no, that merit is not related to the father because it is the merit produced by his action, nor is it related to the son because it is the merit produced by his action.

original: tasmāt pitṛsvargakāmanājanyapuṇyatvena pitṛsvargahetuteti putra eva tatpuṇyamiti /
analyzed: tasmāt pitṛ svarga kāmanā janya puṇya tvena pitṛ svarga hetu tā iti putraḥ eva tat puṇyam iti
translated: Therefore, because it is the merit produced by the desire for the father's heaven, it is the cause of the father's heaven. Thus, that merit belongs to the son alone.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, it should not be so.

original: svargopapādakaṃ hyapūrvaṃ svargāśraye kalpyate prathamopasthitatvāt lāghavāt kalpanāyāḥ sākṣādupapādakaviṣayatvācca /
analyzed: svarga upapādakam hi apūrvam svarga āśraye kalpyate prathama upasthita tvāt lāghavāt kalpanāyāḥ sākṣāt upapādaka viṣaya tvāt ca
translated: For the unseen effect that produces heaven is imagined to be related to heaven because it is the first to appear, because the imagination is simple, and because it is the direct producer.

original: na ca svargahetukāmanāśraye svargakāmanājanyakriyākartari vā vilambopasthitikatvāt gauravāt paramparayā svargopapādakatvācca /
analyzed: na ca svarga hetu kāmanā āśraye svarga kāmanā janya kriyā kartari vā vilamba upasthitika tvāt gauravāt paramparayā svarga upapādaka tvāt ca
translated: And it is not so, because the father who is liberated by the merit of his son would have to wait for the birth of his body etc. and happiness, due to the delay in the appearance of the father who is the agent of the action born from the desire for heaven, which is based on the desire for heaven, and because of indirectly bringing about heaven.

original: yadi ca putrakṛtapuṇyena muktasya pituḥ śarīrādyutpattiḥ sukhañca syāt tadā sākṣividhayā
analyzed: yadi ca putra kṛta puṇyena muktasya pituḥ śarīra ādi utpattiḥ sukham ca syāt tadā sākṣi vidhayā
translated: And if the father who is liberated would have the birth of a body etc. and happiness by the merit of his son, then he would also have the experience of hell as indicated by the text:

original: asatyābhidhānādiputrakriyājanyapāpena sa viṣṭhāyāṃ kṛmirbhūtvā pitṛbhiḥ saha pacyate''
analyzed: asatya abhidhāna ādi putra kriyā janya pāpena sa viṣṭhāyām kṛmiḥ bhūtvā pitṛbhiḥ saha pacyate
translated: He becomes a worm in feces and is cooked along with his ancestors by the sin born from the actions of his son who speaks untruth etc.

original: ityādibodhitanarakabhāgitāpi muktasya pituḥ syāt /
analyzed: ityādi bodhita naraka bhāgi tā api muktasya pituḥ syāt
translated: Thus, the father who is liberated would have the experience of hell.

original: tathā ca putrakṛtatatathāvidhaśaṅkayā na kaścinmokṣārthaṃ brahmacaryādiduḥkhenātmānamavasādayet
analyzed: tathā ca putra kṛta ta tathāvidha śaṅkayā na kaścid mokṣa artham brahmacarya ādi duḥkhena ātmānam avasādayet
translated: And in that case, no one would mortify himself with the suffering of celibacy etc. for the sake of liberation, fearing that his son might do such a thing.

original: duḥkhenātyantaṃ vimuktaścarati na sa punarāvartate'' iti śrutivirodhaśca tathāca
analyzed: duḥkhena atyantam vimuktaḥ carati na sa punar āvartate iti śruti virodhaḥ ca tathā ca
translated: And there would be a contradiction with the Vedic text: He moves about completely free from suffering and does not return again.

original: muktasya sukhaduḥkhe śarīrañca bhavatītpadarśanaṃ mukte pitari śrāddhādinā doṣābhāvādeva nādṛṣṭamutpadyate /
analyzed: muktasya sukha duḥkhe śarīram ca bhavati iti adarśanam mukte pitari śrāddha ādinā doṣa abhāvāt eva na adṛṣṭam utpadyate
translated: And the statement that the liberated one has happiness, suffering and a body is not seen, because no unseen effect arises from the Śrāddha etc. of the liberated father due to the absence of sin.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: na caivaṃ sāṅgaśrāddhasyāpi niṣphalatvaṃ adṛṣṭotpattau svarūpasatodoṣasyāṅgasya vaiguṇyāt🔽yathā vighnahetuduritaśūnyena kṛtaṃ maṅgalaṃ na pāpadhvaṃsaṃ janayati svarūpasataḥ
analyzed: na ca evam sa aṅga śrāddhasya api niṣphala tvam adṛṣṭa utpattau svarūpa sataḥ doṣasya aṅgasya vaiguṇyāt  yathā vighna hetu durita śūnyena kṛtam maṅgalam na pāpa dhvaṃsam janayati sva rūpa sataḥ
translated: And thus, even the Śrāddha with its auxiliaries is not fruitless, because in the production of the unseen effect, the auxiliary which exists in its own form is defective.🔽Just as the auspicious act performed by one free from sin which is the cause of an obstacle does not produce the destruction of sin, because the auxiliary which is sin exists in its own form.

original: pāpasyāṅgasyābhāvādevañca yāgasyāpi vyadhikaraṇo vyāpāro bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: pāpasya aṅgasya abhāvāt evam ca yāgasya api vyadhikaraṇaḥ vyāpāraḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And thus, the sacrifice also will have an operation with a different substratum.

original: ucyate /🔽vihitakriyāyā kartṛgatavyāpāradvārā kālāntarabhāviphalaṃ janyata ityutsargaḥ sa ca
analyzed: ucyate  vihita kriyāyā kartṛ gata vyāpāra dvārā kāla antara bhāvi phalam janyate iti utsargaḥ sa ca
translated: It is said:

original: balavatā bādhakenāpodyate prakṛte ca bādhakaṃ nāsti yathā śāstradeśitaṃ phalamanuṣṭhātarītyutsvargaḥ
analyzed: balavatā bādhakena apodyate prakṛte ca bādhakam na asti yathā śāstra deśitam phalam anuṣṭhātari iti utsvargaḥ
translated: The effect which occurs at a later time is produced through the operation of the agent of the enjoined action. This is the general rule. And that is set aside by a strong contradictory. But in the present case there is no contradictory. As the effect taught by the scriptures belongs to the performer. This is the general rule.

original: sa ca balavatā bādhakenāpodyate prakṛte ca bādhakaṃ nāsti yathā śāstradeśitaṃ phalamanuṣṭhātarīyatyutsvargaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca balavatā bādhakena apodyate prakṛte ca bādhakam na asti yathā śāstra deśitam phalam anuṣṭhātar īyati utsvargaḥ
translated: And that is set aside by a strong contradictory. But in the present case there is no contradictory. As the effect taught by the scriptures belongs to the performer. This is the general rule.

original: putrakṛtagayāśrāddhāsya pitṛsvargaṃ prati pitṛkṛtajāteṣṭeḥ putrapūtatvādikaṃ prati hetutvasya śāstreṇa bodhanāt /
translated: Because the scriptures teach that the father's attainment of heaven through the son's performance of the Gayā Śrāddha and the son's purity etc. are caused by the father's performance of the Jātakarman.

original: nanvayaṃ niyama eva pitṛyajñajāteṣṭyādau paramparāsambandhena kartṛgatameva phalam /🔽na hi yasya kasyāpi pitari putre vā phalaṃ kintu svapitṛputrayostathāca svapitṛgatatvaṃ
analyzed: nanu ayam niyamaḥ eva pitṛ yajña jāta iṣṭi ādau paramparā sambandhena kartṛ gatam eva phalam  na hi yasya kasya api pitari putre vā phalam kintu sva pitṛ putrayoḥ tathā ca sva pitṛ gata tvam
translated: Is it not that in the case of the Pitri-yajna, the Jati-Iṣṭi, etc., the result accrues to the performer himself through a series of relations?

original: svargabhāgipitṛkatvaṃ vā paramparāsambandhaḥ phalena putrasya evaṃ pūtaputrakatvādikamapi pitṛgatameva /
analyzed: svarga bhāgi pitṛka tvam vā paramparā sambandhaḥ phalena putrasya evam pūta putraka tva ādikam api pitṛ gatam eva
translated: For no one else's father or son has the result, but rather the father and son themselves. Thus, the fact of belonging to a father who has gone to heaven, or the series of relations, is the result for the son. Similarly, the fact of having a purified son, etc., belongs to the father himself.

original: na ca palasya kartṛgatvaṃ sākṣāt sambandhenaiveti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca palasya kartṛ ga tvam sākṣāt sambandhena evā iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the result accrues to the performer directly only through a relation.

original: grāmapaśuputrahiraṇyādīnāṃ paramparayā kartṛgatvamiti vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: grāma paśu putra hiraṇya ādīnām paramparayā kartṛ ga tvam iti vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is deviation, as the village, cattle, son, gold, etc. belong to the performer through a series of relations.

original: na hi grāmādayaḥ sākṣāt kartṛsambaddhāḥ /
analyzed: na hi grāma ādayaḥ sākṣāt kartṛ sambaddhāḥ
translated: For the village, etc. are not directly related to the performer.

original: evaṃ phalasya sākṣāt kartṛgāmitvabodhane śāstrasyotsargo na tu phalasya kartṛgāmitābodhane /
analyzed: evam phalasya sākṣāt kartṛ gāmi tva bodhane śāstrasya utsargaḥ na tu phalasya kartṛ gāmi tā bodhane
translated: Thus, when the result is directly shown to belong to the performer, the scripture is abandoned, but not when the result is shown to belong to the performer.

original: yattu svargabhāgipitṛkatvaṃ na phalaṃ tatkāmanāyā adhikāriviśeṣaṇatvābhāvāt pitṛgatasvargakāma ityādiśruteḥ /
analyzed: yat tu svarga bhāgi pitṛkatvam na phalam tad kāmanāyāḥ adhikāri viśeṣaṇa tva abhāvāt pitṛ gata svarga kāmaḥ ityādi śruteḥ
translated: And that belonging to a father who has gone to heaven is not the result, because the desire for that is not a qualification of the person entitled, as stated in the Vedic text one who desires heaven for his father, etc.

original: svataśca tathā kāmanayā pravṛttau śrutakāmanāviraheṇa prayoge 'ṅgavaiguṇyāt phalābhāvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: svatas ca tathā kāmanayā pravṛttau śruta kāmanā viraheṇa prayoge ṅga vaiguṇyāt phala abhāva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If one were to engage in the performance of the act through one's own desire for such a result, then in the absence of the desire expressed in the Vedic injunction, there would be a deficiency in the subsidiary factors of the performance, leading to the undesirable consequence of the absence of the result.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: kiñca svargabhāgipitṛkatvaṃ viśiṣṭaṃ tatra viśeṣyaṃ tatpitṛkatvaṃ na kāmyaṃ na vā phalaṃ siddhatvātadasādhyatvācca kintu viśeṣaṇaṃ pitṛgatasvarga
analyzed: kiñca svarga bhāgi pitṛka tvam viśiṣṭam tatra viśeṣyam tad pitṛka tvam na kāmyam na vā phalam siddha tvāt tad asādhya tvāt ca kintu viśeṣaṇam pitṛ gata svarga
translated: Moreover, the fact of having a father who is entitled to heaven is a specific property there. The property of having a father is not desired nor is it the result, because it is already established and cannot be accomplished. Rather, the qualification is the heaven belonging to the father.

original: iti sa eva phalamiti /
analyzed: iti saḥ eva phalam iti
translated: Thus, that alone is the result.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: na hi svargabhāgipitṛkatvaṃ phalaṃ api tu svargeṇa samaṃ putrasya paramparāsambandharūpaṃ taduktamiti /
analyzed: na hi svarga bhāgi pitṛka tvam phalam api tu svargeṇa samam putrasya paramparā sambandha rūpam tat uktam iti
translated: For the fact of having a father who is entitled to heaven is not the result, but rather the relation of the son to heaven through a series of intermediaries, as stated.

original: ucyate yadi paramparāsambandhena putragatatvaṃ pitṛsvargasya tadā saṃyuktasamavāyādinā putretarasyāpi phalaṃ syāt /🔽sa sambandho na śāstreṇa bodhita iti cet tarhi svargabhāgipitṛkatvamapi na tathā
analyzed: ucyate yadi paramparā sambandhena putra gata tvam pitṛ svargasya tadā saṃyukta samavāya ādinā putra itarasya api phalam syāt  sa sambandhaḥ na śāstreṇa bodhitaḥ iti ced tarhi svarga bhāgi pitṛka tvam api na tathā
translated: It is said: If the heaven of the father is related to the son through a series of intermediaries, then the result would belong to the son and others through conjunction, inherence, and so on.🔽If it is argued that that relation is not indicated by the sacred texts, then the fact of having a father who is entitled to heaven is also not so.

original: śāstreṇabādhitatvāt grāmapaśuhiraṇyādīnāñca siddhatvena na kāmyatvaṃ kintu tadviṣayakaṃ
analyzed: śāstreṇa bādhita tvāt grāma paśu hiraṇya ādīnām ca siddha tvena na kāmya tvam kintu tad viṣayakam
translated: Because it is contradicted by the sacred texts. And villages, cattle, gold, and so on are already established, so they are not desired, but rather the knowledge of them,

original: svatvaṃ kāmyaṃ phalamapi tadeva tacca sākṣādeva kartṛgatamiti kartṛgatatvena phalakāmanā
analyzed: sva tvam kāmyam phalam api tat eva tat ca sākṣāt eva kartṛ gatam iti kartṛ gata tvena phala kāmanā
translated: Ownership and the desired result are the same, and that is directly related to the agent. Therefore, the desire for the result is

original: tadgatameva śāstradeśitaṃ phalam /
analyzed: tad gatam eva śāstra deśitam phalam
translated: in relation to the agent. That is the result taught by the scriptures.

original: ata eva kāmanāviṣayaḥ stagata eva svargaḥ phalaṃ yāgādeḥ svargapūtatvādeśca pitṛputragatatvena kāmyatvamiti śrāddhajāteṣṭyādeḥ pitṛputragatameva
analyzed: atas eva kāmanā viṣayaḥ sta gataḥ eva svargaḥ phalam yāga ādeḥ svarga pūta tva ādeḥ ca pitṛ putra gata tvena kāmya tvam iti śrāddha jāta iṣṭi ādeḥ pitṛ putra gatam eva
translated: For this very reason, heaven, which is the object of desire, is the result of the sacrifice etc. and of purification by heaven etc., in relation to the father and son. Thus, the result of the Śrāddha, Jātakarman, and other rites is in relation to the father and son.

original: phalam /
analyzed: phalam
translated: only.

original: evañca mātāpitrādigatasvargakāmanayā putrādinā kṛtaṃ puṣkariṇīmahādānādikaṃ mātāpitrādisvargajanakameva🔽kāmanāviṣayasvargasādhanatvena teṣāṃ śrutatvāt na hi svagatasvargakāmasya kartavyatāṃ🔽puṣkariṇyādervidhirbodhayati tathā śruteḥ kintu svargakāmasya svargaśca svagataḥ
analyzed: evam ca mātā pitṛ ādi gata svarga kāmanayā putra ādinā kṛtam puṣkariṇī mahā dāna ādikam mātā pitṛ ādi svarga janakam eva  kāmanā viṣaya svarga sādhana tvena teṣām śruta tvāt na hi svagata svarga kāmasya kartavya tām  puṣkariṇī ādeḥ vidhiḥ bodhayati tathā śruteḥ kintu svarga kāmasya svargaḥ ca svagataḥ
translated: And thus, the great gift of a lotus pond etc. performed by the son etc. with the desire for heaven in relation to the mother, father etc. is the producer of heaven for the mother, father etc.🔽only, because they are heard as the means of attaining heaven, which is the object of desire. Indeed, the injunction of a lotus pond etc. does not teach the duty of one who desires heaven in relation to oneself,

original: paragato veti svargakāmatvamaviśiṣṭaṃ yajetetyātmanepadamapi kartabhipretakriyāphalamātrajanakatve
analyzed: para gataḥ vā iti svarga kāma tvam aviśiṣṭam yajeta iti ātmanepadam api kart abhipreta kriyā phala mātra janakatve
translated: but of one who desires heaven, whether heaven is in relation to oneself or another. Thus, the desire for heaven is not distinguished. The reflexive verb yajeta (one should sacrifice) also indicates the mere production of the result of the action intended by the agent,🔽in the case of the injunction yajeta (one should sacrifice).

original: na ca svargakāmo dadyādityādau svagatasvargakāmanāyā antaraṅgatvādautsargikatvācca
analyzed: na ca svarga kāmaḥ dadyāt ityādau svagata svarga kāmanāyāḥ antaraṅga tvāt autsargika tvāt ca
translated: And in the case of one desiring heaven should not give, the desire for heaven belonging to oneself is more intimate and natural,

original: svargakāmatvena svagatasvargakāma evocyate sāmānye bādhakaṃ vinā viśeṣaparatve mānābhāvāt /
analyzed: svarga kāma tvena svagata svarga kāmaḥ eva ucyate sāmānye bādhakam vinā viśeṣa paratve māna abhāvāt
translated: so one desiring heaven is spoken of as having the desire for heaven belonging to oneself, because there is no evidence for the special meaning in the absence of a contradiction in the general sense.

original: kecittu samyag gṛhasthāśramaparipālanasya brahmalokāvāptiḥ phalaṃ śrūyata iti jāteṣṭipitṛyajñayorapi
analyzed: kecid tu samyak gṛhastha āśrama paripālanasya brahma loka avāptiḥ phalam śrūyate iti jāta iṣṭi pitṛ yajñayoḥ api
translated: But some say that the attainment of Brahmaloka is heard as the fruit of properly maintaining the householder stage, and that the same fruit is for the jāteṣṭi and pitṛyajña also,

original: gṛhasthakarmatvena tadeva phalamiti phalasya kartṛgāmitve niyama eva prātisvikaphalābhiprāyeṇotsarga ityāhuḥ /🔽nanu yāvannityaparipālanasya tat phalaṃ na tu kāmyaśrāddhādeḥ kāmyāntarbhāve mānābhāvāt yāvat kāmyānuṣṭānāśakteśca /
analyzed: gṛhastha karma tvena tat eva phalam iti phalasya kartṛ gāmi tve niyamaḥ eva prātisvika phala abhiprāyeṇa utsargaḥ iti āhuḥ  nanu yāvat nitya paripālanasya tat phalam na tu kāmya śrāddha ādeḥ kāmya antarbhāve māna abhāvāt yāvat kāmya anuṣṭāna aśakteḥ ca
translated: because they are the duties of a householder, and that the rule is only in the case of the fruit going to the agent, and the general statement is with the intention of individual fruits.🔽But this is not so, because the fruit of that is of the perpetual maintenance, and not of the optional śrāddha etc., because there is no evidence for the inclusion of the optional in the perpetual, and because of the inability to perform the optional as long as possible.

original: yāvacchakyānuṣṭhānasyāpi nātrāntarbhāvaḥ kāmanāvirahādināpyakaraṇāt yāvannityānuṣṭhāne tatphalābhāvaprasaṅgāt nityasyaivāvaśyakatvenopasthityānvayācca
analyzed: yāvat śakya anuṣṭhānasya api na atra antarbhāvaḥ kāmanā viraha ādinā api akaraṇāt yāvat nitya anuṣṭhāne tad phala abhāva prasaṅgāt nityasya eva āvaśyaka tvena upasthitya anvayāt ca
translated: Even the performance of what is possible is not included here, because it is not done even due to the absence of desire etc., and because of the connection with the necessary presence of the perpetual due to the contingence of the absence of its fruit in the performance of the perpetual as long as possible, and because of the connection with the necessary presence of the perpetual due to its being necessary.

original: api ca taiḥ karmabhiḥ pratyekamutpattyapūrvaṃ taiśca paramāpūrvaṃ janyate iti na gauravān mānābhāvācca /
analyzed: api ca taiḥ karmabhiḥ pratyekam utpatti apūrvam taiḥ ca parama apūrvam janyate iti na gauravāt māna abhāvāt ca
translated: Moreover, by those actions, a new unseen potency is produced for each, and by those, the highest unseen potency is produced, so it is not due to complexity. And because there is no evidence.

original: kintvantimakriyā paripālanarūpakriyāntareṇa veti na sarvaṃ karma brahmalokāvāptiphalakamiti /
analyzed: kintu antima kriyā paripālana rūpa kriyā antareṇa vā iti na sarvam karma brahma loka avāpti phalakam iti
translated: But the final action is protected by another action in the form of preservation, so not all action has the attainment of Brahmaloka as its fruit.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, it should not be so.

original: bhagavaduddeśena kṛtasya kāmyasya nityasya vā yasya kasyāpi karmaṇaḥ paripālanād brahmalokāvāptiḥ phalaṃ śrūyata iti jāteṣṭipitṛyajñayorapi
analyzed: bhagavat uddeśena kṛtasya kāmyasya nityasya vā yasya kasya api karmaṇaḥ paripālanāt brahma loka avāptiḥ phalam śrūyate iti jāta iṣṭi pitṛyajñayoḥ api
translated: The attainment of Brahmaloka is heard as the fruit of the preservation of any desired or obligatory action done with the Lord as the goal. Thus, even the birth-rite and the ancestral offering have

original: tathā kṛtayostadeva phalam /
analyzed: tathā kṛtayoḥ tat eva phalam
translated: that same fruit when done in that way.

original: tathā ca bhagavadgītā yajñāyācarataḥ karma karmagranthirvilīyate /
analyzed: tathā ca bhagavadgītā yajñāya ācarataḥ karma karma granthiḥ vilīyate
translated: And so in the Bhagavad Gita: The knot of action is dissolved for one who performs action for the sake of sacrifice,

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: yajñārthātkarmaṇo 'yatra lāko 'yaṃ karmabandhanaḥ'' /
analyzed: yajña arthāt karmaṇaḥ yatra lākaḥ yam karma bandhanaḥ
translated: This bondage of action is from action that is not for the sake of sacrifice.

original: iti tacca karma yajñārthatayā pratyekameva tatphalasamarthaṃ sambalanantu maṅgalavadupayujyate anyathā ekaprayogasya vyavadhānādasambhavaḥ
analyzed: iti tat ca karma yajña artha tayā pratyekam eva tad phala samartham sambalanan tu maṅgala vat upayujyate anyathā eka prayogasya vyavadhānāt asambhavaḥ
translated: And that action is capable of its own fruit as being for the sake of sacrifice. But the combination is useful like an auspicious rite. Otherwise, it is impossible due to the interruption of a single performance.

original: paripālanantu kartavyamityeva kāraṇam /
analyzed: paripālanantu kartavyam iti eva kāraṇam
translated: But the preservation is the reason only because it must be done.

original: taduktaṃ dadāmi deyamityeva yajñe yaṣṭavyamityahamiti /
analyzed: tat uktam dadāmi deyam iti eva yajñe yaṣṭavyam iti aham iti
translated: That has been said: I give what is to be given, I sacrifice in the sacrifice.

original: yattu niṣiddhāsambandha eva samyaktvaṃ na tu vihitamātrānuṣṭhānamiti /
analyzed: yat tu niṣiddha asambandhaḥ eva samyaktvam na tu vihita mātra anuṣṭhānam iti
translated: But it is said that correctness is only the absence of connection with what is prohibited, not the performance of only what is enjoined.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: yatkiñcinniṣiddhāsambandhasyābhāvāt sarvaniṣiddhāsambandhasya sarvatra sulabhatvāditi sampradāyaḥ /
analyzed: yat kiñcid niṣiddha asambandhasya abhāvāt sarva niṣiddha asambandhasya sarvatra sulabha tvāt iti sampradāyaḥ
translated: According to the tradition, because there is no connection with any prohibited act, and because the absence of connection with all prohibited acts is easily found everywhere.

original: atra brūmaḥ /
analyzed: atra brūmaḥ
translated: Here we say:

original: bhagavaduddeśena kṛtaṃ kiñcideva karma sarvaṃ kāmyaṃ vā sarvaṃ nityaṃ vā sarvamiti🔽vā nādyaḥ ekenaiva kāmyena nityena vā snānena tathā kṛtena tatphalasiddhau bahuvittādisādhye
analyzed: bhagavat uddeśena kṛtam kiñcid eva karma sarvam kāmyam vā sarvam nityam vā sarvam iti  vā na ādyaḥ ekena eva kāmyena nityena vā snānena tathā kṛtena tad phala siddhau bahu vitta ādi sādhye
translated: Any act done with the Lord as the object is either all desirable, or all obligatory, or all of one kind.🔽Or not the first, because when that result is accomplished by just one desirable or obligatory bath done in that way,

original: śrāddhādāvapravṛttyāpatteḥ /
analyzed: śrāddha ādau apravṛtti āpatteḥ
translated: there would be the consequence of non-engagement in the śrāddha etc. which is accomplished with much wealth etc.

original: nāparau aśakyatvāt /
analyzed: na aparau aśakya tvāt
translated: Not the second two, because they are impossible.

original: na turyaḥ jāteṣṭyādernityatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: na turyaḥ jāta iṣṭi ādeḥ nitya tva abhāvāt
translated: Not the fourth, because the jāteṣṭi etc. are not obligatory.

original: tasmāt samyagagṛhasthāśramapālanasya tatphalaṃ samyaktantu sāmastyameva ato gayāśrāddhāderna brahmalokāvāptiḥ phalamiti sādhuktaṃ śāstradeśitaṃ
analyzed: tasmāt samyak a gṛhastha āśrama pālanasya tat phalam samyaktantu sāmastyam eva atas gayā śrāddha ādeḥ na brahma loka avāptiḥ phalam iti sādhu uktam śāstra deśitam
translated: Therefore, the result of properly maintaining the stage of a householder is the correctness of the whole. Hence, the attainment of Brahmaloka is not the result of the śrāddha etc. at Gayā. Thus it is well said that the result taught by the scriptures

original: phalaṃ anuṣṭhātarītyutsarga iti /
analyzed: phalam anuṣṭhātari iti utsargaḥ iti
translated: is for the performer, according to the general rule.

original: tacca phalaṃ kvacidvidhivākyaśrutaṃ kvaciccārthavādikamiti /
analyzed: tat ca phalam kvacid vidhi vākya śrutam kvacid ca ārthavādikam iti
translated: And that result is sometimes heard in the injunction sentence, and sometimes in the arthavada.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: kāryānvitaśaktivādapūrvapakṣaḥ
translated: The prima facie view on the doctrine of the power of words in relation to the effect.

original: nanvarthavādādīnāṃ siddhārthatayā na prāmāṇyam /
analyzed: nanu arthavāda ādīnām siddhārtha tayā na prāmāṇyam
translated: But the arthavadas etc. are not valid because they have accomplished their purpose.

original: kāryanvita eva padānāṃ śakyavadhāraṇāt vṛddhavyavahārādeva sarveṣāmādyā vyutpattiḥ upāyāntarasya śabdavyutpattyadhīnatvāt /
analyzed: kāri anvitaḥ eva padānām śaki avadhāraṇāt vṛddha vyavahārāt eva sarveṣām ādyā vyutpattiḥ upāya antarasya śabda vyutpatti adhīna tvāt
translated: Because the power of words can be ascertained only in relation to the effect, the initial understanding of all words is from the usage of elders, because any other means is dependent on the understanding of words.

original: tathā hi prayojakavākyoccāraṇānantaraṃ prayojyapravṛttimupalabhamāno bālaḥ prekṣāvadvākyoccāraṇasya🔽prayojanajijñāsāyāṃ tadanvayavyatirekānuvidhāyitvādupasthitatvācca prayojyavṛddhapravṛttimeva
analyzed: tathā hi prayojaka vākya uccāraṇa anantaram prayojya pravṛttim upalabhamānaḥ bālaḥ prekṣāvat vākya uccāraṇasya  prayojana jijñāsāyām tad anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyi tvāt upasthita tvāt ca prayojya vṛddha pravṛttim eva
