translated: For example, a child or an intelligent person, after hearing the utterance of an instigating sentence, observes the activity of the instigated person.

original: prayojanamavadhārayati na cākiñcit kurvatastādarthyaṃ sambhavatīti tajjanyaṃ pravṛttyanukūlaṃ
analyzed: prayojanam avadhārayati na ca akiñcit kurvataḥ tādarthyam sambhavati iti tat janyam pravṛtti anukūlam
translated: When inquiring about the purpose of the utterance of that sentence, he ascertains the activity of the instigated elder as the purpose, because it conforms to the positive and negative concomitance and is present. And it is not possible for something that does nothing to be for that purpose. Therefore, he imagines the knowledge of the effect that is conducive to the activity that is produced by that. And in his own activity,

original: kāryatājñānameva kalpayati svapravṛttau ca tena kāryatājñānameva kalpayati svapravṛttau
analyzed: kārya tā jñānam eva kalpayati sva pravṛttau ca tena kārya tā jñānam eva kalpayati sva pravṛttau
translated: he imagines the knowledge of the effect as the cause.

original: ca tena kāryatājñānasya hetutvāvadhāraṇāt nānyat pravṛtteḥ kāryatājñānāvaruddhatvāt /
analyzed: ca tena kārya tā jñānasya hetu tva avadhāraṇāt na anyat pravṛtteḥ kārya tā jñāna avaruddha tvāt
translated: And because the knowledge of the relation of means to an end is ascertained to be the cause of that, nothing else is the cause of activity, because activity is restricted to the knowledge of the relation of means to an end.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p / 🔽na caivaṃ śabdasya jñānadvārā pravṛttihetutvaṃ svapravṛttau bālena śabdāhitaviśeṣasya kāryatājñānasya hetutvenānavadhāraṇāt /
analyzed: bibl ind  na ca evam śabdasya jñāna dvārā pravṛtti hetu tvam sva pravṛttau bālena śabda āhita viśeṣasya kārya tā jñānasya hetu tvena anavadhāraṇāt
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.🔽And it is not so that the word is the cause of activity through the medium of knowledge, because in one's own activity, the knowledge of the relation of means to an end imparted by the word is not ascertained to be the cause.

original: jñāne ca pratyakṣādinānopāyakatvadarśanāt śabdāpi kāryatājñānaheturityavadhārya tatraiva
analyzed: jñāne ca pratyakṣa ādi nānā upāyaka tva darśanāt śabda api kāryatā jñāna hetuḥ iti avadhārya tatra eva
translated: And because the means of knowledge such as perception etc. are seen to be various in the case of knowledge, it is ascertained that the word is also the cause of the knowledge of the relation of means to an end, and in that alone

original: śaktiṃ kalpayati upasthitatvāt paścādāvāpoddhāreṇa kriyākārakapadānāṃ kāryānvitatattadartheṣu
analyzed: śaktim kalpayati upasthita tvāt paścāt āvāpa uddhāreṇa kriyā kāraka padānām kārya anvita tad tad artheṣu
translated: it imagines the power, because it is present. Later, by the method of elimination, it grasps the power of the words denoting action and factors in the objects connected with the effect,

original: śaktiṃ gṛhṇāti prathamagrahītasāmānyaśaktyanurodhāt /🔽syādetat yadyapi vṛddhavyavahārādādau kāryānvitadhīranumitā tathāpyanvitamātraśaktyaiva
analyzed: śaktim gṛhṇāti prathama grahīta sāmānya śakti anurodhāt  syāt etat yadi api vṛddha vyavahārāt ādau kārya anvita dhīḥ anumitā tathā api anvita mātra śaktyā eva
translated: in accordance with the power of the general meaning grasped first.🔽This may be said: Although at first the cognition connected with the effect is inferred from the usage of the elders, even then,

original: kāryatāvācakapadasamabhivyāhārādākāṅkṣādimahimnā kāryānvitadhīsambhavāt na kāryāṃśe
analyzed: kāryatā vācaka pada samabhivyāhārāt ākāṅkṣā ādi mahimnā kārya anvita dhī sambhavāt na kārya aṃśe
translated: by the power of the mere connected meaning alone, the cognition connected with the effect is possible by the greatness of expectancy etc. due to the association of the word denoting the relation of means to an end. Therefore, in the part of the effect,

original: 'pi śaktiḥ paramparayāpi śabdasya kāryānvitajñānānukūlatvādarthāpattau anyathopapattirapi /
analyzed: pi śaktiḥ paramparayā api śabdasya kārya anvita jñāna anukūla tvāt arthāpattau anyathā upapattiḥ api
translated: Even in the case of potency, the word's tendency towards the cognition of the object along with the effect is also due to presumption.

original: avaśyañcākāṅkṣādeḥ kāraṇatvaṃ kāryāṃśe śaktāvapi tadvyatirekādanvitābhidhānavyatirekaniyamāt /
analyzed: avaśyam ca ākāṅkṣā ādeḥ kāraṇa tvam kārya aṃśe śaktau api tad vyatirekāt anvita abhidhāna vyatireka niyamāt
translated: And the necessity of expectancy etc. as the cause is also due to the restriction of the invariable concomitance of the denotation of the related meaning with the restriction of the effect.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: sati cākāṅkṣādau kāryavyatirekadarśanādanvitābhidhānavyatiriko na kvāpyasti /
analyzed: sati ca ākāṅkṣā ādau kārya vyatireka darśanāt anvita abhidhāna vyatirikaḥ na kvāpi asti
translated: And when there is expectancy etc., there is no restriction of the denotation of the related meaning anywhere except in the case of the restriction of the effect, because the restriction of the effect is seen.

original: anyathā gavādipadānāṃ vyaktāveva śaktiḥ syāt saṃskārādeva vyaktilābhadarśanānna tatheti🔽yadi tadā kāryavācakapadādeva kāryānvitalābha iti kiṃ śaktyā vṛddhavyavahāre niyamataḥ🔽kāryānvitajñānaṃ tatra dṛṣṭamiti tatra śaktikalpane vṛddhavyavahāre śabdopasthāpitenaivānvayabodhadarśanācchabdasannidherevānvayabodhahetutva
analyzed: anyathā gavādi padānām vyaktau eva śaktiḥ syāt saṃskārāt eva vyakti lābha darśanāt na tathā iti  yadi tadā kārya vācaka padāt eva kārya anvita lābhaḥ iti kim śaktyā vṛddha vyavahāre niyamataḥ  kārya anvita jñānam tatra dṛṣṭam iti tatra śakti kalpane vṛddha vyavahāre śabda upasthāpitena eva anvaya bodha darśanāt śabda sannidheḥ eva anvaya bodha hetu tva
translated: If it were otherwise, the potency of words like 'cow' would be only in the individual, because the individual is seen to be obtained only from the impression, not so.

original: kalpane dvāramityādau śabda evādhyāhriyate /
analyzed: kalpane dvāram ityādau śabdaḥ eva adhyāhriyate
translated: And when there is expectancy etc., if the cognition of the object along with the effect is obtained only from the word denoting the effect, what is the use of potency? In the usage of the elders, the cognition of the object along with the effect is seen there. Therefore, in assuming potency there, the cognition of the related meaning is seen only by what is presented by the word in the usage of the elders. Therefore, in assuming the cognition of the related meaning as the cause of the word, the word itself is supplied in 'dvāram' etc.

original: kvacidasampūrṇavākye vṛddhavyavahārādādyavyutpatteḥ śabdasannirvyabhicaratīti cet tarhi siddhārthe 'pyanvayapratītidarśanāt kāryatvamapi vyabhicāri
analyzed: kvacid asampūrṇa vākye vṛddha vyavahārāt ādi avyutpatteḥ śabda sanniḥ vyabhicarati iti ced tarhi siddhārthe pi anvaya pratīti darśanāt kāryatvam api vyabhicāri
translated: If it be said that in some cases, where the sentence is incomplete, the initial cognition arises from the usage of the elders, and so the word is not contradicted, then, since the cognition of the relation is seen even in what is accomplished, the causal nature is also contradicted.

original: na ca tatra lakṣaṇā bādhakābhāvāt /
analyzed: na ca tatra lakṣaṇā bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: And there is no sublation by indication, because there is no sublating reason.

original: śaktiklapanābhiyā hyanyatra lakṣaṇānumatā iha tu laghīyasyā ubhayasādharaṇāpadārthamātraśaktyā mukhyasyaivocitatvāt /
analyzed: śakti klapanā bhiyā hi anyatra lakṣaṇā anumatā iha tu laghīyasyāḥ ubhaya sādharaṇā padārtha mātra śaktyā mukhyasya eva ucita tvāt
translated: For indication is admitted elsewhere only when there is a difficulty in construing, but here, since the principal sense, which is common to both, is fit to be denoted by the mere power of the word-meaning, which is less troublesome, it is proper.

original: kiñca kāryavāciliṅgādīnāṃ ākāṅkṣādyupetapādarthānvitasvārthabodhakatvamavaśyaṃ vācyamato viśeṣāt padāntarāṇāmapi tathātvamastu lāghavāditi
analyzed: kiñca kārya vāci liṅga ādīnām ākāṅkṣā ādi upeta pādartha anvita svārtha bodhaka tvam avaśyam vācyam atas viśeṣāt pada antarāṇām api tathātvam astu lāghavāt iti
translated: Moreover, it must be said that the words like the causal suffix, which have the meaning of the causal, necessarily convey the meaning of their own word related to the desired object. Therefore, by the rule of particularity, let the same be so for other words also, because it is less troublesome.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: Do not say so.

original: vyavahārahetutayānumite hi kāryānvitajñāne 'nvaya vyatirekābhyāṃ śabdasya sākṣātkāraṇatvavadhārayati
analyzed: vyavahāra hetutayā anumite hi kārya anvita jñāne nvaya vyatirekābhyām śabdasya sākṣāt kāraṇa tva avadhārayati
translated: For when the cognition of the desired object is inferred as the cause of usage, by positive and negative concomitance, the word is ascertained to be the direct cause.

original: na paramparayā sākṣāttvasyautsirgikatvena tatsambhave paramparayā anyāyyatvāditi
analyzed: na paramparayā sākṣāttvasya autsirgika tvena tad sambhave paramparayā anyāyya tvāt iti
translated: Not indirectly, because directness is natural, and it is proper when possible, and indirectness is improper.

original: tatraiva śaktiṃ kalpayati nānvitajñāne padārthajñāne vā apravartakatayā pravṛttyā
analyzed: tatra eva śaktim kalpayati na anvita jñāne padārtha jñāne vā apravartaka tayā pravṛttyā
translated: He imagines the potency only in that, not in the cognition of the qualified or in the cognition of the word-meaning, because it does not cause engagement.

original: svakāraṇatvena tayoranupasthāpanāt /
analyzed: sva kāraṇa tvena tayoḥ anupasthāpanāt
translated: Because it does not present those two as the cause of itself.

original: na cānvitajñānaśaktāvapi paramparayā kāryatvadhīḥ sambhavatītyarthāpattyā saiva kalpyatāṃ lāghavāt na tu viśiṣṭajñāne śaktiranyalabhyatvāt
analyzed: na ca anvita jñāna śaktau api paramparayā kāryatva dhīḥ sambhavati iti arthāpattyā sā eva kalpyatām lāghavāt na tu viśiṣṭa jñāne śaktiḥ anya labhya tvāt
translated: And it cannot be said that the cognition of the qualified is imagined by presumption as having the potency in the cognition of the qualified, because it is inferred from something else, due to the possibility of the cognition of the potency in the cognition of the qualified being the effect indirectly, and because of the lightness of presumption, not because of the potency in the cognition of the qualified.

original: iti vācyam /🔽arthāpatteḥ sākṣādupapādakamātraviṣayatvena nyūnādhikāgrāhakatvāt sākṣādupapādakakāryanvitajñāne🔽śaktiḥ kalpyate liṅgādīnāṃ śakteralpanāt anyalabhyatvatarkasyāpyabhāvāt vā ādyavyutpattervicāryatvāt /
analyzed: iti vācyam  arthāpatteḥ sākṣāt upapādaka mātra viṣaya tvena nyūna adhika a grāhaka tvāt sākṣāt upapādaka kāri anvita jñāne  śaktiḥ kalpyate liṅga ādīnām śakteḥ alpanāt anya labhya tva tarkasya api abhāvāt vā ādya vyutpatteḥ vicārya tvāt
translated: This is not correct.🔽Because presumption grasps only what is directly explanatory, and does not grasp what is less or more, the potency is imagined in the cognition of the qualified which is directly explanatory,🔽because the potency of the inferential mark etc. is less, and because there is no reasoning that it is inferred from something else, or because the initial understanding is to be considered.

original: kiñca pravṛttikāraṇatayopasthitaṃ kāryanvitajñānamapahāyānupasthitānvitajñānamātre śaktikalpanamayuktaṃ hetvabhāvādupasthityantare ca gauravāt
analyzed: kiñca pravṛtti kāraṇatayā upasthitam kāri anvita jñānam apahāya anupasthita anvita jñāna mātre śakti kalpanam ayuktam hetu abhāvāt upasthiti antare ca gauravāt
translated: Moreover, it is not proper to imagine the potency only in the cognition of the qualified which is not presented, abandoning the cognition of the qualified which is presented as the cause of engagement, because there is no reason, and because there is heaviness in another presentation.

original: atha kāryanvitajñānopasthitāvapyanvitajñānamapyupasthitamiti lāghavāt kāryāṃśamapahāyānvite
analyzed: atha kāri anvita jñāna upasthitau api anvita jñānam api upasthitam iti lāghavāt kārya aṃśam apahāya anvite
translated: If it is argued that even when the cognition of the object qualified by the relation is present, the cognition of the qualifier alone is grasped due to the economy of assumptions, and the power is grasped in the qualifier alone after discarding the qualified part,

original: śaktirgṛhyatāmiti cet na jñāne hi padānāṃ śaktiḥ śakyatvānnārtheṣu anyacca kāryānvitajñānaṃ
analyzed: śaktiḥ gṛhyatām iti ced na jñāne hi padānām śaktiḥ śakya tvāt na artheṣu anyat ca kārya anvita jñānam
translated: this is not correct. The power of words is in the cognition, not in the objects, because they are capable of producing cognition. Moreover, the cognition of the object qualified by the relation

original: anyadevānvitajñānaṃ viṣayabhedena jñānabhedāt /
analyzed: anyat eva anvita jñānam viṣaya bhedena jñāna bhedāt
translated: is different from the cognition of the qualifier alone, because the cognition is different due to the difference in the object.

original: taduktamabhāvavāde anyadbhūtalajñānamanyacca ghaṭavadbhūtalajñānamiti anvitajñānamupasthāpya tatra śaktigraha iti gauravameva /
analyzed: tat uktam abhāva vāde anyat bhū tala jñānam anyat ca ghaṭa vat bhū tala jñānam iti anvita jñānam upasthāpya tatra śakti grahaḥ iti gauravam eva
translated: This has been stated in the doctrine of negation that the cognition of the ground is different from the cognition of the ground qualified by the pot. After presenting the cognition of the object qualified by the relation, the power is grasped in that. This is indeed cumbersome.

original: gaghuni śakye sambhavatyanyalabhyaṃ guru na tatheti cet na yugapadupasthitau tathātvāt /🔽na ca tasyāpyanupasthitiḥ puruṣaviśeṣadoṣāt sarvairevādyavyutpattau tathānavagamāt /
analyzed: gaghuni śakye sambhavati anya labhyam guru na tathā iti ced na yugapad upasthitau tathātvāt  na ca tasya api anupasthitiḥ puruṣa viśeṣa doṣāt sarvaiḥ eva ādi avyutpattau tathā anavagamāt
translated: If it is argued that when the simple object is possible, it is cumbersome to assume the qualified object, it is not so, because when both are presented simultaneously, it is so.🔽And it is not that the qualified object is not presented, because of the fault of a particular person, since all would not understand it in that way if they were not instructed in that way.

original: tathāpi na kāryānvite śaktiḥ kāryavāciliṅgādīnāṃ vyabhicārāditi cet na sarvapadānāṃ kāryatvaviśiṣṭadhījanakatvāt /
analyzed: tathā api na kārya anvite śaktiḥ kārya vāci liṅga ādīnām vyabhicārāt iti ced na sarva padānām kāryatva viśiṣṭa dhī janaka tvāt
translated: Even so, if it is argued that the power is not in the object qualified by the relation because of the deviation of words expressing the relation, it is not so, because all words produce the cognition qualified by the relation.

original: tacca kāryānvitasvārthāpratipādakatayetarānvitasvārthakāryapratipādakatayā veti /
analyzed: tat ca kārya anvita sva artha a pratipādaka tayā itara anvita sva artha kārya pratipādaka tayā vā iti
translated: And that is because it does not convey its own meaning as connected with an effect, or because it conveys its own meaning as connected with something else.

original: evañca kāryānvitavyutpattau satyāmanākāṅkṣādau vyabhicārādākāṅkṣāderupādhitvam /🔽tathācopajīvyaprathamabhāvikāryānvitavyutpattyanurodhena vidhyaśrutāvapi kāryadhyāhāraḥ🔽kvacillakṣaṇā kvacidasaṃsargāgraha iti siddhārthe 'nvayapratītidarśanāduttarakālamanvitamātre
analyzed: evam ca kārya anvita vyutpattau satyām anākāṅkṣā ādau vyabhicārāt ākāṅkṣā ādeḥ upādhi tvam  tathā ca upajīvya prathama bhāvi kārya anvita vyutpatti anurodhena vidhi aśrutau api kāri adhyāhāraḥ  kvacid lakṣaṇā kvacid a saṃsarga agrahaḥ iti siddhārthe nvaya pratīti darśanāt uttara kālam anvita mātre
translated: And thus, when there is the understanding of the meaning as connected with an effect, there is the fallacy of non-requirement, etc., so requirement, etc., are the limiting conditions.🔽And thus, in accordance with the understanding of the meaning as connected with an effect, which is primary and to be relied upon, even in the absence of the injunctive suffix, the effect is to be supplied.

original: śaktireva kalpyatāṃ prācīnakāryānvitajñānaṃ bādhyatāmityapyata eva nirastam /
analyzed: śaktiḥ eva kalpyatām prācīna kārya anvita jñānam bādhyatām iti api atas eva nirastam
translated: And thus, in some cases there is secondary meaning, and in some cases non-apprehension of non-connection. So, because the understanding of the connected meaning is seen even after the primary meaning has been understood, let the power be assumed only with regard to the connected meaning, and let the prior understanding of the meaning as connected with an effect be contradicted. This too is refuted by the same argument.

original: pūrvakalpanātaḥ kalpanāntaraprasaṅgāt uttarakālabhāvisiddhārthaprayogasya lakṣaṇādibhirapyupapatteḥ ananyathāsiddhatvābhāvena prācīnajñānābādhakatvāt
analyzed: pūrva kalpanātaḥ kalpanā antara prasaṅgāt uttara kāla bhāvi siddha artha prayogasya lakṣaṇa ādibhiḥ api upapatteḥ ananyathā siddha tva abhāvena prācīna jñāna ābādhaka tvāt  /
translated: Because it would lead to the assumption of another power when there is already one, and because the use of the understood meaning which occurs later can be explained by secondary meaning, etc., and because there is no non-difference, the prior cognition is not contradicted.

original: upajīvyavyāghātācca /
analyzed: upajīvya vyāghātāt ca
translated: And because it would contradict what is to be relied upon.

original: atha siddhārthe 'pi vyutpattiḥ tathāhi upalabdhacaitraputrajanmā bālastādṛśenaiva
analyzed: atha siddhārthe vyutpattiḥ tathā hi upalabdha caitra putra janmā bālaḥ tādṛśena eva
translated: Even in the case of the understood meaning, there is understanding, thus: A child who has experienced the birth of Caitra's son, by that very

original: vārtāhāreṇa samaṃ caitrasamīpaṃ gataścaiva putraste jāta iti vārtāhāravākyaṃ śṛṇvan
analyzed: vārtāhāreṇa samam caitra samīpam gataḥ ca eva putraḥ te jātaḥ iti vārtāhāra vākyam śṛṇvan
translated: And hearing the words of the messenger that your son is born,

original: caitrasya mukhaprasādaṃ gṛhṇan śroturharṣamanuminoti hārṣācca tatkāraṇaṃ putrajanmajñānaṃ🔽kalpayati upasthitvādupapādakatvāda nyopasthitau gauravācca tatra vākyasya kāraṇatāṃ
analyzed: caitrasya mukha prasādam gṛhṇan śrotuḥ harṣam anuminoti hārṣāt ca tad kāraṇam putra janma jñānam  kalpayati nya upasthitau gauravāt ca tatra vākyasya kāraṇatām
translated: perceiving the joy of Caitra's face, he infers the joy of the listener. And from the joy, he infers the cause of that, the knowledge of the birth of a son.

original: kalpayati lāghavāditi cet na harṣahetūnāṃ bahūnāṃ sambhavāt harṣeṇa liṅgena putrajanmajñānasya
analyzed: kalpayati lāghavāt iti ced na harṣa hetūnām bahūnām sambhavāt harṣeṇa liṅgena putra janma jñānasya
translated: He infers that the sentence is the cause there, because of its presence, because of its being a means of producing knowledge, and because of the difficulty in the presence of another. If it is argued that it is because of the lightness of the sentence, it is not so, because many causes of joy are possible.

original: bālenānumātumaśakyatvāt priyāntarajñānasya pariśeṣayitumaśakyatvācca /🔽atha putrajanmajñānāvyabhicārivṛddhināddhādikriyāviśeṣadarśanāt putrajanmajñānānumānamiti🔽cet tarhi putraste jāta iti vākyaṃ tat kriyākartavyaparameveti kāryānvitajñānajanakatvameva
analyzed: bālena anumātum aśakya tvāt priya antara jñānasya pariśeṣayitum aśakya tvāt ca  atha putra janma jñāna avyabhicāri vṛddhi nāddha ādi kriyā viśeṣa darśanāt putra janma jñāna anumānam iti  ced tarhi putraḥ te jātaḥ iti vākyam tat kriyā kartavya param eva iti kārya anvita jñāna janaka tvam eva
translated: Because a child cannot infer the knowledge of the birth of a son from the sign of joy, and because the knowledge of another's pleasure cannot be determined by the method of difference.🔽If it is argued that the inference of the knowledge of the birth of a son is from the observation of the particular action of crying etc. which is invariably concomitant with the knowledge of the birth of a son,

original: tasya prathamato gṛhyate uttarakālaṃ putrajanmajñānānumānamiti na vyutpattiḥ kāryaṃ
analyzed: tasya prathamatas gṛhyate uttara kālam putra janma jñāna anumānam iti na vyutpattiḥ kāryam
translated: then the sentence your son is born is only about that action to be done. Therefore, the production of knowledge of the effect is only grasped first. The inference of the knowledge of the birth of a son is later. Thus there is no need for learning.

original: jahāti yatrāpīha sahakāratarau madhuraṃ piko rautīti prasiddhārthapadasamānādhikaraṇyādibhirvyutpattistatrāpi🔽vyavahāradhīnyutpattipūrvikā kāryānvita eva yuktā pikapadaśaktiḥ pūrvaṃ nāvadhṛteti
analyzed: jahāti yatra api iha sahakāratarau madhuram pikaḥ rauti iti prasiddha artha pada samānādhikaraṇya ādibhiḥ vyutpattiḥ tatra api  vyavahāra dhīnī utpatti pūrvikā kārya anvite eva yuktā pika pada śaktiḥ pūrvam na avadhṛtā iti
translated: Where a cuckoo is heard in a mango tree, the knowledge of the meaning is through the similarity of the words with well-known meanings, etc. Even there, the potency of the word 'cuckoo' is proper only in relation to the object to be accomplished, preceded by the knowledge dependent on usage.

original: cet na tatra pikamānayetyādau kasyacit kāryānvita eva vyutpatteḥ upajīvyajātītayā
analyzed: ced na tatra pikam ānaya ityādau kasyacid kārya anvite eva vyutpatteḥ upajīvya jātī tayā
translated: If it is argued that it was not previously ascertained, it is not so. Because someone has the knowledge only in relation to the object to be accomplished in the case of 'bring the cuckoo', etc.

original: ca tasyā balavattvaṃ kiñcedamapi kāryānvitajñānaśaktaṃ padatvāditi sāmānyato 'vagataṃ
analyzed: ca tasyāḥ balavat tvam kiñca idam api kārya anvita jñāna śaktam pada tvāt iti sāmānyatas vagatam
translated: And that is stronger due to being based on the universal that is not overridden. Moreover, this is also known in general as 'having the potency to produce the knowledge of the object to be accomplished, because it is a word'.

original: svārthāviśeṣaḥ paraṃ nādhigataḥ sa idānīṃ suhṛdupadeśādibhiravagamyate /
analyzed: svārtha aviśeṣaḥ param na adhigataḥ saḥ idānīm suhṛd upadeśa ādibhiḥ avagamyate
translated: The particular of one's own meaning is not understood. It is now understood through the instruction of a well-wisher, etc.

original: ataḥ siddhaṃ pravṛttiparāṇāṃ śabdānāṃ pravartakajñānajanakatvaṃ tacca kvacit sākṣāt kāryānvayāt kvacit paramparayā kāryānvayāt ata eva vidhiśeṣībhūtārthavādānāṃ
analyzed: atas siddham pravṛtti parāṇām śabdānām pravartaka jñāna janaka tvam tat ca kvacid sākṣāt kārya anvayāt kvacid paramparayā kārya anvayāt atas eva vidhi śeṣībhūta artha vādānām
translated: Therefore, it is established that words whose purpose is to bring about engagement have the purpose of producing the knowledge that brings about engagement. And that is sometimes directly from the relation to the object to be accomplished, and sometimes indirectly from the relation to the object to be accomplished. For this very reason, the purpose of arthavada statements that become subordinate to injunctions is

original: svargādipadaśaktigrāhakāṇāñca pravṛttiparatvena paramparayā kāryānvayāt kāryānvitasvārthābodhakatvamiti /🔽yatra purāṇabhāratādi pāṭhe phalaśrutirasti tatrārthavādakalpitavidhiśeṣībhūtatvena
analyzed: svarga ādi pada śakti grāhakāṇām ca pravṛtti paratvena paramparayā kārya anvayāt kārya anvita sva artha ābodhaka tvam iti  yatra purāṇa bhārata ādi pāṭhe phala śrutiḥ asti tatra arthavāda kalpita vidhi śeṣībhūta tvena
translated: And the words that convey the power of words like heaven etc. are engaged in the purpose of activity, and by the indirect connection with the effect, they do not convey the meaning connected with the effect.🔽Where there is a statement of result in the recitation of the Puranas, Mahabharata etc., there their engagement is only in the purpose of activity by becoming the subsidiary to the injunction imagined as arthavada.

original: pravṛttiparatvameva teṣāmatiparamparayā kāryānvitasvārthabodhakatvaṃ svarūpākhyānaparāṇāntu
analyzed: pravṛtti para tvam eva teṣām ati paramparayā kārya anvita sva artha bodhaka tvam svarūpa ākhyāna parāṇām tu
translated: By that indirect connection, they convey the meaning connected with the effect. But for those engaged in narrating the nature,

original: kāvyanāṭakādīnāṃ padārthāsaṃsargāgraheṇa saṃsargavyavahāro na saṃsargagraha iti /
analyzed: kāvya nāṭaka ādīnām padārtha a saṃsarga agraheṇa saṃsarga vyavahāraḥ na saṃsarga grahe iti
translated: the usage of connection by the non-apprehension of the unconnected meaning of poetry, drama etc. is not the apprehension of connection.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: kāryānvitaśaktivādasiddhāntaḥ🔽atrocyate ghaṭamānayeti vākyaśravaṇānantaraṃ prayojyasya dhaṭānayanagocarapravṛttyā
analyzed: atrā ucyate ghaṭam ānaya iti vākya śravaṇa anantaram prayojyasya dhaṭa ānayana gocara pravṛttyā
translated: The conclusion of the doctrine of the power connected with the effect.🔽Here it is said: After hearing the sentence Bring the pot, the child infers the knowledge of the causal relation of bringing the pot by the activity of the employed person towards bringing the pot,

original: ghaṭānayanakāryatājñānamanumitaṃ bālena na tu kāryānvitajñānaṃ pravṛttiviśeṣe tasyāhetutvādghaṭādipadaśaktigrahe tasyānupayogācca /
analyzed: ghaṭa ānayana kārya tā jñānam anumitam bālena na tu kārya anvita jñānam pravṛtti viśeṣe tasya ahetu tvāt ghaṭa ādi pada śakti grahe tasya anupayogāt ca
translated: but not the knowledge connected with the effect, because that is not the cause of the particular activity, and because it is not useful in the comprehension of the power of words like pot etc.

original: tatra tajjñānaviśeṣe ghaṭamānayetivākyaviśeṣasyānākalitapadavibhāgasya hetutvamavadhārya
analyzed: tatra tad jñāna viśeṣe ghaṭam ānaya iti vākya viśeṣasya an ākalita pada vibhāgasya hetu tvam avadhārya
translated: There, having determined that the particular sentence bring the pot without the division of words being grasped is the cause for the particular knowledge of that,

original: ghaṭapadadvitīyādhātuvidhipratyayānāṃ pratyekamāvāpodvāpadvāreṇa ghaṭakarmatvānayana🔽kāryatvajñāneṣu pratyekaṃ kāraṇatvamavagamya śaktiṃ kalpayati /
analyzed: ghaṭa pada dvitīyā dhātu vidhi pratyayānām pratyekam āvāpa udvāpa dvāreṇa ghaṭa karma tva ānayana  kārya tva jñāneṣu pratyekam kāraṇa tvam avagamya śaktim kalpayati
translated: having understood that the word ghata, the second case ending, the verbal root, the suffix and the ending are each a cause for the knowledge of the pot, the object, the action of bringing,🔽the effect, he imagines the potency.

original: paścāt pravṛttisāmānyenānumitakāryānvitajñāna vākyamātrasyānyalabhyatvena kāryāṃśamapahāyānvitajñānamātre
analyzed: paścāt pravṛtti sāmānyena anumita kārya anvita jñāna vākya mātrasya anya labhya tvena kārya aṃśam apahāya anvita jñāna mātre
translated: Later, having inferred the knowledge of the effect-related by the general activity, since the sentence alone is obtained by another means, having omitted the part of the effect, he imagines the potency in the mere knowledge of the related

original: śaktiṃ kalpayati na tu prathamaṃ vākyamātrasya kāryānvitajñānamātrahetutvakalpanaṃ /
analyzed: śaktim kalpayati na tu prathamam vākya mātrasya kārya anvita jñāna mātra hetu tva kalpanam
translated: he does not first imagine the mere sentence to be the cause of the mere knowledge of the effect-related.

original: atha ghaṭānayanakriyāyāḥ prathamaṃ kriyātvajñānātpravṛttimātrānumānaṃ tena ca kāryānvitajñānamanumāya
analyzed: atha ghaṭa ānayana kriyāyāḥ prathamam kriyā tva jñānāt pravṛtti mātra anumānam tena ca kārya anvita jñānam anumāya
translated: If it is argued that first, from the knowledge of the action-ness of the action of bringing the pot, there is the mere inference of activity, and by that, having inferred the knowledge of the effect-related,

original: tatra vākyamātrasya hetutvaṃ kalpayitvā śaktiṃ kalpayati taduttaraṃ viśeṣayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvadhīriti
analyzed: tatra vākya mātrasya hetu tvam kalpayitvā śaktim kalpayati tat uttaram viśeṣayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāva dhīḥ iti
translated: having imagined the sentence alone to be the cause there, he imagines the potency, and the cognition of the relation of cause and effect between the particulars follows that,

original: cet na prathamaṃ pravṛttimātrakāryānvitajñānamātrayoranumānaṃ bālasya kramaśobhavatītyatra
analyzed: ced na prathamam pravṛtti mātra kārya anvita jñāna mātrayoḥ anumānam bālasya kramaśas bhavati iti atra
translated: If it is argued that the child does not have inference of mere activity and mere effect-related knowledge in sequence,

original: mānābhāvāt ghaṭādipadaśaktigrahasya tena vināpi sambhavāt /
analyzed: māna abhāvāt ghaṭa ādi pada śakti grahasya tena vinā api sambhavāt
translated: because there is no evidence for that, and because the understanding of the potency of words like 'pot' etc. is possible even without that,

original: na ca tadanumānasāmagrī tadāvṛtteti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca tad anumāna sāmagrī tad āvṛttā iti vācyam
translated: and it cannot be said that the means of inferring that is not available to him,

original: tadā vyāptyādismṛtau mānābhāvāt /
analyzed: tadā vyāpti ādi smṛtau māna abhāvāt
translated: because there is no evidence for the memory of the invariable relation etc. at that time.

original: sāmānyayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvagraho viśeṣayostathātvagrahe heturiti cet na viśeṣayoranvayavyatirekābhyāmeva tadgrahāt /
analyzed: sāmānyayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāva grahaḥ viśeṣayoḥ tathātva grahe hetuḥ iti ced na viśeṣayoḥ anvaya vyatirekābhyām eva tad grahāt
translated: If it is argued that the understanding of the relation of cause and effect between the two universals is the reason for understanding the same between the two particulars, it is not so, because that is understood from positive and negative concomitance between the particulars themselves.

original: yathā dhūmavahniviśeṣayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvagrahe tatsāmānyayorapi hetuhetumadbhāvo🔽bhāsate anyathā na sakṛddarśanagamyā vyāptiḥ syāt tathātrāpi viśeṣayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvavittivedya🔽eva sāmānyayostathābhāva iti cet na pratyakṣeṇa viśeṣagrahe yogyatvāt sāmānyamapi
analyzed: yathā dhūma vahni viśeṣayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāva grahe tad sāmānyayoḥ api hetu hetumat bhāvaḥ  bhāsate anyathā na sakṛt darśana gamyā vyāptiḥ syāt tathā atra api viśeṣayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāva vitti vedya  eva sāmānyayoḥ tathā bhāvaḥ iti ced na pratyakṣeṇa viśeṣa grahe yogya tvāt sāmānyam api
translated: Just as when there is the understanding of the relation of cause and effect between the particulars of smoke and fire, the relation of cause and effect between their universals also becomes manifest,🔽otherwise the invariable relation could not be understood from a single instance, similarly here also, the relation of cause and effect between the universals is known only when it is known between the particulars.🔽If it is argued that when the particulars are grasped by perception, the universal also appears because of its fitness, but in the present case, when a particular effect is inferred from a particular cause, the universal does not appear, so there is no simultaneous appearance, it is not so,

original: bhāsate prakṛte ca kāryaviśeṣeṇa kāraṇaviśeṣānumitau na sāmānyamiti na yugapadupasthitiḥ /
analyzed: bhāsate prakṛte ca kārya viśeṣeṇa kāraṇa viśeṣa anumitau na sāmānyam iti na yugapad upasthitiḥ
translated: because when the particulars are grasped by perception, the universal also appears due to its fitness. But in the present case, when a particular effect is inferred from a particular cause, the universal does not appear, so there is no simultaneous appearance.

original: atha viśeṣayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvāt sāmānyayorapi tathātvamanumāpayatīti cet tarhi
analyzed: atha viśeṣayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāvāt sāmānyayoḥ api tathātvam anumāpayati iti ced tarhi
translated: If it is argued that the relation of cause and effect between the particulars implies the same between the universals, then

original: viśeṣayoḥ kāryakāraṇabhāvāvagamaḥ prāthamika iti tanmūlakaḥ prathamaṃ padaviśeṣe🔽śaktigraha eva syāt niṣprayojanakatvenāntarānumitau mānābhāvāt yaccoktaṃ pravṛttikāraṇatayopasthitaṃ🔽kāryānvitajñānamapahāyānvitajñānaṃ kalpayitvā tatra śaktikalpanamayuktaṃ uyayathā
analyzed: viśeṣayoḥ kārya kāraṇa bhāva avagamaḥ prāthamikaḥ iti tad mūlakaḥ prathamam pada viśeṣe  śakti grahaḥ eva syāt niṣprayojanaka tvena antara anumitau māna abhāvāt yat ca uktam pravṛtti kāraṇatayā upasthitam  kārya anvita jñānam apahāya anvita jñānam kalpayitvā tatra śakti kalpanam ayuktam
translated: the ascertainment of the relation of cause and effect between the particulars is primary, so the cognition of the power in the particular word based on that would occur first,🔽because there is no means of knowledge for the internal inference due to its being purposeless. And what was said - that it is unreasonable to assume the power in that, abandoning the cognition of the object-possessor which is presented as the cause of activity,

original: gauravāditi tanna kāryānvitajñāne 'nvitajñānatvasya sattvāt tadviśeṣatvāt tasya atastatraiva
analyzed: gauravāt iti tat na kārya anvita jñāne nvita jñāna tvasya sattvāt tad viśeṣa tvāt tasya atas tatra eva
translated: and assuming the cognition of the possessor - is not so, because in the cognition of the object-possessor, the state of being a cognition of the possessor exists, and that is a particular of it, therefore the cognition of the power occurs there itself,

original: śaktigraho na kāryatvāṃśe 'pi /🔽ata eva ghaṭavadbhūtalajñāne bhūtalajñānanatvamapīti tadbhinnaṃ tajjñānamabhāvavyavahāre kāraṇaṃ tvayāpi svīkṛtaṃ /
analyzed: śakti grahaḥ na kāryatva aṃśe pi  atas eva ghaṭa vat bhū tala jñāne bhū tala jñānana tvam api iti tat bhinnam tat jñānam abhāva vyavahāre kāraṇam tvayā api svīkṛtam
translated: not even in the aspect of being an object.🔽For this very reason, in the cognition of the ground with the pot, the state of being a cognition of the ground is also different from that, and the cognition of that is accepted by you as the cause of the usage of negation.

original: astyevaṃ kintu tadupasthitāvapyanvitajñānatvaṃ na viṣaya iti tasyaivopasthityantaraṃ
analyzed: asti evam kintu tad upasthitau api anvita jñāna tvam na viṣaye iti tasya eva upasthiti antaram
translated: This is so, but even in its presentation, the state of being a cognition of the possessor is not the object, so another presentation of that itself is necessary.

original: kalpyamiti cet na kāryānvitajñāne anvitajñānaṃ viśeṣyamiti tadupasthitau tasyāpi
analyzed: kalpyam iti ced na kārya anvita jñāne anvita jñānam viśeṣyam iti tad upasthitau tasya api
translated: If it is argued that it is to be imagined, it is not so, because in the cognition of the qualified object, the qualified cognition is the qualifier. When it is present, it is also

original: viṣayatvāt viśiṣṭajñānasāmagrītoviśeṣyabhānāvaśyambhāvāt anyathā anyajjātijñānaṃ
analyzed: viṣaya tvāt viśiṣṭa jñāna sāmagrītaḥ viśeṣya bhāna avaśyambhāvāt anyathā anyat jāti jñānam
translated: the object, because the presence of the qualifier is necessary from the collection of causes of the cognition of the qualified. Otherwise, the cognition of the universal

original: anyacca jātiviśiṣṭajñānamiti vyaktijñānamapahāya jātijñānaṃ kvāpi nopasthitamiti
analyzed: anyat ca jāti viśiṣṭa jñānam iti vyakti jñānam apahāya jāti jñānam kvāpi na upasthitam iti
translated: is one thing and the cognition of the individual qualified by the universal is another. Since the cognition of the individual is not present anywhere without the cognition of the universal,

original: na tava jātireva padārthaḥ syāt jāteḥ kevalopasthitau ca vyaktisamānasaṃvit saṃvedyatvaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: na tava jātiḥ eva padārthaḥ syāt jāteḥ kevala upasthitau ca vyakti samāna saṃvid saṃvedya tvam na syāt
translated: the universal alone cannot be the meaning of a word for you. And if the universal were present alone, there would be no experience of the individual being experienced in the same way as the universal.

original: atha jātiviśiṣṭajñānopasthitervyavyaktijñānaviṣayatve 'pi gauravādvyakteranyalabhyatvācca
analyzed: atha jāti viśiṣṭa jñāna upasthiteḥ vya vyakti jñāna viṣaya tve pi gauravāt vyakteḥ anya labhya tvāt ca
translated: If it is argued that even though the cognition of the universal qualified by the individual is the object of the cognition of the individual, due to the burden of the individual and because it is known from something else,

original: jātiviśiṣṭajñānatvaṃ na śakyatāvacchedakaṃ kintu jātijñānatvaṃ lāghavāditi mataṃ tarhi tulyam /
analyzed: jāti viśiṣṭa jñāna tvam na śakya tā avacchedakam kintu jāti jñāna tvam lāghavāt iti matam tarhi tulyam
translated: the property of being the cognition of the universal qualified cannot be the defining characteristic, but due to simplicity, the property of being the cognition of the universal is the defining characteristic, then that is the same for me.

original: na ca yugapadupasthitau lāghavāvatārona cātra yugapadupasthitiriti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca yugapad upasthitau lāghava avatāraḥ na ca atra yugapad upasthitiḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that simplicity does not apply when they are present simultaneously, and they are not present simultaneously here.

original: viśiṣṭajñānasya viśeṣyaviṣayatvaniyamāt kiñca mamedaṃ kāryamiti jñānaṃ sākṣādupapādakaṃ
analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñānasya viśeṣya viṣaya tva niyamāt kiñca mama idam kāryam iti jñānam sākṣāt upapādakam
translated: Because the cognition of the qualified is necessarily about the qualifier. Moreover, the cognition this is my duty is directly explanatory.

original: pravṛttyā svakāraṇatvenānumitamatastatra śaktiṃ gṛhṇīyāt sākṣādupapādakaviṣayatvāt
analyzed: pravṛttyā sva kāraṇatvena anumitam atas tatra śaktim gṛhṇīyāt sākṣāt upapādaka viṣayatvāt
translated: Therefore, one should grasp the potency there, because imagination has as its object what is directly productive.

original: kalpanāyāḥ śaktiṃ gṛhṇīyāt sākṣādupapādakaviṣayatvāt kalpanāyāḥ /
analyzed: kalpanāyāḥ śaktim gṛhṇīyāt sākṣāt upapādaka viṣaya tvāt kalpanāyāḥ
translated: One should grasp the potency, because imagination has as its object what is directly productive.

original: na tvidaṃ kāryajñāne tasya sākṣādupapādakatvāt /
analyzed: na tu idam kārya jñāne tasya sākṣāt upapādaka tvāt
translated: But this is not so in the cognition of the effect, because that is directly productive of it.

original: athedaṃ kāryamitijñāne śaktyaiva paramparayānumānadvārā mamedaṃ kāryamiti jñānasambhavāt🔽anyalabhyatvena na śaktikalpanā tarhi itarānvitajñānaśaktyaiva kāryavācakapadasamabhivyāhārāreṇaiva
analyzed: atha idam kāryam iti jñāne śaktyā eva paramparayā anumāna dvārā mama idam kāryam iti jñāna sambhavāt  anya labhya tvena na śakti kalpanā tarhi itara anvita jñāna śaktyā eva kārya vācaka pada samabhivyāhāra āreṇa eva
translated: Now, in the cognition this is to be done, the knowledge that this is to be done by me is possible through potency only indirectly by way of inference.

original: kāryānvitajñānasambhavāt anyalabhyatvena na tatra śaktikalpanamiti tulyam /
analyzed: kārya anvita jñāna sambhavāt anya labhya tvena na tatra śakti kalpanam iti tulyam
translated: If it is argued that potency should not be imagined as obtainable from something else, then the same applies to the cognition of the object qualified by another, because the knowledge of the object qualified by the potency of the cognition of what is connected with another is possible only through the association of the word denoting the effect.🔽Potency should not be imagined there as obtainable from something else.

original: nanvidaṃ kāryamiti jñānaṃ sākṣādeva pravartakaṃ kartavyatāprayojakayāvadekaviśeṣaṇasya svagatatvapratisandhānaṃ sahakāri tena nātiprasaṅgaḥ
analyzed: nanu idam kāryam iti jñānam sākṣāt eva pravartakam kartavya tā prayojaka yāvat eka viśeṣaṇasya svagata tva pratisandhānam sahakāri tena na atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: Now, the cognition this is to be done is directly instigating, prompting the performance by the cognition of the object to be done. The cognition of the object to be done is the only special feature that is a contributory factor. It is not an over-extension.

original: na ca sahakārivilambena kāryānutpāde sākṣātsādhanatvaṃ nivartata iti cet na lāghavena
analyzed: na ca sahakāri vilambena kārya anutpāde sākṣāt sādhana tvam nivartate iti ced na lāghavena
translated: If it is argued that when the effect does not arise due to the delay of the contributory factor, the direct instrumentality ceases, it is not so. It is due to lightness.

original: mamedaṃ kāryamiti jñānādeva pravṛtteḥ yathā ca bhaviṣyadviṣayā kāryatānumitistasthoktamadhastāt /🔽api ca yādṛśasya puruṣasyāvigītakṛtisādhyamidaṃ tādṛśo 'hamiti dhīrna pravṛttihetuḥ
analyzed: mama idam kāryam iti jñānāt eva pravṛtteḥ yathā ca bhaviṣyat viṣayā kāryatā anumitiḥ tasthā uktam adhastāt  api ca yādṛśasya puruṣasya avigīta kṛti sādhyam idam tādṛśaḥ ham iti dhīḥ na pravṛtti hetuḥ
translated: Because activity is caused by the mere knowledge that this is my duty, and as for the inference of the nature of an object to be accomplished in the future, that has been stated below.🔽Moreover, the cognition that I am like the person whose activity is the means of accomplishing this is not the cause of activity.

original: kṛtakriyamāṇaviṣayakakṛtisādhyatājñānasya siddhaviṣayasyāsiddhaviṣayecchānutpādakatvāt🔽icchāyāḥ svaprakārakadhīsādhyatvena kṛtyā sādhayāmītīcchāyāḥ svaprakāradhīsādhyatvena
analyzed: kṛta kriyamāṇa viṣayaka kṛti sādhya tā jñānasya siddha viṣayasya asiddha viṣaya icchā anutpādaka tvāt  icchāyāḥ sva prakāraka dhī sādhya tvena kṛtyā sādhayāmi iti icchāyāḥ sva prakāra dhī sādhya tvena
translated: Because the knowledge of the nature of being accomplished by the activity of what has been done and what is being done, which has a well-known object, does not produce desire for an unknown object.

original: kṛtyā sādhayāmītīcchāyāḥ svakṛtyanantarabhaviṣyattārūpakṛtisādhyatādhījanyatvācca /
analyzed: kṛtyā sādhayāmi iti icchāyāḥ sva kṛti anantara bhaviṣyat tā rūpa kṛti sādhya tā dhī janya tvāt ca
translated: Because desire is accomplished by the cognition of itself, and because the desire I will accomplish my duty is produced by the cognition of the nature of being accomplished by the activity that will exist after one's own activity, which has the form of future existence.

original: api cāstu prathamaṃ kāryānvitajñāne vākyasya
analyzed: api ca astu prathamam kārya anvita jñāne vākyasya
translated: Moreover, let there be the apprehension of the power of the sentence in the first cognition of the object to be accomplished,

original: sākṣātatkāraṇatābodhāttatra śaktigrahaḥ tathāpi paścādāvāpodvāreṇa padaviśeṣasyetarānvitasvārthajñāne śaktiṃ kalpayati lāghavāt /
analyzed: sākṣā tad kāraṇatā bodhāt tatra śakti grahaḥ tathā api paścāt āvāpa udvāreṇa pada viśeṣasya itara anvita svārtha jñāne śaktim kalpayati lāghavāt
translated: because of the understanding of the direct causal nature of the sentence there. Even then, afterwards, it imagines the power of a particular word in the cognition of its own meaning connected with another by the method of superimposition, due to simplicity.

original: na tu kāryatvāṃśe 'pi gauravāt anyalabhyācca /
analyzed: na tu kāryatva aṃśe gauravāt anya labhyāt ca
translated: But not even in the aspect of being an effect, because of complexity and because it is obtained from something else.

original: na caivaṃ prathamapravṛttasya sākṣātkāraṇatābodhasya tanmūlakakāryānvitaśaktigrahasya ca bādhā syāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam prathama pravṛttasya sākṣāt kāraṇatā bodhasya tad mūlaka kārya anvita śakti grahasya ca bādhā syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that there would be contradiction of the cognition of the direct cause of the first occurrence and the apprehension of the power related to the effect based on that.

original: iṣṭatvāt anyathāsiddhimapaśyato hi bālasya sa bhūta iti tasyābalavattvāt gauravānyalabhyatvatarkasahakṛtapramāṇajanyatvenottarasya balavattvāt
analyzed: iṣṭa tvāt anyathā siddhim apaśyataḥ hi bālasya sa bhūtaḥ iti tasya abalavat tvāt gaurava anya labhya tva tarka sahakṛta pramāṇa janya tvena uttarasya balavat tvāt
translated: Because it is accepted. For, when one who does not see any other means of cognition is a child, that is weak, and the subsequent cognition is stronger because it is produced by a means of knowledge assisted by the reasoning that can be obtained only by the weight of the prior cognition.

original: na copajīvyabādhānna tathā pratyatīti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca upajīvya bādhāt na tathā vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that one does not cognize it thus because it contradicts the basis of cognition.

original: upajīvyatve mānābhāvāt /
analyzed: upajīvya tve māna abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no proof of being the basis.

original: daivāddhi prathamaṃ tadvṛttaṃ na tu padaviśeṣaśaktigrahe tasya hetutvatena vināpi tatsambhavāt /
analyzed: daivāt hi prathamam tat vṛttam na tu pada viśeṣa śakti grahe tasya hetu tva tena vinā api tad sambhavāt
translated: For by chance, it occurs first, but in the apprehension of the power of a particular word, it is not the cause, because it is possible without that.

original: na ca prāthamikatvena balattvasya vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: na ca prāthamika tvena balat tvasya vyabhicārāt
translated: And it is not a fallacy that strength is due to priority.

original: nāpi sarvaiḥ prathamaṃ pratīyamānatvena balavattvaṃ sarveṣā śarīrāhampratyaye candratārakādiparimāṇasya sarvairalpatvagrahe ca vyabhicārāt
analyzed: nā api sarvaiḥ prathamam pratīyamāna tvena balavat tvam sarveṣām śarīra ahampratyaye candra tārakā ādi parimāṇasya sarvaiḥ alpa tva grahe ca vyabhicārāt
translated: Nor is strength due to being cognized first by all, because it is contradicted in the cognition of the self of the body by all and in the cognition of the smallness of the moon, stars, etc. by all.

original: ata eva pūrvakalpanātaḥ kalpanāntaraprasaṅgaḥ syāditi /
analyzed: atas eva pūrva kalpanātaḥ kalpanā antara prasaṅgaḥ syāt iti
translated: For this very reason, there would be the undesirable consequence of the assumption of another assumption from the previous one.

original: nirastam /
analyzed: nirastam
translated: This is refuted.

original: yatrānanyathāsiddhatayopajīvyatayā vā balattvaṃ pūrvakalpanāyāstatra tathātvāt /
analyzed: yatra ananyathāsiddha tayā upajīvya tayā vā balat tvam pūrva kalpanāyāḥ tatra tathātvāt
translated: Where there is strength in the prior assumption due to non-establishment of anything else or being the basis, it is so.

original: kiñca prathamaṃ kāryānvitajñāne vākyasya sākṣāt parampodāsīnaṃ kāraṇatvamātraṃ gṛhyate
analyzed: kiñca prathamam kārya anvita jñāne vākyasya sākṣāt kāraṇa tva mātram gṛhyate
translated: Moreover, in the first cognition of the object-related meaning, the mere causal nature of the sentence, whether directly or indirectly, is grasped.

original: na tu viśeṣo 'pi upāyasyānvaya'vyatirekāderubhayaviśeṣasādhāraṇatvena tatsaṃśayakatvāt
analyzed: na tu upāyasya anvaya vyatireka ādeḥ ubhaya viśeṣa sādhāraṇa tvena tad saṃśayaka tvāt
translated: But even the particular is not grasped, because the means of knowledge such as concomitance and non-concomitance are common to both particularities, and hence create doubt.

original: utsargo 'pi bādhakābhāvaniścayasahakṛto niścāyakaḥ /
analyzed: utsargaḥ pi bādhaka abhāva niścaya sahakṛtaḥ niścāyakaḥ
translated: And the general rule is also determinative when accompanied by the ascertainment of the absence of contradiction.

original: na cānyalabhyatvasya bādhakasyābhāvamāpātataḥ svato darśanamātreṇa bālo niścetumarhati /🔽ata eva prāmāṇyasyautsargikatve 'pi bādhakābhāvasahakṛtaniścayādeva niścayaḥ anyathā pramāpramā vā sākṣātparamparāsādhanaṃ veti saṃśayaḥ kvāpi
analyzed: na ca anya labhya tvasya bādhakasya abhāvam āpātataḥ svatas darśana mātreṇa bālaḥ niścetum arhati  atas eva prāmāṇyasya autsargika tve pi bādhaka abhāva sahakṛta niścayāt eva niścayaḥ anyathā pramā apramā vā sākṣāt paramparā sādhanam vā iti saṃśayaḥ kvāpi
translated: And a child cannot ascertain by mere perception, even prima facie, the absence of the contradictory, which is apprehended by something else, by himself.

original: na syāt /
analyzed: na syāt
translated: For this very reason, even though validity is general, the ascertainment is only from the ascertainment accompanied by the absence of contradiction. Otherwise, there would be no doubt anywhere as to whether it is valid knowledge or invalid knowledge, whether it is established directly or indirectly.

original: yacca harṣahetūnāṃ bahūnāṃ sambhavādityādi tanna svatohītaharṣahetustanapānāderbādhāvatāradanyasya
analyzed: yat ca harṣa hetūnām bahūnām sambhavāt ityādi tat na svatas hīta harṣa hetu stana pāna ādeḥ bādhā avatāra danyasya
translated: And what has been said regarding the plurality of causes of joy, etc., that is not so. The cause of joy is not self-evident, as it is contradicted by the drinking of breast-milk, etc.

original: harṣahetoragrahādupasthitatvādupapādakatvācca putrajanmajñānasyaiva harṣahetutvena kalpanāt /
analyzed: harṣa hetoḥ agrahāt upasthita tvāt upapādaka tvāt ca putra janma jñānasya eva harṣa hetu tvena kalpanāt
translated: Because the knowledge of the birth of a son is imagined to be the cause of joy, due to the absence of any other cause of joy, its presence, and its being the means of producing joy.

original: anyapriyajñānaṃ harṣakāraṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīti śaṅkāyāḥ kathamevamiti cet na evaṃ hi kāryānvitajñāne
analyzed: anya priya jñānam harṣa kāraṇam bhaviṣyati iti śaṅkāyāḥ katham evam iti ced na evam hi kārya anvita jñāne
translated: If it is argued that the knowledge of another's pleasure will be the cause of joy, how can it be so? No, because in that case, even in the cognition of the effect-related object,

original: 'pi śaktirna gṛhyate prayojyajñānahetūnāṃ bahutvādananyathāsiddhaśabdānuvidhānasya
analyzed: pi śaktiḥ na gṛhyate prayojya jñāna hetūnām bahu tvāt ananyathā siddha śabda anuvidhānasya
translated: the potency is not grasped, because there are many causes of the employed cognition, and because the invariable concomitance with the word is the same.

original: ca tulyatvāt anyapriyasyājñānācca jñāne 'pi vā tadā tadupasthitiniyame mānābhāvāt🔽sandehābhāvopapatteḥ liṅgābhāsajanyakākatālīyasampannasaṃvādānumitivaddhaharṣeṇa
analyzed: ca tulya tvāt anya priyasya ajñānāt ca jñāne vā tadā tad upasthiti niyame māna abhāvāt  sandeha abhāva upapatteḥ liṅga ābhāsa janya kākatālīya sampanna saṃvāda anumiti vaddha harṣeṇa
translated: And because another's pleasure is unknown, and even if known, there is no reason for its being present then.🔽Because the absence of doubt is possible, and because the inference of the knowledge of the birth of a son is possible through the reason of joy,

original: liṅgena putrajanmajñānānumānasambhavācca /
analyzed: liṅgena putra janma jñāna anumāna sambhavāt ca
translated: like the inference of the coincidence of a reliable person produced by a false mark.

original: na cāsāsajatvenānumiterbhramatve taddhetukaśaktigraho bhramaḥ viṣayasya tathābhāvena tayoryathārthatvāt /
analyzed: na ca asāsa ja tvena anumiteḥ bhrama tve tad hetuka śaktigrahaḥ bhramaḥ viṣayasya tathā bhāvena tayoḥ yathārtha tvāt
translated: And even if the inference is a mistake due to being false, the apprehension of potency caused by it is not a mistake, because the object is true in that way.

original: yathā kaścit sūtrasañcārādhiṣṭhitaṃ dāruputrakaṃ ghaṭamānayeti niyuṅke sa ca tamānayati tadā cetanavyavahārādiva taddarśī bālo vyutpadyate🔽iyaṃ kriyā kṛtijanyā sā jñānajanyā tat vākyajanyamityunumiti paramparāyā bhramatve🔽'pi taddhetuśaktigrahaḥ tajjanyaśābdabodhaśca yathārtha eva viṣayasya tathābhāvāditi
analyzed: yathā kaścid sūtra sañcāra dhiṣṭhitam dāru putrakam ghaṭam ānaya iti niyuṅke sa ca tam ānayati tadā cetana vyavahārāt iva tad darśī bālaḥ vyutpadyate  iyam kriyā kṛti janyā sā jñāna janyā tat vākya janyam iti unumiti paramparāyāḥ bhrama tve  tad hetu śakti grahaḥ tad janya śābda bodhaḥ ca yathārthaḥ eva viṣayasya tathā bhāvāt iti
translated: Just as someone employs a wooden doll controlled by string movements, saying Bring the pot, and when it brings it, a child who sees it learns the convention that it is an action,🔽generated by an agent, generated by knowledge, or generated by that sentence, even though the inference chain is erroneous,🔽there is the apprehension of the power that causes it, and the verbal cognition generated by it is indeed true, because the object is so.

original: siddhaṃ siddhārthe 'pi śaktigraha iti /
analyzed: siddham siddhārthe pi śakti grahe iti
translated: Thus it is established that even in the case of a well-known meaning, there is the apprehension of power.

original: ata eva yanna duḥkhena sambhinnaṃ na ca grastamanantaraṃ /
analyzed: atas eva yat na duḥkhena sambhinnam na ca grastam anantaram
translated: For this very reason, That which is not mixed with sorrow, nor is immediately overwhelmed,

original: abhilāṣopapanītañca tat sukhaṃ svaḥpadāspadaṃ'' /
analyzed: abhilāṣa upapanītam ca tat sukham svar pada āspadam
translated: and is accompanied by desire, that happiness is the abode of heaven.

original: ityarthavādopasthite sukhe vedādeva svargapadasya śaktigrahaḥ na tu candanādau sukhoparāgeṇa
analyzed: iti arthavāda upasthite sukhe vedāt eva svarga padasya śakti grahaḥ na tu candana ādau sukha uparāgeṇa
translated: When happiness is presented by this explanatory passage, the apprehension of the power of the word heaven is only from the Veda, not from the application of the word heaven to sandalwood etc. due to the association of happiness,

original: svargapadaprayogāddheyatādaśāyāñcāprayogāt sukhameva śakyaṃ bahuvittavyayāyāsasādhye
analyzed: svarga pada prayogāt heya tā daśāyām ca a prayogāt sukham eva śakyam bahu vitta vyaya āyāsa sādhye
translated: and because it is not used in the state of being an object to be obtained. Happiness alone is capable, because it is accomplished with much wealth, effort and hardship.

original: tatkarmaṇi sukhamātrārthī na pravartata ityarthavādopasthite svargapadatātparyaṃ /
analyzed: tad karmaṇi sukha mātra arthī na pravartate iti arthavāda upasthite svarga pada tātparyam
translated: The meaning is that one does not engage in that action merely for the sake of pleasure, but when the praise is presented, the purport is the word 'heaven'.

original: na cārthavādasyopajīvyatvāt tadunīte tata eva śaktigrahaḥ tasya svargapadatātparyaviṣayatvenāspadatvopapatterna atiśayitasukhatvaṃ vācyaṃ prayogopādhirvātiśayaḥ
analyzed: na ca arthavādasya upajīvya tvāt tad unīte tatas eva śakti grahaḥ tasya svarga pada tātparya viṣaya tvena āspada tva upapatteḥ na atiśayita sukha tvam vācyam prayoga upādhiḥ vā atiśayaḥ
translated: And since the praise is the basis, the understanding of its power is not from that, because it is not possible for it to be the object of the purport of the word 'heaven'. Therefore, the meaning is not 'having superior pleasure' or 'the superior is the condition of application'.

original: na cātiśayasya sāvadhitvena candanasukhe 'smādayaṃ svarga iti dhīḥ syāt rasādāvivātiśayasya jātitvenāvadhyanirūpyatvāt /
analyzed: na ca atiśayasya sāvadhi tvena candana sukhe smāt ayam svargaḥ iti dhīḥ syāt rasa ādau iva atiśayasya jāti tvena avadhya nirūpya tvāt
translated: And it is not that due to the limited nature of the superior, there would be the cognition 'this pleasure from sandalwood is heaven', because like taste, the superior is determined by the universal.

original: atiśayapadaprayogastu itarajñānāpekṣa iti cet na vicitrahetusādhyatayā vilakṣaṇātiśayasyānekatvenānanugamāt
analyzed: atiśaya pada prayogaḥ tu itara jñāna apekṣaḥ iti ced na vicitra hetu sādhyatayā vilakṣaṇa atiśayasya aneka tvena ananugamāt
translated: If it is argued that the use of the word 'superior' is dependent on the knowledge of something else, it is not so, because the various superiorities are not uniform due to being accomplished by various causes.

original: sukhatvāvāntarātiśayatvenāsyānugame 'pyanadhyavasāyena śaktyagrahādapravṛttyāpatteḥ /
analyzed: sukha tva avāntara atiśaya tvena asya anugame pi anadhyavasāyena śakti agrahāt apravṛtti āpatteḥ
translated: Even if it is uniform due to being the internal superiority of pleasure, there would be non-determination due to the non-understanding of power, leading to non-engagement.

original: sukhatvāvāntarajāteśca sukhamātrasādhāraṇatvāt prayogopādhernirākartavyatvāt loke ca lakṣaṇā /
analyzed: sukhatva avāntara jāteḥ ca sukha mātra sādhāraṇa tvāt prayoga upādheḥ nirākartavya tvāt loke ca lakṣaṇā
translated: And since the internal universal of pleasure is common to mere pleasure, the condition of application must be refuted, and in the world, there is indication.

original: nanu duḥkhāsambhinnasukhasya śakyatve candanādau svargapadaprayogolakṣaṇayāpi na
analyzed: nanu duḥkha asambhinna sukhasya śakya tve candana ādau svarga pada prayogaḥ lakṣaṇayā api na
translated: But if pleasure not mixed with pain is possible, then even by secondary meaning the word 'heaven' would not be used for sandal etc.

original: syāt sātiśayasukhasya śakyatve tatsambandhitayā candanādau lakṣaṇā bhavati tasmāt
analyzed: syāt sātiśaya sukhasya śakya tve tad sambandhi tayā candana ādau lakṣaṇā bhavati tasmāt
translated: When pleasure with a high degree is possible, secondary meaning occurs in sandal etc. as related to that. Therefore,

original: duḥkhāsambhinnatvādinopalakṣitā sukhatvāvāntarajātireva vācyā ekajātisattve 'pi vilakṣaṇahetusādhyasvargeṣṭhakajātau mānābhāvāt /
analyzed: duḥkha asambhinna tva ādinā upalakṣitā sukha tva avāntara jātiḥ eva vācyā eka jāti sattve pi vilakṣaṇa hetu sādhya svargeṣṭhaka jātau māna abhāvāt
translated: the sub-class of pleasure itself, characterized by not being mixed with pain etc., is what is denoted. Even when there is only one class, there is no evidence for the class of heaven to be accomplished by causes of different characteristics.

original: vihitakarmajanyatā ca tattadviśeṣatvenaiva ananugatasyāpi janyatāvacchedakatvāt sambandhamātrañca lakṣaṇābījamiti vakṣyate /
analyzed: vihita karma janya tā ca tad tad viśeṣa tvena eva ananugatasya api janya tā avacchedaka tvāt sambandha mātram ca lakṣaṇā bījam iti vakṣyate
translated: And the fact of being produced by enjoined actions is only as a particular of that, because even a non-universal can be the determiner of what is to be produced. And mere relation is the seed of secondary meaning. This will be stated.

original: evaṃ devatāyāmapi indramupāsītetyādau lāke prayogasyāniyamāt gauṇatayaiva vyavahārāccārthānadhyavasāye
analyzed: evam devatāyām api indram upāsīta ityādau lāke prayogasya aniyamāt gauṇa tayā eva vyavahārāt ca artha anadhyavasāye
translated: Thus, in the case of deities also, in statements like 'one should meditate on Indra', since usage is not fixed in ordinary language and because of the usage itself as secondary, there is no ascertainment of meaning.

original: 'laukikasahasrākṣādāvindrādipadaśaktigrahaḥ pramāṇañca indraḥ sahasrākṣa ityādirvidhisabhabhivyāhṛtor'thavāda eva svargapadavat /
analyzed: laukika sahasrākṣa ādau indra ādi pada śakti grahaḥ pramāṇam ca indraḥ sahasrākṣaḥ ityādiḥ vidhi sabh abhivyāhṛta ūrthavādaḥ eva svarga pada vat
translated: The means of knowing the meaning of words like 'Indra' and 'thousand-eyed' etc. which are not worldly is only the explanatory passage uttered along with the injunction like 'Indra is thousand-eyed' etc., just like the word 'heaven'.

original: atha svargapade pravṛttyanyathānupapattyā tatsukhaṃ svaḥpadāspadamitiśruteścārthavādādeva🔽śaktigrahaḥ na ceha tathārthavādaḥ kintu indraḥ sahasrākṣa ityādi stāvakatvena🔽pravṛttiparamiti cet na indraḥ sahasrākṣaityādiprasiddhapadasāmānādhikaraṇyaśrutau
analyzed: atha svarga pade pravṛtti anyathā anupapattyā tat sukham svar pada āspadam iti śruteḥ ca arthavādāt eva  śakti grahaḥ na ca iha tathā arthavādaḥ kintu indraḥ sahasrākṣaḥ ityādi stāvaka tvena  pravṛtti param iti ced na indraḥ sahasrākṣaḥ ityādi prasiddha pada sāmānādhikaraṇya śrutau
translated: Now, if the existence of heaven is inferred from the non-otherwiseness of activity, and the existence of the happiness of heaven is inferred from the statement that it is the abode of heaven, then the cognition of the power of the word is only from Arthavada.🔽And here there is no such Arthavada, but rather the statement beginning with Indra is the thousand-eyed one is used for praise.🔽If it is argued that it is used for activity, it is not so, because in the heard statement of co-reference with well-known words such as Indra is the thousand-eyed one,

original: bādhakaṃ vinā sahasrākṣasyaivendrādipadavācyatvāvadhāraṇāt prasiddhapadasamanvabalena🔽pratīyamānamarthamabādhitamādāyaiva teṣāṃ pravartakatvāt /
analyzed: bādhakam vinā sahasrākṣasya eva indra ādi pada vācyatva avadhāraṇāt prasiddha pada samanva balena  pratīyamānam artham abādhitam ādāya eva teṣām pravartaka tvāt
translated: without contradiction, it is determined that only the thousand-eyed one is denoted by the words Indra etc., and because they are active only by taking the meaning understood by the power of the co-reference with well-known words, which is not contradicted.

original: mantraprakāśitaśaśiśekharādyupetamuddiśya havistyāgena tatraiva yājñikānāṃ devatāvyavahārāt /
analyzed: mantra prakāśita śaśiśekhara ādi upetam uddiśya haviḥ tyāgena tatra eva yājñikānām devatā vyavahārāt
translated: Because the sacrificers use the term god in reference to that [Indra] alone by offering oblations to him who is indicated as having the moon on his head etc., revealed by the mantra.

original: api ca śivāya gāṃ dadyādityādinā devatāsampradānatvaśruteḥ śivādisahasranāmnāṃ
analyzed: api ca śivāya gām dadyāt ityādinā devatā sampradāna tva śruteḥ śiva ādi sahasranāmnām
translated: Moreover, because of the heard statement that the god is the recipient in One should give a cow to Shiva etc., because of the heard statement that the thousands of names of Shiva etc.

original: paryāyatvena śrutermahājanaparigraheṇa pramāṇatvādārādhitadevatāyāṃ varadātṛtvaśruteśca
analyzed: paryāya tvena śruteḥ mahājana parigraheṇa pramāṇa tvāt ārādhita devatāyām vara dātṛ tva śruteḥ ca
translated: are synonyms, because of the validity by the acceptance of the great people, and because of the heard statement that the worshipped god gives boons,

original: bādhakaṃ vinā cetanaiva devatā /
analyzed: bādhakam vinā cetanā eva devatā
translated: without contradiction, the god is only a conscious being.

original: atha devatācaitanyapakṣe
analyzed: atha devatā caitanya pakṣe
translated: Now, if it is argued that in the case of the sentience of the deity,

original: tatprītireva yāgavyāpāra iti nāpūrvasiddhiriti cet na prīteḥ sukhasya tadanubhavasya
analyzed: tad prītiḥ eva yāga vyāpāraḥ iti na apūrva siddhiḥ iti ced na prīteḥ sukhasya tad anubhavasya
translated: the operation of the sacrifice is just that very delight of the deity, so there is no establishment of the unseen, it is not so, because delight, happiness, and the experience of that

original: cāśutaravināśitvāt tajjanyasaṃskārasya svāviṣaye phalāhetutvāt phalahetusthāyikṛtivyāpārāpekṣāyāṃ
analyzed: ca āśutara vināśi tvāt tad janya saṃskārasya sva aviṣaye phala ahetu tvāt phala hetu sthāyi kṛti vyāpāra apekṣāyām
translated: are destroyed very quickly, and the impression produced by that is not the cause of the result in its own object, when there is a need for the operation of a permanent cause of the result,

original: lāghavena kṛtisamānāśrayasyaiva vyāpāratvakalpanāt /
translated: the operation is imagined to be of the same substratum as the volition itself, due to simplicity.

original: nānāyāgeṣṭakadāhvāne caikadā sannidhānaṃ tadbaddhiviśeṣa eva pratiṣṭhāvidhinā pratimādāvahaṅkāravat /
analyzed: nānā yāga iṣṭakadāhvāne ca ekadā sannidhānam tad baddhi viśeṣaḥ eva pratiṣṭhā vidhinā pratimā ādau ahaṅkāra vat
translated: And in the case of many sacrifices, the presence at one time of the desired oblation and invocation is just that special cognition, like the sense of I in an image etc. by the injunction of installation.

original: atha rājasūyādiphalatvena śraterindrādiścetana eva devatātvantu tasya nāsti mānābhāvāt
analyzed: atha rājasūya ādi phalatvena śrateḥ indra ādiḥ cetanaḥ eva devatā tvan tu tasya na asti māna abhāvāt
translated: Now, if it is argued that Indra etc. are sentient only because of being mentioned as the fruit of the Rajasuya etc., but they do not have the nature of deity, because there is no proof of that,

original: kintu deśanādeśikatacaturthyantapadanirddeśyatvaṃ devatātvamitīndrāyetyādipadameva
analyzed: kintu
translated: but the nature of deity is the quality of being denoted by a word ending in the fourth case as the object of instruction by a teacher, so the word to Indra etc.

original: devatā ata evāgniprakāśakamantreṇāgniprakāśanānantaraṃ agnaya iti niyamato havisastyāgo na paryāyāntareṇa /
analyzed: devatāḥ atas eva agni prakāśaka mantreṇa agni prakāśana anantaram agnaye iti niyamataḥ havisaḥ tyāgaḥ na paryāya antareṇa
translated: itself is the deity. For this very reason, after the illumination of the fire by a mantra that illuminates the fire, the offering of oblations with the word to the fires is regular, not by another alternative.

original: na cendroddeśena havisastyāga indraniṣṭhakiñcijjanakaḥ tatsvarūpājanakatve sati taduddeśena kriyamāṇatvāt brāhmaṇāya dānavaditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca indra uddeśena havisaḥ tyāgaḥ indra niṣṭha kiñcid janakaḥ tad svarūpa ajanaka tve sati tad uddeśena kriyamāṇa tvāt brāhmaṇāya dāna vat iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the offering of oblation not for the sake of Indra does not produce anything related to Indra, because it is done with reference to him, like giving to a Brahmin.

original: aprayojakatvāt tadarthatvena kriyamāṇatvasyopādhitvācca /
analyzed: aprayojaka tvāt tad artha tvena kriyamāṇa tvasya upādhi tvāt ca
translated: Because that is not the purpose, and because being done for that purpose is a property.

original: indrāya svāhetyatra na tādarthye caturthī kintu svāhādipadayoge upapadavibhaktireva anyathā namaḥsvastisvāhetyādisūtravaiyarthyāt /
analyzed: indrāya svāhā iti atra na tādarthye caturthī kintu svāhā ādi pada yoge upapada vibhaktiḥ eva anyathā namaḥ svasti svāhā ityādi sūtra vaiyarthyāt
translated: In Svāhā to Indra, the fourth case is not for the sake of, but rather in the compound with the word Svāhā, it is the case of a subordinate element. Otherwise, the sūtras beginning with namaḥ, svāsti, svāhā would be useless.

original: maivaṃ /
analyzed: mā evam
translated: Do not say so.

original: caturthyantapadasya devatātve mānābhāvāt caturthīṃ vināpi indro devateti vyavahārāt /
analyzed: caturthī anta padasya devatā tve māna abhāvāt caturthīm vinā api indraḥ devatā iti vyavahārāt
translated: Because there is no evidence that a word ending in the fourth case is a deity, and because the usage Indra is the deity occurs even without the fourth case.

original: agraye kavyavāhanāyetyādau devatādvayaprasaṅgāt indraḥ sahasrakṣa ityarthavādasya🔽indramupāsītetyādividhisamabhivyāhāreṇa ekavākyatayā tasyaivopāyasyatvāt śivasvannādadītetyatra
analyzed: agraye kavyavāhanāya ityādau devatā dvaya prasaṅgāt indraḥ sahasra kṣaḥ iti arthavādasya  indram upāsīta ityādi vidhi samabhivyāhāreṇa ekavākyatayā tasya eva upāya syatvāt śiva svat ādadīta iti atra
translated: Because in to Agni, the carrier of oblations, etc., two deities would be implied, and because the Arthavāda Indra has a thousand eyes

original: mahādevamuddiśya tyakte 'pi śiṣṭānāṃ śivasvatvena vyavahārācca /
analyzed: mahādevam uddiśya tyakte śiṣṭānām śiva sva tvena vyavahārāt ca
translated: is syntactically connected with the injunction One should meditate on Indra, etc., and is therefore subordinate to that means, and because even when something is given with reference to Mahādeva, the good people use the expression the property of Śiva in One should take the property of Śiva.

original: agnaya iti padena niyamatastyāgaśrutibodhitatvena tathā tyāgasya phalahetutvāt /
analyzed: agnaye iti padena niyamatas tyāga śruti bodhita tvena tathā tyāgasya phala hetu tvāt
translated: By the word 'fires', the offering is understood to be enjoined by the Vedic text, and thus the offering is the cause of the result.

original: na ca bījākṣarāṇāṃ devatātvāt tatraiva śivādipadaśaktigraha iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca bīja akṣarāṇām devatā tvāt tatra eva śiva ādi pada śakti grahaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that the understanding of the power of the words 'Shiva' etc. is only in those (fires), because the seed syllables are deities.

original: bījākṣarāṇāṃ caturthyantatvāniyamāt /
analyzed: bīja akṣarāṇām caturthī anta tva aniyamāt
translated: Because the seed syllables are not necessarily in the fourth case.

original: tadapratītāvapi mantraprakāśitaśaśiśekharādyupetamuddiśya havistyāgena tatraiva yājñikānāṃ🔽vyavahāraḥ bījākṣarāṇāṃ havistyāgabhāgitvenānuddeśyatvāt śivasya pratimantraṃ bījākṣarāṇāṃ
analyzed: tad apratītau api mantra prakāśita śaśiśekhara ādi upetam uddiśya haviḥ tyāgena tatra eva yājñikānām  vyavahāraḥ bīja akṣarāṇām haviḥ tyāga bhāgi tvena anuddeśya tvāt śivasya pratimantram bīja akṣarāṇām
translated: Even if that is not understood, the sacrificers' practice is only there, by offering oblations to the one endowed with the moon-crest etc. revealed by the mantra,

original: nānātvāt ananugamena śivapadaśaktigrahasyāśakyatvācca /
analyzed: nānātvāt ananugamena śiva pada śakti grahasya aśakya tvāt ca
translated: because the seed syllables are not the object of offering, but are participants in the offering, and because it is impossible to understand the power of the word 'Shiva' due to the lack of a common element in the different seed syllables for each mantra.

original: na ca mūrtibhedena śivaśarīrāṇāmananugatatvena tavāpi na śaktigraha iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca mūrti bhedena śiva śarīrāṇām ananugata tvena tava api na śakti grahaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that for you also there is no understanding of the power (of the word 'Shiva') due to the non-commonality of Shiva's bodies due to the difference in forms.

original: bālyādinā bhinnaśarīreṣu caitratvavacchivatvajātedṛṣṭaviśeṣopagṛhītatvasya vānugatvāt
analyzed: bālya ādinā bhinna śarīreṣu caitra tva vat śiva tva jāta idṛṣṭa viśeṣa upagṛhīta tvasya vā anuga tvāt
translated: Because the universal 'Shiva-ness' is grasped as having a specific characteristic seen in the different bodies due to childhood etc., just like the universal 'Caitra-ness'.

original: adṛṣṭaśūnyasya ceśvarasya na devatātvaṃ īśānaśca tadbhinna eva tasmānmantrakaraṇakahavistyāgabhāgitvenoddeśyatvaṃ
analyzed: adṛṣṭa śūnyasya ca īśvarasya na devatā tvam īśānaḥ ca tad bhinnaḥ eva tasmāt mantra karaṇaka haviḥ tyāga bhāgi tvena uddeśya tvam
translated: And God, who is not seen as empty, is not a deity. And the Lord is different from that. Therefore, being the object of injunction by participating in the offering of oblations with mantras,

original: devatātvaṃ anyeṣāṃ haviḥsambandhe mantrasyāhetutvāditi /
analyzed: devatā tvam anyeṣām haviḥ sambandhe mantrasya a hetu tvāt iti
translated: is being a deity. For others, in the connection with the oblation, the mantra is not the cause.

original: kvacicca vākyaśeṣācchaktigrahaḥ yathā yavamayaścarurbhavati vārāhī copānat vaitase🔽kaṭe prājāpatyaṃ caruṃ cinotītyatra yavavarāhavetasaśabdāḥ kiṃ kaṅgavāyasajambūnāṃ
analyzed: kvacid ca vākya śeṣāt śakti grahaḥ yathā yava mayaḥ caruḥ bhavati vārāhī ca upānad vaitase  kaṭe prājāpatyam carum cinoti iti atra yava varāha vetasa śabdāḥ kim kaṅga vāyasa jambūnām
translated: And in some cases, the power is grasped from the supplementary passage, as in the case of the barley oblation, the boar's hide, and the mat of reeds.🔽Here, the words barley, boar, and reed - are they the words for the kanka bird, the crow, and the rose-apple tree,

original: vācakāḥ uta dīrghaśrūkasūkaravañjulānāmiti mlecchāryavyavahāradarśanādvipratipattau
analyzed: vācakāḥ uta dīrghaśrūka sūkara vañjulānām iti mleccha ārya vyavahāra darśanāt vipratipattau
translated: or for the long-snouted pig and the cane? Due to seeing the usage of Mlecchas and Aryas, there is doubt.

original: mukhyārthānadhyavasāyāt tatpade pramāṇyāniścaye vyavahārādvyutpattiḥ sa cāviśiṣṭaḥ
analyzed: mukhya artha anadhyavasāyāt tad pade pramāṇya aniścaye vyavahārāt vyutpattiḥ sa ca aviśiṣṭaḥ
translated: Due to the non-ascertainment of the primary meaning, there is no certainty about the validity of that word. The usage is the same.

original: pikādipadeṣu mlecchavyavahārādvyutpatteḥ sūkarasyeva carmaṇā kākasyāpyupānahoḥ sambhavāditi
analyzed: pika ādi padeṣu mleccha vyavahārāt vyutpatteḥ sūkarasya iva carmaṇā kākasya api upānahoḥ sambhavāt iti
translated: In the case of words like pika, the learning is from the usage of Mlecchas. And because it is possible to make shoes for a crow with the skin of a pig,

original: pūrvapakṣe vasante sarvasasyānāṃ jāyate patraśātanaṃ modanamānāḥ pradṛśyante yavāḥ kaṇiśaśalinaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvapakṣe vasante sarva sasyānām jāyate patra śātanam pradṛśyante yavāḥ kaṇi śaśalinaḥ
translated: In the prima facie view, in spring, the withering of leaves of all crops occurs. The barley grains are seen to be sprouting and sprouting.

original: ''varāhaṃ gāvo 'nudhāvanti'' /
analyzed: varāham gāvaḥ nudhāvanti
translated: The cows follow the boar.

original: ''ambujo vetasaḥ'' /
translated: The lotus is the reed.

original: iti vākyāśeṣarūpavedavirodhinau mlecchaprasiddhaḥ smṛtiriva vedaviruddhā heyeti nirastāyāṃ mlecchaprasiddhau niṣpratipakṣāryavyavahārācchaktigrahaḥ
analyzed: iti vākya aśeṣa rūpa veda virodhinau mleccha prasiddhaḥ smṛtiḥ iva veda viruddhā heyā iti nirastāyām mleccha prasiddhau niṣpratipakṣa ārya vyavahārāt śakti grahaḥ
translated: Thus, just as Smṛti that contradicts the Vedas in the form of the remaining part of the sentence is to be rejected, so too the popular usage of the Mlecchas, which contradicts the Vedas, is to be rejected. When the popular usage of the Mlecchas has been refuted, the grasping of the power is from the Aryan usage, which has no opponent.

original: nanu vākyaśeṣāt śrūkarādiṣu tātparyaniścayo na śaktinirṇāyakaḥ kākādi sadṛśatayā śrūkarādau prayogasya gauṇyādināpi sambhavāditi cet na śrūkarādau 🔽tātparyavacchakterapi niścayāt /
analyzed: nanu vākyaśeṣāt śrūkara ādiṣu tātparya niścayaḥ na śakti nirṇāyakaḥ kāka ādi sadṛśa tayā śrūkara ādau prayogasya gauṇī ādinā api sambhavāt iti ced na śrūkara ādau  tātparya vat śakteḥ api niścayāt
translated: But the ascertainment of the purport in the case of the words śṛṅgāra etc. from the remaining part of the sentence is not determinative of the power, because the use of śṛṅgāra etc. is possible even by the secondary meaning etc. like the crow etc. If this is argued, it is not so, because the ascertainment of the power along with the purport is also from the śṛṅgāra etc.

original: tathā hi yadyapyanādiprayogayāgitā na śaktiniyatā vaidikagauṇyādinā vyabhicārāt tathāpi śaktiranādiprayoganiyatā ato varāhaśabdasyānādi /
analyzed: tathā hi yadi api anādi prayoga yāgi tā na śakti niyatā vaidika gauṇya ādinā vyabhicārāt tathā api śaktiḥ anādi prayoga niyatā atas varāha śabdasya anādi
translated: Thus, although the eternality of usage is not determined by the power, because of the deviation by the Vedic secondary meaning etc., still the power is determined by the eternality of usage. Therefore, the eternality of usage of the word 'varāha'

original: prayogayogitā śaktiśca kāke kalpyeti gauravaṃ śrūkaratve 'nādivedasambandhāt prayogo 'nādisiddha eva śaktimātraṃ kalpyata iti lāghavamityanāditātparyāt
analyzed: prayoga yogitā śaktiḥ ca kāke kalpyā iti gauravam śrūkaratve na ādi veda sambandhāt prayogaḥ na ādisiddhaḥ eva śakti mātram kalpyate iti lāghavam iti anādi tātparyāt
translated: and the power are to be imagined in the crow. This is heavy. In the case of śṛṅgāra, the usage is eternally connected with the Veda. It is eternally established. Only the power is imagined. This is light. Thus, from the eternal purport,

original: śrakare śaktireva /
analyzed: śrakare śaktiḥ eva
translated: the power is in the śṛṅgāra.

original: atha kākavat śrūkaro 'pyasadṛśa eva susadṛśasya gavayādeḥ sattvāt kathañcit sādṛśyaṃ
analyzed: atha kāka vat śrūkaraḥ pi asadṛśaḥ eva su sadṛśasya gavaya ādeḥ sattvāt kathañcid sādṛśyam
translated: Now, even if the crow is like the gavaya, it is not similar at all, because the gavaya and so on are real. In some way there is similarity,

original: kākasyāpyastīti cet na kākaśrūkarayorvarāhaśabdād buddhisthatve 'nayoḥ ko vācya
analyzed: kākasya api asti iti ced na kāka śrūkarayoḥ varāha śabdāt buddhi stha tve nayoḥ kaḥ vācya
translated: Now, if the crow is like the horn, it is indeed very dissimilar, because of the existence of a very similar gavaya etc. If it is argued that the crow also has some similarity, no, because in the cognition of the crow and the horn from the word 'varaha', when they are present in the mind, for one who is desirous of knowing which of these is denoted,

original: iti jijñāsamānasya smṛtiviṣaya iti tannirāsādanyathā tātparyagrāhakavākyaśeṣasyāpi
analyzed: iti jijñāsamānasya smṛti viṣayaḥ iti tad nirāsāt anyathā tātparya grāhaka vākyaśeṣasya api
translated: it is an object of memory. Therefore, by refuting that, the remaining sentence which indicates the intended meaning in another way would also

original: niṣprayojanatvaṃ syāt kathañcit sādṛśyasya sarvatra sattvena tātparyānadhyavasāyāditi /
analyzed: niṣprayojana tvam syāt kathañcid sādṛśyasya sarvatra sattvena tātparya anadhyavasāyāt iti
translated: be purposeless, because the existence of some kind of similarity everywhere would lead to the non-ascertainment of the intended meaning.

original: itarānvite śaktirityapi guḍajihvikā vastutonvaye 'pi na śaktiḥ /
analyzed: itara anvite śaktiḥ iti api guḍajihvikā vastutas nvaye na śaktiḥ
translated: The statement that there is power in what is related to the other is mere prattle. In reality, there is no power even in the relation.

original: nanu vyavahāreṇānumite itarānvitajñāne padaśakyatvagrahāt tatraiva śaktiṃ gṛhṇāti upasthitatvāt /🔽na cāgre tatyāgo hetvabhāvāt na tu padārthajñānamātre vyavahārāt tasyānupasthiteḥ
analyzed: nanu vyavahāreṇa anumite itara anvita jñāne pada śakya tva grahāt tatra eva śaktim gṛhṇāti upasthita tvāt  na ca agre tatyāgaḥ hetu abhāvāt na tu padārtha jñāna mātre vyavahārāt tasya anupasthiteḥ
