translated: But it is argued that when the cognition of what is related to the other is inferred by usage, one grasps the power there itself, because it is present, by grasping the fact that it is capable of being denoted by the word.🔽And it is not abandoned later, because there is no reason. But not in the mere cognition of the word meaning, because of the absence of usage, due to its non-presence.

original: upāyāntarāttadupasthityantarakalpane mānābhāvāt ata itarānvitasvārthajñānaśaktatvena
analyzed: upāya antarāt tad upasthiti antara kalpane māna abhāvāt atas itara anvita sva artha jñāna śakta tvena
translated: Because there is no evidence for imagining another presence of that from another means. Therefore, by the power of the cognition of one's own meaning related to the other,

original: jñātapadaṃ svārthānvayānubhāvakaṃ ityanvitābhidhānamiti cet na itarānvitapadārthajñānopasthitau
analyzed: jñāta padam svārtha anvaya anubhāvakam iti anvita abhidhānam iti ced na itara anvita padārtha jñāna upasthitau
translated: If it is argued that the word conveys the meaning in relation to others, because it is known that the word conveys its own meaning, this is not so. When the meaning of the word in relation to others is present,

original: padārthajñānaṃ viśeṣyamiti tadupasthitau tasyāpi viṣayatvāt viśiṣṭajñānasya viśeṣyaviṣayatvaniyamāditi
analyzed: padārtha jñānam viśeṣyam iti tad upasthitau tasya api viṣaya tvāt viśiṣṭa jñānasya viśeṣya viṣaya tva niyamāt iti
translated: the knowledge of the meaning of the word is the qualifier. When that is present, it is also the object, because a cognition of a qualified object is necessarily about the qualified object.

original: tatraiva śaktiṃ kalpayati lāghavāt na tvanvayāṃśe 'pi gauravāt /
analyzed: tatra eva śaktim kalpayati lāghavāt na tu anvaya aṃśe gauravāt
translated: Therefore, the power is imagined only in that, because of simplicity, and not in the part of the relation, because of complexity.

original: astu vā prathamamitarānvitajñāne śaktigrahe 'gre tatyāgaḥ anyalabhyatvapratisandhānāt
analyzed: astu vā prathamam itara anvita jñāne śakti grahe gre anya labhya tva pratisandhānāt
translated: Or let there be abandonment of the first cognition of power in the cognition related to others, due to the remembrance of being obtained from something else.

original: ananyalabhyasyaiva śabdārthatvāt prathamagṛhītamātrañca na balamityuktameva tasmāt
analyzed: an anya labhyasya eva śabda artha tvāt prathama gṛhīta mātram ca na balam iti uktam eva tasmāt
translated: Because only what is not obtained from something else is the meaning of a word, and what is merely first grasped does not have force. This has been said. Therefore,

original: sarvaiḥ prathamagṛhītamātrañca na balamityuktameva tasmāt sarvaiḥ prathamavyavahārādupasthite
analyzed: sarvaiḥ prathama gṛhīta mātram ca na balam iti uktam eva tasmāt sarvaiḥ prathama vyavahārāt upasthite
translated: when all are present through the first usage,

original: kāryānvitajñāne 'nvitajñāne vā padakāraṇatvagrahāttatra śaktigraho 'gre 'pi gauravānyalabhyatvapratisandhāne 'pi na tatyāgaḥ
analyzed: kārya anvita jñāne nvita jñāne vā pada kāraṇatva grahāt tatra śakti grahaḥ gre pi gaurava anya labhya tva pratisandhāne pi na tad tyāgaḥ
translated: the cognition of the effect in relation or the cognition in relation is grasped as the cause of the word, the grasping of power there is first, even in the remembrance of being obtained from something else and the complexity, there is no abandonment.

original: pūrvakalpanāyā viparītatvāditi svaśiṣyavyāmohanam /
analyzed: pūrva kalpanāyāḥ viparīta tvāt iti sva śiṣya vyāmohanam
translated: It is a deception of his own disciples, because the first assumption is contrary to fact.

original: atha kāryatvasyetarapadalabhyatvena tathā na tvevamanvaye tasyetarapadāśakyatvācchakyatve
analyzed: atha kāryatvasya itara pada labhya tvena tathā na tu evam anvaye tasya itara pada aśakya tvāt śakya tve
translated: If it is argued that since the fact of being an effect is understood from other words, it is not so in the case of implication, because it is impossible to express that by other words, or

original: vā avivādāditi cet na ghaṭaśaktatvena jñātaṃ padaṃ svārthasmaraṇadvārā ākāṅkṣādisahakārivaśāt
analyzed: vā avivādāt iti ced na ghaṭa śakta tvena jñātam padam sva artha smaraṇa dvārā ākāṅkṣā ādi sahakāri vaśāt
translated: if it is possible, there is no dispute, it is not so, because a word known as having the capacity for a pot, by the door of remembering its own meaning, by the power of cooperating factors like expectancy,

original: samabhivyāhṛtapadārthena saha svārthasyānvayamanubhāvayati svabhāvādityanyathaivānvayajñānalābhāt kiṃ śaktyā /
analyzed: samabhivyāhṛta padārthena saha sva arthasya anvayam anubhāvayati svabhāvāt iti anyathā eva anvaya jñāna lābhāt kim śaktyā
translated: experiences the relation of its own meaning with the meaning of the co-occurring word by its own nature. Since the knowledge of relation is obtained in another way, what is the use of capacity?

original: anvayamātraśaktāvapyanvayaviśeṣajñānārthamākāṅkṣāderavaśyamapekṣaṇāt kriyākārakapadayoḥ pratyekamitarānvitasvārthabodhakatve vākyarthadvayadhīprasaṅgāt
analyzed: anvaya mātra śaktau api anvaya viśeṣa jñāna artham ākāṅkṣā ādeḥ avaśyam apekṣaṇāt kriyā kāraka padayoḥ pratyekam itara anvita svārtha bodhaka tve vākya artha dvaya dhī prasaṅgāt
translated: Even if there is capacity only for relation, expectancy etc. must be necessarily required for the knowledge of the particular relation, because if the words denoting action and objects each convey their own meaning related to the other, there would be the consequence of the cognition of two sentence meanings.

original: na caikamevānvitābhidhāyakamitarattu pratiyogismārakamiti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca ekam eva anvita abhidhāyakam itarat tu pratiyogi smārakam iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that only one expresses the related meaning, while the other reminds of the counter-entity.

original: aviśeṣādaśakyānvayānubhave 'tiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: aviśeṣāt aśakya anvaya anubhave tiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because there would be no distinction, and in the experience of the impossible relation, there would be an overextension.

original: anvaye 'pi śaktiriti cet na aśakyamapi hi śakyānvayaṃ bodhayati nānyat śakyānvayatvasya svarūpatoniyāmakatvāt anyathā tavāpyapratīkārāt /
analyzed: anvaye pi śaktiḥ iti ced na aśakyam api hi śakya anvayam bodhayati na anyat śakya anvaya tvasya svarūpataḥ niyāmaka tvāt anyathā tava api apratīkārāt
translated: If it is argued that there is power even in the case of the meaning, it is not so. For even what is incapable conveys the meaning that is capable, not anything else. Because the property of having a capable meaning is a determiner of the form. Otherwise, even for you, there would be no remedy.

original: nanvevaṃ padānāmanvitajñānajanakatvāt tatra śaktirastyeva aśaktasyājanakatvāt tavāpi
analyzed: nanu evam padānām anvita jñāna janaka tvāt tatra śaktiḥ asti eva aśaktasya ajanaka tvāt tava api
translated: If it is argued that thus, since words generate knowledge of the related meaning, there must be power in them, because what is incapable cannot generate, and even for you,

original: padādanvayabodha itīśvarecchāsattvāditi satyaṃ kintu anvayabodhe svarūpasatī sā vyāptiyate
analyzed: padāt anvaya bodhaḥ iti īśvara icchā sattvāt iti satyam kintu anvaya bodhe svarūpa satī sā vyāptiyate
translated: there is knowledge of the related meaning from the word, because of the existence of God's will, it is true, but in the knowledge of the related meaning, that [power] is merely a pervader,

original: na tu jñātā ghaṭajñānaśaktatvena jñānādeva ghaṭānvayabodhopapatteḥ yathā tava jātiśaktapadasya
analyzed: na tu jñātā ghaṭa jñāna śakta tvena jñānāt eva ghaṭa anvaya bodha upapatteḥ yathā tava jāti śakta padasya
translated: not known. Because the knowledge of the related meaning of a pot is possible just from the knowledge that the word has the power to produce knowledge of the pot, just as for you,

original: ātmavyaktijñāne dṛṣṭañca jñātakaraṇe sāmānyasambandhitayā jñātasyāpi viśeṣabuddhyupāyatvaṃ
analyzed: ātma vyakti jñāne dṛṣṭam ca jñāta karaṇe sāmānya sambandhi tayā jñātasya api viśeṣa buddhi upāya tvam
translated: from the word that has the power to denote the universal. And it is seen that even what is known as related to the universal is a means of knowing the particular,

original: yathā vahnisāmānyavyāptatayā gṛhītadhūmasya vahniviśeṣabuddhijanakatvam /
analyzed: yathā vahni sāmānya vyāpta tayā gṛhīta dhūmasya vahni viśeṣa buddhi janaka tvam
translated: just as smoke, which is grasped as pervaded by the universal fire, is the cause of the knowledge of a particular fire.

original: atha ghaṭajñānatvaṃ itarānvitaghaṭajñāne 'pyastīti tena rūpeṇānvitaghaṭajñāne 'pi
analyzed: atha ghaṭa jñāna tvam itara anvita ghaṭa jñāne pi asti iti tena rūpeṇa anvita ghaṭa jñāne pi
translated: Now, the property of being the knowledge of a pot exists in the knowledge of a pot related to something else also. Therefore, in the knowledge of a pot related to something else, by that form,

original: jñātā śaktirvyāpriyata iti cet satyaṃ kintu ghaṭajñānatvaṃ śakyatāvacchekaṃ na tvanvitaghaṭajñānatvaṃ
analyzed: jñātā śaktiḥ vyāpriyate iti ced satyam kintu ghaṭa jñāna tvam śakya tā vacchekam na tu anvita ghaṭa jñāna tvam
translated: If it is argued that the power is cognized and operates, it is true, but the nature of the cognition of a pot is the determiner of possibility, not the cognition of an associated pot,

original: gauravāt anyalabhyatvācca /
analyzed: gauravāt anya labhya tvāt ca
translated: because of the burden and because it is obtained from something else.

original: evañca jātivācakapadasya vyaktāviva ekaiva śaktiranvayāṃśe svarūpasatī padārthāṃśe jñātā vyāptiyate /
analyzed: evañca jāti vācaka padasya vyaktau iva ekā eva śaktiḥ anvaya aṃśe sva rūpa satī padārtha aṃśe jñātā vyāptiḥ yate
translated: And thus, just as for a word denoting a universal, there is only one power in the individual, being present in the form in the part of the relation, it is cognized and operates in the part of the meaning of the word.

original: jātivyakteyaḥ samānasaṃvitsaṃvedyatvāt tathā ghaṭajñānādikantu nānvayaviṣayatāniyataṃ🔽smaraṇe vyabhicārāditi cet ghaṭānubhavaviśeṣaṃ prati ghaṭapadatvena kāraṇatā sa ca
analyzed: jāti vyaktā iyaḥ samāna saṃvid saṃvedya tvāt tathā ghaṭa jñāna ādikantu na anvaya viṣaya tā niyatam  smaraṇe vyabhicārāt iti ced ghaṭa anubhava viśeṣam prati ghaṭa pada tvena kāraṇatā sa ca
translated: Because the universal and the individual are cognized by the same consciousness. But the cognition of a pot, etc. is not necessarily the object of the relation,

original: śabdānubhavo 'nvayaviṣayatāniyata eva kelalasya śabdenānanubhavāt smaraṇañca prati🔽padatvena na janakatā vyabhicārāt kintu sambandhitayā jñātatvena /
analyzed: śabda anubhavaḥ nvaya viṣaya tā niyataḥ eva kelalasya śabdena ananubhavāt smaraṇam ca prati  pada tvena na janaka tā vyabhicārāt kintu sambandhi tayā jñāta tvena
translated: because of the deviation in memory. If it is argued that the word pot is the cause for the particular experience of a pot, and that experience of the word is necessarily the object of the relation, because a fool does not experience the pot by the word, and memory is not produced by the word as a related object, because of deviation, but by being known as related.

original: syādetat anvayatātparyakatayā tatpratipādakaṃ padamityavivādaṃ tātparyanirvāhikā ca vṛttiḥ sā ceha na gauṇī na vā lakṣaṇeti śaktisiddhiḥ /
analyzed: syāt etat anvaya tātparyaka tayā tad pratipādakam padam iti avivādam tātparya nirvāhikā ca vṛttiḥ sā ca iha na gauṇī na vā lakṣaṇā iti śakti siddhiḥ
translated: This may be so. It is undisputed that the word is expressive of that which is intended to be related. And the function that fulfills the intention is not figurative here, nor is it secondary signification. Thus, the existence of power is established.

original: athānvaye lakṣaṇaiva svārthasambandhini tātparyāt padārthopasthityanantaraṃ tadanvayopapatteśca /
analyzed: atha anvaye lakṣaṇā eva svārtha sambandhini tātparyāt padārtha upasthiti anantaram tad anvaya upapatteḥ ca
translated: If it is in the case of the relation, then it is only indication, because of the intention towards what is related to one's own meaning, and because of the possibility of the relation after the presentation of the meaning of the word.

original: na ca vṛttidvayasya virodhaḥ anvayaviśeṣaṇatayā padārthopasthiteḥ /
analyzed: na ca vṛtti dvayasya virodhaḥ anvaya viśeṣaṇa tayā padārtha upasthiteḥ
translated: And there is no contradiction between the two operations, because the presentation of the meaning of the word is by way of qualifying the relation.

original: na ca lākṣaṇikānāmananubhāvakatvādanvayānubhavaḥ kathamiti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca lākṣaṇikānām ananubhāvaka tvāt anvaya anubhavaḥ katham iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the experience of the relation is not possible because of the non-indicating nature of the figurative,

original: padārthasya smaraṇādanvaye śaktatvācca padānāṃ śaktyānanubhāvakatayā sarvatra lākṣaṇikasyaivānubhāvakatvaditi /
analyzed: padārthasya smaraṇāt anvaye śakta tvāt ca padānām śaktyā ananubhāvaka tayā sarvatra lākṣaṇikasya eva anubhāvaka tvat iti
translated: because the relation is capable of being related to the recollection of the meaning of the word, and because of the non-indicating nature of the words by their power, the figurative is the only indicating everywhere.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: vṛttirhi jñatopayujyate na svarūpasatyatiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: vṛttiḥ hi jña tā upayujyate na svarūpa sati atiprasaṅgāt
translated: For an operation is useful for knowledge, not for mere existence, because of the fallacy of over-extension.

original: na ceha svārthasambandhitayānvayaḥ prāgavagataḥ vākyārthasyāpūrvatvāt /🔽kiñca śakyasambandhitayā anvaye lakṣaṇārtha padārthe śaktikalpanaṃ tadvaraṃ lāghavādanvaye
analyzed: na ca iha svārtha sambandhi tayā anvayaḥ prāk avagataḥ vākya arthasya apūrva tvāt  kiñca śakya sambandhi tayā anvaye padārthe śakti kalpanam tat varam lāghavāt anvaye
translated: And here the relation is not known previously as related to one's own meaning, because the meaning of the sentence is new.🔽Moreover, if the relation is by the connection with what is possible, and the word is imagined to have power towards the meaning of the word in the figurative sense, then it is better to assume the power even in the relation,

original: 'pi śaktirastu kiṃ vṛttidvayakalpanā evaṃ sthite prayoge 'pi anvayaḥ padaśakyaḥ vṛttyatyantaraṃ
analyzed: śaktiḥ astu kim vṛtti dvaya kalpanā evam sthite prayoge anvayaḥ pada śakyaḥ vṛtti atyantaram
translated: for the sake of simplicity. Thus, even in the case of the expression, the relation is possible for the word, and there is no need for another operation.

original: vinā padapratipādyatvāt padārthavaditi /
analyzed: vinā pada pratipādya tvāt padārtha vat iti
translated: Because it is not what is denoted by the word, like the meaning of a word.

original: ucyate /🔽vṛttiṃ vināpi tātparyanirvāhāt kiṃ vṛttyā padānāmuktakrameṇānvayabodhajanakatvasambhavādanyathā śaktyā tātparyanirvāhodṛṣṭa iti lakṣaṇocchedaḥ
analyzed: ucyate  vṛttim vinā api tātparya nirvāhāt kim vṛttyā padānām ukta krameṇa anvaya bodha janaka tva sambhavāt anyathā śaktyā tātparya nirvāhaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ iti lakṣaṇa ucchedaḥ
translated: It is said:🔽Even without a relation, the intended meaning is conveyed. What is the use of a relation? The words are capable of producing the understanding of the relation in the stated manner. Otherwise, if the intended meaning were conveyed by potency, the definition would be contradicted.

original: atha śaktiṃ vināpiśakyasambandhāt tannirvāha iti na tatra śaktiḥ tarhi vṛttiṃ vināpi tannirvāha iti kiṃ vṛttyā /
analyzed: atha śaktim vinā api śakya sambandhāt tad nirvāhaḥ iti na tatra śaktiḥ tarhi vṛttim vinā api tad nirvāhaḥ iti kim vṛttyā
translated: If it is argued that the intended meaning is conveyed even without potency, by the relation of what is possible, then there is no potency there. In that case, even without a relation, the intended meaning is conveyed. What is the use of a relation?

original: ata evānumānamaprayojakaṃ anyathā padapratipādyatvādeva śaktisādhane vṛttyantarocchedaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva anumānam aprayojakam anyathā pada pratipādya tvāt eva śakti sādhane vṛtti antara ucchedaḥ
translated: For this very reason, inference is not a means of knowing potency. Otherwise, if potency were established merely by being denoted by a word, other relations would be excluded.

original: ata eva dhūmo 'stītyatra dhūmapadasya vahnibodhaparatve 'pi vahnau na lakṣaṇā śaktyā dhūmopasthitau anumānadvārā tatpratītisambhavāt /
analyzed: atas eva dhūmaḥ sti iti atra dhūma padasya vahni bodha para tve vahnau na lakṣaṇā śaktyā dhūma upasthitau anumāna dvārā tad pratīti sambhavāt
translated: For this very reason, even though the word 'dhuma' ('smoke') in the sentence 'dhumostis' ('there is smoke') has the purpose of conveying the knowledge of 'vahni' ('fire'), there is no figurative sense in 'vahni'. When 'dhuma' is presented by potency, the knowledge of 'vahni' is possible through inference.

original: tathā gaccha gacchati cet kānta panthānaḥ santu te śivāḥ /
analyzed: tathā gaccha gacchati ced kānta panthānaḥ santu te śivāḥ
translated: Similarly, in the verse Go, go, O beloved, may your paths be auspicious.

original: mamāpi janma tatraiva bhūyādyatra gato bhavān iti /
analyzed: mama api janma tatra eva bhūyāt yatra gataḥ bhavān iti
translated: May I also be born there where you go,

original: vākyasya mā gacchetyatra tātparye 'pi na lakṣaṇā gamanasya priyāmaraṇahetutvaṃ hi🔽vākyārthaḥ tena gamanaṃ mayā na kartavyaṃ priyāmaraṇahetutvādityanumānādeva gamane
analyzed: vākyasya mā gaccha iti atra tātparye na lakṣaṇā gamanasya priyā maraṇa hetu tvam hi  vākya arthaḥ tena gamanam mayā na kartavyam priyā maraṇa hetu tvāt iti anumānāt eva gamane
translated: Even when the purport of the sentence is 'Do not go', there is no figurative usage. For the meaning of the sentence is that going is the cause of the beloved's death.

original: akartavyatābodhanena tātparyanirvāhāt /🔽Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Therefore, by the understanding that going is not to be done because it is the cause of the beloved's death, the purport is fulfilled by the inference itself.

original: yatra hi mukhyayā sākṣāt paramparayā vā na tātparyanirvāhaḥ tatra lakṣaṇā /
analyzed: yatra hi mukhyayā sākṣāt paramparayā vā na tātparya nirvāhaḥ tatra lakṣaṇā
translated: Where there is no fulfillment of the purport by the primary meaning directly or indirectly, there is figurative usage.

original: nanu ghaṭamānayetyatra pratyekamanvayaviśeṣe jijñāsā bhavati /
analyzed: nanu ghaṭam ānaya iti atra pratyekam anvaya viśeṣe jijñāsā bhavati
translated: Now, in 'Bring the pot', there is a desire to know the specific relation of each word.

original: na ca sāmānyānavagame viśeṣe sa syāt ityanvayasāmānye śaktireveti cet na kāraṇena kiyāyā ca kriyākārakasāmānyākṣepāttadupapatteḥ dṛṣṭe phalādau
analyzed: na ca sāmānya anavagame viśeṣe sa syāt iti anvaya sāmānye śaktiḥ eva iti ced na kāraṇena kiyāyā ca kriyā kāraka sāmānya ākṣepāt tad upapatteḥ dṛṣṭe phala ādau
translated: And if the general is not understood, there cannot be a specific. Therefore, the power is only over the general relation. If this is argued, it is not so. Because the general of action and instrument is implied by the cause and the instrument, it is appropriate. In the seen result etc.,

original: rasaviśeṣajijñāsāvat /
analyzed: rasa viśeṣa jijñāsā vat
translated: like the desire to know the specific taste.

original: etena yaduktamanvitapadārthe mama tvakaika śaktistava tvekā padārthe 'parā tvanvaya iti nirastam /
analyzed: etena yat uktam anvita padārthe mama tu aka eka śaktiḥ tava tu ekā padārthe parā tu anvaye iti nirastam
translated: By this, what was said - that for me there is one power over the related meaning, but for you one power over the individual meaning and another over the relation - is refuted.

original: anvaye śaktyabhāvāt /
analyzed: anvaye śakti abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no power over the relation.

original: na caivamanyayānubhave padaviniyogo na syāditi vācyam /
analyzed: na ca evam anyayā anubhave pada viniyogaḥ na syāt iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that if it were so, the application of words to other things would not be possible.

original: anvayānubhavārthameva padārthe padānāṃ śaktikalpanāt /
analyzed: anvaya anubhava artham eva padārthe padānām śakti kalpanāt
translated: Because the potency of words with regard to word-meanings is assumed only for the purpose of experiencing the relation.

original: tasmāt padaṃ karaṇaṃ padārthasmaraṇaṃ vyāpāraḥ ākāṅkṣādisahakārivaśāt smāritārthānvayānubhavaḥ phalaṃ padārthasmaraṇaṃ na vyadhāyakaṃ vyāparatvāt🔽na ca smaraṇadvārā padārtha eva
analyzed: tasmāt padam karaṇam padārtha smaraṇam vyāpāraḥ ākāṅkṣā ādi sahakāri vaśāt smārita artha anvaya anubhavaḥ phalam padārtha smaraṇam na vyadhāyakam  na ca smaraṇa dvārā padārthaḥ eva
translated: Therefore, the word is the instrument, the recollection of word-meanings is the operation, the experience of the relation of the remembered meanings through the help of expectancy etc. is the result. The recollection of word-meanings is not the cause, because it is an operation.

original: kāraṇaṃ tasyānāgatatvādinā svasmaraṇe anvayānabhave cānakatvāt /
analyzed: kāraṇam tasya anāgata tva ādinā sva smaraṇe anvaya anabhave ca ānaka tvāt
translated: And it is not that the word-meaning itself is the cause through recollection, because that is not the cause in the recollection of itself as future etc. and in the non-experience of the relation.

original: tathapi padārthasmaraṇameva karaṇamastu āvaśayakatvāt ata eva cintāvaśopanītapadārthānāmanvayabodhanāt
analyzed: padārtha smaraṇam eva karaṇam astu āvaśayaka tvāt atas eva cintā vaśa upanīta padārthānām anvaya bodhanāt
translated: Even so, let the recollection of word-meanings itself be the instrument, because it is necessary. For this very reason, because it conveys the understanding of the relation of the word-meanings brought in by the desire to know,🔽if it is argued that it is poetry etc., it is not so, because recollection is not the cause, being an operation,

original: kāvyādiriti cet na smaraṇasya nirvyāratvenākaraṇatvāt ananyathāsiddhānvayavyatirekābhyāṃ
analyzed: kāvya ādiḥ iti ced na smaraṇasya nirvyāra tvena akaraṇa tvāt ananyathā asiddha anvaya vyatirekābhyām
translated: because through the positive and negative concomitance that it is not otherwise established,

original: ākāṅkṣādimatpadasyānvayānubhavaviśeṣe kāraṇatvāt padārthopasthiteḥ saṃsargadhīmātrahetutve
analyzed: ākāṅkṣā ādimat padasya anvaya anubhava viśeṣe kāraṇa tvāt padārtha upasthiteḥ saṃsarga dhī mātra hetu tve
translated: because the word with expectancy etc. is the cause in the special experience of the relation, and because the presentation of the word-meanings is the cause of mere cognition of the relation,

original: 'pi śābdasaṃsargadhīviṣaye padasyaiva hetutvāt gauḥ karmatvamānayanamityatra padārthajñāne
analyzed: pi śābda saṃsarga dhī viṣaye padasya eva hetu tvāt gauḥ karma tvam ānayanam iti atra padārtha jñāne
translated: because in the case of the cognition of the relation of words, the word alone is the cause, and even when there is knowledge of the meaning of the word 'cow' in the sentence 'cow is the object of bringing',

original: 'pi anvayajñānānudayāt padaviśeṣopasthitapadārthajñānasya hetutve padaviśeṣasyaivāvaśyakatvena hetutvācca /
analyzed: anvaya jñāna anudayāt pada viśeṣa upasthita padārtha jñānasya hetu tve pada viśeṣasya eva āvaśyaka tvena hetu tvāt ca
translated: the knowledge of the relation does not arise. Therefore, the cause is the knowledge of the meaning of the word that is present as a particular word. And because the particular word itself is necessary, it is the cause.

original: kāvyasthale ca padārthajñānavyāpārakaṃ utprakṣādisahakṛtaṃ mana evānvayānubhavakaraṇam /
analyzed: kāvya sthale ca padārtha jñāna vyāpārakam utprakṣā ādi sahakṛtam manaḥ eva anvaya anubhava karaṇam
translated: And in the case of poetry, the mind itself, aided by imagination etc., is the instrument of the experience of the relation, operating through the knowledge of the meaning of the words.

original: na caiva utprekṣayāḥ prathak pramāṇatvaṃ vyabhicārijātīyatayā liṅgādāviva pramākaraṇatāvacchedakānatiprasaktānugatarūpābhāvānnirvyāpāratvācca
analyzed: na ca eva utprekṣayāḥ prathak pramāṇa tvam vyabhicāri jātīya tayā liṅga ādau iva pramā karaṇa tā avacchedaka anatiprasakta anugata rūpa abhāvāt nirvyāpāra tvāt ca
translated: And imagination does not have a separate status as a means of knowledge, because it does not have a form that is not too wide and is in conformity with the determiner of the nature of a means of knowledge, like an inferential mark, due to the absence of a distinct operation, and because of the occurrence of the cognition of the relation even without a word when there is knowledge of fitness etc.

original: kintu pramāṇasahakāriṇī sā /
analyzed: kintu pramāṇa sahakāriṇī sā
translated: But it is an auxiliary to the means of knowledge.

original: ata eva mānase liṅgaparāmarśe vyāptismṛtyādi na pṛthak pramāṇam /
analyzed: atas eva mānase liṅga parāmarśe vyāpti smṛti ādi na pṛthak pramāṇam
translated: For this very reason, in the mental apprehension of the inferential mark, the recollection of the pervasion etc. is not a separate means of knowledge.

original: atha padamantareṇāpi yogyatādijñāne 'nvayabodho bhavatyataḥ padārthasmaraṇa eva padānāmupakṣayaḥ /
analyzed: atha padam antareṇa api yogyatā ādi jñāne nvaya bodhaḥ bhavati atas padārtha smaraṇe eva padānām upakṣayaḥ
translated: Now, even without a word, the cognition of the relation occurs when there is knowledge of fitness etc. Therefore, the function of words is only in the recollection of the meaning of the word.

original: taduktaṃ paśyataḥ śvetamā rūpaṃ heṣābdañca śṛṇvataḥ /
analyzed: tat uktam paśyataḥ rūpam śṛṇvataḥ
translated: This is stated: 'When one sees the white form and hears the neighing sound,

original: khuravikṣepaśabdañca śveto 'śvedhāvatīti dhīḥ /
analyzed: khura vikṣepa śabdaḥ ca śvetaḥ śvedhāvatī iti dhīḥ
translated: The cognition that a white horse is running arises from the sound of its hooves.

original: iti cet satyaṃ prayojakavākyoccāraṇānantaraṃ prayojyavyāpāradarśanāt anvitajñānopapattyarthaṃ padasyaiva śaktiḥ kalpyate prathamastasyaiva
analyzed: iti ced satyam prayojaka vākya uccāraṇa anantaram prayojya vyāpāra darśanāt anvita jñāna upapatti artham padasya eva śaktiḥ kalpyate prathamaḥ tasya eva
translated: If this is argued, it is true that after the utterance of the prompting sentence, the prompted activity is seen, so the potency of the word itself is imagined for the sake of the possibility of the cognition of the relation. The first of these

original: padārtheṣu śaktyantarakalpane gauravāt tadāhuḥ prāthabhyādibhidhātṛtvāttātparyopagamādapi /
analyzed: padārtheṣu śakti antara kalpane gauravāt tat āhuḥ prāthabhya ādi bhidhātṛ tvāt tātparya upagamāt api
translated: is because of the heaviness of imagining another potency in the word-meanings. They say: Because of the prima facie statement of the speaker, and also because of the acceptance of the purport,

original: padānāmeva sā śaktirvaramabhyupagamyatā /
analyzed: padānām eva sā śaktiḥ varam abhyupagamya tā
translated: it is better to accept that very potency of the words.

original: iti śveto 'śvedhāvatīti dhīśca liṅgajā padasya kḷptakāraṇabhāvasyābhāvāditi /
analyzed: iti śvetā śvedhāvatī iti dhīḥ ca liṅga jā padasya kḷpta kāraṇa bhāvasya abhāvāt iti
translated: Thus, the cognition that a white horse is running arises from the word, because there is no absence of the established causal relation of the word.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: jātiśaktivādaḥ
analyzed: jāti śakti vādaḥ
translated: The doctrine of the potency of universals

original: evaṃ padārthamātre śaktau padārthonirūpyate /
analyzed: evam padārtha mātre śaktau padārthaḥ nirūpyate
translated: Thus, when there is potency in the word-meaning alone, the word-meaning is not determined.

original: tatra prabhākarāḥ /🔽yadyapyānayanādivyavahārādvyaktāveva śaktirucitā /
analyzed: tatra prabhākarāḥ  yadi api ānayana ādi vyavahārāt vyaktau eva śaktiḥ ucitā
translated: Regarding that, the Prabhākaras say:🔽Although the potency is proper in the manifest itself due to the usage of bringing, etc.,

original: tathāpyānantyavyabhicārābhyāṃ tatra na śaktigrahaḥ samuccayena śakyatve gāṃ dadyādityādau sarvopādānāsāmarthyaṃ ekasya śakyatve 'nadhyavasāyaḥ
analyzed: tathā api ānantya vyabhicārābhyām tatra na śakti grahaḥ samuccayena śakya tve gām dadyāt ityādau sarva upādāna asāmarthyam ekasya śakya tve na adhyavasāyaḥ
translated: nevertheless, the potency is not grasped there due to infinity and non-deviation. If something is capable by combination, there is incapacity in the giving of a cow, etc., if one is capable, there is non-determination.

original: na ca govyaktimātramarthaḥ mātraśabdasya sarvārthatve uktadoṣāt sāmānyārthakatve
analyzed: na ca go vyakti mātram arthaḥ mātra śabdasya sarva artha tve ukta doṣāt sāmānya arthaka tve
translated: And the individual cow is not the meaning, because if the word 'only' means all, there is the stated fault.

original: vyakterapratīteḥ nānārthatve ca sarvāsāṃ pratyekaṃ jñātumaśakyaṃ śaktau śakye ca
analyzed: vyakteḥ apratīteḥ nānā artha tve ca sarvāsām pratyekam jñātum aśakyam śaktau śakye ca
translated: If it means the universal, the individual is not cognized. If it means many things, all of them cannot be known individually. If it means the capacity, it is possible.

original: gauravaṃ apūrvagavi vyavahārābhāvācca /
analyzed: gauravam apūrva gavi vyavahāra abhāvāt ca
translated: But it is heavy. And because there is no usage regarding a cow not seen before.

original: nāpi gotvenopalakṣitā vyaktiḥ śakyā dhenupadavadato na śakyānantaraṃ na vyabhicāraḥ na sarvāsaṅgrahaḥ na nānārthatvaṃ gotvena tāsāmaikyāditi
analyzed: nā api go tvena upalakṣitā vyaktiḥ śakyā dhenu pada vat atas na śakya anantaram na vyabhicāraḥ na sarva asaṅgrahaḥ na nānārtha tvam go tvena tāsām aikyāt iti
translated: Nor can the individual characterized by cowhood be cognized, like the word 'cow'. Therefore, there is no contradiction after the capacity, no non-inclusion of all, no meaning of many things, because they are one by cowhood.

original: vācyam /
analyzed: vācyam
translated: This cannot be said.

original: rūpāntareṇa vijñātamanyena rūpeṇa hi upalakṣyate yathā kākena gṛhaviśeṣogotvena dhāna karmavyaktiviśeṣaḥ svatovilakṣaṇaḥ na tu kākādyākāreṇaiva 🔽tatpratītiḥ /
analyzed: rūpa antareṇa vijñātam anyena rūpeṇa hi upalakṣyate yathā kākena gṛha viśeṣaḥ go tvena karma vyakti viśeṣaḥ svatas vilakṣaṇaḥ na tu kāka ādi ākāreṇa eva  tad pratītiḥ
translated: For what is cognized in one form is characterized by another, just as a house is characterized by a crow, and a particular action-individual is characterized by cowhood. It is different from itself, but its cognition is not in the form of a crow etc.

original: na ca vyaktīnāṃ jātiṃ vinā rūpāntaramekamasti jñāyate vā gopadād gaurityeva pratīteḥ
analyzed: na ca vyaktīnām jātim vinā rūpa antaram ekam asti jñāyate vā go padāt gauḥ iti eva pratīteḥ
translated: And individuals have no other form than the universal, nor is one known. Because of the cognition 'cow' from the word 'cow'.

original: gotvaviśiṣṭe ca kāryānvayādgotvaṃ viśeṣaṇaṃ nopalakṣaṇaṃ tadanyena kāryānvaye upalakṣaṇarṃ
analyzed: go tva viśiṣṭe ca kārya anvayāt go tvam viśeṣaṇam na upalakṣaṇam tad anyena kārya anvaye
translated: And in the qualified by cowhood, cowhood is the qualifier, not the characteristic, because of the connection with the effect by that, in the connection with the effect by something else, the characteristic is

original: yathāyaṃ vāsasvī devadattaśabdavācya ityatra vāsaḥ /
analyzed: yathā ayam vāsasvī devadatta śabda vācyaḥ iti atra vāsaḥ
translated: As in the case of the word 'vasa' in the sentence 'yathāyam vāsasvī devadattaḥ' (this Devadatta is wearing a garment).

original: na ca gotvaikatvena vyaktīnāmaikyaṃ kriyate aśakyatvāt /
analyzed: na ca go tva eka tvena vyaktīnām aikyam kriyate aśakya tvāt
translated: And the individuals are not made one by the universal 'cow' being one, because that is impossible.

original: nāpi jñāpyate asattvāt /
analyzed: na api jñāpyate asattvāt
translated: Nor is it indicated, because it does not exist.

original: na ca tadekatvameva vyakterekatvaṃ asambhavāt /
analyzed: na ca tad eka tvam eva vyakteḥ eka tvam asambhavāt
translated: And that universal itself is not the one universal of the individual, because that is impossible.

original: nāpi vyaktiḥ śakyā gotvamavacchedakaṃ kāraṇatve daṇḍavat evaṃ hi gopadāt na gotvaviśiṣṭabuddhiḥ
analyzed: nā api vyaktiḥ śakyā go tvam avacchedakam kāraṇa tve daṇḍa vat evam hi go padāt na go tva viśiṣṭa buddhiḥ
translated: Nor is the individual capable of being the substratum of the universal 'cow', like a stick in the cause of cutting. Thus, from the word 'cow' there would not be the cognition of the individual qualified by the universal 'cow'.

original: syāt śaktigrahāhitasaṃskārasacivādgopadādeva dhenupadāviva gotvaviśiṣṭajñānaṃ tadudbodhaśca
analyzed: syāt śakti graha āhita saṃskāra sacivāt go padāt eva dhenu padau iva go tva viśiṣṭa jñānam tad udbodhaḥ ca
translated: From the word 'cow' itself, aided by the impression produced by the knowledge of the relation of the word and its meaning, there would be the cognition of the individual qualified by the universal 'cow' and its manifestation,

original: tadvadeva paramparāsambandhāditi cet na tatra hi dhānakarmavyaktiviśeṣasyāvaśyaśakyatve
analyzed: tadvat eva paramparā sambandhāt iti ced na tatra hi dhāna karma vyakti viśeṣasya avaśya śakya tve
translated: just as from the words 'dhānakarma' (threshing) and 'vyakti' (individual) respectively. If that is argued, then in that case, the particular individual of the action of threshing is necessarily capable of being denoted,

original: 'nugamāya gotvamavacchedakamātraṃ na tu vaiṣarītya gotvasya vṛṣabhe 'pi sattvāt iha
analyzed: anugamāya go tvam avacchedaka mātram na tu go tvasya sattvāt iha
translated: and the universal 'cow' is merely the substratum for the purpose of continuity, but not the qualifier, because the universal 'cow' exists in a bull also. But here,

original: tu vyaktiratiprasakteti jātiviśiṣṭaiva sā śakyā syāt /
analyzed: tu vyaktiḥ ati prasaktā iti jāti viśiṣṭā eva sā śakyā syāt
translated: the individual is too wide, therefore it would be only the individual qualified by the universal that could be denoted.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: vastutastu jāteḥ śakyopalakṣaṇatve śakyavacchedakatve vāvaśyakatvāt lāghavācca jātireva śakyā syāt na tu vyaktiḥ dhenupade tu gotvaṃ na tathā
analyzed: vastutas tu jāteḥ śakya upalakṣaṇa tve śakya avacchedaka tve vā āvaśyaka tvāt lāghavāt ca jātiḥ eva śakyā syāt na tu vyaktiḥ dhenu pade tu go tvam na tathā
translated: But in reality, when the universal is capable of being indicated, it must necessarily be the capable indicator, and because of simplicity, the universal alone would be the capable one, not the individual. But in the word 'cow', the universal is not so.

original: atiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of over-extension.

original: astu tarhi jātiviśiṣṭaṃ śakyaṃ svavyavahāreṇa ca svahetutayā jātiviśiṣṭajñānasyānumitatvāditi cet na viśeṣyabhedādviśiṣṭānāmantatvena vyaktivācyatve
analyzed: astu tarhi jāti viśiṣṭam śakyam sva vyavahāreṇa ca sva hetutayā jāti viśiṣṭa jñānasya anumita tvāt iti ced na viśeṣya bhedāt viśiṣṭānām anta tvena vyakti vācya tve
translated: If it is argued that then the capable one is the individual qualified by the universal, and because of its own usage, the knowledge of the individual qualified by the universal is inferred from its own cause, it is not so, because of the difference in the qualified ones due to the difference in the qualifiers. If the individual is denoted,

original: uktadoṣagrāsāt /
analyzed: ukta doṣa grāsāt
translated: then the stated fault is swallowed.🔽Because the identity of the qualified ones due to the identity of the single qualifier is faulty like the theory of indication. Therefore, when the individual is not the meaning of a word, the universal alone is the meaning of a word.

original: viśeṣaṇasyaikyaikyena viśiṣṭanāmaikyasyopalakṣapakṣavadduṣyatvāt tasmādvyakterapadārthatve jātireva padārthaḥ /🔽vastutastu vyaktau jātiranugamikā viśeṣikā cāvaśyaṃ vācyeti nāgṛhītaviśeṣaṇānyāyena saiva vācyā /
analyzed: viśeṣaṇasya aikya aikyena viśiṣṭa nāma aikyasya upalakṣa pakṣa vat duṣya tvāt tasmāt vyakteḥ apadārtha tve jātiḥ eva padārthaḥ  vastutas tu vyaktau jātiḥ anugamikā viśeṣikā ca avaśyam vācyā iti na agṛhīta viśeṣaṇā nyāyena sā eva vācyā
translated: But in reality, the universal is necessarily both the follower and the qualifier in the individual. Therefore, it alone is denoted by the rule of the qualifier not being grasped.

original: atha jātāvapi vyaktireva viśeṣaḥ dharmāntarābhāvāt gavetarāvṛttitve sati sakalagovṛttitvāderūpādherapi
analyzed: atha jātau api vyaktiḥ eva viśeṣaḥ dharma antara abhāvāt gavā itara avṛtti tve sati sakala go vṛtti tva ādeḥ ūpādheḥ api
translated: If it is argued that even in the universal, the individual alone is the qualifier, because there is no other property, and because of the property-possessor being the qualifier, the universal is not denoted,🔽then it is not so, because of the fault of over-extension. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified and the qualifier. The universal is not the qualifier of the individual, because of the absence of the relation of the qualified

original: vyaktighaṭitatvāt nāgṛhītaviśeṣaṇānyāyovyaktāvapītyubhayamapi vācyamiti na jāteḥ
analyzed: vyakti ghaṭita tvāt vācyam iti na jāteḥ
translated: Because it is constituted by individuals, the principle of the qualifier not being apprehended does not apply to individuals. Both should be stated. Therefore, the universal

original: svata eva vyāvṛttatvāt /
analyzed: svatas eva vyāvṛtta tvāt
translated: is not excluded by itself.

original: anyathā jātivyaktorvyāvṛttatvajñānādanyonyavyāvṛttatvabuddhāvanyonyāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā jāti vyaktoḥ vyāvṛtta tva jñānāt anyonya vyāvṛtta tva buddhau anyonya āśrayaḥ
translated: Otherwise, from the knowledge of the exclusion of the universal and the individual, there would be mutual dependence in the cognition of mutual exclusion.

original: svatovyāvṛttatvañca na svayameva svavyāvartakatvaṃ svasmin svāvṛtteḥ /
analyzed: svatas vyāvṛtta tvam ca na svayam eva sva vyāvartaka tvam svasmin sva āvṛtteḥ
translated: And self-exclusion is not itself the quality of excluding itself, because it does not exclude itself.

original: nāpi vyāvartakaṃ vinaiva vyāvṛttatvaṃ asambhavāt /
analyzed: nā api vyāvartakam vinā eva vyāvṛtta tvam asambhavāt
translated: Nor is there exclusion without an excluding quality, because that is impossible.

original: kintu svāśrayavatsvātmani vyāvṛttadhījanakasvabhāvatvaṃ pareṣāmantyaviśeṣavat /
analyzed: kintu sva āśrayavat sva ātmani vyāvṛtta dhī janaka svabhāva tvam pareṣām antya viśeṣa vat
translated: But it is the quality of producing the cognition of exclusion in its own self along with its substratum, like the ultimate particular of others.

original: vyāvartakadharme 'pi dharmāntarādeva vyāvṛttabuddhāvanavasthā syādata eva kiñciddhi vastu svata eva vilakṣaṇamityāhuḥ /
analyzed: vyāvartaka dharme pi dharma antarāt eva vyāvṛtta buddhau anavasthā syāt atas eva kiñcid hi vastu svatas eva vilakṣaṇam iti āhuḥ
translated: Even in the case of an excluding quality, there would be an infinite regress in the cognition of exclusion from another quality itself. For this very reason, some say that a certain entity is indeed different by itself.

original: astu vā vyaktyā vyāvṛttatayā bodhitā jātireva padārtholāghavāt na tu vaiparītyamubhayaṃ
analyzed: astu vā vyaktyā vyāvṛtta tayā bodhitā jātiḥ eva padārthaḥ lāghavāt na tu vaiparītyam ubhayam
translated: Or let the universal itself be the meaning of a word, being cognized as excluded by the individual, for the sake of simplicity, and not the reverse, or both,

original: vā gauravāt kutastarhi vyaktidhīḥ jātiśaktādeva kathamanyaśaktādanyadhīḥ svabhāvāt
analyzed: vā gauravāt kutas tarhi vyakti dhīḥ jāti śaktāt eva katham anya śaktāt anya dhīḥ svabhāvāt
translated: because of the burden. Then how is there the cognition of the individual? From the very capacity of the universal. How can there be the cognition of something else from something else, by nature?

original: tatsvabhāvatvameva vyaktiśaktiṃ vinā na nirvahatīti cet na gopadaṃ hi niyamatojātivyaktī
analyzed: tad svabhāva tvam eva vyakti śaktim vinā na nirvahati iti ced na go padam hi niyamataḥ jāti vyaktī
translated: If it is argued that the nature of that [word] cannot be established without the power of the individual, it is not so, because the word 'cow' invariably conveys both the universal and the individual.

original: bodhayati tatrāsya jātiśaktidhīreva sahakāriṇī kalpyate lāghavādāvaśyakatvācca na
analyzed: bodhayati tatra asya jāti śakti dhīḥ eva sahakāriṇī kalpyate lāghavāt āvaśyaka tvāt ca na
translated: There, the cognition of the power of the universal alone is imagined to be the cooperating factor, due to simplicity and necessity.

original: tu vyaktiśaktidhīrapi gauravāt /
analyzed: tu vyakti śakti dhīḥ api gauravāt
translated: But not the cognition of the power of the individual, because of complexity.

original: jātiśaktijñāne sati tāṃ vinā vyaktibodhe vilambābhāvāt yathā tava padārthaśaktādevānvayadhīḥ /
analyzed: jāti śakti jñāne sati tām vinā vyakti bodhe vilamba abhāvāt yathā tava padārtha śaktāt eva anvaya dhīḥ
translated: When there is the cognition of the power of the universal, there is no delay in the cognition of the individual without it, just as for you, the cognition of the relation is from the power of the word alone.

original: yadvā jātiśaktameva padaṃ vyaktiṃ bodhayati aśakyatve 'pi jātyāśrayatvameva niyāmakaṃ yathā aśakyamapi svārthāntaraṃ bodhayati /
analyzed: yat vā jāti śaktam eva padam vyaktim bodhayati aśakya tve pi jāti āśraya tvam eva niyāmakam yathā aśakyam api svārtha antaram bodhayati
translated: Or, the word which has the power of the universal conveys the individual, even though it is incapable, because the substratum of the universal alone is the determining factor, just as it conveys another incapable object.

original: tatra prayojakatvena kḷptā śaktirevāstu jātyāśrayatvasya tathātvakalpane gauravāditi cet na anyalabhyasyāpadārthatvādanyathā anvayo 'pi śakyaḥ
analyzed: tatra prayojaka tvena kṷptā śaktiḥ evā astu jāti āśraya tvasya tathātva kalpane gauravāt iti ced na anya labhyasya apadārtha tvāt anyathā anvayaḥ pi śakyaḥ
translated: If it is argued that there may be the power of the universal alone, which is imagined to be the cause, because it is so imagined, due to simplicity, it is not so, because what is obtained from another is not the meaning of the word. Otherwise, the relation could also be possible.

original: syāt lakṣaṇādyucchedaśca /
analyzed: syāt lakṣaṇa ādi ucchedaḥ ca
translated: And there would be the destruction of the definition etc.

original: atha vā jātiśaktijñānājjātidhīrbhavantī vyaktimapi gocarayati /
analyzed: atha vā jāti śakti jñānāt jāti dhīḥ bhavantī vyaktim api gocarayati
translated: Or, the cognition of the universal, being produced from the cognition of the power of the universal, makes the individual also its object.

original: vyaktiṃ vinā jāterabhāvāt yo yena vinā na bhāsate taddhīhetustamavabodhayati yathā
analyzed: vyaktim vinā jāteḥ abhāvāt yaḥ yena vinā na bhāsate tad dhī hetuḥ tam avabodhayati yathā
translated: Because the universal cannot exist without the individual, the cause of the cognition of that which does not appear without something else informs about it, just as

original: jñānadhīhetustadviṣayaṃ yathā vā tavādhikaraṇasiddhānto jñānādinityatvaṃ anyathā
analyzed: jñāna dhī hetuḥ tad viṣayam yathā vā tava adhikaraṇa siddhāntaḥ jñāna ādi nitya tvam anyathā
translated: the cause of the cognition of knowledge informs about its object, or just as your conclusion in the topic informs about the eternality of knowledge etc. otherwise

original: padaṃ jātimapi na bodhayet kevalāyā apratīteḥ tathā ca jātiśaktikalpanāvaityarthaṃ
analyzed: padam jātim api na bodhayet kevalāyāḥ apratīteḥ tathā ca
translated: the word would not even convey the universal, because the bare [universal] is not apprehended. And thus the postulation of the potency of the universal is pointless.

original: tasmāt jātijñānārthaṃ kḷptā śaktirvyaktimapi bodhayati ekavittivedyatvaniyamāt /
analyzed: tasmāt jāti jñāna artham kḷptā śaktiḥ vyaktim api bodhayati eka vitti vedya tva niyamāt
translated: Therefore, the potency that is postulated for the sake of the knowledge of the universal also conveys the individual, because of the rule that they are to be known by a single cognition.

original: etenaikavittivedyataiva vyaktiśaktiṃ vinā na syāt jñāpakābhāvāt /🔽na hi vyaktijñānamahetukaṃ jātihetukaṃ vā sadātanatvaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: etena eka vitti vedya tā eva vyakti śaktim vinā na syāt jñāpaka abhāvāt  na hi vyakti jñānam ahetukam jāti hetukam vā sadātana tva prasaṅgāt
translated: By this [argument], the very being known by a single cognition would not be possible without the potency of the individual, because there is no indicator [of such a potency].🔽For the knowledge of the individual is not causeless, nor is it caused by the universal, because then it would follow that it is eternal.

original: nāpi jātidhīhetukaṃ saṃvidbhedāpatteriti nirastam /
analyzed: nā api jāti dhī hetukam saṃvid bheda āpatteḥ iti nirastam
translated: Nor is it caused by the knowledge of the universal, because then there would be a difference in consciousness. This is refuted.

original: jātiśaktereva vyaktijñāpakatvāt /
analyzed: jāti śakteḥ eva vyakti jñāpaka tvāt
translated: Because the very potency of the universal is the indicator of the individual.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: Bibl. Ind. IV. p.

original: nanu jātiṃ vinā pratyakṣādinā vyaktijñānādanyaiva vyaktidhīsāmagrī jātiviśiṣṭajñānañcobhayajñāpakasāmagrīdvayasamājādārthaṃ /
analyzed: nanu jātim vinā pratyakṣa ādinā vyakti jñānāt anyā eva vyakti dhī sāmagrī jāti viśiṣṭa jñānam ca ubhaya jñāpaka sāmagrī dvaya samājāda artham
translated: Now, because of the knowledge of the individual by perception etc. without the universal, the very collection of causes for the knowledge of the individual is different. And the knowledge characterized by the universal is from the combination of two collections of causes that indicate both [the universal and the individual].

original: ata eva vyaktiṃ vinā jātesmaraṇena jātismaraṇasya vyaktiviṣayatvaniyamāt jātijñāpakamātrameva vyaktijñāpakaṃ kalpyate sāmānyakalpanāyāṃ bādhakābhāvāditi
analyzed: atas eva vyaktim vinā jāteḥ smaraṇena jāti smaraṇasya vyakti viṣaya tva niyamāt jāti jñāpaka mātram eva vyakti jñāpakam kalpyate sāmānya kalpanāyām bādhaka abhāvāt iti
translated: For this very reason, the mere indicator of the class is imagined to be the indicator of the individual, because the remembrance of the class is restricted to the object of the individual by the remembrance of the class without the individual, since there is no contradiction in the imagination of the universal.

original: parāstam /
analyzed: parāstam
translated: This is refuted.

original: jātiṃ vināpi vyaktismaraṇāttatrānyaiva sāmagrī cātiviśiṣṭasmaraṇañcobhayāṃśasmārakasamājāditi /
analyzed: jātim vinā api vyakti smaraṇāt tatra anyā eva sāmagrī ca ati viśiṣṭa smaraṇam ca ubhaya aṃśa smāraka samājāt iti
translated: Because the remembrance of the individual is possible even without the class, the collection of causes there is different, and the very specific remembrance is from the combination of the two-part remmberer.

original: atra brūmaḥ /🔽jātivyaktipratyakṣādibodhe tathaiva sāmagrīdvayasya pṛthaganvayavyatirekagrahācchābde
analyzed: atra brūmaḥ  jāti vyakti pratyakṣa ādi bodhe tathā eva sāmagrī dvayasya pṛthak anvaya vyatireka grahāt śābde
translated: Here we say:

original: tu vyaktibodhe jātiśaktijñānameva heturlāghavāt na sāmagṣantaraṃ tatsattve tena vinā vilambābhāvāt /
analyzed: tu vyakti bodhe jāti śakti jñānam eva hetuḥ lāghavāt na sāmagṣa antaram tad sattve tena vinā vilamba abhāvāt
translated: In the cognition of the class and individual, etc., the two collections are separately inferred from the positive and negative concomitance, but in the cognition of the individual, the knowledge of the power of the class alone is the cause, due to simplicity. Not another collection. Because there is no delay in its existence without that.

original: evañca jātiśaktatvena jñātaṃ padaṃ jātiviśiṣṭasya smārakamanubhāvakañca /
analyzed: evam ca jāti śakta tvena jñātam padam jāti viśiṣṭasya smārakam anubhāvakañca
translated: And thus the word known as having the power of the class is the remmberer and the manifester of that qualified by the class.

original: nanu jñāne śaktiḥ śakyatvāt tathāca yasya jñāne śaktistacchakyaṃ jātivyaktijñāne
analyzed: nanu jñāne śaktiḥ śakya tvāt tathā ca yasya jñāne śaktiḥ tat śakyam jāti vyakti jñāne
translated: But in cognition, the power is due to being capable. And thus that whose power is in cognition is capable. In the cognition of the class and individual,

original: ca śaktiriti jātivadvyaktirapi śakyeti cet na yadviṣayatayā hi jñātā jñāne śaktirupayujyate
analyzed: ca śaktiḥ iti jāti vat vyaktiḥ api śakyā iti ced na yad viṣaya tayā hi jñātā jñāne śaktiḥ upayujyate
translated: If it is argued that just as the universal, so the individual is also capable, that is not so. For, the capacity in cognition is useful only when it is known as the object of that.

original: tat śaktijñāne viṣayatayā śakyatāvacchedakaṃ śakyaṃ jātijñānañca tatheti jātireva
analyzed: tat śakti jñāne viṣayatayā śakya tā avacchedakam śakyam jāti jñānam ca tathā iti jātiḥ eva
translated: In the cognition of capacity, the individual is capable as the determiner of capability through the object. And the cognition of the universal is also like that. Therefore, only the universal

original: śakyā na tu vyaktijñānatvamapyacchedakaṃ gauravāt /🔽na ca śakyajñāne niyataviṣayatvameva śakyatvaṃ vyavahārānumita śakyānubhavaviṣayāṇāmanvaye
analyzed: śakyāḥ na tu vyakti jñāna tvam api acchedakam gauravāt  na ca śakya jñāne niyata viṣaya tvam eva śakya tvam vyavahāra anumita śakya anubhava viṣayāṇām anvaye
translated: is capable, not the individual. Because of the burden of cognition.🔽And in the inference of usage, the determiner of capability is only the necessary object in the cognition of the capable. Because of the inclusion of the objects of the experience of the capable.

original: tatsambandhimitimātṛṇāmapi śakyatāpatteḥ evañca jātivyaktijñānajanakakatvādubhayatrāpi śabdaśaktiḥ /
analyzed: tad sambandhi miti mātṛṇām api śakya tā āpatteḥ evañca jāti vyakti jñāna janakaka tvāt ubhayatra api śabda śaktiḥ
translated: And thus, the power of the word is in both cases due to the cause of the cognition of the universal and the individual.

original: jātyaṃśe sa jñātā vyaktyaṃśe svarūpasato heturlāghavāditi kubjaśaktivādaḥ /
analyzed: jāti aṃśe sa jñātā vyakti aṃśe svarūpa sataḥ hetuḥ lāghavāt iti kubja śakti vādaḥ
translated: In the part of the universal, it is known. In the part of the individual, it is the cause of the existent due to lightness. Thus is the doctrine of bent power.

original: evañca saiva tadaiva tenaiva jñātā ajñātā ca vācikā avācikāvetyatra jātivyakyavacchedakabhedenāvirodhaḥ tvayāpyanvaye kubjaśaktisvīkārāt /
analyzed: evam ca sā eva tadā eva tena eva jñātā ajñātā ca vācikā avācikā ava iti atra jāti vyakya avacchedaka bhedena avirodhaḥ tvayā api anvaye kubja śakti svīkārāt
translated: And thus, that itself is known at that time by that itself, and is also unknown, spoken and unspoken. There is no contradiction here due to the difference in the determiner of the universal and the individual. Because you also accept the bent power in the inference.

original: vyakteḥ śakyatve 'pi jñātaśaktiśabdajanitajñānaviṣayatvalakṣaṇaṃ vācyatvaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: vyakteḥ śakya tve pi jñāta śakti śabda janita jñāna viṣaya tva lakṣaṇam vācyatvam na asti
translated: Even though the individual is capable, it does not have the denotability characterized by being the object of knowledge produced by a word whose power has been known.

original: na caivaṃ paribhāṣā śabdajanyajñānaviṣayatvena vācyatve lākṣaṇikāderapi vācyatvāpatteḥ
analyzed: na ca evam paribhāṣā śabda janya jñāna viṣaya tvena vācya tve lākṣaṇika ādeḥ api vācya tva āpatteḥ
translated: And thus, in the definition of denotability as being the object of knowledge produced by a word, even figurative expressions would become denotable.

original: vyakteḥ śakyatve 'pi vyaktiśaktijñānaṃ na kāraṇaṃ vyaktiśaktijñānatvaṃ nāvacchedakamiti lāghavam /🔽yattu tacchaktatvena jñātādeva tadarthabodhaḥ śaktibhramādapi dhīdarśanāt /
analyzed: vyakteḥ śakya tve pi vyakti śakti jñānam na kāraṇam vyakti śakti jñāna tvam na avacchedakam iti lāghavam  yat tu tad śakta tvena jñātāt eva tad artha bodhaḥ śakti bhramāt api dhī darśanāt
translated: Even though the individual is capable, the knowledge of the power of the individual is not the cause, and the nature of being the knowledge of the power of the individual is not the determiner, so it is simple.🔽But it is said that the cognition of that meaning is produced only from what is known as having that power, because cognition is seen even from an error regarding power.

original: tathā yogyatādyanvayānupapattī vinā padādupasthitiḥ śaktisādhyeti vyaktirapi śakyeti /
analyzed: tathā yogyatā ādi anvaya anupapattī vinā padāt upasthitiḥ śakti sādhyā iti vyaktiḥ api śakyā iti
translated: Thus, without the impossibility of the relation of fitness etc., the presence is accomplished by the word, and the individual is also capable.

original: tanna /
analyzed: tat na
translated: That is not so.

original: anyalabhye śakterakalpanāt anyathā tavānvaye 'pi śaktirlakṣaṇādyucchedaśca /
analyzed: anya labhye śakteḥ akalpanāt anyathā tava anvaye śaktiḥ lakṣaṇa ādi ucchedaḥ ca
translated: Because power is not imagined in what is obtained from another. Otherwise, even in your relation, there would be power, and the definition etc. would be destroyed.

original: nanu na jātirarthaḥ /
analyzed: nanu na jātiḥ arthaḥ
translated: But a universal is not the meaning.

original: vyavahārābhāvena vyutpatterasiddheḥ kārakoparaktakriyā hi vyavahāragocaraḥ jatiśca
analyzed: vyavahāra abhāvena vyutpatteḥ asiddheḥ kāraka uparakta kriyā hi vyavahāra gocaraḥ jatiḥ ca
translated: Because usage is absent, the derivation is not established. The action tinged with the agent is indeed the sphere of usage. And a universal is not an agent.

original: na kriyā nityatvāt kārakaṃ na kartrādi kriyāyāstatrāsamavāyāt parasamavetakriyāphalabhāgitvābhāvāt
analyzed: na kriyā nitya tvāt kārakam na kartṛ ādi kriyāyāḥ tatra asamavāyāt para samaveta kriyā phala bhāgi tva abhāvāt
translated: The individual is not the agent because action is eternal, the individual is not the instrument etc. because action does not inhere in it, because it does not partake of the fruit of action inhering in another,

original: kartṛtvavyāpārānāśrayatvāt acetanatvāt tayā saha vibhāgābhāvāt kriyānādhāratvācceti
analyzed: kartṛ tva vyāpāra anāśraya tvāt acetana tvāt tayā saha vibhāga abhāvāt kriyā anādhāra tvāt ca iti
translated: because it is not the substratum of agency and activity, because it is insentient, because it does not have a relation of inherence with action, and because it is not the substratum of action.

original: cet na vyaktivyavahārādeva uktanyāyena jātau śaktigrahāt jātisavikalpakādyavyāvṛttatayā
analyzed: ced na vyakti vyavahārāt eva ukta nyāyena jātau śakti grahāt jāti savikalpaka ādi avyāvṛtta tayā
translated: If this is argued, it is not so, because the potency is grasped in the universal by the above-mentioned reasoning itself from the usage of the individual. When the individual is known along with the exclusion of the conceptual cognition etc. of the universal,

original: jñātāyāṃ vyaktau kriyānvayaḥ savikalpakañcālocanadvārā jātijanyamiti paramparayā
analyzed: jñātāyām vyaktau kriyā anvayaḥ sa vikalpakam ca ālocana dvārā jāti janyam iti paramparayā
translated: the relation of action is with the individual through the conceptual cognition which is produced by the universal through the door of perception.

original: jāterapi kārakatvenānvayaḥ /
analyzed: jāteḥ api kāraka tvena anvayaḥ
translated: Thus, the universal also has a relation as an instrument by a series of events.

original: yadvā na kevalavyakteḥ kārakatvaṃ na hi gaurgacchatītyatra vyaktimātraṃ yātīti kasyacitpratītiḥ kintu jātiviśiṣṭāyāḥ tathācobhayamapi kārakam
analyzed: yat vā na kevala vyakteḥ kāraka tvam na hi gauḥ gacchati iti atra vyakti mātram yāti iti kasyacid pratītiḥ kintu jāti viśiṣṭāyāḥ tathā ca ubhayam api kārakam
translated: Or, the individual alone is not the instrument, because no one has the idea that only the individual goes in the sentence the cow goes, but the idea is of the individual qualified by the universal. Thus, both are the instruments.

original: śrīkarastu kevalajātivyakteyarakāratvāt kriyānvayovyakterāśrayatayā jāteravacchedakatayā āruṇyādivat evañca jātiśaktapadāt jāteranubhavaḥ
analyzed: śrīkaraḥ tu kevala jāti vyakteḥ yarakāra tvāt kriyā anvayaḥ vyakteḥ āśraya tayā jāteḥ avacchedaka tayā āruṇya ādi vat evam ca jāti śakta padāt jāteḥ anubhavaḥ
translated: Śrīkara says that the relation of action is with the individual as the substratum and with the universal as the determiner, like redness etc., because only the universal and the individual are the instruments. Thus, there is experience of the universal from the word denoting the universal through potency.

original: śābdovyakteraupādānikaḥ aśakyatvāditi /
analyzed: śābdaḥ vyakteḥ aupādānikaḥ aśakya tvāt iti
translated: The verbal cognition of the individual is the material cause, because it is not possible otherwise.

original: Bibl / Ind / / IV / / p /
analyzed: bibl ind
translated: BibL. Ind. IV. P.

original: anye tu jātiśaktameva padaṃjātivyaktyoḥ smārakamanubhāvakañceti vyakterapi śābdatvam /🔽na ca vṛttiṃ vinā anvayānubhave 'praveśānna vyakteḥ śābdatvaṃ vṛttiṃ vināpi ekavittivedyatvaniyamena
analyzed: anye tu jāti śaktam eva padam jāti vyaktyoḥ smārakam anubhāvakam ca iti vyakteḥ api śābda tvam  na ca vṛttim vinā anvaya anubhave praveśāt na vyakteḥ śābda tvam vṛttim vinā api eka vitti vedya tva niyamena
translated: Others say that a word, which has the power to denote the universal, is both a reminder and a revealer of the individual, so the individual is also denoted by the word.🔽And it is not that the individual is not denoted by the word because it does not enter into the cognition of the relation without a relation, because🔽the individual is cognized by the word itself, which has the power to denote the universal, even without a relation, by the rule that it is cognized by a single cognition.

original: jātiśaktādeva vyakteranubhāvāt anyathā jātyanvayo 'pi na syāt vyaktiṃ vinā jāterananubhavāt /
analyzed: jāti śaktāt eva vyakteḥ anubhāvāt anyathā jāti anvayaḥ na syāt vyaktim vinā jāteḥ ananubhavāt
translated: Otherwise, even the relation of the universal would not be possible, because the universal is not cognized without the individual.

original: ata eva jātiśaktireva vyaktiṃ bodhayatīti guravaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva jāti śaktiḥ eva vyaktim bodhayati iti guravaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the teachers say that it is only the power to denote the universal that makes one understand the individual.

original: kiñca śakyopasthāpitasyānvayānubhavaṃ prati padānāṃ kāraṇatvaṃ ato jātivadupasthāpitāyā vyakteranubhavaḥ padāt na tu tattacchaktoyapasthāpitasya
analyzed: kiñca śakya upasthāpitasya anvaya anubhavam prati padānām kāraṇa tvam atas jāti vat upasthāpitāyāḥ vyakteḥ anubhavaḥ padāt na tu
translated: Moreover, since words are the cause of the cognition of the relation of what is presented by what is possible, the cognition of the individual presented by the universal, like the universal, is from the word, but not of what is presented by the power of this and that,

original: gauravāt /
analyzed: gauravāt
translated: because of the difficulty.

original: na caivamaśakyaparatve lakṣaṇā yathā hyanyata eva jñānānna śaktistathā lakṣaṇāpi
analyzed: na ca evam aśakya paratve lakṣaṇā yathā hi anyatas eva jñānāt na śaktiḥ tathā lakṣaṇā api
translated: And in this way, there is no secondary meaning when the meaning is not possible, just as there is no power to denote, so also there is no secondary meaning.

original: na tat kimaśakye 'pi mukhyaḥ prayogaḥḥ satyaṃ śaktyā sākṣādupasthita eva tasya mukhyatvātsvaśaktyeti tvadhikam /
analyzed: na tat mukhyaḥ prayogaḥ satyam śaktyā sākṣāt upasthitaḥ eva tasya mukhya tvāt sva śaktyā iti tu adhikam
translated: Is that not possible even in the impossible? The primary usage is true. Only the individual is directly presented by the power, because its primary nature is its own power. But this is an addition.

original: vastutastu jātiśaktādeva vyaktidhīsambhavānna vyaktau śaktiḥ /
analyzed: vastutas tu jāti śaktāt eva vyakti dhī sambhavāt na vyaktau śaktiḥ
translated: In reality, the cognition of the individual is possible only from the power of the universal, not from the individual.

original: yadi ca tato na taddhīstadā tatra śaktireva syāt anyathā taddhīrna syādeva /
analyzed: yadi ca tatas na tad dhīḥ tadā tatra śaktiḥ eva syāt anyathā tad dhīḥ na syāt eva
translated: And if the cognition does not arise from that, then there would be only the power in that. Otherwise, the cognition of that would not arise at all.

original: nanu padajātibhyāmapyekojātivyaktyanubhavaḥ kriyate tatra jātyaṃśe padasya vyaktyaṃśe🔽jāteranubhāvakatvamayameva upādānārthaṃ iti cet tarhi jāteḥ kāraṇatvāpekṣayā śaktijñāne🔽upasthitavyakteravacchedakatvamātrakalpanaiva laghīyasī jāteḥ pramāṇāntaratvāpātaśca /
analyzed: nanu pada jātibhyām api ekaḥ jāti vyakti anubhavaḥ kriyate tatra jāti aṃśe padasya vyakti aṃśe  jāteḥ anubhāvaka tvam ayam eva upādāna artham iti ced tarhi jāteḥ kāraṇa tva apekṣayā śakti jñāne  upasthita vyakteḥ avacchedaka tva mātra kalpanā eva laghīyasī jāteḥ pramāṇa antara tva āpātaḥ ca
translated: But even from the word and the universal, the experience of the same individual with the universal is produced. There, the word has the universal part, and the universal has the🔽individual part. This alone is the purpose of the designation. If so, then in the cognition of the power, the mere assumption of the individual presented by the universal as the limiting adjunct is simpler, and there is the undesirable consequence of the universal being a separate means of knowledge.

original: ata eva brīhīnavahantītyatra vyaktau na lakṣaṇā tatsādhyopasthiterjātiśaktita eva siddheḥ / /
analyzed: atas eva brīhīn avahanti iti atra vyaktau na lakṣaṇā tad sādhya upasthiteḥ jāti śaktitaḥ eva siddheḥ
translated: For this very reason, in the sentence He should thresh the rice, there is no figurative sense in the individual. Because its presentation is accomplished by the power of the universal itself, which is to be accomplished by that.

original: astu vā gavāvacchedakatvenāruṇyādivadvrīhitve 'pyavaghātānvaya iti /
analyzed: astu vā gavā avacchedaka tvena aruṇī ādi vat vrīhi tve pi avaghāta anvayaḥ iti
translated: Or let there be the connection of threshing with rice even in the universal, like the redness etc. which is the limiting adjunct of the cow.

original: atrocyate /
analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this it is said.

original: gotvajñāne gojñāne vā śaktaṃ padamityākāraḥ /
analyzed: go tva jñāne go jñāne vā śaktam padam iti ākāraḥ
translated: The form is that the word is capable in the cognition of cowness or the cognition of cow.

original: śaktigrahaḥ tathāca śakyajñāne🔽viṣayatayā jāteravacchedakatvaṃ vyaktimādāyaiva pratīyate na kevalāyāḥ vyaktiṃ vinā
analyzed: śakti grahaḥ tathā ca śakya jñāne  viṣayatayā jāteḥ avacchedaka tvam vyaktim ādāya eva pratīyate na kevalāyāḥ vyaktim vinā
translated: The apprehension of potency is like that. And thus in the cognition of the possible🔽the universal is cognized as the determiner only by taking the individual, not by itself alone, because

original: jāterapratīteḥ tathāca jāteravacchedakatve nāgṛhītaviśeṣaṇānyāyena vyakteravacchedakatvaṃ
analyzed: jāteḥ apratīteḥ tathāca jāteḥ avacchedaka tve na agṛhīta viśeṣaṇa anyāyena vyakteḥ avacchedaka tvam
translated: without the individual the universal is not cognized. And thus in the determinativeness of the universal, by the principle that a qualifier is not apprehended without the qualified, the determinativeness of the individual

original: vajralepāyitamiti śaktijñāne viṣayatayā avacchedakatvāt jātivatsāpi śakyā tasmāt
analyzed: vajra lepāyitam iti śakti jñāne viṣayatayā avacchedaka tvāt jāti vat sā api śakyā tasmāt
translated: is firmly fixed. Thus in the cognition of potency, by being the determiner as the object, the universal and that also are possible. Therefore

original: pariharaikavittivedyatvaniyamaṃ svīkuru vā vyaktervācyatvam /
analyzed: parihara eka vitti vedya tva niyamam svīkuru vā vyakteḥ vācya tvam
translated: either accept the restriction that they are cognized by a single cognition or accept the individual as the denoted.

original: api ca yaddharmavattayā jñāta eva yatra yasya jñānaṃ sa tatrāvacchedakaḥ vyaktijñānanatvena jñāta eva tatra jñāne śaktidhīriti vyaktirapi śakyā🔽nanvādyavutpattau mitimātṛviṣayatvena jñāta eva jñāne pravartakatvaṃ jñātaṃ na ca
analyzed: api ca yad dharmavat tayā jñātaḥ eva yatra yasya jñānam sa tatra avacchedakaḥ vyakti jñāna na tvena jñātaḥ eva tatra jñāne śakti dhīḥ iti vyaktiḥ api śakyā  nanu ādya utpattau miti mātṛ viṣaya tvena jñāte eva jñāne pravartaka tvam jñātam na ca
translated: Moreover, that which is known to have a certain property is the determiner of the cognition of that only in that, and the cognition of potency is known only when the individual is known to be the determiner in that cognition. Therefore the individual is also possible.🔽But in the first case, the determiner and the cognizer are known as the object, and the instigativeness of the cognition is known only when they are known. But

original: tayorjñānaṃ pravartakamato vyabhicāraḥ anyathā pravartakatvena mitimātṛjñānamapi
analyzed: tayoḥ jñānam pravartakam atas vyabhicāraḥ anyathā pravartaka tvena mitimātṛ jñānam api
translated: the cognition of them is not instigative. Therefore there is a fallacy. Otherwise, the cognition of the determiner and the cognizer🔽would also be instigative.

original: prayojyasyānumāya bālastatrāpi śaktiṃ gṛhṇīyāt evaṃ tavāpi kāryānvitajñāna eva śaktiḥ
analyzed: prayojyasya anumāya bālaḥ tatra api śaktim gṛhṇīyāt evam tava api kārya anvita jñāne eva śaktiḥ
translated: The child would grasp the potency even in that case, having inferred the employed word. Similarly, for you also, the potency would be only in the cognition of the object along with its effect.

original: syāt tattvena jñāta eva jñāne śaktigrahāditi cet mitimātṛjñānatvaṃ kāryānvitajñānatvañca
analyzed: syāt tattvena jñātaḥ eva jñāne śakti grahāt iti ced mitimātṛ jñāna tvam kārya anvita jñāna tvam ca
translated: If it is argued that the potency is grasped only in the cognition known to be true, the fact of being a cognition of the object along with its effect is

original: vināpi pravartakajñāne ghaṭajñānatvādikaṃ jñātuṃ śakyamiti tayornāvacchedakatvaṃ
analyzed: vinā api pravartaka jñāne ghaṭa jñāna tva ādikam jñātum śakyam iti tayoḥ nā avacchedaka tvam
translated: not a determiner, because the fact of being a cognition of the pot, etc. can be known even without the motivating cognition.

original: kintu ghaṭajñānatvādikameva lāghavāt tayorapi tata eva prāpteśca /
analyzed: kintu ghaṭa jñāna tva ādikam eva lāghavāt tayoḥ api tatas eva prāpteḥ ca
translated: But the fact of being a cognition of the pot, etc. alone is the determiner, due to its being less cumbersome. Because the other two facts are also obtained from that alone.

original: kiñca padaṃ vyaktijñānārtha śakyajñāne viṣayatayā vyakteravacchedakatvamātraṃ kalpayati
analyzed: kiñca padam vyakti jñāna artha śakya jñāne viṣaya tayā vyakteḥ avacchedaka tva mātram kalpayati
translated: Moreover, the word assumes only the mere determinative character of the individual in the cognition of the individual, as the object of the potency to be known,

original: lāghavāt jātiviṣayatvavadvyaktiviṣayatvasya jñānavittivedyatvenāvaśyaṃ śīghropasthitatvāt🔽na tu jātiśaktistadbodhe kāraṇāntaraṃ vā tadavacchedakaṃ gauravācchaktigrahakakāle
analyzed: lāghavāt jāti viṣaya tva vat vyakti viṣaya tvasya jñāna vitti vedya tvena avaśyam śīghra upasthita tvāt  na tu jāti śaktiḥ tad bodhe kāraṇa antaram vā tad avacchedakam gauravāt śakti grahaka kāle
translated: due to its being less cumbersome. Because the fact of being the object of the individual, like the fact of being the object of the universal, must be quickly presented to consciousness as known by the cognition of the knower.

original: kalpanīyopasthitikatvācca /
analyzed: kalpanīya upasthitika tvāt ca
translated: But not the potency of the universal, nor any other cause for its cognition, nor any determiner of it, because of its being cumbersome. And because it would have to be assumed to be presented at the time of grasping the potency.

original: anye tu prathamaṃ vyavahārānumitavyaktijñāne śabdānuvidhānāt padaṃ śaktamityavadhārayati
analyzed: anye tu prathamam vyavahāra anumita vyakti jñāne śabda anuvidhānāt padam śaktam iti avadhārayati
translated: Others, however, first determine that the word is potent, because of the conformity of the word in the cognition of the individual inferred from usage.

original: na tu jātijñāne vyavahārājanakatve na tadā tasyānupasthiteḥ paścādvyaktervyāvṛttyarthaṃ
analyzed: na tu jāti jñāne vyavahāra ajanaka tve na tadā tasya anupasthiteḥ paścāt vyakteḥ vyāvṛtti artham
translated: But when the universal is not the cause of the cognition of the individual, it is not because the universal is not present at that time, but because the individual is excluded later.

original: anugamārthañca jātirapi tadviṣaya iti mānāntareṇa jñātvā jātijñāne 'pi tatpadasya
analyzed: anugama arthaḥ ca jātiḥ api tad viṣayaḥ iti māna antareṇa jñātvā jāti jñāne tad padasya
translated: And for the purpose of inclusion, the universal is also its object. Knowing this by another means of knowledge, it is understood that the word is the cause even in the cognition of the universal.

original: kāraṇatāṃ pratyeti tathāca vyaktiśaktijñānamapi kāraṇaṃ na tu jātiśaktijñānenānyathāsiddhiḥ
analyzed: kāraṇatām pratyeti tathā ca vyakti śakti jñānam api kāraṇam na tu jāti śakti jñānena anyathā siddhiḥ
translated: And the knowledge of the power of the individual is also a cause. It is not otherwise established by the knowledge of the power of the universal.

original: vyaktijñānakāraṇatāṃ upajīvya jātijñāne kāraṇatāgraha ityupajīvyavirodhāt /
analyzed: vyakti jñāna kāraṇatām upajīvya jāti jñāne kāraṇatā grahaḥ iti upajīvya virodhāt
translated: Because the apprehension of the cause in the cognition of the universal depends on the apprehension of the cause in the cognition of the individual, and because it contradicts the dependent.

original: etena jātirapi śakyā lāghavāt śaktigrahajanyasaṃskārasya vyaktiviṣayatvaniyamena
analyzed: etena jātiḥ api śakyā lāghavāt śakti graha janya saṃskārasya vyakti viṣaya tva niyamena
translated: By this, the universal is also capable. Because of the rule that the impression produced by the apprehension of power has the individual as its object,

original: padāt jātismaraṇamutpādyamānamavaśyaṃ vyaktiviṣayaṃ saṃskārasyāniyatodbokadhatve
analyzed: padāt jāti smaraṇam utpādyamānam avaśyam vyakti viṣayam saṃskārasya aniyata udbokadha tve
translated: the recollection of the universal produced by the word must have the individual as its object, even though the arousal of the impression is not fixed.

original: 'pi jātyaṃśodbodhakādeva vyaktaṃśodbodhaniyamakalpanā yathā padenodbuddhasaṃskārādeva
analyzed: pi jāti aṃśa udbodhakāt eva vyakta aṃśa udbodha niyama kalpanā yathā padena udbuddha saṃskārāt eva
translated: Even when the universal is aroused, the rule that the individual is aroused is assumed. Just as the recollection of power, which is fixed by the impression aroused by the word alone,

original: niyatā śaktismṛtiḥ padaṃ vināpi sa sarvā jātismṛtirvyaktiviṣayā anyathā kevalajātimātrasmaraṇāpatteḥ /
analyzed: niyatā śakti smṛtiḥ padam vinā api sa sarvā jāti smṛtiḥ vyakti viṣayā anyathā kevala jāti mātra smaraṇa āpatteḥ
translated: all the recollection of the universal is about the individual, otherwise there would be the fault of the mere recollection of the universal alone.

original: saṃskārasahitāt padādeva jātiviśiṣṭānubhavo 'pīndriyadiva pratyabhijñā /
analyzed: saṃskāra sahitāt padāt eva jāti viśiṣṭa anubhavā pratyabhijñā
translated: From the word itself along with the impression, there is recognition of the experience qualified by the universal, like from the sense organ etc.

original: ata eva bhāṣyaṃ saṃskāraśabdaśaktibhyāṃ viśiṣṭānubhavaityunnītamatamapāsta uktanyāyairjātivadvyakterapi
analyzed: atas eva bhāṣyam saṃskāra śabda śaktibhyām viśiṣṭa anubhavā iti unnīta matam apāstaḥ ukta nyāyaiḥ jāti vat vyakteḥ api
translated: For this very reason, the doctrine raised by the commentary that the cognition is qualified by impression and word-power is refuted by the reasoning stated, because the individual, like the universal, is also

original: śakyatvāt viśiṣṭanāmānantye 'pi ekatra viśiṣṭe tattvaṃ vihāya gotvamādāya gotvaviśiṣṭaṃ
analyzed: śakya tvāt viśiṣṭa nāma ānantye pi ekatra viśiṣṭe tattvam vihāya go tvam ādāya go tva viśiṣṭam
translated: capable of being denoted. Even in the infinity of qualified names, in one qualified thing, setting aside the individual, taking the universal, the qualified

original: śakyamita śaktigrahaḥ yathā ca kvacideva dhūme dhūmovahnivyāpya iti buddhiḥ yathā
analyzed: śakya mita śakti grahaḥ yathā ca kvacid eva dhūme dhūmaḥ vahni vyāpyaḥ iti buddhiḥ yathā
translated: universal is capable of being denoted. Just as the cognition that smoke is pervaded by fire arises only in some smoke,

original: va tathaiva kāryāṇāmānantye 'pi kvacit kārye tattvaṃ taṭasthīkṛtya kṛtimādāya dharmiṇi
analyzed: tathā eva kāryāṇām ānantye kvacid kārye tattvam taṭasthīkṛtya kṛtim ādāya dharmiṇi
translated: in the same way, even in the infinity of effects, setting aside the individual in some effect, taking the action, in the subject,

original: kāryaṃ śakyamiti liṅāderapūrvaṃ śaktigrahaḥ avacchedakaikyācchakterekatvaṃ tadvadeva
analyzed: kāryam śakyam iti liṅ ādeḥ apūrvam śakti grahaḥ avacchedaka aikyāt śakteḥ eka tvam tadvat eva
translated: the effect is capable of being denoted. The cognition of the unseen potentiality of the optative suffix etc. is like that. Due to the unity of the qualifier, the potentiality is one. Just like that.

original: yathā vā vyaktivācakapaśvādipadānāṃ atha vā gotvena sāmānyalakṣaṇayā jñāte sarvatra
analyzed: yathā vā vyakti vācaka paśu ādi padānām atha vā go tvena sāmānya lakṣaṇayā jñāte sarvatra
translated: Or, in the case of words denoting individuals like 'cow' etc., when the universal is known by the indication of the universal, in every cow,

original: gavi gotvamādāya śaktigrahaḥ prameyatvena ca sarvajñāne sārvajñamiṣyata eva neṣyate
analyzed: gavi go tvam ādāya śakti grahaḥ prameya tvena ca sarva jñāne sārvajñam iṣyate eva na iṣyate
translated: taking the universal, the potentiality is grasped. And omniscience in all cognitions is accepted as possible by the means of valid knowledge called 'upamana' (analogy). It is not accepted as impossible.

original: tu ghaṭatvādi sarvaprakārakajñānavattvena sarvaikodasīnagoḥ śakyatvād yatkiñcidekopādāne 'nadhyavasāyo vā /
analyzed: tu ghaṭa tva ādi sarva prakāraka jñānavat tvena śakya tvāt yat kiñcid eka upādāne vā
translated: But in the case of a pot, etc., everything is possible, as they are known in all aspects, so there is either non-determination of anything in a single substratum, or else,

original: anyathā tavāpyekavittivedyatayā sarvaikaparatve uktadoṣe kā gatiḥ kā vā gatirvyaktivācakapaśvādipadānāṃ /
analyzed: anyathā tava api eka vitti vedya tayā sarva eka paratve ukta doṣe kā gatiḥ kā vā gatiḥ vyakti vācaka paśu ādi padānām
translated: otherwise, even for you, when everything is one's own, there is the same fault stated, or what is the course, or what is the course of words like 'cow', which denote individuals?

original: bhaṭṭamate tu jātireva śakyā lāghavāt vyaktistvākṣepalabhyā /🔽nanu nākṣepa ekavittivedyatvāttayoḥ samānānāṃ hi bhāvaḥ sāmānyaṃ tacca vyaktiṃ vinā
analyzed: bhaṭṭa mate tu jātiḥ eva śakyā lāghavāt vyaktiḥ tu ākṣepa labhyā  nanu nā ākṣepaḥ eka vitti vedya tvāt tayoḥ samānānām hi bhāvaḥ sāmānyam tat ca vyaktim vinā
translated: But in the Bhatta's view, only the universal is possible, due to its simplicity, while the individual is understood by implication.🔽But it is not by implication, because they are known by a single cognition. For a universal is the existence of similar things, and that does not appear without an individual.

original: na bhāsate iti cet na svarūpeṇa śakyā jātiḥ na ca sāmānyatvaṃ tasyāḥ svarūpaṃ taddharmatvāt
analyzed: na bhāsate iti ced na svarūpeṇa śakyā jātiḥ na ca sāmānya tvam tasyāḥ svarūpam tad dharma tvāt
translated: If it is said that the universal is possible in its own form, and being a universal is not its own form, because it is its property,

original: anyathā ālocane 'pi sā na bhāseta /🔽kathaṃ sāmānyatvenāpratītā jātirvyaktitobhinnatayā śabdanābhidhātavyeti cet na śabdena vyaktito bhinnatayā jāterabodhanāt /
