analyzed: anyathā ālocane pi sā na bhāseta  katham sāmānya tvena apratītā jātiḥ vyaktitaḥ bhinna tayā śabdanā abhidhātavyā iti ced na śabdena vyaktitaḥ bhinna tayā jāteḥ abodhanāt
translated: otherwise it would not appear even in perception.🔽If it is said that how can a universal, which is not apprehended as a universal, be expressed as different from an individual, it is not so, because the universal is not understood as different from the individual by the word.

original: nanu vyāvṛttā jātivyācyā vyāvṛttabuddhiṃ vinā vyaktiviśeṣānākṣepāt vyāvartikā tatra
analyzed: nanu vyāvṛttā jātiḥ vyācyā vyāvṛtta buddhim vinā vyakti viśeṣa anākṣepāt vyāvartikā tatra
translated: But the universal is to be expressed as excluded, because without an excluding cognition, the particular individual is not implied, so the exclusion is there.

original: vyaktireva anugatatvamapyanugamyamānaṃ vinā na bhāsata iti jātivittivedyaiva vyaktiriti
analyzed: vyaktiḥ eva anugata tvam api anugamyamānam vinā na bhāsate iti jāti vitti vedyā eva vyaktiḥ iti
translated: If it is argued that the individual itself, even when being followed, does not appear without something to be followed, so the individual is known only through the cognition of the universal,

original: cet na svatovyāvṛttajātisvarūpasya vācyatvāt /
analyzed: ced na svatas vyāvṛtta jāti svarūpasya vācya tvāt
translated: no, because the nature of the universal, which is distinct by itself, is to be denoted.

original: vyakterdharmāntarasya vā vyāvartakatve 'nyonyāśrayo 'navasthā vā /
analyzed: vyakteḥ dharma antarasya vā vyāvartaka tve nyonya āśrayaḥ navasthā vā
translated: If the individual or another property is what distinguishes, there is mutual dependence or infinite regress.

original: nanu gauritipadāt jātivyakatyoryugapatpratītiḥ /
analyzed: nanu gauḥ iti padāt jāti vyakatyoḥ yugapad pratītiḥ
translated: But it is argued that from the word cow there is simultaneous cognition of the universal and the individual.

original: na ca sūkṣmakālabhedāgrahāt sā bhrāntā bādhakābhāvāt tathāca gopadādgotvadhīstataḥ
analyzed: na ca sūkṣma kāla bheda agrahāt sā bhrāntā bādhaka abhāvāt tathā ca go padāt go tva dhīḥ tatas
translated: And it is not mistaken due to non-apprehension of a subtle difference in time, because there is no contradiction. Thus from the word cow there is cognition of cowness.

original: krameṇa vyāptipakṣadharmatājñānaṃ tato vyaktyanumitiriti jñānaparamparakalpanādvaraṃ
analyzed: krameṇa vyāpti pakṣa dharma tā jñānam tatas vyakti anumitiḥ iti jñāna parampara kalpanāt varam
translated: From that, in sequence, there is knowledge of the universal and the property of the subject, and from that there is inference of the individual. It is better to posit a series of cognitions

original: jātivittivedyatvaṃ vyakteriti cet na vyutpattyadhīnaṃ hi śabdasya bodhakatvaṃ ato
analyzed: jāti vitti vedya tvam vyakteḥ iti ced na vyutpatti adhīnam hi śabdasya bodhaka tvam
translated: than to say that the individual is known through the cognition of the universal. If it is argued that this is so because the word's ability to convey meaning depends on derivation,

original: vyutpattiparyālocanayā yugapajjñānamasiddham /
analyzed: vyutpatti paryālocanayā yugapad jñānam asiddham
translated: the simultaneous cognition is not established by considering the derivation.

original: ata eva jñānaparamparākalpanamapi yuktaṃ anyathā karturapyākṣepona syāt śabdāt sakartṛ
analyzed: atas eva jñāna paramparā kalpanam api yuktam anyathā kartuḥ api ākṣepaḥ na syāt śabdāt sa kartṛ
translated: For the same reason, the postulation of a series of cognitions is also appropriate. Otherwise, even the agent would not be implied by the word,

original: kāyā eva kriyāyā avagamāt /
analyzed: kāyāḥ eva kriyāyāḥ avagamāt
translated: because only the action along with its agent is understood from the word.

original: na ca jātijñānatvena vyaktiviṣayatāniyamaḥ pratyakṣādau tasya vyaktidhīhetusamājādhīnatvāt /
analyzed: na ca jāti jñāna tvena vyakti viṣaya tā niyamaḥ pratyakṣa ādau tasya vyakti dhī hetu samāja adhīna tvāt
translated: And the restriction of the cognition of the individual to the cognition of the universal is not due to the nature of perception etc., because that is dependent on the assemblage of causes of the cognition of the individual.

original: ata eva na jātidhīhetau vyaktidhīhetusahakāritāniyamaḥ samājasyārthasiddhatvāt gotvaṃ gavāviṣayapratītiviṣayaḥ jātitvāt gobhinnabhāvatvādveti
analyzed: atas eva na jāti dhī hetau vyakti dhī hetu sahakāri tā niyamaḥ samājasya artha siddha tvāt go tvam gavā aviṣaya pratīti viṣayaḥ jāti tvāt go bhinna bhāva tvāt vā iti
translated: For the same reason, there is no restriction of the individual cognition being an auxiliary cause of the universal cognition, because the assemblage is established by the meaning. The universal is the object of cognition that has the cow as its object, because it is a universal, or because it is a thing different from the cow.

original: jātimātradhīsiddheśca /
analyzed: jāti mātra dhī siddheḥ ca
translated: And because the cognition of the universal alone is established.

original: atha yat tatparatantraṃ tat tenaikāvittivedyaṃ yathārthaparatantraṃ jñānamarthena
analyzed: atha yat tat paratantram tat tena eka avitti vedyam yathārtha paratantram jñānam arthena
translated: If it is argued that what is dependent on another is known by that alone through a single cognition, like the knowledge dependent on the object is known by the object,

original: jātiśca paratantreti vyaktau bhāsamānāyāmeva bhāsata iti cet na paratantratvaṃ hi🔽na parasamavetatvaṃ gandhādinā vyabhicārāt na taddhīnirūpyatvaṃ asiddheḥ nāpi tasmin
analyzed: jātiḥ ca paratantrā iti vyaktau bhāsamānāyām eva bhāsate iti ced na paratantra tvam hi  na para samaveta tvam gandha ādinā vyabhicārāt na tad dhī nirūpya tvam asiddheḥ nā api tasmin
translated: and the universal is dependent on another, so it appears only when the individual appears, it is not so. For dependence on another does not mean

original: bhāsamāna eva bhāsamānatvaṃ sādhyāviśeṣāt nāpi viśeṣaṇatvenaiva jñānaṃ gaurityeva
analyzed: bhāsamāne eva bhāsamāna tvam sādhya aviśeṣāt nā api viśeṣaṇa tvena eva jñānam gauḥ iti eva
translated: being inherent in another, because there is deviation with smell etc. Nor is it being defined in terms of that, because that is not established. Nor is it the appearance only when that appears, because the conclusion is the same. Nor is the cognition only as a qualifier, because the cognition this is a cow

original: pratīteḥ /
analyzed: pratīteḥ
translated: appears even without the qualifier in the initial perception.

original: gavi gotvamiti kaścit pratyetīti cet na ālocane viśeṣaṇatvaṃ vināpi svarūpataḥ pratīteḥ
analyzed: gavi go tvam iti kaścid pratyeti iti ced na ālocane viśeṣaṇa tvam vinā api svarūpataḥ pratīteḥ
translated: If it is argued that someone cognizes the universal in the cow as the cow has the universal, it is not so, because in the initial perception, the universal is cognized in its own form without any qualification.

original: jātimātraśaktāt padāt jāteḥ smaraṇamālocanameva jātiviśiṣṭagocarasaṃskārādeva padena
analyzed: jāti mātra śaktāt padāt jāteḥ smaraṇam ālocanam eva jāti viśiṣṭa gocara saṃskārāt eva padena
translated: From a word that has the mere power to denote the universal, the recollection of the universal is only a mental operation, arising from the impression that has the universal as its object.

original: jātyaṃśodbodhe sati jātimātrasmaraṇāt /
analyzed: jāti aṃśa udbodhe sati jāti mātra smaraṇāt
translated: Because the recollection of the universal alone occurs when the part of the universal is awakened by the word.

original: ata eva tato jātiṃ vināpi kadācit vyaktismṛtiḥ /
analyzed: atas eva tatas jātim vinā api kadācid vyakti smṛtiḥ
translated: For this very reason, sometimes the recollection of the individual occurs even without the universal.

original: astu vā gurorivālocanamappi saṃskārajanakaṃ śabdavyutpattibalena jātimātrasmaraṇasiddheḥ /
analyzed: astu vā guroḥ iva ālocanam appi saṃskāra janakam śabda vyutpatti balena jāti mātra smaraṇa siddheḥ
translated: Or let it be that the mental operation, like the teacher, produces the impression, because the recollection of the universal alone is established by the power of learning the word.

original: na ca smaraṇasya viśiṣṭajñānatvameva anubhavasyāpi tathātvena nirvikalpakāsiddhiprasaṅgāt
analyzed: na ca smaraṇasya viśiṣṭa jñāna tvam eva anubhavasya api tathātvena nirvikalpaka asiddhi prasaṅgāt
translated: And let not the recollection itself be a cognition of a qualified object, because even experience is of that nature, for then the impossibility of indeterminate cognition would follow.

original: evavittavedyatve 'pi prathamadarśanavat śabdādugotvasmaraṇamālocanameva gotve govyaktivṛttitvādi🔽vaiśiṣṭyasyāśakyatvena tadaviṣayatvāt /
analyzed: eva vitta vedya tve pi prathama darśana vat śabdāt u go tva smaraṇam ālocanam eva go tve go vyakti vṛtti tva ādi  vaiśiṣṭyasya aśakya tvena tad aviṣaya tvāt
translated: Even if it is known by the intellect, the recollection of cowness from the word, like the first perception, is only a mental operation, because the qualification of cowness as occurring in the individual cow is impossible.

original: na cālocanasyendriyajanyatvāt na smṛtitvaṃ jñānatvasākṣādvyāpyadharmatvena smṛtitvasyālocanavṛttitvāt /
analyzed: na ca ālocanasya indriya janya tvāt na smṛti tvam jñāna tva sākṣāt vyāpya dharma tvena smṛti tvasya ālocana vṛtti tvāt
translated: And let not the mental operation be a memory because it is produced by the sense organ, since the property of being a memory, which is an immediate invariable concomitant of being a cognition, belongs to the mental operation.

original: nanvākṣepādvyaktidhīrna vyaktitvena na vā rūpāntareṇa gaurityeva pratīteḥ nāpi gotvena gotvasya gotvaviśiṣṭabhedenākṣepābhāvāditi cet na viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyayorbhedenānumānāvirodhāt
analyzed: nanu ākṣepāt vyakti dhīḥ na vyakti tvena na vā rūpa antareṇa gauḥ iti eva pratīteḥ nā api go tvena go tvasya go tva viśiṣṭa bhedena ākṣepa abhāvāt iti ced na viśeṣaṇa viśeṣyayoḥ bhedena anumāna avirodhāt
translated: If it is argued that the cognition of the individual is not due to implication, because of the cognition of the individual as a cow, not as an individual, and because of the cognition of the individual as a cow, not as a cow qualified by cowness, due to the absence of implication of cowness as a different category from the individual qualified by cowness, it is not so, because there is no contradiction of inference due to the difference between the qualifier and the qualified.

original: ata eva gotvaṃ vyaktyāśritaṃ jātitvāditi pakṣadharmatābalāt gotvāśravyaktisiddhiḥ arthāpattervā tatsiddhiḥ /
analyzed: atas eva go tvam vyakti āśritam jāti tvāt iti pakṣa dharma tā balāt go tva āśra vyakti siddhiḥ arthāpatteḥ vā tad siddhiḥ
translated: For this very reason, the establishment of the individual as the substratum of cowness is due to the power of the property of the subject in the inference cowness is dependent on the individual because of being a universal, or the establishment of that is by presumption.

original: nanu vyaktyā vinā kimanupapannaṃ vyaktiṃ vināpi gotvasya tadbuddheśca siddheḥ kathamarthāpattiriti cet na vyāpakaṃ vinā vyāpyasyāsiddheḥ ucyate
analyzed: nanu vyaktyā vinā kim anupapannam vyaktim vinā api go tvasya tad buddheḥ ca siddheḥ katham arthāpattiḥ iti ced na vyāpakam vinā vyāpyasya asiddheḥ ucyate
translated: If it is argued that what is not possible without the individual? Even without the individual, cowness and the cognition of that are established. How is there presumption? It is not so, because without the all-pervading, the pervaded is not established. It is said:

original: gāmanayetyato gotvaviśiṣṭasya kriyānvayabodhādgaurityākārakagoviśeṣyakabuddhiḥ kāraṇaṃ sā ca na śabdaṃ vinā ākṣepādvyaktyāśritaṃ gotvamiti
analyzed: gām anayā iti atas go tva viśiṣṭasya kriyā anvaya bodhāt gauḥ iti ākāraka go viśeṣyaka buddhiḥ kāraṇam sā ca na śabdam vinā ākṣepāt vyakti āśritam go tvam iti
translated: From the sentence bring the cow, there is the understanding of the relation of action with that qualified by cowness. The cognition of the individual cow in the form cow is the cause, and that is not without the word. Cowness is dependent on the individual due to implication.

original: dhīrna tu gauriti /
analyzed: dhīḥ na tu gauḥ iti
translated: The cognition is cowness, not cow.

original: na caivaṃ vyakteḥ kriyānvayo 'pi gotvāśritatayā nirākaṅkṣatvāt rājapuruṣamānayetyatreva rājñaḥ anvaye vā vyaktimānayeti dhīḥ syāt na tu gāmiti
analyzed: na ca evam vyakteḥ kriyā anvayaḥ go tva āśrita tayā nirākaṅkṣa tvāt rāja puruṣam ānaya iti atra eva rājñaḥ anvaye vā vyaktim ānaya iti dhīḥ syāt na tu gām iti
translated: And thus, even the connection of the individual with action is not denied by being based on cowness, because it is not wanting, just as in bring the king's man, or if the connection is with the king, the idea would be bring the individual, not bring the cow.

original: kiñca gotvaṃ na vyaktivyāpyaṃ na hi yatra yadā vā gotvaṃ tatra tadā vyaktiryat sāmānyaṃ sā vyaktiriti vā niyamaḥ vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: kiñca go tvam na vyakti vyāpyam na hi yatra yadā vā go tvam tatra tadā vyaktiḥ yat sāmānyam sā vyaktiḥ iti vā niyamaḥ vyabhicārāt
translated: Moreover, cowness is not pervaded by the individual, for there is no rule that wherever or whenever cowness is, there or then the individual is, or that the universal is the individual.

original: nāpi gotvaṃ gavāśritaṃ gotvādityanumitiḥ vyāptigrahaśarīratvāt /
analyzed: nā api go tvam gavā āśritam go tvāt iti anumitiḥ vyāpti graha śarīra tvāt
translated: Nor is cowness based on the cow, because the inference cowness is based on the cow is the body of the apprehension of pervasion.

original: na ca jātitvaṃ vyaktyāśritatve liṅgaṃ jātitvasya padādanupasthiteḥ tathātve vā jātivittivedyaiva vyaktiḥ /
analyzed: na ca jāti tvam vyakti āśrita tve liṅgam jāti tvasya padāt anupasthiteḥ tathātve vā jāti vitti vedyā eva vyaktiḥ
translated: And being a universal is not the reason for being based on the individual, because the universal is not presented by the word. If it were so, the individual would be known only by the cognition of the universal.

original: api ca liṅgaṃ vyāpyamanupapannaṃ svāśraye vyāpakapapādakañca bodhayati /
analyzed: api ca liṅgam vyāpyam anupapannam sva āśraye bodhayati
translated: Moreover, a reason that is pervaded and not established in its substratum conveys the pervasion and the establishment in its substratum.

original: na ceha gotvāśraye vyaktibuddhiḥ /
analyzed: na ca iha go tva āśraye vyakti buddhiḥ
translated: And here there is no cognition of the individual based on cowness.

original: vayantu brūmaḥ vyakterapadārthatve vibhaktyarthasaṅkhyākarmatvādervyaktāvananvayaḥ
analyzed: vayantu brūmaḥ vyakteḥ apadārtha tve vibhakti artha saṅkhyā karma tva ādeḥ vyaktau ananvayaḥ
translated: But we say that if the individual is not the meaning of a word, number, accusative case-ending, etc., which are the meanings of inflections, are not connected with the individual.

original: syāt suvibhaktīnāṃ prakṛtyarthānvitasvārthabodhakatvasya vyutpattisiddhatvāt prakṛtitātparyaviṣaye
analyzed: syāt su vibhaktīnām prakṛti artha anvita sva artha bodhaka tvasya vyutpatti siddha tvāt prakṛti tātparya viṣaye
translated: It may be so, because the meaning of the case endings, which conveys its own meaning along with the meaning of the root, is established by derivation, and the meaning of the root is the subject matter of the case endings.

original: tadanvayavyutpattau lakṣaṇocchedo gauravañca /
analyzed: tad anvaya vyutpattau lakṣaṇa ucchedaḥ gauravañca
translated: In the derivation of the relation of that [meaning of the case endings] there would be the destruction of indication and heaviness.

original: ākhyātārthasaṅkhyāpi nānumitenānveti kintu bhāvanānvayinā śuddhena prathamāntādupasthitena padāntarādupasthitireva tatrākṣepārthaḥ /
analyzed: ākhyāta artha saṅkhyā api na anumitena anveti kintu bhāvanā anvayinā śuddhena prathamā antāt upasthitena pada antarāt upasthitiḥ eva tatra ākṣepa arthaḥ
translated: The number of the meaning of the verb also does not relate to what is inferred, but the mere [number] that is related to the bhāvanā, which is presented by the word ending in the first case, and the presentation of another word is the meaning of implication in that case.

original: ata eva na vyakterākṣepaḥ kintu lakṣaṇayā gopadādgauriti vyaktidhīriti maṇḍanaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva na vyakteḥ ākṣepaḥ kintu lakṣaṇayā go padāt gauḥ iti vyakti dhīḥ iti maṇḍanaḥ
translated: For this very reason, there is no implication of the individual, but the cognition of the individual as a cow by the word 'cow' through indication, says Maṇḍana.

original: yadāha jātāvastitvanāstitve na hi viśeṣaṇe'' iti /
analyzed: yat āha jātau astitva nāstitve na hi viśeṣaṇe iti
translated: As he says: The existence or non-existence of the individual is not a qualifier.

original: ucyate /
analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: svārthādanyena rūpeṇa jñāte bhavati lakṣaṇā tīratvena jñāte gaṅgāpadasyeva /
analyzed: svārthāt anyena rūpeṇa jñāte bhavati lakṣaṇā tīra tvena jñāte gaṅgā padasya iva
translated: When something is known in a form other than its own meaning, there is indication, just as when the bank is known, the word 'Gaṅgā' [indicates it].

original: na ceha gotvādanyena rūpeṇa vyakterupasthitiḥ kintu gotve naiva vyaktitvena sāsnādimattvena copalakṣyatve gopadādvyaktitvādirūpeṇa dhīḥ syānna
analyzed: na ca iha go tvāt anyena rūpeṇa vyakteḥ upasthitiḥ kintu go tve nā eva vyakti tvena sāsnādimattvena ca upalakṣya tve go padāt vyakti tva ādi rūpeṇa dhīḥ syāt na
translated: But here the individual is not presented in a form other than cowness, but rather by cowness itself, and by being characterized by having dewlaps etc., the cognition of the individual in the form of cowness etc. would arise from the word 'cow', not

original: tu gauriti /
analyzed: tu gauḥ iti
translated: as 'cow'.

original: nāpi gotvasambandhini gotvaviśiṣṭe lakṣaṇā gotve hi na sākṣādānayanādyanvaya iti vyaktyavacchedakatayā tasyānvaye 'mukhyatvam /
analyzed: nā api go tva sambandhini go tva viśiṣṭe lakṣaṇā go tve hi na sākṣāt ānayana ādi anvayaḥ iti vyakti avacchedaka tayā tasya anvaye mukhya tvam
translated: Nor is there a secondary sense in the qualified by cowness, because the relation to cowness is not directly related to bringing, etc. So, in its relation as the distinguisher of the individual, it is secondary.

original: lakṣaṇayāpi gotvāvacchinnaiva vyaktiḥ kriyānvayinī pratīyate na kevalā vyaktiriti gotvaviśiṣṭasya lakṣyatve yugapadvṛttidvayavirodhaḥ gotve
analyzed: lakṣaṇayā api go tva avacchinnā eva vyaktiḥ kriyā anvayinī pratīyate na kevalā vyaktiḥ iti go tva viśiṣṭasya lakṣya tve yugapad vṛtti dvaya virodhaḥ go tve
translated: Even by secondary sense, the individual qualified by cowness is understood to be related to the action, not the individual alone. So, if the qualified by cowness is the object of the secondary sense, there is a contradiction of two simultaneous senses in cowness.

original: 'pi vā lakṣaṇā /
analyzed: pi vā lakṣaṇā
translated: Or, even in cowness, there is secondary sense.

original: api ca jātimātre na śaktirna vā vyaktau lakṣaṇā jātau mukhyaprayogābhāvāt tayostanmūlakatvāt prayogo hi vyavahārahetujñānarthaḥ /
analyzed: api ca jāti mātre na śaktiḥ na vā vyaktau lakṣaṇā jātau mukhya prayoga abhāvāt tayoḥ tad mūlaka tvāt prayogaḥ hi
translated: Moreover, there is no power in mere class, nor secondary sense in the individual, because there is no primary use in the class, and those two are based on that. For use is the means of knowledge for the purpose of usage.

original: na ca jātimātranirvikalpakādvyaktimanādaya kevalajātau vyavahāraḥ tasya viśiṣṭajñānasādhyatvāt gāṃ paśya gaurastītyādāvapi gotvaviśiṣṭasyaiva 🔽jñānaṃ vyavahāraśca /
analyzed: na ca jāti mātra nirvikalpakāt vyaktim anādaya kevala jātau vyavahāraḥ tasya viśiṣṭa jñāna sādhya tvāt gām paśya gauḥ asti ityādau api go tva viśiṣṭasya eva  jñānam vyavahāraḥ ca
translated: And from the indeterminate cognition of mere class, there is no usage regarding the individual or mere class, because that is accomplished by the cognition of the qualified. Even in see the cow, the cow exists, etc., there is cognition and usage of the qualified by cowness alone.

original: tasmādekavittivedyatvaniyamāt jātiviśiṣṭaṃ śakyam /
analyzed: tasmāt eka vitti vedya tva niyamāt jāti viśiṣṭam śakyam
translated: Therefore, because of the rule of being known by a single cognition, the qualified by class is possible.

original: yadi ca tṛtīyāyāḥ karaṇaikatva iva gogotve śakye tadā gotvaṃ govyaktiśceti dhīḥ🔽syāt na tu gauriti vaiśiṣṭyañca sambandho vā jñāto ghaṭa ityatreva viśeṣaṇatāviśeṣor'thāntaraṃ vetyanyadetat /
analyzed: yadi ca tṛtīyāyāḥ karaṇa ekatve iva go go tve śakye tadā go tvam go vyaktiḥ ca iti dhīḥ  syāt na tu gauḥ iti vaiśiṣṭyam ca sambandhaḥ vā jñātaḥ ghaṭaḥ iti atra iva viśeṣaṇa tā viśeṣaḥ ūrtha antaram vā iti anyat etat
translated: And if the universal and the individual cow could be denoted by the third case ending, just as the instrument is denoted by the same ending, then there would be the cognition of the universal cow and the individual cow.🔽But there is not the cognition of the qualified, nor the cognition of the relation, as in the case of the cognition of the pot. The difference lies in the fact that the relation of qualification and qualified is a different thing altogether.

original: jātiviśeṣavadavayavasaṃyogarūpākṛtirapi padaśakyā gopadāt jātyākṛtisadṛśākṛtau lakṣaṇā piṣṭakasaṃyogaviśeṣasyāśakyatvāt /
analyzed: jāti viśeṣa vat avayava saṃyoga rūpa ākṛtiḥ api pada śakyā go padāt jāti ākṛti sadṛśa ākṛtau lakṣaṇā piṣṭaka saṃyoga viśeṣasya aśakya tvāt
translated: Just as the universal, so also the configuration, which is in the form of the arrangement of parts, is denoted by the word. From the word 'cow', there is secondary signification of the configuration similar to the universal and the configuration. Because the particular conjunction of flour cannot be denoted.

original: jātyākṛti vyaktīnāṃ pratyekamātraparatve lakṣaṇaiva pratyekasya jātyākṛtiviśiṣṭānyatvāt yathā gurūṇāṃ kāryaśaktāyā liṅgo loke kāryatvaparatve
analyzed: jāti ākṛti vyaktīnām pratyeka mātra paratve lakṣaṇā eva pratyekasya jāti ākṛti viśiṣṭa anyatvāt yathā gurūṇām kārya śaktāyāḥ liṅgaḥ loke kāryatva paratve
translated: If the universal, the configuration, and the individual are denoted by the word only as mere particulars, then there is only secondary signification, because each individual is different from that which is qualified by the universal and the configuration, just as in the world, the word 'effect' denotes only that which has the capacity for action.

original: ata eva vyaktyākṛti jātayastu padārtha iti pāramarṣasūtraṃ ekayaiva śaktyā ekavittivedyatvasūcanāya padārtha ityekavacanam /
analyzed: atas eva vyakti ākṛti jātayaḥ tu padārthaḥ iti pāramarṣasūtram ekayā eva śaktyā eka vitti vedya tva sūcanāya padārthaḥ iti ekavacanam
translated: For this very reason, the aphorism of the great sage says, The individual, the configuration, and the universal are the meanings of words. The singular number in 'padārtha' is used to indicate that they are known by a single cognition through a single potency.

original: jātiśaktivādaḥ evaṃ padmaṃ paṅkajapadaśakyaṃ tato niyamataḥ paṅkaja nikatṛpadmamiti pratīteḥ avayavānāṃ tatrāsāmarthyāt rūḍhiṃ vinā yogamātrāt
analyzed: jāti śakti vādaḥ evam padmam paṅkaja pada śakyam tatas niyamataḥ paṅkaja nikatṛ padmam iti pratīteḥ avayavānām tatra asāmarthyāt rūḍhim vinā yoga mātrāt
translated: The doctrine of the power of words to denote universals and individuals is as follows: The word lotus can denote a lotus, because it is understood that a lotus is produced from mud, and the parts of the word have no power to denote that without convention.

original: prayogadhīprasaṅgācca /
analyzed: prayoga dhī prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because it would lead to the cognition of usage.

original: nanu rūḍhāvapi yogāt kumude tau kuto na syātāṃ rūḍhyā pratibandhāditi prāñcaḥ /
analyzed: nanu rūḍhau api yogāt kumude tau kutas na syātām rūḍhyā pratibandhāt iti prāñcaḥ
translated: But even if there is convention, why would those two not apply to a water lily? Because they are restricted by convention, say the ancients.

original: vayantu niyamato rūḍhyā smṛtaṃ padmameva vyaktivācakaḍapratyayena paṅkajanikartṛtayānubhāvyate
analyzed: vayantu niyamataḥ rūḍhyā smṛtam padmam eva paṅkaja nikartṛ tayā anubhāvyate
translated: But we say that the lotus, which is remembered by convention, is experienced by the suffix ka as being produced from mud,

original: bādhakaṃ vinā vyaktivacanānāṃ sannihitaviśeṣaparatvaniyamāt yathāgneyīti ḍhagantapadena
analyzed: bādhakam vinā vyakti vacanānām sannihita viśeṣa paratva niyamāt yathā āgneyī iti ḍhak anta padena
translated: because words denoting individuals are restricted to denoting a specific thing that is present, without contradiction, just as the word ending in ḍha denoting Agni

original: prakaraṇādinā sannihitā ḍhagabhihitā ṛgvyaktirbodhyate evañca sarvatra padmānubhavasāmagrīveti
analyzed: prakaraṇa ādinā sannihitā ḍhak abhihitā ṛc vyaktiḥ bodhyate evam ca sarvatra padma anubhava sāmagrī vā iti
translated: denotes the individual Ṛc verse containing ḍha that is present by context, etc. And thus, in all cases, the collection of causes for the experience of a lotus

original: na kumude dhīrna vā tadarthaprayogaḥ /
analyzed: na kumude dhīḥ na vā tad artha prayogaḥ
translated: is not present in a water lily, so there is no cognition of it as a lotus, nor its use in that sense.

original: nanvevaṃ rūḍhirevāstu tata evobhayalābhāt kiṃ yogarūḍhyā na avayavaśakteḥ kḷptatvāt yaugikārthānubhavācca /
analyzed: nanu evam rūḍhiḥ evā astu tatas eva ubhaya lābhāt kim yoga rūḍhyā na avayava śakteḥ kḷpta tvāt yaugika artha anubhavāt ca
translated: Well then, let there just be convention, since both are obtained from that. What is the use of convention and convention? Because the power of the parts is established, and because the meaning of the conventional expression is experienced.

original: yadi ca rūḍhyartha eva yaugikārtha eva vānubhūyate tadā vivāda eva syāt anubhavenaiva tadvicchedāt /
analyzed: yadi ca rūḍhi arthaḥ eva yaugika arthaḥ eva vā anubhūyate tadā vivādaḥ eva syāt anubhavena eva tad vicchedāt
translated: And if the primary meaning or the secondary meaning is experienced, then there would be a dispute itself, because that distinction is made by experience itself.

original: atra mīmāṃsakāḥ /🔽na tāvat smṛtyarthaṃ śaktiḥ paṅkajapadaprayogaviṣaye niyatapadmānubhavajanitasaṃskārāt smṛterevopapatteḥ smṛtestajjanyatvaniyamāt /
analyzed: atra mīmāṃsakāḥ  na tāvat smṛti artham śaktiḥ paṅkaja pada prayoga viṣaye niyata padma anubhava janita saṃskārāt smṛteḥ eva upapatteḥ smṛteḥ tad janya tva niyamāt
translated: Here, the Mīmāṃsakas say:🔽First, the power is not for the sake of memory, because the memory arising from the impression produced by the definite experience of the lotus in the case of the use of the word 'lotus' is itself sufficient. Because memory is necessarily produced by that.

original: nāpyanubhavārthaṃ niyamataḥ smṛtaṃ padmamādāya vyaktivacananyāyenāvayavaiḥ paṅkajanikartṛ padmamityanubhavasambhavāt smṛtiśca rūḍhyā anyathā
analyzed: nā api anubhava artham niyamataḥ smṛtam padmam ādāya vyakti vacana nyāyena avayavaiḥ paṅkaja nikartṛ padmam iti anubhava sambhavāt smṛtiḥ ca rūḍhyāḥ anyathā
translated: Nor is it for the sake of experience, because the lotus, which is remembered, can be experienced by the parts according to the principle of the word denoting individuals, as 'that which produces lotus from mud', and memory is by convention, otherwise

original: veti na kaścidviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: vā iti na kaścid viśeṣaḥ
translated: there is no difference.

original: śaktiṃ vinā niyamataḥ prayoga eva kuta iti cet na pūrvaprayogamapekṣya avayavānumuktanyāyena padmānubhavajanakatvaniyamāt /
analyzed: śaktim vinā niyamataḥ prayogaḥ eva kutas iti ced na pūrva prayogam apekṣya avayava anumukta nyāyena padma anubhava janaka tva niyamāt
translated: If it is asked how there is a definite usage without power, it is not so, because the power to produce the experience of lotus is definite according to the principle stated by the parts, depending on the previous usage.

original: pūrvaprayogo 'pi tatpūrvaprayogamapekṣyetyanāditaiva /
analyzed: pūrva prayogaḥ tad pūrva prayogam apekṣya iti anāditā eva
translated: And the previous usage also depends on the previous usage, so it is beginningless.

original: athāniyatodbodhasya saṃskārasya śaktiṃ vinā niyatodbodhe hetvabhāvāt niyatā smṛtireva
analyzed: atha aniyata udbodhasya saṃskārasya śaktim vinā niyata udbodhe hetu abhāvāt niyatā smṛtiḥ eva
translated: Now, if the impression that produces arousal without restriction has no power, then there is no cause for the arousal with restriction, so the memory itself is restricted.

original: na syāditi cet na kadācicchaktito 'pi udbodhābhāvena śakyāsmaraṇāt śaktiṃ vināpi
analyzed: na syāt iti ced na udbodha abhāvena śakya asmaraṇāt śaktim vinā api
translated: If it is argued that it would not be so, it is not so, because even if there were no manifestation of the potency, it could not be remembered without potency.

original: niyamataḥ śaktismaraṇācca /
analyzed: niyamataḥ śakti smaraṇāt ca
translated: If it is argued that it would not be so, it is not so, because even without potency, the memory of what is possible is not possible due to the absence of manifestation. And because potency is remembered even without potency.

original: udbodhakañca na niyataṃ sadṛśapadaśaktisambandhijñānānāṃ pratyekaṃ vyabhicārāt
analyzed: udbodhakam ca na niyatam sadṛśa pada śakti sambandhi jñānānām pratyekam vyabhicārāt
translated: And the manifester is not necessarily existent, because there is deviation of each of the cognitions related to the potency of similar words.

original: kintu yatra smṛtistatra tatkālotpannamaniyatamevodbodhakaṃ kalpyate phalabalāt kāryonneyadharmāṇāṃ🔽yathākāryamunnayanāt /🔽na ca padmatvavattadvyāpakāderapi smṛtiprasaṅgaḥ smṛtibalenodbodhakalpanamiti tatra smṛtyabhāvena tadudbodhābhāvāt tasmācchaktiṃ vinā śakteriva
analyzed: kintu yatra smṛtiḥ tatra tad kāla utpannam aniyatam evā udbodhakam kalpyate phala balāt kārya unneya dharmāṇām  yathākāryam unnayanāt  na ca padma tva vat tad vyāpaka ādeḥ api smṛti prasaṅgaḥ smṛti balena udbodha kalpanam iti tatra smṛti abhāvena tad udbodha abhāvāt tasmāt śaktim vinā śakteḥ iva
translated: But where there is memory, there the manifester that arises at that time is imagined to be non-existent due to the power of the result, because the properties to be inferred are inferred according to the effect.

original: padmatvasya niyatā smṛtiḥ /🔽na caivaṃ gavādipade 'pi na śaktiḥ syāt vyavahārakālīnasaṃskārādeva gavādismṛtisambhavāditi vācyam /
analyzed: padma tvasya niyatā smṛtiḥ  na ca evam gav ādi pade pi na śaktiḥ syāt vyavahāra kālīna saṃskārāt eva gav ādi smṛti sambhavāt iti vācyam
translated: And it is not that there is the possibility of memory of the pervader etc. like padma-ness, because the imagination of the manifester is due to the power of memory. There is no memory of that due to the absence of its manifestation. Therefore, like potency, the memory of padma-ness is restricted even without potency.🔽And it should not be said that in the word 'go' etc. also there would be no potency, because the memory of 'go' etc. is possible even from the impression belonging to the time of usage.

original: na hi tatra smṛtyarthaṃ śaktiḥ kintvanubhavārthaṃ padādanyato gavāderanubhavāsambhavādavyutpannasya
analyzed: na hi tatra smṛti artham śaktiḥ kintu anubhava artham padāt anyatas gavādeḥ anubhava asambhavāt avyutpannasya
translated: For there, potency is not for memory, but for experience, because the experience of 'go' etc. is not possible from anything other than the word. For one who is not initiated,

original: tato 'nubhavāsambhavācca padmānubhavaśca yogādeveti na samudāyo heturanyathāsiddhatvāt
analyzed: tatas nubhava asambhavāt ca padma anubhavaḥ ca yogāt eva iti na samudāyaḥ hetuḥ anyathā siddha tvāt
translated: And because the experience of the lotus is not possible otherwise, it must be due to yoga. Thus the collection is not the reason, because it is otherwise established.

original: ato nānubhavabalāt samudāye śaktikalpanam /
analyzed: atas nā anubhava balāt samudāye śakti kalpanam
translated: Therefore, the power of the collection is not to be imagined by the force of experience.

original: nanvevaṃ gavādipadānāṃ prameyatve śaktirastu gavādismṛtiḥ saṃskārāditi cet na govyavahāreṇa
analyzed: nanu evam gav ādi padānām prameya tve śaktiḥ astu gav ādi smṛtiḥ saṃskārāt iti ced na go vyavahāreṇa
translated: If it is argued that the power of words like cow should be accepted in the object of knowledge, and the recollection of cow etc. is from impression, it is not so, because of the usage of cow.

original: svopapādake gojñāne padasya śaktikalpanaṃ na tvanupapādake prameyatvena gojñāne gopadāt
analyzed: sva upapādake go jñāne padasya śakti kalpanam na tu anupapādake prameya tvena go jñāne go padāt
translated: The power of the word is imagined in the cognition of cow which is self-explanatory, not in the unexplainable cognition of cow as an object of knowledge. From the word cow,

original: prameyo gaurityananubhavācca /
analyzed: prameyaḥ gauḥ iti ananubhavāt ca
translated: The cow is an object of knowledge is not experienced.

original: athaivaṃ saṃskārādeva tīrādismṛtisambhave gauṇalākṣaṇikocchedaḥ tīradyanubhavārthaṃ🔽hi na tatkalpanaṃ tadanubhavasyetarapadādeva siddheḥ tayorananubhāvakatvāt tasmānniyatā🔽smṛtiḥ vattisādhyeti tayoḥ kalpanāt tathā ca niyatapadmasmṛtyarthaṃ paṅkajapade 'pi
analyzed: atha evam saṃskārāt eva tīra ādi smṛti sambhave gauṇa lākṣaṇika ucchedaḥ tīra di anubhava artham  hi na tad kalpanam tad anubhavasya itara padāt eva siddheḥ tayoḥ an anubhāvaka tvāt tasmāt niyatā  smṛtiḥ vatti sādhyā iti tayoḥ kalpanāt tathā ca niyata padma smṛti artham paṅkaja pade pi
translated: If it is argued that in the same way, when the recollection of the bank etc. is possible from impression itself, the figurative and secondary senses are eliminated,🔽for the purpose of experiencing the bank etc., that [power] is not imagined, because the experience of that is established by another word itself. Because those two are not expressive, therefore the recollection is limited.

original: vṛttitvena śaktikalpanamāvaśyakaṃ lakṣaṇādyabhāvāditi cet na gaṅgāyāmityādau vṛttiṃ
analyzed: vṛtti tvena śakti kalpanam āvaśyakam lakṣaṇa ādi abhāvāt iti ced na gaṅgāyām ityādau vṛttim
translated: It is to be accomplished by the operation. For the sake of the limited recollection of the lotus, the power as the operation is necessarily imagined in the word lotus, because there is no secondary sense etc. If it is argued that in on the Ganges etc., the operation is imagined as the primary meaning,🔽because the word Ganges is not expressive of the bank, and the word on is not expressive of the bank,

original: vinā tīrāderapadārthatve vibhaktyarthānvayastatra na syāt vibhaktīnāṃ prakṛtyarthagatasvārthānvayabodhakatvavyutpatteḥ /
analyzed: vinā tīra ādeḥ apadārtha tve vibhakti artha anvayaḥ tatra na syāt vibhaktīnām prakṛti artha gata sva artha anvaya bodhaka tva vyutpatteḥ
translated: If the bank etc. were not a different object, there would be no connection of the case-meaning with it, because the case-endings are known to convey the connection of their own meaning with the meaning of the verbal root.

original: padmasya tu paṅkajavākyapratipādyatvena pācakāderiva vibhaktyarthānvayopapattiḥ /
analyzed: padmasya tu paṅkaja vākya pratipādya tvena pācaka ādeḥ iva vibhakti artha anvaya upapattiḥ
translated: But in the case of the lotus, the connection of the case-meaning is proper, as it is to be conveyed by the sentence lotus just like the cook etc.
